description: Wild camp spot in the forest, near the river. There is flat grass to pitch a tent and some fire pits.  You can park the car on the side of the road or if 4x4 drive drive in to be more hidden. The dirt road is good quality and was no problem to drive even after the rain. 3-4 cars passed by in the evening.

name: Nomad beach Năvodari
description: Beautiful place for off camping near the beach and restaurant.

name: Clover Creek
description: Nice spot to pitch the tent beside a small river. The road is visible, but very little traffic. Good for motos or bikes, vehicles will need to park 30m away.

name: Axm Service
description: Theres no signboard outside the premise but you can check the picture attached here. Open Monday to Saturday, 8am - 6pm. Repair cars, vans & motorbikes. The mechanic speaks English. Owner is Mihai, +40 732103897

name: P13 Caravan parking San Marino
description: Free parking on several levels, on gravel, lots of trees, 300 m walking distance to cable car which leads to the city center - 4,50 EUR pp. Quiet. Toilets level 1, entrance level 2, dumping station level 3 (with fresh water access) , lower levels 4,5 even quieter with nicer views.

name: Serravalle stadium
description: Car park in front of stadium; dumping and water at the other side of the street .free

name: San Marino P10 Parking
description: 220v electricity available in some places 8 hrs €2.  Car park. Unfortunately cars often take the campervan places but on a Friday in mid September mid afternoon there were about 12 places free. Max stay 24 hrs (€15). Short walk (25 mins uphill!) into the beautiful old town. Shaded by trees. Bit of road noise. Signposted camper dump point 2.2 km away.

name: San Marino Dump station, small parking & electricity/water
description: Dump station (free and excellent as these things go!) a little parking and electricity (coins required). Water 100 litres €1 available for coins in machine. Views & picnic tables. Shady. Beside main road. Toilets almost opposite.

name: Camping Zasavaca
description: Probably the nicest campground we have seen in all of Eastern Europe. Well maintained grassed pitches with shade. Immaculate bathrooms and showers. Kitchen and very nice covered hangout area. Not sure what you would do staying here for a few days as there isn't much near by. 23 euro for caravan and 2 people with electricity. Washing machine extra.

name: Camping Dunav Belgrade
description: only camping near the city. Basic with free wi-fi

name: Camping Enigma
description: basis but very friendly. They have a great swimming pool which will be open in season

name: Joca Krofna Restoran, Tekija
description: Campside at the shore of river Dunabe near a little "tent-restaurant". When we have been there in springtime, the restaurant was closed, but the friendly owner let us stay overnight for free.

name: Djura
description: Motorcycle mechanic and shop. Contact Ivan at Ivan.rusic@gmail.com

name: Studenica monastry
description: Parking near monastry. Quiet, lit at night. Restaurant a few hundred meters in village. Toilets in monastry.

name: Topola, parking in front of Hotel Oplenac
description: parking in front of Hotel Oplenac, also parking for vistors of the late king Petar I.  wifi from the hotel.

name: Ruma, grass field with picknick tables opposite of resaurant Borbovac
description: opposite the restaurant and public swimming pool. wifi from restaurant if you have the code. Very good food in the restaurant. 200 meter further on the road is a water tap.

name: Tatinac
description: 2019–now 17€ for car+2 pp/n. 5 euro per person, 5 for car (nothing for motorcycles), 2 for small tent and 3 for large tent. So, we paid 12 Euro per night for two people, one small tent, and two motorcycles (we paid in local currency and it ended up being 1700 or US$15.46) No electricity but there are outlets in the kitchen for charging small items. Large grass field (flat) with very little shade. Good hot water shower. Only 1 shower/toilet room. Friendly owners. It is part of a working small farm so there are goats, chickens, etc.

name: Josanička Banja Picknik area
description:
Silent and beautiful place into the forest. Barbecue facilities. Pit toilet. 

Follow track 500m through the forest from given coordinates. 

Restaurant "Velež" direction Joanička offers good and tasty food.

name: Fair and Square Hostel
description: Ample private parking space for 2 to 3 cars (Chargable for cars, parking out in the street is free). No problems for motorcycles. A new industrial-inspired designer hostel situated in a peaceful part of Belgrade. Spacious common area with with bench, comfy couches, television, Play Station and a well-equipped kitchen. It is easily to hang out and socialise with other guests. Comprised of 3 buildings, there are options of dormitories and private rooms. Each dormitory room has its own bathroom. Towels provided. There is even an outdoor pool in the summer. Free and fast WiFi throughout premises. Pet-friendly. There are two cats and a dog that can keep your stay enjoyable. Secure parking available for cars, motorcycles and bicycles. Very personalised service from the friendly staff and owner. Bus stop is just across the road from the hostel. Great value for the price.

name: Kapetan Mišin Breg
description: Scenic view point of the Danube river. Open air gallery there with wooden sculptures. There is a wine museum which is free to visit if you bring a wine from your country and store it there. Camping for one person is 5 euros per night with own tent. Can request meals for additional cost. My friend had a sumptuous breakfast for 5 euros and dinner the day before was free. Toilet shower kitchen WiFi available. Friendly owners who welcomed us with snapps. Gave us some magnets as gifts.

name: Meanders of Uvac
description: Flat spot in deserted area in the nature reserve surrounding the Uvac river. 1 km hike to lookout point. Even driveable. Beautiful and amazingly quiet area with several spots to camp. Not another soul around while we stayed. A couple of farm houses a few Kilometers back. Enough space for big rigs although getting there will be tricky for large trucks on 9km long dirt road with lots of trees overhanging.

name: the green studio
description: Very friendly hostel. Very alternative place. Just hang out with the friends of the owner who are always there. Run by 4 young people as volunteers. They live in the downstairs room. 10 bunk beds at 1000 dinars per night. Very small kitchen.

name: Bend in the road
description: The road turns here and there is a large place to park. Up to 5 big campers could park here. It's near a ski resort that has a large parking lot. Another potentially good spot to park. It's hard to say how busy this place is in the summer but we're here in the winter and only the owner of the ski resort and the plow have driven by. The ski resort is not open. In the winter be prepared to drive up a steep snow covered road. It's a paved road. Beautiful views and great ovation for hikes and skiing. Good cell coverage

name: Gorgeous Mountainside Spot
description: Nice place off the road with a picnic table.

name: Water well/ tap under the trees
description: Also locals get their water at this tab. Nice people!

name: Derelict Hotel and Disused Camp Ground
description:
Former campsite by a derelict hotel. 
Lots of space but obviously also used by the locals for courting. 
Some noise from motorway but ok for night stop over

name: Dejan
description: Good Mechanic, speaks fluent Serbian, German and English

name: Mini Kamp Viljamovka
description: Great camping between the pear trees which provide the fruits for the local produced brandy. Nice view over the Tara area. Amenities in good shape. I paid €12 per night for the car and myself.

name: Angelinin Konak
description:
Small colorfull cabins made of old wine barrels in a garden. The setting is really nice. I paid €10 including breakfast. You're also allowed to camp for a small discount, but I didn't bother. Outside shower is really nice but unfortunately not enough water pressure. Other available shower is basically only cold water but does the job.

They provide dinner, only menu of the day, which was in my case a delicious goulash, smoked pork and a salad.

name: Camp Asin
description:
New place, opened in 2017, and all facilities up to date. Off the main road. Good and clean showers and toilets. Nice outdoor kitchen with tables and fireplace.
Large place outside the campground for big rigs with electricity and water at each lot. No WiFi or mobile phone coverage, but they told me they're working on that.

I paid € 4 for the car and € 4 per person

name: Nippon Car Servis
description: Quick service for Toyota. English speaking

name: Water and shelter
description:
Free water tap and shelter from the rain. Close to a vista point. 
Parking available.

name: camperstop belgrade
description: CAMPS "Beograd" is easy to find because it is situated not far from the intersection of highway 2 away from E70 3.3 km and 3.3 km from the E75, 24 km from the city center in the village of Dobanovci. The camping site is more than just a parking lot. Located on the outskirts of the village in a quiet place ideal place to have a good rest. The action is open 24 hours a day 365 days a year, so if you decide to travel please visit us. It belongs to a type of mini camps with 15 camping pitches average size of 6x10 meters with a grassy area for sitting and staying. The camp has a lot of trees that create natural shade and where lives a lot of birds. The camp is equipped with drinking water, the necessary electrical installation, lighting, equipment for discharging waste water and chemical toilets, toilet, shower, free WIFI, video surveillance.

name: Sosul Camping Ground
description:
Very nice place to come and camp, green grass, shade cloths, pool, sauna, kitchen, affordable drinks, close to town. Clay tennis court too haha 

Good wifi, good showers and everything

For the two of us in our tent, it was €14


Big rigs could be parked in here or just outside the gate, it’s at the end of a quiet street, so all good for security

name: Nice spot next to a stream
description: Nice quiet spot next to a stream. The road is calm. Further up the road is probably beautiful but there is a tunnel with a max height of 3.5 meter. Two ways to access, 1 easy but low trees, 1 a bit steep but good for big rigs. The locals are relaxed.

name: Kadijevac Camp zone
description:
Beautiful camp site near the river.
Very quiet and has drinkable water.
Perfect for camping.

name: Iron Gates border: Romania - Serbia
description:
US citizens in US registered truck. Romania into Serbia
Low key border crossing on a Saturday in August. About 10 cars in line. Quick processing out of Romania and into Serbia. Entering Serbia, the officer reviewed our passports. Did not ask for car documents or insurance. Beautiful drive along the Danube from the border toward Belgrade.

name: Border Serbia - Hungary at Backi Brag
description:
Exiting Serbia into Hungary. Very mellow border. On a Monday in August, only 2 cars ahead of us at the border. Essentially, no wait. (US citizens with a US registered truck). We were told and read online that the main border at Tomba can have a 4 hour wait in summer - in either direction. Weekends are the worst. So, this border was a great option.
Entering Hungary, you need a vignette to drive on the motorways. We bought ours online - with a small service fee - at http://www.hungary-vignette.eu/. Online we paid €11.91 for a 10-day vignette.

name: Camping Odmoriste
description: Really small simple campsite. Check in at the hotel Vila Drina. We paid 1880 dinar (9 Euro) for car + 2 persons.

name: Bike camp LongTour
description: Camp for cyclists on EuroVelo 6 (Danube) route and information desk (infopoint) / First cycle tourism camp in the center of the city in Serbia / Sombor, Serbia

name: Bike camp LongTour
description: First cyclists tourism camp in the center of city in Serbia / Your EuroVelo 6 (Danube) route starting point in Serbia and the information desk / Sombor, Serbia

name: Niška banja
description:
A very nice meadow by the river, equipped with tables and  running water, that locals use for picnicking. Lots of space in the shadows of the trees. 
The main road Sofia - Belgrade is on the other side of the river, so it’s a bit noisy.

name: grasland next to highway
description:
bigger grassy area next to the Highway. If you're parking a little bit behind the trees it would be nice. hear noise from the road but there is not so much traffic at night. good to sleep there one night.
Too high grass for a 2W camper. It is possible parking following the track 200m at your left

name: free and fast wifi
description: free and fast wifi without limit and Password

name: lakeview minispot
description: At the end of a very steep rocky trail through the forest, there is some place for a normal-sized 4x4. Not much place to turn. 4x4 is very important, as we had some trouble getting back up the trail. But the camping spot is awesome.

name: LHC Salon Camping
description: Small Place on The ground of a furniture shop(LHC Salon) directly aside One of The mainroads into The City of Belgrade. 3-4 CamperVans Max.. Nice People, very helpfull. Bus line into The City. 10€ per Night

name: Mountain top Ostrovica and great spot for camp.
description: Great spot for overnight or just a coffee break and a bit of climbing on the  top of vulcanic mountain Ostrovica (758m) with some via ferata parts. Great view from the top. Around 5 km from town Rudnik, with restaurants and everything else.

name: Monastery Tronosa
description: Old Ortodox Monastery from 14 century, surrounded by old forest and hils, beautiful place to see. A lot of free camping space and a big water spring.

name: Mountain top by the Cross
description: Mountain Cer, it's a pretty hidden cool place, you can go by almost any vehicle but the last 50 m. You'll need a 4x4. Nice place to camp, no water, no toilet, but I will make a pin for the nearest water!

name: Parking at Roman Ruins car park
description: We parked here for a night, we asked the security guard of our was ok to park for the night and he was very nice and said yes. There are toilets and water, but only fitting the opening hours. There is also open fast WiFi.

name: Amazing farm Campsite - Farma 47
description: Really amazing small scale campsite. Run by a friendly man who doesn't speak much English bit is very nice. All facilities available, and breakfast is €5 per person. He offers you homemade brandy when you enter. We paid €15 for 2 people with electricity. Very hot, clean showers. Laundry available.

name: Camping Avala
description:
Camping Belgrade Avala is a modern campsite located in nature near Belgrade. As a part of camping there is wine cellar where you can taste homemade wine. Camping has a beautiful view on vineyards and hills.

 NAVIGATION COORDINATES GPS : WE DON'T RECOMEND SEARCHING FOR THE CAMPING BY ADRESS, navigation devices can lead you on small country roads or wrong place. Better way is to use cordinates how it's written here:

 If you are coming from NORTH or WEST, first you need to enter these middle point coordinates : 44.717009 20.503612, than you need to add final location coordinates of our camping : 44.6186229 20.5554618.

 If you are coming from SOUTH, first you need to enter this middle point coordinates : 44.493175 20.655506, than you need to add final location coordinates of the camping : 44.6186229 20.5554618

name: on top of the old road
description: driving towards the border of Bosnia, turn left off the main road just before the tunnel. you can drive up the old road and on top there's a spot to camp. not perfectly flat but using some wood you can level out. the spot can be muddy when raining. the road is paved. nice to go for walks in the woods.

name: Back-up Plan
description: We wouldn’t recommend you head here especially for this spot, but if you’re in the area and need somewhere to wild camp, it was fine. Small spot as the track bends to the right. We parked onto another smaller track that went straight on, but it didn’t look like this track had been used for a long time. There is enough space to get one car level. Didn’t see anyone between 5:45pm and 10am. There was a house at the end of the main track but it appeared deserted.

name: Fruska Gora
description: Nice flat spot several hundred meters from the road. Two different tracks off the road which converge into one and then a couple hundred meters further on the tracks split at a wide open flat spot. Space for 5/6 vehicles or a couple of big rigs. Very quiet and peaceful.

name: petrol station
description: place to fill a german gas bottle.with an adaptor all

name: Ethno Saponjic
description: Very nice traditional farm with rooms to rent and also a flat grass patch in front where you can camp. Good shower inside and outside. Exceptionally nice owners! There is the possibility to eat delicious homemade serbian food. Ideal place to explore the beautiful Uvac Lake and Canyon (Owners are very helpful in organizing boat trips). We stayed 2 nights in this lovely place. Be sure to visit the viewpoint 15min away! Note: Last bit (about 200meters) of the road is a good gravel road.

name: Park at the beach
description: A huge park at the beach with a restaurant. good for children. out of the city.

name: Mokra Gora
description: Great quiet spot backing onto a small stream. This place is only a short walk  if you visiting Sargan Eight Museum and Tourist Railway with Restaurants nearby. We stayed here a couple of nights no problem.

name: Camp and Guesthouse for Cyclist & Adventurers
description: Beautiful place to stay in the heart of Negotin. Bojan, the host, is the most welcoming and helpful guy you will ever meet! He and his wife are doing everything to make your stay perfect! You can pitch your tent in the beautiful garden or just rent one for 13 Euros a night. There are also rooms to rent. New perfect shower/toilets and well equipped kitchen! We planned staying one night and in the end enjoyed four wonderful days!

name: Overland Camp Serbia
description:
ADMIN NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified.
This is a camp specially made for Overlanding travelers. Located on mountain Cer, surrounded by trees and nature. It is not finished yet, but there is already space to camp and everything you need to enjoy your stay. Me and my family are also travelers and actually live at this location. All the information you need please contact me at +381652612770 and on Instagram @overland_srb

name: Serbia - Hungary border crossing
description: Small, quiet border crossing between Serbia and Hungary. I went from Hungary to Serbia and they had a quick look in the back of my NL registered car and checked my NL passport, whole thing took me about 5-10 minutes

name: omv gas station
description: Nice an new gasstation with playground and wifi. Good for a night, although some road noise.

name: Gradac Monastery Car park
description: Car park of the monastry with toilets and water. No one here, when we arrived at 8pm. Nice place for a night and to visit the monastry. Even nicer than Studenac Monastry.

name: Miss depolo
description: Big house inside Beograd. Kitchen, parking safe and closed. Room with shared bathroom. 22€.

name: Mystic River hostel
description:
Very nice new hostel around the mountain in Tara national park 
8€ shared room 
nice kitchen 
nice staff 
fast WiFi 
parking for my motorbike .. safe

name: My Memento Camping
description: Rooms and small campsite in the backyard of a lovely couple. Have a kitchen you can use. They offered us raki and local food, very nice place and people! We paid 1200 DIN per person, but was totally worth the price!

name: Bordercrossing Serbia/Kosovo
description: Don’t use this bordercrossing. They will not let you in to Kosovo at this border. You have to take gate 1 or gate 31.

name: Border Serbia & Kosovo
description: Easy to pass. We paid 10€ insurance for the bike. The whole procedure took 10 minutes.

name: Camping Kalinovac
description:
Small campsite next to the Danube/ Silver Lake, overlooking the Carpathian Mountains, about 10km from Ram Fortress. Opened in summer 2018 so everything is new. Really friendly owner, who doesn’t speak much English but still makes you feel welcome. His son was home when I arrived so he came to see if I was ok or had any questions.

Site has 2 toilets, 2 showers & a small kitchen which you can use. They also have a twin / double room to rent.

For tent, 1 person & motorbike was 1000 Dinar per night.

Small campers & cars with roof tents would also fit.

name: OMV Gaz Station
description:
Just after the Danube, from Novi Sad to Belgrad.
Station 24/24, with free toilets and free shower. Cafeteria, free good wifi. And water to refill tank
We stay one night with trucks. Little bit noisy

name: Fortress parking
description: Dirt lot next to the ottoman fortress. Shades on one side. Next to a nice playground and a short walk to a Maxi supermarket. It’s a nice little town.

name: Now parking
description: It was hot when we were here so this was perfect as it was right outside the pool (300 dinar/person). There’s some shade and it’s quiet as it’s not really a road. Short walk to the center and a fenced in dog park right next to it.

name: Restaurant - Istanbul
description:
Huge parking lot behind the restaurant, no passing through traffic, actually only three trucks parked there with us. Restrooms behind the restaurant, free of charge for men, 50 cents for women. 
Water taps left from the entrance. 
A bit of usual road noise from the motorway but not too bad since the parking lot is not next to the road. For us it was the best option, we’ve checked some gas stations before.

name: Park and Pool lot
description: At the end of the lined parking lot there’s an unlined open space. We parked there. Right next to the playground and indoor/outdoor pool. Short walk to the center. The pool plays music 8am-8pm.

name: OMV Gaz station
description:
Probably as all OMV Gaz station : cafeteria 24/24, free wifi, free toilets, free shower.
We stay one night with the trucks but possibility to find a better place when you don't come as later than us!

name: Restaurant
description:
Wow this is the best vale for money restaurant ever. :)
We had some beef and lamb, being the lamb the best. It bring potatoes as side dish and they were also extremely good.
We paid around 1000. 

Safe travels

name: Border crossing Serbia / Montenegro
description: Small & quiet northern border crossing between Serbia and Montenegro. Everything took 15 minutes, checked passports only, no charges. Cannot buy car insurance on either side so arrange beforehand.

name: Palic, small area by the lake
description: Next to the lakeside road there's this small opening with plenty of trees and space for several cars. The trees are to the west and lake to the east, decent shadow in the afternoon. There are mosquitos. Just on the back there is an even bigger field, out of sight from the road/lake. Restaurant in 5' walking distance by the lake. Supermarket in nearby town too, including exchange bureau.

name: Stari Banovci
description: Danube beach with water faucet; Restaurant; a harmless homeless; some fisherman and a boat slipway; we asked and stayed at the Restaurant's parking lot.

name: carski drum camping
description: Campground near Highway. Many peacock in campsite. To expensive (25Euro)but a really good stopover coming/going to Turkey.

name: Golubac
description: Golubac water and Parking place. We fix the water pump and is useable for all Gardena adapters.

name: Ruza Vetrova
description:
Nice clean Camping site in the hills. Disposal of Toilet, power, water, nice Toiletts, clean Shower (hot). Nice Hosts. They are doing the registration for you.
Restaurant is in walking distance. Driving up is 15% for 300-400m.

name: WestCampBG
description:
New Camping place. Space for 16 Camper and Tents. Every Place has its own Water, Power, Toilet disposel.
But to close to motorway, loud as hell, smells of burned platic and 1960 Dinar.

name: Zvornik Border Crossing Bosnia/Serbia
description:
Border crossing between Bosnia and Serbia. Quite straightforward mostly, leaving Serbia was extremely easy. Entering Bosnia—less so. Mostly because we had no green card insurance. Perhaps you have thought this through more, and foreseen such a thing, but coming from the US my insurance is basically useless in Europe. They will make you buy some, and have limited English at the border. It cost us €30 for the ten day minimum (motorcycle). The guy accepted usd, euros, dinar, or BAM. However...no cards. And there is no atm in walking distance. The man had to drive me to one! So it all worked out, but be prepared with some cash beforehand if you believe you will need insurance. The border workers were very helpful though. 

Other than that, super easy border crossing. Roads are quite good on both sides.

name: Rookies Hostel / Bar
description: Nothing too fancy but after a thorough search, it's the only place you can park directly out front. The location tagged is actually the entrance to the alleyway off the main road. just head to this pin and take that alleyway down 100m, otherwise you'll circle the block 3 times like I did. 10 euros for a dorm

name: Lukoil gas station
description: Don't stop for nothing never there! We slept overnight, an the morning the engine refuses to start - after months testing and checking it for the future vacation. A guy from the petrol station - tiny guy with glasses came to us and asked what happened and offered us "help" - fake road assistance who took us to Raketa Servis in Krnjevo. The car was quickly "repaired" for unbelievable price and had no issues after it. Once we had internet connection, we found an article in Czeck forum that happened the same story - http://borejk.net/srbsko.html . The perfect crime, you cannot say anything on the police, because you came voluntarily there. Even the "boss" said to my boyfriend go to the police, to the embassy, if want, I am giving you warranty answering on his question if all now is good with the car. The most sad of the story is that his like 12-13 years old daughter was involved on that, she took us the money via POS and she has black under her nails! Imagine how this kid is growing up!

name: Border Crossing Croatia - Serbia
description:
This is a border on a small road but they still manage to be unbelievably slow. Stood in the line before the border for 1,5 almost 2h. 

Slowest border I’ve ever encountered in Europe. Also people here follow the law the jungle so you will be passed in the line and encounter angry locals that don’t care that you’ve been waiting.

name: Lepenac
description:
Family business restaurant since 1998.
With a beautiful outdoor terrace looking on a Danube river and panoramic city view in the background.
Tired, sleepy???
We are offering accomodation with air-conditioning,TV, bathroom..
Hungry???
Fresh homemade bread,traditional chesse, refreshing salad,grilled fresh fish and  and grilled mixed meat served with ice cold drinks..
See you ☺️

name: Little Suites 15
description:
Small B&B . Safe parking .five minutes off main road.
approx £15 night (2019) Friendly, helpful host.

name: Wild camp at the river
description: Very nice place directly at the river. Not many cars or noise from the street (the water overlays it all), you can cool yourself in the water and make a fire. Close to the famous Manasija Monastery. The small road is easy to drive for any car. Big rigs might not fit. Good 3G with Telenor.

name: Sunset view at Zavojsko Jezero Lake
description: Nice camp spot and you cam camp several places there.

name: Toplica River Camp
description:
Entry point from village “Drenovac”, e.g. Use google maps to find dirt road. 
You can camp here where we did or go to next road to the river and camp at a lake. We camped here in rain, but river view great. PS. you need 4wd for the last 100meters.

name: Valley farm view and mountains
description: Drive up the dirt road 750-1100meter, from paved road route 35. There are several options when leaving the dirt route, find cover behind trees and view to the other side. You need 4wd, we left our camp at river, too many mosquitos because of rain the day before - we found cover here, only few mosquitos.

name: Valley Mountain View Near Uvac
description: After the view point of Uvac, we drove to here. There is a smaller old tractor road that leads up, however we just drove on the grass land. Locals had made bon fire here, very great view, no people, perfect direction for sunset.

name: KnezPetrol
description: Fuel, water, icecream and not fare away from the old senic vulcano.

name: Deliblato plato Wild camp
description: You need non heavy 4wd, you see the entry from the road, sand track and leads in to an open area with a great view.

name: Teletubbies camp area
description: This is a quit nice spot, fantastic view. This is a nature area worth visiting, probably best entry access is from the South, we came in from the North along a long dirt road next to fields. The camp site is prime.

name: Pozezena Donau River Camp
description: Nice camp, easy acces from Pozezena, little walk access to river, flat ground no people

name: Lazerev Canyon
description:
Very beautiful place with the view on the canyon, probably for one or two nights for discover the area.  It's a picnic
 table and place for one or 2 cars. Gravel and rocky road, easy access.

name: Camping Jankovic Crvika
description: Very nice small campground in Jankovic Family garden. Tents only!

name: Comunal free campsite
description:
Free campsite at the river. Locals camp and picknick here as well. If you have a smaller car you fit under the trees and csn use benches and barbecues.
Big rigs can stay in the green

name: Prima 1 Pharmacy
description: 24/7/365 pharmacy right opposite the old train station

name: camping next to lake
description: there is a lake that locals fish in (not sure you can swim) we stayed here the night as there was no where else nearby. we drove a bit past the lake (since we arrived early and there were lots of locals fishing) and there was a grass patch next to an empty shipping container. it was fine for one night... there are some stray dogs who are hungry but scared of you... they appreciate some food from afar though if you have any to spare

name: By the Manastir
description:
You can stay in front of the Vratna Monastery. We ask the nun's or padres and it was ok.
We stayed on the parking lot.
You can visit the monastery and the Stone Gates.

name: Sajo-Rajo
description: Small shop for food - the owner has a 34 old Toyota HDJ 80

name: Dolina Apartments
description: Nice wooden houses, home made honey for sale! Lake is walking distance

name: Kopanik Creek
description: Beautiful field in the forest with a little nice creek, table for cooking is available. Approxi a football field size place... Worth to stay a night here

name: Tyre Service
description: Perfect tyre service. They can fix trucks tyres too. Speak Serbian only

name: MotoCamp Serbia
description:
This Greek couple created a great spot for motor- or push bike travelers. Entrance gate at nr. 98. Put up your tent in the green backyard, take a room in the house, go for traditional and use one of the available hammocks in the half open ancient farm shed or sleep in the the little wooden cabin.  MotoCamp Serbia is not really a place for cars, but if you come with a small passenger car with tent you probably can park on the premises. The place has a hostel atmosphere, fridge/freezer, beer, wine, water, homemade marmalade and very friendly. Also English-speaking owners. Tent, motorbike, 2 people, 1 night, € 15.
motocamp.serbia@gmail.com

name: Filipov breg
description: Welcome to the campground "Filipov breg" in village Ojkovica with a view of 1.000.000 dinars on Zlatar Lake

name: One night
description: Had to move previous viewpoint, because local came to drink beer, and wont let us be peacefully. Found this place little uphill, to spend the night. High clearance or 4x4

name: Hidden parking and grass
description: This place is perfect to camp. We did 4 days of wild camping here and it was perfect. There is some shadow

name: Spring Bozurnja
description: Potable watter, locals drink it, and myself for long period of time.

name: Etno selo Vidikovac
description: Bungalows and restaurant. Typical serbian food. Owner very friendly. Nice place to spend one night or more. Close to Uvac viewpoint.

name: Camp Plum
description: The best camping, very nice hospitality and owner, clean toilets and shower!!!

name: Wild Camp near the river
description: It's a few meters from the road, but it's quiet. Next to a river, flat ground, nice place.

name: Villa Alexandra/Camping Drina
description: Basic camping in the garden of a guesthouse. Nice green space with a shelter and a couple of picnic tables. Hot shower, sink for washing dishes and potable water. Nothing special, but good for one night. 5 euros per person.

name: Wi-Fi restaurant no password
description: A nice restaurant by the sidewalk of the road, cheap and also a hot-spot for free wifi

name: Taverna Jacovijevic
description: Floating restaurant, nicely decorated and delicious food. Looks like in summertime they also have a big terrace. We loved the baked beans. But there is a lot of choice (English menu also).

name: Devil's Town
description: Wildcamping spot next to the road. The road is small, unpaved, twisty and steep at times, so 4x4 with higher ground clearance is recommended. If coming from the west, you can also stay at the start of the hiking trail (paved road until there). From the camping spot you can go in eastern direction, there will be more spots to stay at but the road gets more tricky.

name: Parking next to restaurant
description: Very quiet at night. Tasty regional restaurant at reasonable prices next to it. Average Wi-Fi picking up from there

name: City Beach “Topoljar”
description: Enclosed area of ​​the city beach, camping is free on a large grassy area near the river Danube.  It can be entered by car, motorcycle or bicycle.  There is a Nautical Club, a restaurant with local food and a cafe.  Free toilet and shower.

name: Dejan Zelic Mechanic
description:
Amazing and friendly guy that specializes in fixing VW vehicles. 
Great prices, great overall experience.

name: close the river
description:
place close the river with several spots for tent and a few also for vehicules.

behind a soccer field but quiet.

name: Motel Krnjevo
description: good Motel directly at the highway A1. nice room, hot shower, TV. 36 Euro including breakfast via booking.com for two persons. As we got a room at the backside of the Motel we did not hear any traffic noise. Very good Wifi.

name: Monastery Manasija Parking
description: Parking of the Manasija Monastery behind the river. Water in a monastery about 300 metres.

name: Waterfall next to Road and Monastery
description:
There is a nice waterfall and a monastery 1.2km up the water
good side to have a break

name: Water for filling up tank
description: In the middle of the village, old school. Public water. very good for filling up water tank

name: Water Source and in the Countryside
description: Piped water from a spring. A good spot to refill before or after Deliblato Sands.

name: Dr. Milan Jovanovic Batut Covid vaccine centre
description: Booster for Covid. Free with European certification. Very easy and quick

name: Big park by the river
description: Large park by the river.  Many people doing sports during the day.  Quiet at night.  Public toilet and water tap in the area.

name: Exchange Office
description: A small Office for Money exchange open 8 am to 7 pm

name: Quiet Creek
description: There is a pullout that leads down to a small creek. Lots of grassy area for tents or campers. The spot is partially visible from the road but there was hardly any traffic. A Shepard came by in the evening but didn’t seem to care that we were here.

name: Motoristika
description: If you need a Moto mechanic in Čačak this is the place. From the looks of the shop they are capable of working on any size moto, new or old. They welded and machined our kickstart assembly that had snapped. Highly recommended.

name: By the small Bushtranit lake
description: There is a small dam surrounded by a dirt road. There are some flat spots for pitching the tent and shadow under two different small roofs. Water is good for swimming. If you come with vehicle, you can park on the road. The place is quiet during the day and night. People from the town are super friendly, they even got us some Pita and beverages! We stayed here two nights!

name: Flat area by the river
description: We came by bike and pitch the tent here. It's quiet and far from the road. To get here you have to take a dirt road before the bridge on the main road. It's good for bikes, not sure for other vehicles.

name: Quiet spot
description: There's a clear sport under the trees and next to the river. It looks like people come her to fish or spend time. There are some spots for pitching the tent or parking. It's quiet and ok for a night.

name: In the country side
description: Coming from the dirt road there is an even narrower path that takes you to this place. There's some shadow and plenty flat space for pitching the tent. It's ok for vans and cars too. Super quiet during the night.

name: Open clear
description: Right in the curve from the road there is a path into an open field area. There are lots of trees and plenty space for tents and vehicles. We had a quiet night.

name: Fountain
description: water from the mountains, public use next to small town

name: Next to lake
description:
It is a parking area next to a lake. If you get here you can drive further closer to the lake but that can be muddy, so first check. 
It is next to a skilift so in the winter this will be a no go. 

It's beautiful to stay here and quiet!

name: Zlatibor park
description: Before getting to the train station there is a spot with a table that's good for camping. It's near the road but there's almost no traffic. We camped with our tent and it was a super quiet night.

name: Before Tara park
description: On the road towards Tara National Park, there are some tracks into the forest. We are bike traveling so right to the left there was some nice flat space for pitching the tent. Super quiet and far from the main road.

name: hostel golub
description:
just cheap hostel with private rooms, not busy at all
safe parking bicycle in garden shed. 
swimming pool is not available
kitchen is basic
living room 
wifi good 
15€ for two person room 
owner speaks English

name: s.u.r. sunce
description:
old hotel, good for cyclists that are used to basic needs. 
not really clean
but working air-conditioning and shower
10€ per person
breakfast 400 local units 
friendly owners, 
bicycle storage inside garage
wifi is good

name: By the Drina
description: Coming from the road to the left there's a dirt road to the Drina. There are some bushy areas but if you continue to the end you'll find a nice spot for pitching the tent or parking.

name: advenure camp
description: The place is sitting near to Danube river, with amazing view. There are bungalows, toilets, kitchen, it is possible to pitch the tent, showers, outlets, eketricity, restaurant, wifi

name: in the forest
description: Nice place in the forest. If it rains could be a problem

name: By the Sava river
description: You can get here by taking a dirt road from the main one. It's a big area with plenty space for tents or vehicles. There's lots of shade under the trees. There is also a small roof and some tables. We spent a quiet night camping.

name: private camping
description: Private camping but if you go by bike they let a car camp for free. Very friendly people. It has toilets, showers, water and electricity

name: Into the nature
description: Coming from the road you'll see a path towards the Danube, if you have a vehicle there are some nice places to park. We were bike traveling so we went a little further and pitch the ten under some trees. It's flat and with good shadow. You can hear a little bit the cars from the road in the distance but in general super quiet.

name: Adventure Hub Camp
description: Beautiful camp on Danube river. There are showers, electricity, bungalows, places for tents and campers. It's pet friendly, and the hosts are amazing.

name: Camping near the border
description: There's a small beach over the Danube. You can park there, or if you are biking like us, you can get a little bit further through the small peninsula and pitch your tent. There's some flat areas and shadow. Really quiet during the night, and we are in July!

name: water tap
description: two water taps, very good pressure. locals use it as drinking water.

name: Pic nic area
description: Fresh water from the mountain. The local people came to drink the water. So potable water.

name: Ram Ferry
description: Ferry across the Danube. See pictures for prices and schedule. Cash only.

name: Border crossing Serbia - Montenegro
description:
Small border crossing in the mountains between Serbia and Montenegro. The border was a bit more formal than I'm used to in Europe. On the Serbian side was the only bribery/ extortion attempt I have ever experienced in Europe. The border guards tried to convince me that I needed a negative marijuana test to cross the border. I could pay a "local" fine or wait for them to call the police... 
Nothing that can't be dealt with but it can definitely catch you off guard in an otherwise normal border.

name: Parking on the river and near the Vinca site
description: Nice and calm place in the river of the Danube. There is a public parking of the archaeological site or there is also a big parking of a restaurant.

name: Grassy hilltop view
description: Beautiful grassy spot on top of a mountain, with a fantastic view. Extremely isolated, as we didn't see a single car pass during our stay. We took a old service road from Jezero Zaovine to get here, where 4x4 is definitely recommended. However, the spot is also reachable from the other side, via a much better maintained road. Spot is suitable for multiple tents, or small vehicles. No water, but there is a hotel/ ski resort about 10min drive away, who were happy to fill up our canisters. 4G service

name: Vrbinc Caravan Stop
description: It's a place for caravans next to a hotel. If you need wifi, go to the hotel next door, there is free wifi available. I payed 12€ for one night alone with my van! Included bathroom with hot shower and toilets! If you need electricity it cost you 5€ more! It's just 5km away from the city center of Ljubiana. So if you have a bike or a longboard it's perfect, you'll just need 10 minutes to reach the beautiful centre of Ljubiana.

name: Camp Lucija
description: This campground is placed directly on the see and harbor. I payed for one person and my van with electricity and tax like 17€ per night!(low-season) Toilets are not the best, but shower has hot water!

name: Camping Putj
description: Nice grassy / shady spot on the river near the old center of Putj. Clean facilities. Quiet. Laundry, tennis courts, pool or spa complex(?) adjacent but I didn't use.

name: Dujceva Kamp
description: This camp in part of a working farm. Big grassing field/island with river running either side and bridge access. Clean toilets and showers. Wifi at reception/farm house/restaurant. €15 for 1 adult tent camping.

name: Sava River Wild Camp
description:
Nice shady area along river bank with a couple of options to park up. Popular with local trout fisherman. Rough stoney access path with low trees. Not for big rigs.

Acess is via track which is on your right coming from Bled before you cross the bridge. N 46 17'56.7" E 014 02' 19.8"

name: Jelovica Forest
description: Flat grassy clearing off of power lines track surrounded by big pine trees. Field can be soft in places so big rigs take care. Access is via grave tracks from road.

name: Kamp Koren
description:
Nice campground. Lots of shade. Can get packed in the high season. Easy walk to the center of Kobadrid. For bathing you better walk a bit in the direction of the village. We had to pay 28,68€ for 2 persons, a van without electricity. 
There's another campground a little bit further in the other side of the river: Kamp Lazar. I didn't visit it, but I saw the campground from the hills during a hike. It might be a better option for bathing but it's a longer walk to the center of Kobadrid.

name: Vina Saksida
description: Small family-run campsite in a wine yard, around 15 pitches and some extra space for tents in the wine yard. 10 EUR per person incl. electricity, internet and shower. Pool. Nice view. Yes we recommend eating in the restaurant, execellent set meal 6 cours each with a diffrent own wine, 40 EUR.

name: Pivka Jama Camping
description: Large Forest Camping, ok facilities, pool, tennis court, restaurant, wifi only at designated point, washing machine. And an own Cave (visits at 9am and 5pm, we did not). The righthand side of the areal tends to be overcrowded with campingcars. On the lefthand side you can stand peaceful between trees. You always find a spot even if you arrive late. Better than expected at such a popular destination (Postojna Cave nearby). EUR 25 for 2

name: Kamp Gabrije
description: Basic campside. Beautiful located on river Soca. Even if you arrive late, the camping is never full, but so gets the field next to :-). Not enough facilities therefore, but clean. They book adventure activities and you can bath in the Soca. 26 EUR for 2. no electricity and 4x4

name: Kamp Sobec
description: Huge Campground with everything. Shop with good range, swimming lake, sports facilities. Even if you arrive late you will find a pitch. But not in walking distance of Bled. EUR 35 for 2 incl. elec. EUR 31 without

name: Kamp Liza
description: Smaller campground at river, beautiful located, fireplaces at some pitches, very popular among kayakers. Restaurant sells bread in the morning. Owner seems a bit unorganized, but we liked the place anyway. Around 28 EUR for 2 with electricity, 25 EUR without. 3 other campings just next door.

name: Camp Zlatorog Bohinj
description:
Beautiful campground at beautiful lake Bohinj, surrounded by beautiful mountains. Very popular but not massiv overcrowded as they let only a certain amount of people in - in high season don't come too late. No other possibility in Ukanc to stand for the night. EUR 25 for 2 with electricity, EUR 22 without.
In high season the place was totally overcrowded for days. It's a problem because in that wildlife park area including the village Ukanc wild camping is totally forbidden. All the parking lots in Ukanc are controlled by the police daily. Sometimes they "accept" camper in those days if they pay 5 EUR parking fine per day.

name: Old open air bar
description: A place up on a hill that seems to be a former bar location because you can still see the seats and tables. Reach it via a paved road in bad condition. It ist a little messy but quiet and you can see the ocean.

name: Sabotín, Slovenia
description: On top of the Sabotin mountains, which rise from the shores of the Soka river, with a breathtaking view over the Adriatic. Apart from enjoying the landscape we can walk a circular route, either from here or starting from the Soka bridge, going through  passages, caves, shelters and trenches built by the Italians and Astro -Hungaros armies during the First World War.

name: Loce
description: It is an area for resting, with shadow, nice view, a table a a bench. The local brought us some beer for us to enjoy the evening.

name: Grajski park vitez
description: campground in the garden of the renovated castle of Logatec. It is 20/25 km south of Ljubljana and north of Postonja. We could stay for free because the season was not started yet (it was april).

name: Camping Bled
description: Nice clean Campground. Established trees. Hot showers. Good facilities

name: Kamp danica
description: Nice campsite with all you need. Get one of the spots next to the river and enjoy !

name: Camping Lovsin
description:
Small really quiet campsite next to the river. Swimming possible next to the old mill, cafe available onsite. Kanoe rental possible.. recommended if you're looking for a quiet spot ! 
Grassy level field with lots of trees and shade.

name: Autocamp Kekec
description:
Very nice site close to Maribor.
Modern and clean facilities.

name: Kamp Triglav
description: Nice official camping ground in the nature reserve, with clean toilet, shower, electricity, bus stop (to go to Bovec, Vršič pass, Kranjska Gora or Ljubljana). If its full (which can happen in high season) they have some extra space behind the official camping site for vans (as seen on the photo). Costs: About 20-25 EUR for a van and 2 persons per night.

name: by the bridge
description:
no facilities, parking next to bridge, mostly out of sight, 2-3 places, not very scenic, just praktical, easy access to the shallow river, road noise, 
entrace is a few meters after the bridge on the right (direction to Bistrica), do not cross the railroad, follow the tiny dirtroad down about 100m. you will find 2 places. Quiet, only in the morning workers showed up to repair the bridge.

 Big rigs might make it to the first two spots, too.

 If you drive on under the little railbridge, you will reach a much nicer spot at the river (200m). Attention when rainy, the puddle under the bridge gets quite deep.

name: Tolmin Gorge
description:
nice walk along soca river canyon. 5euro /p, 1h, easy, dogs allowed, but they should be well behaved, otherwise its stressfull. Pathes are norrow, and you will go back and forth sometimes, and chances are high you meet other dogs along the path. Parking can get crowded. 
Parking not really suitable for camping, as in full sight of the tiny restaurant. 
Some walking pathes start here.

name: Lonely Parking
description:
Parking near Metal Days Festival area in dead end street. (festivals take place only sometimes, otherwise deserted). 
Didn't stay here, but looks like nobody would disturb you. Some buildings a bit further away. 
Water from the river, ca. 5 min walk. 
beautiful riverwalk with little tiny, stoney beaches. Hardly anybody around. Bring your bathing suit. 
You could probably find a place to pitch a tent. 

It's very difficult to find any wildcamps in the area. Here there is no sign, that you can not camp.

name: Vrbje
description: Official free camperstop on a nice park close to some rivers. Possibility for waste water/toilet disposal and against payment fresh water (10 cent for 8 liter) and electricity (50 cent 1KWh).

name: Krizna Jama
description: Visitors parking for the Krizna Jama cave entrance. Small tourist info point open April to September, or on appointment. Deserted outside the opening times. parking lot for multiple cars, fits big vehicles when not crowded.

name: Camp near castle
description: A free camper van ground near entrance of a 16th century castle. There is a camper van parking sign on an abandoned building. Quiet during night, but some car noise at the day.

name: Parking near Sheraton
description:
Park & Ride near Sheraton Hotel.
Near A11 so it's not silent.

name: Pension Patrick
description: Nice place with a very friendly owner - EUR 10/night

name: Bled RV parking
description: City lot for buses and RVs. Walking distance to the town and lake. Gas station and grocery store/cafe/pharmacy/toilets right next door. €10 for 24 hours but I think it was free on Sundays.

name: Trnek
description: Free camping @ natural reserve next to restaurant. Diner preferred also breakfast is possible. Very relaxed stay.

name: Camp Vrhpolje
description: Small camping in the town of Vrhpolje. Postojna Cave is easily accessible and also Triglav National Park. We stopped here for one night on our way from the Dolomites to Croatia. The daughter of the owner gave us ice cream because we said no to the home made wine. A real gem. And also affordable: 2 persons with 2 motorcycles and a small tent for one night 20€

name: Camp Špik
description:
A three star camping 6 Km from Kranjska Gora. It is all you can expect from a camping. It is clean and quiet and the view is magnificent. There is also a climbing wall, a store and a play ground for kids. There are a lot of bike routes and hiking routes here. 
PS 25% off for motorcyclists

name: Gostilna pri Boštjanu
description: Lovely quiet restaurant with a wonderfull view! Has traditional dishes & a homemade whine.

name: Camperstop Portoroz Habour
description: Camperstop in the Portoroz habour. Directly to the sea. Beach-showers. Nice view. Small bar and small playground for children. Expensive for a camperstop: 36€ for one night.

name: Camp Siber
description: Small campground on Tolminska river. There's a small path who follows the river to reach the center of Tolmin. Good price. We had to pay 18€ for 2 persons and a van (without electricity).

name: Field for parking nearby castle
description: Field for parking nearby castle. Castle only open on weekends and holidays. Therefore nobody comes by. We pitched up our tent, but bigger cars can stay there too. Great view into the valley. Even dixi toilets available at the parking lot.

name: Just off the main road
description: Just off the inland main road #7/E61 crossing the small part of Slovenia from Italy to Croatia. Plenty of space and all flat. Trees give good coverage towards the main road, so one cannot be seen. There is less traffic during the night, but the trucks can still be heard.

name: Big parking
description:
We ask to people who works on wood shop to stay the night. It was very quiet. First vehicles arrive around 7:00 AM.

Après avoir demandé à des employés du magasin de bois d'à côté, nous nous sommes posé pour la nuit. Très calme. le parking commence à se remplir vers 7h.

name: Kamp Perun
description: Established basic campground with showers etc. No swimming pool, but you can swim in the river (muddy). €29 for a camper and 2 persons, €4,- extra for electricity. Nice staff, good WiFi.

name: Camp Lijak
description: a beautiful camp not so expensive . wonderful landscape, very clean WC and bathroom. a lot of things To do around and To visit.

name: Lakefront
description: Nice quiet Place to Stay for a Night. Can stay directly on waterfront.

name: Dead End next to Mangert Street
description: Next to the Road up the Mangert there is an unfinished dead end road where you can park. Even ground, waterfall next by. View is great except the street. Stayed there for one night. Nobody cared.

name: Camp Podljubelj
description: Big grassy low key campsite in the Karawank Alps. Enthusiastic owners who give you a lot of information on walks and tours in the area. Beautiful surroundings. On the road to Klagenfurt (A), bypassing the Karawankentunnel. 20,30 Euro for campervan + 2 persons

name: Camping Podzemelj
description: Camping and cabins next to the river. Very nice spots down by the river with trees. Perfect and clean amenities. Bike rental. Great for kids. Pretty surroundings. Shop close by.

name: Eco River Camp
description:
A nice little camping that aims to be completely self sufficient. Showers are solar heated and power is solar generated.

Plenty of spots available for tents and only a few for vans or bigger cars.

They do limit the amount of guests to not over-use water and power.

name: Kamp Korita
description: Nice little camp ground right next to the river. 20€ for two person and camper without electricity. Wifi available if you need. Very clean facilities. Many nice and small hiking paths nearby. Due the low altitude (about 600m) not that cold (mid September). Not that crowded.

name: Tivoli Park Parking
description: Shaded parking lot next to the park a short walk into town. Safe and quiet. It's says .60/hour but we were here 24 hours and paid 3 Euros. 1 hour free wifi a day city wide

name: Dolgi Most P+R
description:
Big parking area, with sites for Caravans. 
There is a dump station, free water and electricity at site. and some picnic tables. It's 10€ per 24 hours. You can buy a Urbia Parking Card at the Ticket machine for 2 €. This card is working for travelling by bus. 8min to the old city by bus.

name: Into the woods
description: Very cozy place in the forest. Fits up to 4 vehicles. Only a few locals have taken their dogs for a walk a long the road.

name: one night stop
description: good for one night before crossing the border to Croatia. Spot is off the main road. No facilities. Please keep it clean.

name: Senkova Domacija
description: Beautifull camp site and hostel/hotel at the base of the pass into Austria. Family is restoring an old farmhouse with all buildings. Very quiet. Plenty of space to pitch your tent, kitchen (incl ammenities) available for cooking, very nice and new toilets and showers, restaurant also present. You can even sleep in the hay loft. When out of season, eating with the family is possible. Cost for 1p, tent & motorbike: €12 Limited space for motorhomes.

name: Speed Queen Ljubljana
description: Self service laundromat, 4€ for 9kg, 1€ for drying. Opened 6.00-24.00 every day. Free wifi.

name: Camper stop at restaurant
description: We stayed here in winter so the restaurant was closed but it's an official camper night stop. There aren't any services but the view is nice. Restaurant with toilets in summer.

name: Forest Mud Parking
description: Little place next to the forest with nice view. Muddy when rainy:-)

name: Kamp Polje
description:
Small, a bit remote campground near Novo Mesto. Having all you need to spend a night or a week: nice, clean showers/toilets, common area, canoo rental, etc.
~20€/night for 2 persons and a campervan incl. electricity, hot showers, tourist tax and wifi.

name: one of the best
description: fantastic spot for motorhomes only. Provided by the local community free of charge. This place has free water, electricity, rubbish bins a dump point and toilets in the sports club next to it. Great restaurants are in walking distance. This place is very clean please keep it this way.

name: Hostel Pekarna
description:
nice hostel in maribor .. near from center .
have parking outside of the hostel but safe . 
25€ shared rooms 
with breakfast

name: Vintgar River and Cave walk
description: Super cool attraction with one of Slovenia’s beautiful lakes running through a valley. Amazing place to get some epic pictures while in and around Bled.

name: Camping-Celje
description: About 7 kilometres from Celje, a relaxed campground behind a local bar. €18 for 2 people with a tent and a motorcycle. Very friendly and tranquil.

name: Pizzeria Plus Sevnica
description: Delicious pizza and vegetarian plate. Try it!

name: Free Camp Sevnica
description: Parking lot for camper with free water, electricity, dump station and wifi (near castle). No toilets. Thank you Sevnica!

name: Waterfall Bojana
description: Start of the 20min hiking trail to the waterfall bojana. You can go further up after you reach the waterfall. There you will find a flat and grassy area.

name: Field in Forest
description: Big open area in the forest. Very quiet, far from everything. We came with 2 motorbikes and camped in the middle of the field.

name: Istrabenz Plini
description:
Filled my Gaslow tanks. Can fill any bottle. 
Mon Fri 8 to 4.  price 12€ for 5 kg.
Has small disposable tanks also several kinds of small refillable tanks for sale. Very efficient. Facilities very modern. 
Tel: 05 663 46 00
www.istrabenzplini.sl
info@istrabenzplini.sl

name: Pri Ancki
description: A small out-of-the-way Guest house about 8 miles (13) outside Ljubjlana. The owner speaks English and motorcyclists are welcome. Parking on site but not covered/secure.

name: Camping Mirjam
description:
Established campsite in a great setting. It's in the village of Razdrto, overlooked by the most spectacular mountain - Nanos. 

Apart from a little (non-food) bar, there is a no facilities in the village. The campsite also has a bar but again, no food. There's a regular bus to the nearby town of Postojna, only 15 minutes away, where you can find supermarkets and shops, etc.

Very quiet and laidback place to pitch your tent or park up your RV. I cycled past on the 409 road and detoured in to the village to take a better look at the spectacular mountain overlooking it, and ended up staying four nights. 

Three hour hike to the top of the mountain begins by the church. Lovely campsite.

name: Picikato
description: Amazing amount of food, known for the pizza but the menu (English menu on request and everyone speaks it) is extensive. Huge salads, great pizza and almost everything you order is great. Can park some bigger rigs in lower lot. They deliver too!

name: Camping Belvedere
description: High above the sea, 3 sites without any toilet/ ablution block ..16Euros/pers...one hour parking fee 3 euros money talks here

name: Free Camp Tribej
description: Parking lot for camper with free water, electricity and dump station. No toilets. Next to the river. There is low wifi signal next to the farm house, maybe it is private but open:-). It was free of charge.

name: Camper parking Trzic
description:
Parking lot for camper with free water, electricity, dump station and wifi (1h/day). No toilets. 
Price 7€ for campervan per 24h
Thank you Trzic!

name: Autokamp Smica
description: Nice campground next to the river. Friendly owner and everything was clean! 8Euro/person and night. Dog was free! Wifi at the entrance Recommended!

name: River Trail
description: Nice walk along the beautiful river. There are several spots for a refreshing bath.

name: Babji Zob Night of Silence
description: We had two perfect nights here. Hiking trail to Babji Zob starts at this point. There is also a climbing spot next to this parking.

name: Kamp Klin
description: Nice campground direct at the river. Small walk to the gorge where you can jump from rocks into the river. Fuuuuun! Wifi only at the restaurant. Highly recommended!

name: Camping Radenci ob Kolpi
description:
Nice campground on a grassy field.
Located directly at the river.
Bathrooms not the newest, but clean.
11,90 € per person. 
You can rent canoes and make tours.
We really like it.

name: Lake Soboško jezero
description: Wild camping spot near the lake and Expano on the outskirts of Murska Sobota city. There is a restaurant close to the lake. Highway is close, so it can be a bit noisy during the night.

name: Ledava Lake
description: Nice fishing area behind the football pitch next to the lake. Really quiet a night. Fire pit, flat area, tap water, but not sure it's possible to swim into the lake. Some mosquitos.

name: Parking Lot for rigs
description: Big parking lot no tents allowed. but for rigs some facilities

name: Camp Natura (Aqualuna Water Park)
description: Neat and tidy campsite next to the water park, Eu71 for a night’s camping and access to the water park for 2 adults and 2 kids. An absolute score and great site if you have kids with you. There is also an abandoned castle on the hill nearby which is great to explore.

name: Camping Smlednik
description: Little camping place | River close to the camp | really quiet

name: Eco Camp Supot
description:
Beautiful small camping site. It is run by a family. They also have some chickens, dogs and sheep there. You can have a camping spot for tents in the Forrest or close to a fireplace. Also at the family house you can get some good food, cold beer and wine. Fresh water, Wifi, showers and a kitchen are also included. But it is only suitable for tents. Caravans couldn’t be too big. 1 Person, 1 tent with one motorcyle was about 15€.
Also difficult to find it. But you can call the Campsite owners, they speak good english and can describe the way (+386 31 683 466)

name: Lucija’s farm
description:
Very friendly owner Lucija. Camping on a farm with lots of animals, cats, dogs, horses. Only for 10 people space since there’s only 1 toilet with shower. The owner strongly requests to make reservation beforehand: 0038631335102
Per night: E12,50 per person, kids under 6 for free. Now (06/2022) €17.50 pp
Lucija Lešnjak, Grušova 11, 2229 Malečnik, Slovenija

name: Gostilna Lipan
description:
A beautifull and Charming Hotel with a nice fish restaurant. Fish comes from the river! Owners are bikers and have place in their safety garage for your bikes. They speak very good english. Bedrooms are clean and big. Breakfast is delicious and they serve only local product. Ljubljana is about 35 min with motorbike.
I paid 45€/night with breakfast.

name: Log pod Mangartom
description: Road side water tap. Road is busy so care needed. There is another roadside tap at 46.415640, 13.609882.

name: Place next to small ski centrum
description: This place is parking for ski centrum. We don’t pay. Very beautiful place,but isnt private. Water and toilet are there.

name: Free 4 places camp
description:
Official free parking lots, for 4 big rigs.
Electricity and water available in extra
Picnic area and small playground
Perfect to visit the castel
Many restaurants in the main street
Nice town

name: Grad Haasberg
description: A nice place to stop to sleep and have a rest. Wonderful sky in the night, quiet, no noises. I slept here in my Nissan Patrol.

name: Don‘t go here without the Vignette.
description:
We got on to the motorway at the last entrance before the border to Croatia. We were allowed to drive to the first exit into Slovenia, too. So we thought we wouldn’t need a Vignette. We had to pay 150€ fee and 15€ for the Vignette directly at the border.

PS: Before we got on the motorway we drove southbound parallel to it. We saw a police car and were not sure if we can cross the border on the small street so we asked them (they stopped anyways). These idiots told us we can buy the Vignette at the border for 15€ but didn’t tell us about the 150€ fee.

name: Grad Vuberk
description:
on the grassy parking Quiet restaurant closed AT 10pm free

au fond du parc de stationnement calme a 10 h le resto ferme

name: pneus
description:
ideal for changing tires fast services cheap also sells schnapS
we Cyril. 6 € per liter


idéal pour changer les pneus services rapides pas cher vend aussi du schnapS
nous Cyril. 6 € le litre

name: Spondja  Vizinga
description:
area near River road 100 m few trafic 7 pm to 9 am


un emplacement au bord de la rivière la route a 100 m peu passante la nuit

name: Hostel Hildegard
description:
Nice hostel with friendly owners. We booked a double bed room via booking.com for 52€, including breakfast.
Came from the TET from direction Zaga and it's not far off the trail. Could park the motorcycles in the driveway.
Free Wi-Fi and a neat little garden with hammocks and sun chairs.
Bathroom to be shared with others.

name: route 696
description: A grand'mother offered her flat area to stay one night near road without traffic. View of valley.

name: Vrhpolje
description:
take the path after the cemetery to the right to the end along the creek 
place to walk the premises
--
prendre le chemin apres le cimetière a droite jusqu'au bout le long du ruisseau 
lieu de promenade des locaux

name: Sokla
description:
parking entrance town quiet no train at night, not a lot of traffic
parking a l'entrée de la ville calme pas de train la nuit peu de trafic

name: Danica
description:
Really nice and clean hostel. The owner Stefani is a really friendly lady who knows the needs of motorcyclists. - Beer and breakfast.
We paid 40€ for a double bed room including breakfast with air-condition.
3 parking places behind the house also for campers. Motorcycles can be parked on the property.
Laundry service is possible.
Supermarkt and gas station within walking distance. Beach is around 200m away across the main road.
Extremely clear water! Incredible!

name: Turistična kmetija Abram Nanos (Tourist Farm)
description: Nice place in the mountains. There is a restaurant and they have rooms as well. We asked to camp and they let us put our tents for free, we had dinner and breakfast though in their restaurant, prices are quite ok!

name: Viewpoint Kopitnik
description: A very nice viewpoint. You can walk up there from Uzice. Or drive up there from the other side. It's a starting point for paragliding. Looks like an amazing point for wildcamping, but not sure if it's allowed.

name: Planica Ski Center
description:
Official overnight parking spot for campers, vans etc. 12€ for campers (electrical ports available), 2,5€ for small vans and 4x4 etc. Huge area to choose if you are not attaching to electricity. 
Olympic Ski flying slopes, hikes, zipline and what not there. Interesting area and beautiful valley Tamar. 
I asked at the reception at the Ski Center and showers can be used for free. There is a bathroom and bistro. All only available at opening times. Planica Nordic Center.

name: Camping Trenta Sergej Bolčina
description:
In the middle of the mountains. Quite high, the view is splendid.
Places for tents, cars, camping cars.
Trails not far.

name: Kva Hostel
description:
The location really can't be beaten. It's right on the river walk and near all the bars and restaurants. The entrance has double doors and the owner was happy to let me park the motorcycle inside the building for the night - a rarity for Europe! 

fast WiFi, nice common area, good kitchen.

dorm was €13/night

name: LRS - Land Rover Repairs
description: Great workshop for Defender and Discovery in Ljubljana, and passionate about Defender refurbishing. Pero is super knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful. Good supply of spares. Speaks English +38640430021 (WhatsApp).

name: Water & wc
description: Potable water source and wc on one spot on the border of triglav NP

name: Vulkanizerstvo Žemlja Žemlja Janez Ml. s.p.
description: Excellent tire shop. Recommended by local campsite owner. Friendly staff. After repairing a broken valve on the rear wheel they also checked the other tyres .

name: Beside Dirt Road
description: Drive up the dirt road, over a little bridge, keep left and aprox 100meters you have a spot for the night. Little close to road, ok for one night.

name: Vodiška Planina
description: The road is very good up to the mountain, no need of 4wd. We camped behind the restaurant after we asked permission to overnight. We heard from a local friend that the food should be good there - so will go there and check it out.

name: CamperStop Šmarje pri Jelšah
description: A free place for 5 Motorhomes. You can get electricity and water. And you can dispose grey and black water.

name: krnica
description: Parking place beside mountain road, with a great view of the mountains and the valley.

name: šoder jama
description: Lake with beautiful water, on weekends is very busy, peaceful at night. Water is very clean, suitable for swimming.

name: David‘s place
description:
This is beautiful campsite established by David. Please call him before you arrive: ‭+386 70 516 222‬ 
It’s a free campsite, however, if you want  the place to be maintained as it is you are welcome to donate as much as you want and you are able to.
 
The campsite provides you with everything you need: a cold shower, a regular toilet, running water, a kitchen, a fire pit...not to mention the beautiful view of the mountains. 
If you want David can give you information about local rafting or kayaking tours.
There is two waterfalls in walking distance (20min) from the campsite where you can cliff jump and swim. 
If you stay with David please be respectful and help to make this stay a beautiful place. 

HOW TO GET THERE:
From Bovec you follow the road to Kobarid for more or less 3km. At the sign of the golf course turn right and follow the road across the golf course (don’t hesitate, it’s just old people playing golf, they don’t bite). At the end of the golf course you will cross a small bridge. Right after the bridge, turn sharp left. There will be a sign “Privat. No parking.” That belongs to David. Keep going 10m more and you will see his property on the right hand side.

name: Hidden place just off the road
description: Wild camping spot on what seems to be a walking path, but unused. Right next to the road but hidden by the trees. There is a restaurant walking distance just up the road.

name: Riverside
description: Nice clearance just off the bridge. Access to the river. During the day lots of people trying to cool down in the river. Campfires possible.

name: Magical Dragonja
description:
A field in the region of Dragonja with lots of space to set up tents. You have to cross a river with your car but it's very low. Managed it with a Seat Ibiza. 

The surrounding area is wonderful to explore! Lots of swimming spots. 

There is a summer home next to the field, but they were friendly and did not mind us camping here for a few days.

name: By the River Grad Haasberg
description:
Nice little spot by the river to camp for a night. Looks like locals come here sometimes to make a fire by the water.

Came in a group of 5 with 2 tents. 

Please don't forget to pick up your litter :)

name: Paternoster Farm Camping
description:
Really nice place. Friendly owner. Gave us tomatoes, peppers and onions for free. Place is made with a lot of passion. 18€ per camper and night. Lots of ducks, dogs and other animals around.
Bar 600m away. 3 tiny cabins available. Parking on grass, some trees for a hammock if you have long straps. Very nice and clean place opposite of the fire fighter station.

name: mountain view
description: Nice spot for the night. In the morning gorgeous view on Triglav peak and the valley.

name: Camp Plana Pivka
description:
Nice place for travelers and good food lovers. Not overpriced. 
10€ per person, 5€ tent spot, pets allowed 1€. 
Showers and toilets are new and classy. 
Quite a few cool places around: Military museum, Postojna cave, some hiking spots. 
Very good food in bar.

name: Kamp Tunarica
description: Family with 3 small kids, a lot of shade but hard to find even ground for  tents. We were not happy with the beach  and water was not totally clean. The camp is in the nature and the toilets are new and clean. It was fine, but could be better.

name: Motorhome parking
description: There are 3 parking spots in Lasko. Wifi, water, waste water, electricity are free according to sign. Didn't see a sign that says: No overnight parking. So I guess it it allowed. located next to a Spar supermarket and train station with toilets.   Probably trains will pass by and make noise.

name: wild juta house
description: wild juta house. you can upgrade it if you want.

name: Flosar Reataurant
description: Family reataurant with space for 3-4 tents. Free wifi, restrooms, nice restaurant. A real FIND!

name: Picnic Areas
description:
Moderator Note: The description indicates that the Place is for picnics. Please verify that it is acceptable to stay overnight,
.....
One of two designated "picnic areas" on this bike path. Has picnic table, very clean porta-potty, restaurant less than 300 meters away.

name: Riverside
description: We found this nice little spot next to the river. It’s somewhat close to the road so there is a little road noise, but it is closer to the river so mostly you just hear rushing water. There are no toilets or electricity and if you don’t have 4 Wheel or at least all wheel drive it *may* be tricky to get down to the spot, or rather back up to the road. But it’s also very nice to go for a little swim in the river (though it was very cold).

name: jezero mola
description:
Clean small site close to a warm water lake.
Not sure how legal it is. I was here during summer week and had no people here what so ever. I think fisher might use this place intens. Take care of the environment please.

name: pomjan hidden viewpoint over koper
description: This is on a field and hunters do hunt here. Keep it clean and make no fire or you will get visitors from the locals. This region is firehazardus.

name: Roadside parking (free)
description:
Free parking by the side of the road. Enough space for 4 motorhomes. 
Picnic area with tables and bin.

Cars pass by, but it doesn’t bother. Not much of a view.

One of the few places around with free parking.

name: Town’s parking (free)
description: Town’s parking, free of charge. Enough space for 5-6 cars. Relatively quiet at night. Close to stables and a restaurant.

name: Swimming area
description: A very nice and clean place to have a swim. There is a picnic area with toilets, shower and tables/benches. Great for during the day but camping overnight here is not allowed.

name: Strmec
description: Roadside public fountain, drinking water.

name: Free flat area next to viewing tower
description: Nice and clean spot, space for multiple rigs, right next to a wooden tower. No facilities.

name: Small side road near quarry remains
description: Small offshoot from the main road below the remains of an old quarry. Invisible to passers-by at night, visible during daylight. We reversed about a 100m into the path to not be right by the road.

name: Scenic road - Incredibly beautiful
description: Very-very beautiful scenery along the road. A lot of it is unpaved but 4wd is not required. Multiple water sources next to the road.

name: Organic Winery
description: Lovely Winery which doesn't advertise that they offer space for campers or tents. The owners speak English and offer tastings of their orange wine. There is a toilet, no shower, and plenty of space for tents and cars. They charged €10 per night for the two of us.

name: Restaurant Koblarjev Bay
description: Restaurant parking lot next to river Drau, toilets from the restaurant, electricity, and water. All for free donation. Good food at the restaurant.

name: Large parking lot next to roundabout
description:
Parking on gravel for for 30+ campers. Its next to roundabout, but almost no traffic at night during high season. Awesome place if you dont book a campsite, they are often full during the season. 

If this one is full (it filled up after 10pm) there is one more parking lot full of campers right next to the ski lift (across the roundabout on a small hill).

name: Smrekovec
description: Forest wild campsite with superb view. Large enough for few cars.

name: Camping Prosca
description:
At the time we are here (september 2021) no toilets or other type of facilities. No running water or electricity, though our one camping companion has found a drinking water source nearby and provided a large container of water. 

Nice quiet field in the wood. Looks like the owner is building up the place; planted some fruit trees, halfway built a wooden house. 

From the road a small way in the bush over a small creek (don’t need 4x4)

name: if the lake nearby is too crowded
description: flat, big, quiet. we came here because the lake was too crowded. the corn was high in september and nobody could see us at night using outdoor light. minus: there is a hughe electrical power line over the place. for us it was ok. nice sunrise in the morning

name: Kamp Tura
description: Nice practical camp, with spacious pitches for campers. Also extra place for tents. Dogs are welcome. Great for climbers. Nearby is tennis court and climbing wall. Very kind staff and nice bar.

name: Waterside Wildcamping Spot
