description: Small, very pretty spot for camping/vibing next to a small lake. Cars bigger than a VW Bus might be tricky. Pls pick up your litter.

name: Beautiful place next to river
description: Large grassy parking lot where you can spend the night. It belongs to a river boat company and the owner allows campers to stay. We only spoke to him in the morning and he said we could stay as long as we want.

name: Beside a pub by the river
description: This is an actual free motorhome overnight area, but you'd never know it. Mid October we were the only ones here on a Saturday night, but I'm sure it's busier during the summer months. Washroom available at the pub.

name: Free overnight
description:
A large gravel lot dedicated to motorhome campers. Trash facility, and free WiFi. Water tap and outhouse nearby.
 Room for 30 motorhomes, been here mid October night and we were the only ones here. 
No place to empty toilet cassettes. Even has two free electric outlets.

name: Bicycle shop Bajkmanija
description:
Great bike shop where you can find rare and special parts - big and small ones. Super nice and helpful staff.
They will do their best to help you out!

name: Kaki Plac
description: Kaki Place is a little campground in the woods. Space for max 40 people. No Campervans or cars, but motorcycle is possible.

name: Logar Valley Lay-by by Church
description: Little lay-by just off road next to beautiful church and surrounded by mountains with incredible view. Good for 1 possibly 2 nights. We stayed in January and had no issues. There is a plaque with a motor home printed on it which suggests that it is allowed to stay here.

name: bled, slovenie
description: beautiful quit, sunny spot nearby lake bled

name: top of the hill
description:
Only for campers. A wonderful place accessible by foot.
There is flat place on the top of the hill. It's quiet , out of sight and fantastic view

name: Furman Guesthouse
description: Guesthouse with Pizzeria below. We paid €50/night for a one bedroom apartment for two people. (Washing machine in room.) What we liked most about this place is that they are outfitted for motorcycles. A parking garage specifically for them, with a place to hang your gear and rags to wipe it. Pizzeria had great pizza and prices ranged from €6-10 each. The location is ideal if you are riding the TET.

name: Apartment Natasa
description: We paid about €45 in off season for two people for a room with two beds, private bath and a kitchen. Kitchen is outside the room. I say approx because we booked on Booking.com, but you can just show up. There is a €2/pp tourist tax as well. Owner gave us a welcome drink and snack, plus a little souvenir. Beautiful town and views, with lots of hiking trails nearby. Covered spot to park your Motos. 👍🏻

name: Pr. Smolet
description: New and modern apartments in a little village on a hilltop. Great views and extremely kind owners. Susan and her husband have a shop where they make and sell local liquor, lots of options and good prices. We were welcomed with a thorough tasting of as many liquors as we liked. €60 for a nice studio apartment with amazing view. Susan can provide breakfast on request for €8 per person. Lots of parking space.

name: Smartinski Park
description: Parking lot by the park. It’s paid parking. €0.60 per hour and €12 per day M-F. It appears to be free on weekends. It’s open 24hrs. I had breakfast here on a Sunday with slider facing the park. Quiet with some park patrons out on a job, riding bike, and walking their dogs.

name: Podgorje border with Herzogovena
description: Approached this border and wont permit us to cross with UK passports post Brexit.  Advised to go to Kozina

name: Parkingspot
description:
Cheap parking area near the center of Ljubljana. 10 min to walk to the center.
8h parking 3,5€ and from 19.00-7.00 1,50€. We stayed here one night with our 6.5m truck.

name: Wild camp near lake
description: Big grass space near a lake. Leveled and flat. A bit bumpy to arrive but ok. Good for tent, car or caravan.

name: Camping & Camper Stop near Ljubljana
description: Camping in Dol pri Ljubljani is a small campsite located in nature just 15 min from the town, available for motorhomes, camping tents, cars or travel trailers. It's well equipped with everything you need: showers, toilets, washing machine, electricity & water supply, dump station (for grey and black wastewater), free WIFI internet access, large covered terrace with sits and tables, etc. Camper stop offers parking spaces on the lawn or paved surface (also possible under the roof). Good connections to Ljubljana town (BUS/train), bike rental, hiking options on nearby hills, rock climbing, guided yoga & meditation sessions, wine tasting, vegetables, musical evenings, and more. Also offers camper repair, wash, and indoor winter storage for campers

name: Herzerlstrasse
description:
You could pay €5 pp to take a picture, also you can consume some food and drinks. 
I think €5 is a total rip off!!!

name: CARWASH Zaldska
description:
24/7 carwash, self service. 1.5€ per jeton.
needed 2 to clean my motorbike after some offroad (TET)

name: picnic area on route to Vršič Pass
description: Picnic area next to a historic telpher line display. There's a picnic table with benches and access (via long steep steps) to the river. We put our tent & moto next to the wall to stay out of sight. Camping cars would be visible to the road but little traffic after dark. No signs prohibiting camping. Nice spot for a night.

name: Soka Pot (free access to beautiful gorge)
description: Access to a beautiful gorge and to the river. Paid parking lot. Toilet in parking area. Crowded but nice area.

name: unused forest road
description: We passed a quiet night camped in our tent on this unused (we think) forest road. We wanted to camp at the nearby "mountain view" spot but the road there was too rocky for our moto. We found this instead; good spot in the forest for motorcycles & bicycles,likely ok for camping cars too but may have to back out since the road is narrow. Near road but not visible.

name: Camping @ Nogometni Golf
description: Small, simple, nice campground. large grassy area for tents and camping cars. Some shade. Just 4 toilets & 2 showers but clean. Nice covered area with tables, benches, refrigerators & sink for washing dishes. No electricity for camping cars but charging point for mobil phones, etc.. Nice owners. 10.50 € + 3.13€ city tax pp.

name: nice spot next to road
description: We passed a quiet night in our tent in this little grassy area just off the main road. It's possible to camp/park where you're out of sight (or mostly out of sight) of passing cars. Good spot for tent campers or camping cars.

name: Kamp Lazar Edi Lazar sp
description: A beautiful campsite you drive in and is looking for your place and reception is in the restaurant and food is also good looking good for me as a motorcycle ride also voor 4x4 and the big campers

name: river stop/rest area
description: nice stop if you want to go for a cold swim! huge parking area, free wifi, picnic area. don't think you can spend the night

name: Speleo Camp
description: Nice, small, quiet, family run camping place mostly used by cavers and climbers. Owner speaks english and has a very nice dog.

name: Logarska Dolina
description: A dry riverside place. Can accommodate several tents, parking 200 meters away.

name: Near Ankaraska Plaza
description: 54€ for one person is way too much especially if you get a place which is only mud and it was really hard to get the tent pegs in because the ground is really hard. don't go here!

name: Camp Jelinčič
description: Camp located right next to the Soča river. Clean, shared toilets and showers, with warm water. Lot of place for tents and campers.  Arranged fireplaces. Electricity on some spots. Local specialities (cheese and fishes) in their own restaurant. Very nice family owners. Dog friendly

name: Mountain Lookout
description:
Just on the Slovenia side of the border is a small disused forest track that switchbacks up the mountain to a flat lookout spot. 
Great views and the track shows little to no signs of use. It's rutted out and the last part is steep so 4x4 recommended. You can always stop further down the hill and camp as well.

name: plaža
description: local place, open for overland wisitors.

name: Grega's Van spot (WhatsApp / Viber)
description:
Privately owned SAFE parking / overnight parking spot inside Triglav National Park.

Contact Grega (+386-40-209-602) via WhatsApp / Viber. 

Rare opportunity to stay over night with your Van / Car / Small Camper within the bounds of Triglav National Park. 
Safe location, bright, start of hiking trails. 2km from Waterfall Pericnik. 

Located on the PRIVATE land. Possible to park over night. Marked with 'chain'.

Please contact Grega - +386-40-209-602 if you want stay there. (€15/night).

name: Voda
description: It's a little fountain in a parking in city.

name: Za Blatom
description: Parallel to the 911 runs the old road, which is a good gravel road. This spot is a larger flat clearing in the forest, but several spots can be found along the track.

name: Krnica
description: On a dead end of a forest road is a larger clearing.

name: falkenau
description: Very good restaurant. It was the fourth Time since 10 years (we love Slovénia) and it's allways a good expérience. Squid stuffed with ham and cheese, Bear goulasch, Nice staff and service continued ( we arrived at 3 pm and people are still arriving at 4.30...

name: Toyota garage
description: Very knowledgeable Toyota garage and almost everybody speaks English.

name: Ljubliana Resort Hotel&Camp
description: Big campsite for all kind of recreational vehicles. Bus stop is on the other side of the road and takes you straight to the city center. Price (without electricity) in high season is 45 euro's. During the night, you have some noise from passing trains (but not too bad). Next door there is also a pool, but you have to additionally pay for it.

name: Vargalant
description: If a 'normal' garage can't help you (because they don't have parts for example), this workplace can make replacement (fake) parts and install them. They also have a big selection of oils and additives.

name: Borovnici
description: A few spots in the forest, on a sidetrack of an unpaved (gravel) forest road. Not suitable for big vehicles. Nobody around during the day or night (we stayed a couple of nights). Some chamois and dear visited us (on a distance).

name: Kamp Terme Catez
description: Expensive and very high frequented campingsite. With a Motorbike or by foot you can enter through the Roadblock next to the Aquapark easyly. The showers need no Coins of u need a shower on the road and if you dont want to pay it's possible. They only control the Main Entrance. We stayed here for free for 2 days. Keep away from the gril Restaurant. Very Expensive and Bad food.

name: Kamp Beli gaber
description:
Small camp site opened June 2022. Simple tent pitches on terraces. Exellent facilities. 
https://kampbeligaber.com/

name: Cvetlin
description: Border crossing only for EU citizens. All passports are checked on the Slovenian side of the border (both directions), but delay is minimal.

name: Celje Community RV spot
description: There are six level parking slots for RVs at the end of the parking lot.  2.50 euros to park weekdays from 6am to 3pm.  free after that and IV weekends. Cassette dumping free, water is 50 cents for 40L, power is 50 cents a kWh.  Pit toilets in the park area and bathrooms in the ice arena when it's open.  Free wifi from the arena too.  4G cell reception. 800m walk across a pedestrian bridge into old town.

name: Slovenia, near the border with Austria
description: One of the best spots we've ever found. Magnificent views. Next to vines. Near the viewing platform, so steep climb for the last section. Not for big rigs. Space for two vans parked considerately. Bin.

name: Konibar camp
description:
A nice campsite next to the lake.
More info and pricelist here in the link. The route from Zarnovica to Banska Stiavnica is very picturesque, I truly recommend it.

name: Banská Štiavnica
description: Probably the most beautiful of all towns in Slovakia. Historic Unesco heritage mining city from 13th century, full of beautiful castles and cobbled streets. A must see, if you are visiting Slovakia.

name: Počúvadlo lake
description:
This is one of 24 "Tajchy": a unesco heritage preserved artificial water reservoirs made in 18th century for mining purposes. Now used for recreacional purposes (swimming). I highly advise to pay some of them a visit, you can find some campspots (and freecamp too) along some of them. Perfect for cycling around in the hills.
More info on Tajchy:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tajchy 
Good resources on Tajchy, cycling routes and accommodation:
http://www.bajkomktajchom.sk/index/language/en

name: Riverside near Sedliacka Dubova
description: Piece of grassland next to river. You could also camp on the other side of the river, there are some picknick tables and a small, slow running well.  Closeby runs the train over the bridge, but it is a  very small one and stops at night. A few hundred meters north you could camp under big trees near the football field. Local people very friendly.

name: Ski lift parking
description: A huge gravel parking place at the foot of a ski lift. In summer there is no one and it is good to stay a night.

name: Abandoned ski jumping ramp
description: An old ramp in the forest next to the ski lift. Really worth seeing it. Follow the blue hiking trail an you will get right between the ramp and the landing area. You could park a camper there.

name: Parking next to danube
description:
A huge paved/grassy parking lot, lots of leveled space. Could get crowded during the summer festivals or end of the week if the weather's nice, but there's a lot of space.
Just next to the park(Sad Janka Kráľa), across the park there's a huge shopping mall with anything you need.
Also right next to the "Old Bridge", which is the newest bridge in Bratislava - the city center begins just across the bridge, so 10-15 minutes walking and you're there.
Free, no amenities.

name: laundry
description: automatic laundry 8h-21h at 3,60€ for 6kg and 1€ fort 20 min dryer

name: tiger park
description: open on weekend 12h-17h. project to protect the siberian tiger. 21 tigers and 2 lions. good place for children. it is free but gift are welcome, for exemple you can buy soft toy for 10€

name: Pocuvadlo lake
description: Parking near the lake. we payed 2,70€ fort 24h on the week-end but nothing on the week. Great walk to do around the lake and in the forest. there is a little farm near the hotel toky. great place for children

name: Podzamcok old castel
description: very quiet place near the ruin of the old castel. pik nik table. Nice walking to do. there is place for 2 campers

name: banska free parking
description: city free parking open all day and night. no amenities.

name: Cicmany
description:
free parking at the entrance of the village.
there is a small slop. it's next to the river

name: Autokemping Bojnice
description: Nice shady place with a few spots to park and put a tent but also some cute huts to stay in. The sanitary area ok, there's toilets and showers. The receptionist is really nice and speaks fluent English and during high season the bar/Restaurant ist open till midnight. WiFi is really good. Prices: a/n: 3€, van/n: 6€, tax/Person: 1€.

name: Duchonka
description:
Large campsite in trees on lake. Two bars and restaurants nearby selling good cheap food. 
Toilets and showers ok. 
Bar at site really chilled. Owner speaks English and very helpful. 
We paid €9 for 2 persons car and bike.
Be aware that at the weekends this can be a party site, great for meeting the locals, drinking and music all night😀🍺. 
During the week you'll probably be alone.

http://www.duchonkacamping.sk/index.php/english

name: Rijo Camping
description:
At the bottom of the mountains with nice views. Open areas on grass. very busy when we visited in August.
Faculties basic but clean. WLAN slow, but stable. 
Small bar and snack bar. Restaurants in town.

name: A place with a view
description: Steep dirt road, no 4wd needed, some noise from the main road. Good spot for one night, cool barbecue location.

name: Demanovska dolina - Parking place
description:
Parking place with nice picnic shelter with the table.
It is 500m from Demanovska Ice Cave and 1500m from Demanovska Cave of freedom and 6km from Chopok ski resort. 
Parking is next to the road and close to the river so there you can fill up your water tank. 
There is also nice place with the table to make a coffee or lunch.

name: Demanovska dolina - Parking place
description:
Parking place with nice picnic shelter with the table.
It is 500m from Demanovska Ice Cave and 1500m from Demanovska Cave of freedom and 6km from Chopok ski resort. 
Parking is next to the road and close to the river so there you can fill up your water tank. 
There is also nice place with the table to make a coffee or lunch.

name: Autocamping Barca, Kosice
description: Fantastic little campsite. Brandnew facilities that are superclean with rainshowers and hooks there where you need them. Kitchen with microwave and 2 4 pit induction cooking plates. There are 2 washing machines and 2 dryers in the reception area. Receptionist speaks good English. The on site bar offers snacks and drinks.

name: Castle Devin
description:
A large free parking lot, just below the medieval castle Devin. It can be quite busy during the day, but after visiting hours it should be very quiet.
I also recommend visiting the castle or walk around a bit, it's a nice area. Bus goes from here to Bratislava as well.

name: Farm & Camping Lazy
description:
Small farm with campsite, lovely owners (overlanders!), good bathrooms, bread service, free vegetables, cheese, meat, WiFi - all you need for a nice stay. 
Owners speak English.

name: Grasfield
description: Grassfield near to a Forest. Depending of your preferences one side with the sun in the evening, the other side of the forest in the Morning.

name: Mara Camping
description: Well established camp, on a lake with beach, water sports and kids activities. Lots of bathroom and shower options plus a washing machine available. Clean and a lovely position on the lake.

name: Behind the tower
description:
From the road there are tracks that lead to a grass field with a huge tower (for phone reception). If you drive about 20 meters up you see a small trail into the woods. Here you can pitch a tent.

Perfect for motorcycles or 4x4. Not so much for big rigs.

The place itself is used by some locals every now and than as they do leave some garbage around. Still a nice spot to camp. Pick up after yourself!

name: Camping Marina
description:
Beautiful location. Near road. Few flat spots, mostly Ieaning. Good for all size vehicles.
€4 per vehicle and per person (July 2018)

name: Camping Studenec
description: Newly established campsite. Very neat and everything is brand new. 5€ per person, 5€ tent, 5€ motorcycle. The very friendly owner speaks English.

name: Old Chapel
description: On top of this hill above the old castel is an old chapel with a beautiful view of the village and surroundings. We just had a break here but i am sure no one would disturb you if you park up here or camp here. The road is steep.

name: Flower hills
description: Amazing Spot to park and camp. Just Nature! Flowers all around! Good Dirt road to the place.

name: Podlesok camping
description: Large campground, start towards most of the walks in “Slovakian Paradise”

name: Camping Dronte
description: Small basic campsite next to the river. Mainly used by people with canoes. Various places where you can build a small camp fire next to your tent. I believe I paid 3,5 euro for one night (1 motorbike, small tent and 1 person).Beautiful place to meet other people

name: Camping Rybniky Opatovce
description:
Very nice Campground. They have Lakes for fishing and a Swimmingpool, prices are cheap compared to the area. 
Showers and toilets are Clean, space for all kinds of vehicles, can only recommend.

name: Camp Majerka
description: Restaurant with campground at the river. The reception is at the restaurant. The meadow is on the other side of the railroad crossing on the left side. Cost for one night is 1 euro per person. The owner is very friendly, but speaks no english. The campground is not visited often.

name: Kohutka hill
description: Place for the night, short of the peak of the mountain - borders to cz

name: Autocamping Tatranská Štrba
description:
This is an established camping in the Tatra mountains. It is easily accessible from the highway, but I recommend the national roads because of the scenery. 
The prices are good: one person, one motorbike, one small tent for one night - 9€. There is also a restaurant. I paid for dinner (soup and second course) 10€.
There is grass almost everywhere, but the terrain is not at a level.

name: parkinglot spis castle
description: No established ground for camping. parking infront of the Castle, nice View. No Problem to stay there for the night.

name: View point 360' Tatras
description:
Amazing place on the top of a small hill. 
So beautiful view to the small Tatras and Big Tatras. 
Possibility to stay a few nights. 
Excellent start for trekking, mountain bike,...
4x4 is better

name: Wild camp between Bratislava and Senec
description: Parking alongside a fishing lake. We arrived when it was dark and just parked between the road and the lake. A few people night fishing but other than that very quiet.

name: Liptovsky Mara church
description: Amazing views of the lake and mountains, small old church next to the dam. Very quiet spot quite far from anything but a perfect place to relax

name: Great spot by the river
description:
Great little spot next to the river! Beautiful and peaceful 
A few dog walkers and a friendly fisherman are the only people we have seen in our two nights here 

Tesco and a few other shops about 15min drive away!

name: Veľký Paklán
description: At the end of the asphalt or even further behind the hill you will find space between bushes and trees. not much space for huge rigs. due to the distance to the main road and the trees it is very quiet. some locals go hiking or cycling but it was not busy when I was here.

name: AutoKemping
description: camped here although it was close for winter so there was no access to toilets. Went to nearby restaurant, had dinner and used facilities.

name: Autocamp Levoca
description: Nice campsite with sober (but clean!) sanitary facilities. Nice german anď english speaking owner. With fireplaces.

name: Ruzemberok
description: Great view over the city and mountains. Small fire place.

name: Autocamping Snina
description:
Autocamping with a lot of space.
Owners are very friendly and ride motorbikes too.

At 20 kms from a Ukraine border, a little border we passes in 1/2 hour.

name: At the river
description:
Wild camp next to a small river. There are signs saying camp at the entrance, but it's basically a small meadow. We found some firewood.road is  close but just a few cars passing at night.
Two very friendly police officer came by to check our passports in the evening.
4G on Telekom SK.

name: River spot for a night
description:
Good spot for a night. Close to a tiny street but almost no traffic at all except for some hikers. The small street goes up to kind of starting point for hikes a
In that area. The small river/lake looks ok for bathing but maybe not for filling up fresh water.

name: Unaccessible lake
description:
There is no way to access the lake, all roads are blocked with barriers and even guards. Looks permanently closed to the public, the only access was via a guard, who let locals who live there through. Sort of a gated community. 

You could camp on this spot as is a big grassy field, but you're looking at the backside of a dam.

name: Old tank testing range
description: Well known place with the locals, sometimes there are held small festivals. Good camp spots next to the water. I put the GPS point in the second field, next to the concrete one, as it is nicer and has some privacy. Shade from trees and good cell reception.

name: Bad’an
description: An old traditional pump. Right by the bus stop.

name: Wheat field close to Bratislava
description: A quiet place for your tent for a night. There is a tree, close to the main road, on a wheat field. Just some noises of the cars on the main road, but it’s fine to sleep for a night if you don’t know wherever to sleep close to Bratislava.

name: Lake close to Levoča
description:
Update August 6, 2022: There is no place to camp here any more. There is a climbing park here and only a parking lot. 
.....
A nice lake with a lot of grass. You can put your tent here under some trees to have also shade. Then you can swim in the lake for free.
The place is very clean and cute, well maintained.
In the night, expect to have some visitors such as foxes or rabbits.

name: Gravel space by the river
description:
One of the very few places that were not developed (touristic) among the mountains. Relatively quiet but not absolutely. Suitable for 4*4, but not very much so for hikers or cyclist. Some trace of fire was found. Lake is suitable for fishing but not ideal for swimming. 

I was travelling on a bike and basically had no choice so I just crushed there for a night. Luckily the gravel didn't make holes into the tarp.

name: Children's Playground
description:
Met a local lady on a bike. She was curious and offered helpful information. There is a lake to swim in, just 50 metres north from the playground. She said there wouldn't be any problem camping on the playground. The locals all seem to be used to cyclists coming here to cycle along the Danube, so they are all friendly. 

The grass is easy to pitch and there are sheltered picnic tables and bins. 2G signals only.

Not sure about carparks but I think you can find something.

name: By the Danube
description: The place is 2-3 km west of a village. There are traces of campfires. Very quiet, accessible to vehicles and bikes.

name: Vratna
description: Parking area at the base of the ski lift. Toilets at the ski lift. Very quiet when we were here.

name: Bešeňová
description: Parking on the banks of the river across the road from a swimming pool complex.  A bit noisy at night from the trains running past.  Good place for the night. Quite a few restaurants nearby by.  Coop 400m.

name: mountain view
description: probably not a place to set up home for a week, but good for an overnight stop.  Beautiful views of the Tatras and close to Propad. enter along a rough road from Velky Slakov (3080) as the little road passes over the 534... no junctions.  also places further along to camp.

name: Drinkable water
description: Drinkable high-quality (coming from mountain) water for free. Maybe difficult to connect the pipe.

name: Castle panorama
description: Nice place near the forest, hidden from the road. Not very flat. You can see the valley and castle from here. In this area, you can find also other nice places to stay overnight. It is worth having 4x4 while raining.

name: Water at gas station
description: Drinkable water at gas station next to the highway R1 to Bratislava. There is big  electronics shop and huge supermarket nearby.

name: Bobo tuning
description: Very good mechanics working here. We have patrol with bmw engine. They found problem quickly.

name: parking lot with "shower"
description: small parking lot in a quiet road. we found it at the end of a hiking trail so there are quite a few hikers/families passing by. the spot is great  because there is water running out of a pipe just next to it. perfect for a freezing cold shower. also there is a nice bar and grill hut just down the road

name: Leg-pole namiopole Campground
description: we checked out 3 campsites around the lake and this is by far the nicest. just choose a spot in the back away from all other people and you are all by yourself. very cheap and toilets are clean. you are just by the river and they also have some hotdogs, chips, beer and a small store whre you get the basics. trees provide some privacy

name: Leharo camping
description: First year open (2020) Pitches on we’ll-maintained grass. Really nice owners-couple, helpfull. From here you make several hikes in Tatra Mountains. Good 3/4 g coverage.

name: Liptovská mara
description: Parking along the road near a “grass-beach” of a huge lake. Rental of SUP’s, waterbike’s and even motorboats are possible in summer. If you customer of the beachbar you can get the key for the toilets for free. Not at night.

name: parking for the night
description: place of parking for the night. very calm place. no service

name: water tap
description: water tap in the car wash station. free. no problems with the guy

name: Partizanski Airfield
description:
A grass space for campers and rooftents at an small private airfield. Enough space for everyone. The reception is at the Aerocafe. Restaurant, spa and swimmingpool 100m. Not a space in the middle of nature but enough to see in the air. We paid 10€ for one night. Toilets and showers are present and very clean. 

Good to know that there is a railway next to the campsite. Every hour theres passing one small train, not anoying for us.

name: wild camping with Nice view
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Unclear if vehicle access is possible

A small road leeds to a cliff where you put your tent or several tents. the view from the cliff is to an old mine. quite, you can make a fire without being spotted.

name: Camping Slovakia
description:
Nice informal campsite.
plenty space with or without power.
Goats and dog roam freely around the campsite!

name: Creek, towards Štefanová
description: Just off the road to Štefanová is a large gravel area right next to a creek. Nice scenery and start of a beautiful hiking path. We used our water filter system to fill up our tank from the crystal clear creek.

name: Zdiar
description: Huge gravel parking lot. Mostly level. Perfect Tatra Mountain View from the northeast.

name: D1 - E50  Highway Westbound
description:
Free Drinking water pushing tap.
Feel free to fill up your jerrycan !

name: Hostinec Kukucka
description: Traditional small Restaurant. I just asked if its possible to stay for the night - no problem and for free. Of course we went there for dinner. Normal local food, very basic. I also got electricity, the tip before was 5 €. Toilets in the restaurant. Please note the parking lot is not even, drive-up wedges are a must.

name: Lake Luborec
description:
Very nice spots are around the whole lake Luborec. Some of them are occupied with caravans parked here all year long. It's not a big deal to find a free spot. During summer time it could be a bit crowded. Water is clean enough and fresh for swimming. There are a lot of harmless animals around during the night. 

Around the lake there are pit toilets and a small beach (ground is covered tiny rocks) with restaurant/buffet.

name: Camping Ormet
description: Nice campground beside the lake with all you need. Average temperature of water in the lake is the highest in Slovakia. Actually 23°C (it's sunny September with air temperate of 26°C).

name: Camping Moongarden
description:
This is probably the best campground we’ve ever been to. 
The lovely couple Elli and Win from Holland run this place since six years and it’s so lovely made and just perfect. They exactly know the needs of long term travelers since they’ve been on the road for longer time too. 
It has nice hot showers, good WiFi, outdoor kitchen, laundry service,... 
We paid 15,- € per night for 2 people in a Campervan. Please find the price list attached for more information. 
(Moderator Note: The photo with the price list has been deleted as it showed the wifi password.)

name: Lake in the forest
description:
Quite flat place near Lake Izra, with shadows from trees around. Very nice lush forest and remote location. There's table with fire places. No need for AWD but place could be muddy after rain.
On the other side of the lake there used to be a small restaurant/buffet but now closed and another one is a ruin of a burned down restaurant

name: Lake in Poloniny
description: Small lake with lot of space. You need to cross small river, or you can park few meters before river (big space, muddy after rain). We did not sleep here but could be possible.

name: Nova Sedlica
description: Nice campground on private property where you can stay overnight for a voluntary fee. Owners are very kind so please keep this place clean.

name: A quiet place between the fields, with a magnificent view.
description:
A quiet place between the fields, with a magnificent view. 
600 m Further north is a public picnic space with lookout tower (well visited on public holidays and weekend), 600 m further south ends this dirt road for large vehicles. 
On this way forking you have peace, view and a beautiful sunset and entrance! 4G orange.

name: A hidden place on a devoted meadow that has not been mowed for a long time.
description:
A hidden place on a devoted meadow that has not been mowed for a long time. 
At night, we wake up from the tube deer. The slight hillside can be balanced by lane. 4G.
Nearby the wooden church:
http://sk.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kostol svätého Františka z Assisi (Hervartov).

name: Kaliste
description:
Parking place at the entrance to former village Kaliste which is famous by its very sad history during Slovak Natinal Uprising (it was burned by naci soldiers).
There is small fire place with sitting under roof and toilet nearby.

name: Klcov water reservoir
description: A nice water reservoir with forests and meadows around it, a great view of the countryside. Secluded enough ~1km of unpaved road away from closest buildings. I got there on an enduro motorbike, would be barely accessible by normal car.

name: Rohozna - abandoned airstrip
description: Abandoned paved airstrip, overnight, no amenities, day hours possible drivers training activities from schools in Brezno (nearby town)

name: Magnezitovce - viaduct
description:
Parking place at viaduct.
https://sk.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gemersk%C3%A9_spojky?fbclid=IwAR3j_feLZ3F278WJUC6cIPwAqH3b1No2zGXOeZNucToFLLprcdbJiEsa1Ho
--
Muddy after rain.

name: Ochtinská Aragonite Cave
description:
Paved parking place at Ochtinská Aragonite Cave.
(near hotel https://www.hotelhradok.sk/ )

name: Church of Our Lady of Fatima
description:
Parking at church on the hill.
Respect the schedule of masses and make room for visitors.
(Especially on Sunday mornings.)

name: Sirk - blast furnace
description: Parking at historical monument - blast furnace

name: Gavurky
description:
Parking near protected area - oak grove
http://www.vypadni.sk/sk/panonsky-haj-gavurky

name: Near Budiš spring
description: Small asphalt parking space near drinkable water spring Budiš. It's quiet during night (no problem with 1 overnight sleep), but during daytime many locals are filling here bottles for drinking water at home.

name: Island by Canal
description:
Lots of places around on this island outside Trencin.
Some cars parked up for swimming at the beach during the day.
Pebble beach by river to swim,fire pits (i never used).Shaded areas.
locals coming and going,bike riders etc ..
slept well even with some traffic noise from motorway.
There's a sign on the trees but I don't understand Slovakian language.

name: Camp Slnečné skaly
description: very nice and clean camping with river and rocks for climbing, everything what you need is here (WIFI, food, shower, restroom)

name: Horec restaurant
description: Nice and tasty restaurant with cheap daily menu, draft beer and coffee. Wifi [passwords are not allowed]

name: Pizza KIKA
description: Good local pizza very cheap good quality

name: School hostel EDUCO
description: Old school hostel ... the cheapest hostel in slanicka osada (13 € night) with nice view on the lake

name: Patio hostel
description:
Good hostel, you find many reviews online. I parked my vespa for free! Safe parking (they rent for cars). High vans cannot pass through the gate. 
Perfect location.
Dorms 10€.

name: Municipal parking
description: Parking lot next to an old castle. Free between 16:00 and 08:00. Very quiet at night, beautiful view of the Tatras in the morning. Public Wi-Fi available

name: Drink water
description: clean drinking water flowing directly from the forest

name: Wild camping
description: Perfect one night place for motorbiker . Road here goes on gravel , but is Ok

name: Campspot near skiresort
description: Flat spot in a grass field, no amenities but a great view

name: LPG SERVICE
description: really friendly guy refill camping gaz bottle but you need the good adapter ( 2.7kg for 3.5€) and others bottles

name: happy fontain
description: on the main road, just in front of the train station, natural fountain with drinking water.

name: Tatras parking
description:
Big parking area, not the most beautiful one but it's ok if you want to hike on the Tatras mountains and just sleep here.
7€ for 24 hours parking, we slept here 2 nights with no problems. we were alone during the night. Most people come at 9.30 am. Free Wi-Fi .

name: Oravska Polhora
description: rest area at the river bank. Wooden platform with some shelters over the river. Prepared as swimming area. Equipped with  table. Its possible tu set up a tent.

name: orange stones river
description: Really nice spot close to the river. You can just enjoy gently sound of water and birds sing. Sometimes u'll hear trucks from the road but who cares if u got beautiful nature around you. Am I right? I think wild camping in Slovakia is legal but not sure

name: Sutovo lake
description: Former stone mine filled up with water. Nice place to calm down in hot summer. Small restaurant is here.

name: Kalameny hot springs
description: Hot natural springs (temperature between 30-33degC) located in the forest. Nice road (a bit bumpy at the end) brings you to the parking lot. Place could be crowdy.

name: Lake side camping
description:
Wild camping near lake. Great swimming, shade and restaurant. 
No services as such but restaurant has toilets when it's open. 4G is strong. You can hear the highway but it's not loud. 
Many spots around lake, some shady.

name: Gravel Pit Lake
description: Three lakes with awesome views of the mountains. Good for swimming (water is quite deep) with good gravel road access very close to main road. Frequented by locals on hot days, nice for day camping.

name: Water area with dam in Horné Orešany
description: Free public places for camping, fishing, swimming and relax. Access to nearest water may be difficult for bigger cars like camper or car with caravan. Park on the forest path and check it before you entry deeper in the trees. 3G/4G internet available. Drinking water is not available.

name: Penzion HUST
description: Comfortable & quiet place with beautiful green view of the mountain. Twin room for EUR17 (Booking.com) with TV & private shower. There is a horse stable outside the place.

name: Hunting shelter in forest
description: Fairly large opening /crossroads in the forest. Not exactly flat, but it has some benches with a roof, a fireplace, and a Saint to protect it. Not the best road here so I wouldn't recommend it for a a camper trailer. Good for a night's sleep. Good 4G mobile coverage

name: Riverside Wild Camping
description: Big open field, close to secondary road. Waterfalls nearby. Really quiet at night. Seems popular with locals.

name: Kalnica Bikepark
description:
Free places to camp at Kalnica bikepark

Some grass, some dirt spots. Free outdoor shower, toilets at the bar. Cool place if you are a biker. If not it’s just free safe place for one night.

name: Wash & coffee break
description: Lovely lady who speaks English runs this place. 3 10kg washers and 3 10kg dryers.  About 5 euro to wash depending on cycle.  Free wifi and there's a coffee machine and chairs to sit on while you wait.

name: Just off the roads and under the trees
description: Just off the road there is a gravel track that leads you up a little bit. Then you will find this spot. There is a fireplace already but we did not use it a a little creek

name: Hidden corner near a small lake
description: Hidden corner near a lake where you can take a bath. It is few meter from a cycleway with some trees as shelter. Don't sleep here but just stop passing by.

name: Jimera De Liber
description: Lovely Camp site in a beautiful Valley, good place to relax on the way to morocco.

name: Bar Allioli
description: Wonderful little bar set in one of the most beautiful valleys in the world. Run by Paul (originally from the UK and speaks many languages) and his wife Synove from Denmark. If you have a day or two Paul can give you details of some wonderful walks. Enormous selection of beers from round the world, good cheap food and fast internet. Closed from 1700 on Monday and all day Tuesday.

name: Barcelona I Camping Masnou
description:
15 km to "Placa Catalunya", 35 min by R1 - Train (station: El Masnou, 5 min walk from Campground) - probably your best and most safe choise for Barca.

http://campingmasnoubarcelona.com/2015web/index.php/en/transportation

name: Madrid I Camping Osuna
description:
Very nice place!

11km to "Sol", 40 Minutes by Metro (green Line #5) starting at station Canillejas (10 min walk)
http://www.crtm.es/media/146302/serie_0a_esqmetro.pdf

~20€ / night

name: camping montillana
description: lovely campsite situated in the natural pak "sierra de las villas". a good place to relaxe and for hiking. nice and clean ablution blocks, restaurant, bar, shop, wifi, pool and a nice lake nearby. 3.85 €/person, 3 €/car, 3.75 €/tent. tel: 953 126 194

name: los cameros
description: nice quiet place in the natural park "sierra cebollera", all sites on grass, clean ablution block, bar, wifi (only @ the bar), 3.60 €/person, 4.60 €/coche cama

name: Cabo Da Gata Camper Park
description: friendly clean new place with about 40 flat gravel places. nice stay between agricultural greenhouses with grills and chill zone. washing maschine and dryer each 3.5€. you can order bread for breackfast at the reception. the night costs 7€ + 3€ electricity.

name: Hostal Tafalia
description: Double room 49 euro. Hotel with parking out front. They allowed us to put our motorcycles in a basement garage that was very secure (mostly used for general storage). Clean. Restaurant and bar onsite.

name: Parking Vallderrobres
description: Mostly flat dirt parking lot along the river and close to the old town. Camper vans and RVs are allowed 48 hours free. Not allowed to appear as camping though (chairs and other stuff outside). No services but there is a dump station. Great location to old town.

name: Parking Morella
description: Informal free camping/parking area for self contained campers. Mostly flat with some picnic tables and trees for shade. Located about 1.5 km an easy walk from the beautiful town and castle ruins of Morella. There is a free dump station and water spigot.

name: Valencia CamperPark
description: 15 euro per night with 4 amp electricity, can pay less for no electricity or more for higher amperage. Nice flat park, clean bathrooms/showers. Metro to the city a 5 minute walk away. Washing machine for 3 euro per load. Bar/restaurant makes really good paella.

name: Cabo De Gata Camping
description: The park has a bunch of amazing undeveloped beaches and lookouts that would be great for overnighting. Unfortunately camping in the park isn't allowed and we were told by other campers they come through at sunset and kick you out. All of the little towns in the park have a relatively flat gravel municipal parking lot at the beginning of town where sleeping over night is ok (at least in the low season. Not sure about the summer months). No facilities but no cost. There are also a handful of campgrounds scattered throughout the park. They are well signed.

name: Ronda Train Station Parking
description: You can park overnight in the parking lot in front of the train station. 9.10 euros. There is a bathroom inside the station. Not sure if it is open all night. Flat and relatively quiet. There were some campgrounds in the area also.

name: Olvera
description: There is an official camper parking next to the information office. Nice flat parking and for 7 euro you get electricity, water, and a dump station (grey water and cassette toilet). You can also park outside of the designated area for free and use the cassette toilet dump and nobody will bother you. Also flat parking and same great views.

name: Casa Tahivilla
description: Nice villa to rent with 3 bedrooms, in the middle of a cute and quiet white village. The owners are very friendly, the house is in a perfect state.

name: Càdiz Parking
description: Public parking lot near the port and the old town. Clean bathrooms available for use. 3 euro/24 hours for campers. It is conveniently located next to the old town but can be quite noisy. The trucks at the port start early, but it is a good spot to visit the old town which is well worth a stroll and the price is right.

name: Aduana for MAD moto cargo
description: Take passport, title, registration (must be current), green card (insurance - i bought mine online mototouring.com), and waybill (i used lufthansa cargo and swissport 5min walk away) to get clearance stamp

name: Camping Motel Sierra Nevada
description: Big place in town. Across the street from huge supermarket and bus station. Loud on weekends. 3 supermarkets nearby.

name: camping abogao
description: didnt stay

name: camping los aroncales
description: big spot next to fortress

name: Camping valdevaqueros
description: big place across from nice kitesurfing beach. lots of grass and shade

name: Camping sureuropa
description: This camping is operated by Asociación Pro-Personas con Necesidades Socio-Educativas Especiales y/o Dependientes del Campo de Gibraltar. (Disabled persons). The service is absolute correct and friendly. The place is clean and calm at night. Restaurant in walking distance (20 min). Pricing: Caravan 5.70 EUR / Person 4.70 EUR. Only approx. 4 places for 'bigger' caravans (we guess max. 7-8m). Total about 25 places.

name: Camping Torre De La Peña
description: Nice campground with spots right on the water and across the road on the hillside. Most spots are relatively flat. Clean bathrooms, great views, and some spots with shade. 23 euro a night with electricity in May 2016. Washers 3 euros and dryer 2 euros. There is also a very nice salon for campers connected to the restaurant with comfy chairs and a coffee machine.

name: La Chopera
description: For two people, two motorcycles and one tent it was 19.28. Nice place with all amenities of an established campground. We had tons of rain so didn't do any of the hikes that are easy to access from campground

name: Camping Vilsom
description: 28 euro per night for two people, two motorcycles and one tent. Expensive but near Seville. Mostly car campers and motor homes. Nice facilities and very clean bathrooms.

name: Casa De Fusta
description: Place for RV, no costs, with a restaurant next to the place

name: Camping Nuria
description:
It is an ideal place to put the tent, it has water, bath and shower. At about 200m there is a bar where you can have breakfast or eat although it is quite expensive. We went in a touristy time and they did not charge anything for that I do not know the cost. 

Es un sitio ideal para poner la tienda de campaña, cuenta con agua, baño y ducha. A unos 200m hay un bar donde puedes desayunar o comer aunque es bastante caro. 
Fuimos en una época poco turística y no nos cobraron nada por eso desconozco el coste.

name: Red Line Cars 4x4
description: Good quality service

name: Camping Playa America
description: Nice squeaky clean campsite. Grassy and shady. Pool and bar. Laundry etc. Friendly people

name: Camping As Cabazas
description: nice grassy area on a gentle slope above beach overlooking a pretty bay. cleanish facilities. limited shade. open field along main road so a small amount of traffic noise. lots of surfers in the water.

name: Santiago De Compostela Parking
description: Large parking lot for buses that allows camper parking overnight. Nothing special but quiet at night and close to the old center (about 1 1/2 km walking). 3 euro for the day only; 12 euro overnight. Overnight fee includes grey water and chemical toilet dump and water tank refill. If you arrive after 8:00 at night you only have to pay 3 euro for the day.

name: Beach Parking
description: Nice gravel parking lot next to the beach. Quiet and out of town. Spent a great night here.

name: camping
description: great spot near the beach if you kitesurf

name: Camping Covadonga
description: Nice place with lots of grass and shade. Clean bathrooms and area for dishes. Washing machine extra. 2 people and a camper without electricity 16.90 euros

name: Camping Naranjo De Bulnes
description:
Very nice place next to the Rio Cares. Lots of shade and grass. Clean bathrooms, washing machines, sinks for dishes with hot water. 
Still a very nice place. We paid around Euro 30.- 2 people, camper and electricity. Crossing the street there is a bar where you can eat small dishes.

name: Parking In Santillana Del Mar
description: Quiet parking lot near town. It seems like it is overflow parking for the high season. Flat, gravel, and lots of trees and quiet at night. Was empty at the end of June. Short walk to visit the old town. Free.

name: Parking Hondartzak (beach parking)
description: Parking lot overlooking the beach. Popular with surfers. There were quite few other vans and campers parked here overnight. Fairly flat and a nice view of the beach. Some bars/restaurants nearby. We were here on the night of fiesta San Juan so quite a lot of noise. I don't know if it's normal. Free 8 pm to 10 am, other times 0.70 euros an hour.

name: Faro Cabo De Santa Catalina
description: Parking for the lighthouse and bar/restaurant at the top. If you are short enough to fit in the parking spaces you are allowed to park as long as you want. Longer rigs can park on the shoulder but have to move during the day. You have to use levelers to get flat no matter where you park. Beautiful view and a short walk to town.

name: San Sebastian Municipal Caravan Parking
description: Official camper parking for the city. 6.55 euros per night no electricity. Potable water and grey water/wc dump. About 45 minute walk from the old town. Fast by bike with bike lanes into town or you can catch a bus; the stop is right out front. Fills up pretty early in the day so arrive early if you want a spot.

name: San Sebastián Parking
description: Parking lot on the point behind the port. Close to the old town. Flat spots overlooking the water. Parking is paid from 9am to 1:30 pm and 3:30 pm to 8 pm. We were told by a camper they slept there for a whole weekend no problems. We slept one night and were told by a police woman that camping was not allowed. As long as you pay and don't appear to be camping (chairs and blocks out) you are ok. Quite loud at night with traffic. Bathrooms nearby but are only open during the day.

name: Camping Bella Vista
description: Let's call it a luxury camping. Nice treat after a month morocco [sic]. EUR 29 standard pitch 2 pax low season. EUR 37 high season.

name: Camping Albufera de Anna
description: Campground in the hills next to a lake (public park, nice, no swimming). Shady lots under trees, ok infrastructure.

name: Tollo Pillete
description: Free. Valencia province park/camping. This is really set up for tents and day time picnics. There are sinks with water and toilets. The water was turned off in the toilets. They had been cleaned but weren't great. The showers were clean but no water. There was water in the large sinks by picnic area. We put our tent by picnic tables but ranger said they weren't really to be there but he let us stay. Very quiet with lots of shade. A camper car would be ok here.

name: Lake Caspe Camping & Bungalows
description: Menu pricing: in low season 5.3 euros per person, 5.7 euro per tent for two people if one person in tent it is 4, 4.2 per motorcycle. So for us 24.20 per night. Expensive but official camping in Spain is. Overall very nice site with a pool and on the lake. Access for fishing. There is a grill area with picnic tables. Dishes washing area and laundry area. Very clean bathrooms. Bar and restaurant. We ate at the restaurant and it was good. Lots of families and bass fisherman. There is wifi at reception but we didn't use it so I put average speed. It is crowded and there are lots of lights around so it is bright at night.

name: Playa Mar Bella
description: Parking lot next to the beach. Some spots are surprisingly quiet. Free of charge, but only rigs lower than 1.9m will be able to drive in due to height restricting barrier. Free showers(24h) and toilets on the beach(9:30 to 22:30) and Mercadona super market 600m away. Probably one of the best places to wild camp in the car near the center. Stayed here for 2 nights. Avoid on weekend as the music in nearby bars might keep playing until 3 am.

name: MNAC Parking Lot
description: Free parking by Catalonyan National Art Museum. Trees give a bit of shade, but there are no spots, which have it all day long. Lots of parks nearby. There is free wifi by the MNAC. Relatively quiet at night, but toilets are scarce and their opening hours vary (if they are open at all). The only ones we found opened on Sunday were located at Plaza Espana. Campers are forbidden from using the parking.

name: Camping Taull
description: Menu pricing. We paid 23 euro for two people,two motorcycles and a tent. Didn't try the wifi. Hot water in showers, sinks and for dishes. Tent camping and vehicle camping on grass. Beautiful place. Easy walk into Tuell. Lots of hiking.

name: Camping Collegats
description: Menu pricing. 5.6 euros per person plus your site. Full site is 13 euro per night but they also charge by half site which is half price. No problem for two motorcycles and a tent. A can would fit easy too. Tons of trees and shade. A really great relaxed atmosphere along a small river. There are people who have been coming here for 25 years. Pool, bar and restaurant. Very clean bathrooms with lots of sinks, toilets, showers, sinks for dishes and laundry. Hot water is solar. A really great place.

name: Bushcamp Tarifa
description: A hideaway 500 metres off the highway. You would never recognise this grassy camp behind and in high bushes. It has roundabouts and several camp pockets. Today there were 5 campervans here. Place for about 10 to 20 cars. Very clean and quite.

name: Quiet Car Park By City Beach
description: Parked up at the end of the road that leads to the town beach. The car park is next to a flat block but it is quiet and peaceful overnight. 5 mins walk to town with bars shops and cafes, and there's a nice path leads up to the hill -easy stroll in the woods with sea view.

name: El Oasis 2
description:
Perfect place to stop and have a nice breakfast (tostada con tomate), a great lunch, try one of their sandwiches or just a coffee; all at the best price. And if you want the perfect souvenir get the best Andalucian olive oil here.
Don't miss the opportunity to speak with Raimundo, the owner, he is a traveller and passionate about motorbikes.

NOTE: Avoid the petrol station next to the restaurant, it is one of the most expensive on this road.

name: Camping Iznate
description: Euro 19.81 per night for a plot that includes two people, vehicle (and they considered two motorcycles as one vehicle so no additional cost), and a tent. Quiet place with good views. Clean bathrooms, washing up area.

name: camping libre gratis
description:
Bathrooms, tables, chairs, drinking water. Free. This fenced but open door for camping
Baños,  mesas,  sillas,  agua potable.  Gratis.  Esta vallado pero puerta abierta para camping

name: Sird Auto S.L
description: It is a family-run business. Good service. Ask for David.

name: Between  Saravillo y  Sin
description: Very quite for a good rest next to the river. Water is quite cold but feels really good to wet your feet in the river while coats wander around.  Further up driving on a very steepy road we arrive to Sin, where beautifull views of the valley await for us.

name: mirador
description: small mirador parking lot with amazing views, good for the night, but you're probably not alone

name: Partida Poblas
description: Old beach boulevard, has seen better days. Lost fisherman, trash and nudist now reside here off season. Fine for a night at the beach.

name: Complejo Leo
description: Free camping in truck stop car park. 24hr cafe. Don't park to close to the buildings it's noisey

name: Motel Emporio
description: Private ensuite garages and right next to the motorway. 50euro but can be booked online cheaper through various websites. Probably not aimed at tourists but visitors wanting more discretion and maybe to pay by the hour. Still secure parking and somewhere dry to do any maintenance. Hope they don't mind brake fluid in the bath!

name: CEUTA, overnight free parking
description:
Free parking,  in front of a tennis club. Quiet during the night.
Showers could be possible during opening hours of the tennis club.
Water at the dog's training ground nearby.

name: pine forest
description:
it's off the road, quite, and OK.
not the nicest forest ever, rather a plantation.
it's a bit off-roady to get deeper in, don't attempt in a big rig (especially in a wide and low one) or if u don't like branches scratching your paint. if u go further up, there are some spot with great views!
didn't even have to look the other way to not see 'dont enter'- signs. guess not allowed anyhow.

name: Mountain Parking Cocó de Jordi
description:
A big parking place in the mountains for hiking. At the dead end of a road. The place is made out of gravel, big enough for about 15 cars and the surrounding is beautiful. Most of the place is not level but a few spots are almost. There is a sign with some rules, saying that camping is forbidden (a crossed tent sign). 
There is traffic during the day, but we were alone in the night.

name: Camper-Parking at Carlos Ferries
description: lots of lots of campers overnighting next to Lidl supermarket there before they go to Morocco. Close to a good shop (Carlos) for ferry-tickets. Not so good for rooftents because it is very loud from the harbour and busy all night.

name: Puerto de Tiscar
description: A small place to camp for a night at the top of the Mountain pass at 1190m high. There is a fuente (spring / water source) just down the hill at the abandoned restaurant. The nearby old moorish watchtower is really worth the walk up. Amazing views.

name: El Alcazar Recreationa
description:
A beautiful, big parking place in the middle of the national park. There is everything you might wish for: Toilets, cold shower, water from the mountains, a playground BBQ places. There are actually two parking place. Both are large and quite level. Reachable by good gravel roads. 
Could be full during season but we were the only ones in February. Park ranger was greeting friendly...

name: Camping Sierra Maria
description: Beautiful campground in a forest. No noise at all. Refurbished bathrooms. Warm hearted owner. Good possibilities of walks in the surrounding. Very clean. Potable tab water. The swimming pool is opened in summer. Barbecue area nearby. Next village Maria 5 minutes by car for basic shopping, better Velez Rubio 20 minutes. In Velez Blanco interesting ancient wall paintings "Cueva de los Letreros" in a cave (guides on Wednesday, Saturday and Sunday). Low season offer with ACSI Campingcard 17 € (2 adults, plot, electricity).

name: Camping La Vinuela
description:
Campsite on hillside hard standing looking over the lake and mountains. Beautiful spot. All facilities. Acsi accepted. 
Out of season rates 180 euros for a month electric extra on that deal. 
Lovely local restaurant good prices with same view.
Animals welcome.

name: Sandbar parking
description:
Parallel to the dead end streat there is a sand road made wide enough for parking. Enough space for hundret RV's. To one side you will have the dunes and access to the beach, to the other there is the road (low traffic) and you can see the industrial harbor. Some locals come to fish or chill. 

CORRECTION: In the middle of the night the oil refinery on the mainland loaded a ship so we wake up from the engine sound and an awful oil smell.

name: Viajas Normandie (Carlos)
description:
The famous Carlos and his travel agency. Usually the cheapest ferry booking. Open return to Tangier Med, one person and moto. €80. Bring cash.

Near supermarkets. Nice guys

name: Camping Fronterra
description: On road just south of Andorra, a little noisy by the road but friendly and good value at €15 for 2 people and car.  Free wifi at bar/reception.

name: Igueldo San Sebastián Camping
description: €19 pn for 2 people and car.  All facilities but road can be busy during day but is quiet at night.  Really good wifi, showers could be hotter and no soap in bathroom (seems normal in Spain and France..).  Bus takes you straight into city and back (€1.70 each way).

name: Camper area M&H El Rincon
description: Brilliant camper stop. Friendly welcome, lovely beach half a km away. Spotless loo and shower. Handy shop at reception but supermarket nearby too. 10 euros and 3 for ehu. Washing machine and dryer available. There was a great BBQ when we visited. Fresh bread, pizzas etc available too.Thoroughly recommend it. Be careful as some satnavs try to direct you up a steep narrow way. Best to continue to roundabout where you'll see a mororhome emptying sign

name: Almerimar
description: Official Vans and RV parking near the sailboat port office and front the sand beach.

name: Cádiz Parking near the Parador and facing the sea with sep. area for Camper
description: Price 6 m €14,40 bigger cars 28,80 for 24 h /  quiet, light at night.

name: Praia da Balea
description:
A small parking lot (maybe 3 cars) at the side of the gravel road next to a nice sandy beach. Almost level. Sea view. A little wind protection by bushes. There are a few more parking lots like it along this road. 
If you are in this area you should not miss driving along this gravel road which goes along the coast line and gives you beautiful landscape views and crosses lonely beaches.

name: Clearing at the ocean
description: What a nice place to stay! In the forest very close to the ocean. A footpath leading down to it. You will need some ramps to get your car level and maybe 4wd to get back up the track if it's rainy. Expect some mussel fishers to come by but no one else.

name: Motorhomes parking
description: Carpark for motorhomes. Free. No facilities. Good location to spend one night before going to Morocco or when coming back. Supermarkets nearby.

name: Camping Valle Anisclo
description: Very nice campsite. Some pitches have electric. Water points and chemical disposal

name: Zamora Cale De Los Pisones
description: A car park where you can park at night, recommended by the tourist office of Zamora shops at two hundred meters a park with children's playground, without any service

name: Castellar de la Frontera
description: Useful place to empy/fill before or after the ferry to Morocco. Free services and parking for up to 72hr. 23 spaces. Quiet residential area. Not available first week in May because of a local festival.

name: Casa Costa Blanca Appartement
description: very nice place, very nice hosts, perfect Appartement for two

name: Ribera del chanza
description: Picnic site by a river just over border from Portugal

name: Camping parque ardales
description: Nice campgroud near the entrance to the Caminito del Rey. Campsite with electricity, clean toilets/hot showers and direct access to the lake Embalse de Guadalhorce. Price depends on season: 3-5 €/person + 3-5/car + 3 for electricity.

name: Alosno 3 km after cemetery river side
description:
near River nobody around fire owood not allowed good road After is gravel road 
au bord de la rivière personne aux environs route goudronnée après le gué c'est de la piste feu de bois intdrdit

name: Dolmen Pozuelo
description:
5 6 km de piste moyenne véhicule 6.50. m pas plus sur l'aire d'entrée d'un des 3 sites
la nature et les oiseaux
5_6 km gravel road véhicule non more 6.50 are front thé entrance of one of thé 3 sites
nature and birds

name: Berrocal
description: À parking south entrance  Village ,2 foutains drinking water.Un parking entrée sud du village il y a deux fontaines dans le village

name: 3km Aznalcollar
description:
on the lake quiet birds sheeps 
au bord du lake tranquille les oiseaux les moutons

name: Areas Autocaravana Sevilla
description:
an horrible area like à cattle
 Park 1 toilettes
un horrible Park de stationnement un seul WC
12  e power elec 3

name: Lake side camp
description:
Lovely little spot by the lake. A dirt road runs from the main road and opens out next to the lake.
There's a lot of flat area to park and pitch tents.

name: Vale Verde Coripe
description:
à Big area for picknick  acces by à gravel road 1 km After hotel
une grande air
e de pique-nique accessible par une bonne piste 1 km après l'hôtel

name: Ubrique
description:
à large parking 2 minutes walking to down town bigs rigs allowed possibility dumping 
un grand.pafking à 2 mn à pied du centre ville possibilité de vidange

name: Algeciras port pour Tanger
description:
Inter Shipping delay and less customer than FRS
to buy the seats at the port counter and not in an agency
Inter Shipping late ticket on the Harbor offices

_______

Inter Shipping retard et moins de client que FRS 
bien acheter les places au guichet du port et non pas dans une agence
Inter Shipping late buy ticket on the Harbor offices

name: Talleres Victoria
description: Really nice mechanic guys. Their main profile is fixing agricultural machinery but they also do cars. They actually helped me with my motorcycle. Seem to work till late. Only speak spanish.

name: Camping Victoria
description: Nice, small, relaxed camping. Maybe a little noisey for it's right next to a road. By the entrance there's a local restaurant-bar.

name: Vila de Sarria Camping
description: Relaxed, quiet, small camping by the edge of Sarria. Big trees with plenty of shades. Nice communal building/restaurant. Paid 11 euro for 1person/1motorcycle/1tent

name: Alhama de Granada recinto ferial
description:
Car parking with a corner for camper vans 100 m above à fountain.

Un parking avec un coin pour camping car WC public 100 m au-dessus une fontaine.

name: Embalse de los Bermejales
description:
At the edge of the dam.

En bordure du lac du barrage à 500 m un camping

name: Lanteria
description:
Near soccer field 200 m after the end of the paved road with the permission of a farmer.

Près du terrain de foot 200 m après la fin de la route goudronnée avec la permission d'un cultivateur.

name: cabo de gata
description: Nice and clean. 26 Euros for 2 people, car and tent.

name: Nijar road of Torre
description:
In the middle of nowhere on the road to the Torre are many places to park at 15 min from the quiet and free sea.
3G network available.

Au milieu de nulle part sur la route de la Torre de nombreux endroits pour stationner à 15 mn de la mer tranquille et gratuit.

name: El Sur Camping
description: Big but nice camping with swimming pool and good facilities. About 1 km from the city. It's a little expensive and you have to pay for wifi which I don't find to be nice. But this is the only camping place around here...

name: Sanctuario Santa Eulalia
description:
asked to souvenir shop it's OK
à Big parking on the wood on the night you est ring thé Bell for your soul cleaning 😎
demande autorisation au magasin de souvenir vaste parking dans un bois de conifères la nuit  le son des cloches pour purifier nos âmes😎

name: Camping Sierra de Penascosa
description: Super-nice, quiet, family-run camping with lot of trees, shade, birds and a small creek. There's no on sight bar and restaurant but Pescadores is only 10 minutes walk away. If you're looking for a big, industrial kind, party camping than this is not it! If you want  to be in a tiny island of peace far away from anything than this is your place...

name: Ermita Santa Filomena
description:
i think this Ermitage have à great parking,nothing, i ask périple who live near it's OK and they offer
 if we need water
je pensais que il y avait un grand parking devant cet Ermita rien du tout on a demandé aux voisins si on pouvait stationner sur la plateforme attenante, OK ils nous ont même proposé de l'eau si on avait besoin

name: Water. Hidden tent spot
description: Hidden camp spot above spring, good for cyclists camp

name: Planes
description:
sur une ancienne portion de route face au lac du barrage
on an Old road front thé lake

name: El Piusapo
description: Local restaurant and bar free but we eat at the restaurant. Owner is very friendly and offered us water to fill up. Toilets in restaurant. Closed on Mondays. Only 1.5km to the start of Ronda.

name: 1,2 km north La Brava
description:
un parking à 50 m de la plage c'est propre
50 m beach à clean gravel parking

name: Valencia beach
description:
un parking gratuit en bordure de mer sur le malecon mieux que de rester en ville , plus chaud, nombreux restaurant et commerces dans les rues autour, la plage à 30 m
à free parking on the beach of Valencia, best than stay on free parking down town, many restaurants and shops streets around beach 30 m

name: Hotel Pirineos
description: Super-nice hotel on reasonable prices. Nice small town.

name: Barrage Ribesalbes
description:
Aire de Pique-nique au bord du lac de barrage table BBQ 
picknick area on lake side table and 
BBQ

name: San Mateu Ermitage Virgen Angels
description:
300 m de l'Ermitage en pleine nature dominant la plaine eau disponible à l'Ermitage gratuit
300 m Ermitage on a Hill above the valley water near ermitage free

name: Berga Resort
description: Big-euro, industrial size resort with top of the line facilities.

name: Camping Stel
description: Big size camping with good infrastructure...

name: rambla Ruidecols
description:
coming from Reus After runabout "la Vergonya" maps.md  take gravel road on right go underground thé bridge on your left and continue 1 km on the "rambla" quiet place with Wilde rabbit
en venant de Reus après le rond-point "la Vergonya" maps.me prendre dans un virage un chemin à droite qui descend dans le lit du Rio prendre à gauche sous le pont puis 1 km tranquille avec des Garennes

name: Camping Cadaquès
description:
So far the only official camping site in Cadaquès. May need a little refurbishment.
Sites just big enough for a standard-size camper van plus a small awning. 5 minute walk from the city center (10 minutes back uphill). Wifi extremely slow; only 10 minutes per day included.

name: la Cala Camper parking
description: Nice parking for Campers 5 minutes walk to village, shops and beach. Free. with water and dumping facilities which are difficult to spot but it's a manpole near to the wc.

name: Great place
description: Wild camping perfect for a night, next to a river.

name: Calle E, Lago Barasona
description:
There are multiple compacted roads at different levels of the hill, all unused, except there is one building at the lowest level.
Nice view of the lake, especially at sunset.
You can hear some dogs barking late into the night.

name: Camping Port de la Vall
description: Nice tiny camping/caravaning place with direct access to the beach. Full service, restaurant & grocery store inside. Price for motorhome in high season starts at 40 EUR.

name: General workshop
description: General workshop for an emergency

name: Riverside parking place
description: Big parking place for campers and motorhomes. Drinking water from a fountain. Garbage collection point. Fly fishing only with valid permit.

name: Marina Parking
description: free parkinglot at the marina! we had no chance to find a camping so we stay here. also longer campervans who need 2 parkinglots can park here. no toilets/showers/water but right in town.

name: cala joncols
description: Near cala joncols hostel you can sleep in your car.

name: Riaza, campeseo
description: Riaza, campeseo, campground with all faccilities, swimming pool, etc

name: Seaside view
description: Empty plot next to the beach. Wonderful view on the bay. Bar and restaurant nearby. Running water within 100m on the beach.

name: La Fresneda Camping
description:
Finally!  a camp ground that isn't trying to be tourist resort!  Run by a Dutch couple who speak good English, Spanish and likely German and French.  

beautiful location, well organised, no loud music and silence after 11pm, kids on site were well behaved.  spots are spacious and if you don't have extension lead they will provide one - so electric possible at every site. 

plunge pool is really good.

name: Camping Saturraran
description: Near to the road, easy to find - but the road is quite dangerous - was a good place to sleepy one night, shower is good, but restroom does not have soap. Near to the nature and 10 min to the beach.

name: Praia de area maior
description: Small stretch of area to park camper vans next to roads and dunes/shrubs with a short walk 50m to white sandy beach. Cold showers and water available at beach. Small clean surf great for beginners.

name: Arsenal de Moris
description: Grassy field just above a beach. Designated for camping. Multiple beach showers available but restrooms are closed for the season. A couple of other camper cans on site.

name: Camping Muineires
description: Beachside camping. Small campsite with room for maybe 20 RVs/vans. Free showers, very clean. Direct access to a beautiful beach. Paid €24 for one night. Free wifi in the bar and terrace but not at sites.

name: Camping Eucaliptus
description: Nice campsite in trees, beach is nearby, you can ride with bicycle, walking or by your own car. Some spots at the beach needs 4WD but the main road is ok for all kind of cars.

name: CASA Isabelle - Restaurant
description: We had dinner at Casa Isabelle and asked the waiter if we could stay overnight at the parking. He said that it would be ok and no one will close the parking. We've had a good and quite night here.

name: Camping Sierrecilla Humilladero
description: Quiet location with nice flat gravel shadow spots under trees. Facilities are ok. Paid off season with ACSI card €15 per night. Close the ‘laguna’ (dry salt lake). Supposed to see flamingo’s, but have not checked yet...

name: Parking Madrid - IBERICAN OVERLANDERS
description:
Overlanders Parking. Hi! We are Mar & Luis , we are overland travellers and offert a safe and private outside parking in our house. If you want to take a rest in your travel you  can leave your vehicle for 1 day or  even for 12 months. Avaliable for motorbikes and trucks. We can also transfer you to the Adolfo Suarez airport in 20 min. Our prices are: Motorbike 30€/month; Car 50€/month; Campervan/4x4 <6meters 60€/month; Truck 100€ month.
You are welcome and we would like to share oveland adventures!.
You need to contact us for reservation: +34661787395; mar.s.hurtado@gmail.com.

name: Campervan Parking
description: Free formal campsite with basic facilities and close to town centre and big supermarket (Consum). Lots of space, shadow, flat, calm and quite during the week. Tourist info at 10 minutes walking: possible to visit the historic underground wine cellars (it is worthy). Non guarded but totally safe. The perfect stop-over when doing Madrid-Valencia or heading south (Sevilla/Granada) from Barcelona.

name: Parking place in Blanes
description: Municipal parking where you van spero overnight. It was well signed named "Les Pines" in Blanes center.

name: Marbela - Cyclists ONLY
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Use Google maps satellite pic to find this place!!

It is in the end of a off road track on the  mountains of Marbella. Very easy to get here, it's steep though. There are 2 ways (what I've seen), one a trekking path the other one an off road, it does not matter which one you take cos both connected at one point.
to get there by the trekking path you have to go  the top of the Calle Padre Paco Ostos and there will be the path. Go up and in the first fork take the left (still going up) then when you get to the top it will be the off road junction turn left and all the lefts you find until you get there.
It's very flat and with an amazing view of Marbella and the sunset.

name: Playa del Gobernador
description: Nice place very close to beach. Beachshower available, fresh water.

name: Malaga beach
description: park area. not official. locals stay the night over. shower on beach.

name: Mechanic
description: Mechanic just off the road to Ronda, nothing special but my van was leaking oil and I just came across these guys. No English spoken whatsoever.

name: Almocita
description: Nice place nice landscape good and clean toilet service. The people are very friendly.

name: GNV & Grimaldi ferry port
description: Ferry port for GNV & Grimaldi lines ferries for tangier med. one can take their motorcycle, cars, trucks or campers onboard

name: faro de carbonera
description: free camping by the beach with nice views

name: España
description: camping and bungalows. reception 24 hours. bar and restaurant the 10 to 21 hours. good comunicatión

name: La Cerezal
description:
Not the greatest place to spend money on. The owner of this restaurant enjoys killing wolfs and hosting people to do the same, for later, boast of his bravery.

Sick.

name: Lavomatic - self serve laundry
description: Washers and dryers. Good dryers. 8 and 14 kilo washers.

name: Camping Vall de Ribes
description:
Friendly camping close to the woods, for nature lovers. Level parcels with a lot of shade in summer, cool at night. Warm showers, flush toilets, dish washing room, washing machine, place to drain caravan toilet, tap to refill water. Approx. 18 Euro for land Rover with roof tent and 2 persons.
They also have wooden bungalows. Very friendly owners.

name: lake proserpina Merida
description: Camping with all facilities. Old but clean. Ok but nothing special. Out of town. Merida has quiet a lot to discover! EUR 17 for 2 incl power. Noisy from road and dogs. Open all year.

name: Sevilla
description: Free parking near the Club Nautica de Sevilla. Excellent for big rigs with everything on board

name: RC Miguel Angel
description:
Cheap, very clean and friendly hostel,
14 € per night, incl. simple breakfast! Parking for bikes close to hostel possible. Seems to be safe!

name: Termas Potes-La hermida
description: Small parking very close to thermal bath near Potes. Free, very quiet and a water tap available.

name: Camping Ciudad de Zaragoza
description:
Good camping, open all year. Reception open from 8am till midnight.
32€ for 1 camping car and 2 adults.

name: Embalse de valdecaballeros
description: Free camping at the lakeside, nice view very good for big rigs

name: Plays de burriana
description: Small parking area near the beach , normal size parking but kerb behind so vans up to 7.4 M ok

name: Pradollano ski
description: This is the upper parking lot for the Pradollano ski area.
