It is free just for the night, 10€ to stay the day (but you can easily park for free just outside the parking lot during the day. The toilets of the small snackbar are decent, clean, heated and open during the night. There is a water tap too(inside). The ski lift is just here. There is a stall to buy the ski pass (forfait) (46€) next to the snackbar, but is not always open. If closed you need to go down again to buy the forfait. Ski rental is either down at the main station, or inside the youth hostel next to this parking (20€ aday). This place is popular with campervans. On a weekday in January there were >20 staying the night. Constant freezing temps in winter - this is at 2400meters and partially above the ski pistes. Great views over ski area and Granada, great sunset too.

name: Embalse De Yesa
description: Stopped here for a swim.  Lots of scrubby trees with plenty of space for camping.  Several camper vans were parked up near here.

name: Hostal Pepe
description: Just what you need,clean,quiet and safe garage for motorbike!👍😎

name: Quiet parking lot
description: A quiet ground parking lot, leveled and clean, bushes all around.

name: Camping Alpujarras
description: Fantastic campground with good wifi & great hot water showers, they have a bar & restaurant with a communal area. The camp also as bungalows & stands are nice & flat. There is also a large dorm for the budget minded and the owners are terrific & help in any way they can. The camp looks over a spectacular valley with a view of the Mediterranean in the distance!

name: Camping Bahia de la Plata
description: Nice and big campsite anext to the beach, with two different sections. I think the second section (southern section) is slightly cheaper. Low season 22 Euro for 2 people and one unimog. The campsite has a restaurant, supermarket and WIFI near the reception. Restaurant is closed in low season.

name: by the lighthouse
description: you can park next to the lighthouse. Great views, not many people there when we stayed here. 2.8 km from the street. There's also a nice grassy area.

name: Delta Ebro
description: free parking in front of the sea, quiet and peaceful

name: Los Batanes, Lagunas de Ruidera
description: big and nice Campsite,  good and clean ablutions,  flat sites with water and electricity,  in a wonderful landscape ,playpark, supermarket,  20 Euro for 2 people and car incl. Electricity

name: Auto Solar
description: We bought our service battery. They have lots on stock. Really nice and friendly. Spanish and Italian speaking.

name: Petrol Station
description:
This is a big petrol station with parking only for campers and vans and it has dump station and water to refill
You can find free wifi.
Playground for kids
There is an hot shower, cost 3€ per shower without towel and soap.

name: Requena parking
description: great parking to visit the city, suitable for large vehicles

name: Alarćon
description: great parking to visit the castle, suitable for large vehicles

name: Camping Noria
description: wonderful place  with absolutely everything you need, good restaurant, friendly staff, not so expensive,  perfect

name: Camping L`Albera
description: nice and good priced campsite,  good Ablutions, very quiet , restaurant was closed. fast Wifi for 4 Euros a day.

name: Las Valerias
description: Green lawn inside a quiet and peaceful canyon under Roman ruins

name: La bombilla
description:
Parking lot with small kiosko, beach and sweet water showers.
Good for filling up water tanks

name: Prangerte
description: Good oranange tree in the middle of a a meadow. Place to camp anywhere in the pine forest nearby

name: Una
description: off-road parking, quiet next to the lake

name: Nice campsite flat ground and grass
description: Nice campsite with views over mountains. Opportunity for campfire. Easy access with 4x4

name: Camping Las Lomas
description: Great camping at beautiful location with restaurant, small shop and swimming pool.

name: Vilanova Park
description: Large campsite with indoor and outdoor swimming pools. Restaurant/bar showing English football. All the usual amenities you would expect from a big site. We chose it from the Camping & Caravan Club winter brochure and spent 15 days here to qualify for the reduced rate. We had the grandchildren for 6 days and there was lots for them to do. Wi-fi is expensive but you can get an hour free with a drink at the bar v

name: Grassy spot next to the road and river
description: Good spot for cyclists, vehicules won't be able to go that far. Pretty large grassy spot. River nearby. Not visible from the road even if you can hear it.

name: Mercadona Parking
description: Free overnight parking next to Mercadona supermarket.  No facilities no bother from police.    Have stayed here many times both before entering and when returning from Maroc and also just for a good food/drink stocking up day

name: Playa del Regaton
description:
Camping located in the Natural Park of the marshes of Santoña, Noja and Joyel. You will be in the middle of nature, but close to Bilbao (70 Km)
Santander (54 Km). So what you want is tranquility, good views and nature will be a discovery. The beach Salvé is located at 1500 m. We offer you the highest category in comfort, with plots of 70 m2 each with its sink, water intake, drainage, electricity, free wifi and some modern services that will surprise you.

name: 33749 Tapia de Casariego Spain
description:
Beautiful vue on seaside+rocks. 
No facilitys. 
Please keep clean.

name: villarobbledo
description: very big parking asphalted with light near cementary. very quiet at night. easy for big rig

name: santuario ntrs sign del pueyo
description: incredible place by the santuario. on the top of the hill. nobody. on dirty lot. very quiet. free

name: Camping La Playa
description: The Camping & Bungalow & Albergue Turistico La Playa is located in the city of Logroño, capital of La Rioja and has all the advantages of the city but at the same time enjoys its location on the banks of the Ebro River. It is a 10 minute walk to be in the old town and the famous Calle Laurel for Pinchos.

name: Camping Cases
description:
The campsite was built in 1967 and family run, occupies a total area of ​​21,500 m2, mainly characterized by its lush vegetation.

Nearby are the municipalities of Alcanar, Sant Carles de la Rapita, Peñíscola and Vinaròs where you can enjoy local cuisine and where you will find various leisure activities that will make your stay more enjoyable. The campsite is near the Natural Park of the Ebro Delta, one of the most important aquatic habitat of the western Mediterranean

name: Viewpoint and small campground
description: Small track goes down to the water. Good place to have a lunch. Looks like normally water access is fenced, but when we came the fence was open. Visible from the road.

name: Refugio de Pesca
description: A better place to have a lunch. Tables, barbeque spots, stream and small waterfalls. A couple of places for small motorhome (informal). No GSM networks. Some wild animals (deers?) were spotted.

name: Las Negras
description: Awesome free park close to the beach and city center.

name: Venta del Alto - Hotel Las Cumbres
description:
Good place to stay on the way to south Spain or Marocco. Good restaurant and family friendly atmosphere. We parked the motor trailer and  the car for almost two weeks (for free). Super parking for overland trucks, etc. Fair prices. Bikers friendly place!!! 👍

Web: http://www.ventadelalto.com

name: Camping Sierra Espuña
description: Small, family-run campsite in the middle of Sierra Espuña with very nice walks that start right here.

name: Picnic area
description: Picnic area among eucalypts, upper part. Place to park a car, barbeque, tables. May be crowded on week ends.

name: Customs
description: You can get your final CPD verification here when coming from Africa.

name: Ebro Bridge
description: Parking Lot for campers. The nearby road is not that busy. There is next to the square a beautiful old bridge and a green area with tables and seating. It's free.

name: Monasterio de San Salvador de Leyre
description: A large parking lot next to a monastery. The Way of St. James is also there. In the morning the bells of the monastery ring, but until then you should be awake anyway.

name: Tap outside English Options
description: Water from ornate vintage style push button tap.

name: Camping site, next to road
description:
There is a path that runs next to the "main" road to allow bigger rigs to pass the river without having to cross the bridge. If you pass the river with the bridge on the right side, continue 50 meters and on the left you can place 2 decent sized rigs and 2 tents. 
Keep the place clean!

name: Camping valle de Nocito
description: Nice quiet camping ground. €36 for 2 cars, 4 persons, 1 tent.

name: Entrambasaguas, near Reinosa, Cantabria
description: Rustic meadow site surrounded by beautiful mountains. Beautiful and peaceful valley setting. Birdsong in the morning is magnificent. Shower block was basic but clean. There were no other vans or tents on the site when we came so total seclusion. The owners main business seems to be rustic holiday cabins and cottages at a distance from the site. I don’t think campers turn up very often because it’s not signposted or advertised anywhere. The owners seemed surprised we found it.

name: Playa de Santibañez
description:
Free Parking at the Beach. 
There are toilets, but only open till 21.00

name: Meadow near forgotten finca
description: Nice place with late sunset just next to a gravel road between Spain and Andorra. Small creek running next to it, but no mosquitoes.

name: Castro de santa Tecla (santa Tegra)
description: Parking allí web. No facilities. Espléndido landscape. Surge and quiet un the night

name: Area de servicio Ribadesella
description: Dump station close to the city center with 5 parkings

name: Ribadesella
description: 5 dedicated caravaning parkings with dump station. Parking is free, local passes by. Might be a bit noisy during day and calmer as night. 10-15min Walk to the city center.

name: El Molino de Cabuérniga
description: Beautiful, laid back, remote site in a mountain valley near a river. Clean but basic shower block and 6A electrical hook up. Restaurants on the doorstep and others nearby. I sense this was once a well kept campsite but is less well looked after these days. But it’s very charming because it’s so rustic and chilled. We stayed twice and were the only campers both times. Very good for a stopover from or to Santander ferry. And friendly welcoming owners.

name: Camping Ancoradoiro, near Louro
description: Camping site. In off-season nice parking to stay. No toilets, no water. A stunning beach!

name: Mountain and desert views
description: Wild camping spot. Short off-road to get here from the highway, no 4-wheel

name: Las Médulas Parking
description:
Parking lot for visitors of the Area arround las Médulas. 
Lot of dogs in the small village.

name: Camping Igara
description: A wonderful campsite in the middle of the mountains, very green. Quiet but with all the facilities you could wish for. Two spaces for pitching tents, away from the car (you park up) and it’s a very short walk to the tent area. Helpful staff. And a free shuttle into San Sebastián!

name: Old bridge
description: Campsite is next to the old bridge. Nice and quiet. No facilities. A swim in the lake is recomended. The village Herrera del Duque is at 10 km.

name: Praia Foz do Lizandro
description: Near beach, ocean and next to river. You can put tent up in sand or on grass. Quiet. Sunset, 5 min from some beach bars. Barbanata with smoothies, salads, vegan too.

name: Camping Rio Jara
description: A good place, reasonably priced for Europe at this time of year, 23 euros for one motorcycle and tent, elec is extra, clean showers and toilet. Huge beach, morning good for bathing, full on kite surfing in the afternoon. It's an established campsite.

name: Faro de Lastres
description: great sea view, wounderful place, no facilities

name: Free water and dump station
description: Five parking spaces to overnight on gravel parking lot of a vineyard . Free dump station and water.

name: Cabañeros Lincetur Centro de Turismo Rural
description:
The Lincetur campsite is set on the edge of Navas de Estena in the Montes de Toledo, on the edge of the Cabañeros National Park, and next to the Camino del Boquerón hiking route.

The campsite is comfortable. there are about eight cabins and plenty of open spaces for vehicle camping, with some shaded areas for tents under holm oaks (encina) there were electricity point throughout.  The shower and toilet block was clean and well maintained.  There are also black and grey water disposal facilities.

The bar and restaurant is excellent, specialising in local venison (venado) and wild boar (jabalí).  It is also seems well patronised by local residents from Navas de Estena.

Spring to early summer is probably the best time to see this area, it is hot and dry in Summer (but you will appreciate their excellently maintained swimming pool).  If you find yourself passing through this area or are looking for a stop off in central Spain, this campsite is worth the detour.

name: pantano San Juan
description: Nice parking lot at the reservoir with a gazebo and trash very quiet preferred with four-wheel drive.

name: Free water
description: Free water in the Paisatge Natural Protegit Serra del Maigmo park.

name: Wildcamp
description: About 80m off the road. No cell service. Space for two VW Bus/Defender etc. Very quiet. Walking trail nearby.

name: Camping la campina
description: Quiet site, pool, restaurant, bar, electricity hook up, WiFi, clean and pleasant place.

name: Embalse de Yesa
description: Off main road informal campsites and a boat launch. Not kept, not regulated. Beautiful swimming spot and shade

name: Public cold shower
description: Single cold shower on beach front next to Beach Bar. Open during summer season.

name: Camping Urbasa
description:
Large campsite with facilities, bar, restaurant and some good hiking. 

There is WiFi at the bar which is not very good and no 3G reception anywhere nearby.

Lots of play equipment for children and horses for them to feed. (Don’t park near the horses unless you want to be surrounded by children all day!)

name: Mistral Beach Bar
description: Amazing Beach Bar selling Tapas, salads, burgers, Dutch snacks and drinks!

name: Betelu - Swimming Hole
description: River to swim. Has a slide, toilet facility and parking

name: monte cabo
description: Small camping with sea view. The owner is from Netherlands and speaks english, german and spanish... the bathroom is new and very clean. 10 min walk to the next beach. a good spot to watch dolphins.

name: Nice Spot in the "Picos de Europa"
description:
Nice Spot inside the wonderful national natural park "Picos de Europa"

The place is situated just at the beggining of the most famous hiking route of that park. 

No Amenities, just camp.

name: Nice Spot in Gijon
description:
Nice Spot to visit de city of Gijón. Always there are a lot of vans  here

Walking to the city center 20-30 minutes, but with a wonderful views of the sea.

There is a public bathroom in the parking site. In 100 meters you can find a beach that allows dogs. At morning a local baker offers bread and some  things to breakfast

Spanish:
Un buen lugar para pernoctar y conocer la ciudad de Gijón. Siempre está lleno de furgonetas y autocaravanas.

20 o 30 minutos caminando hasta el centro de Gijón por el paseo marítimo. Hay un baño público en el mismo parking y una playa que acepta perros a 100 metros.

Por la mañana pasa un panadero que ofrece pan y bollos para desayunar.

name: Bornos deportiva
description: Parking at the end of the harbor with platform and lake access for swimming

name: Parc Landako
description:
A small car park at the edge of a large reservoir just a few kilometers north of Vitoria-Gasteiz. Busy during the day in summer but mostly quiet at night. Sanitary facilities nearby. Good stop for one night on the road.
---
Un petit parking au bord d'un grand lac de retenue à quelques kilomètres au nord de Vitoria-Gasteiz. Du monde en journée en été mais assez calme la nuit. Sanitaires à proximité. Bonne étape d'une nuit sur la route.

name: Parking Chartreuse Santa Maria de  Miraflores
description:
Parking of the site of the Charterhouse of Miraflores near Burgos. Very calm except the sound of the bells. No services.
---
Parking du site de la chartreuse de Miraflores près de Burgos. Très calme hormis le son des cloches. Pas de services.

name: Aera de recreativa de plaia de Tagle
description:
Parking en forte pente face à l'océan. Petit restaurant en journée. Pas de services.

Parking in steep slope facing the ocean. Small restaurant during the day. No services.

name: Camping Barcelona
description: Great campsite, clean and well maintained facilities. Friendly bilingual staff at reception. Free shuttle to next town - Mantaro (where you can get train to Barcelona) and also shuttle bus on offer direct to Barcelona centre for £2.90. Shaded spots with trees. There’s also an animal petting zoo with some farm animals, swimming pool, restaurant and supermarket onsite.

name: "Official" Parking Spot in Leon
description:
This is a official parking spot in the norhtern city of León.

There is a shopping center at 50 meters. The city center is 20min walking. 
There is also a water fountain in the parking. It's free for 48hours.

Este es un parking oficial en la ciudad del norte de España de León.
Hay un centro comercial a 50 metros de distancia. El centro se encuentra a 20 miutos caminando.

También hay una fuente de agua en el mismo parking. Es gratis las primeras 48 horas.

name: Playa de la Puntilla
description: Large dirt parking lot next to great beach. Toilets open until 7.45pm, public cold beach showers. Patrolling police said 'no problem'.

name: Abandoned Spa and Nive Via Ferrata
description:
Nice and quiet spot in front of a old abandoned spa. It's ideal to meet the nothern of Burgos, where there are a lot of waterfalls.
 
Five minutes walking you have a wonderful via ferrata. Link about that point and the surroundings, in the place website, (Spanish, but you have a video too)

Tranquilo lugar de pernocta en frente del balneario abandonado de Sobrón. A cinco minutos tienes una buena vía ferrata. 

Perfecto para conocer el norte de burgos y sus fantasticas cascadas (link en la web del lugar)

name: El Meson Camping
description: Small family run camp near small village, grassy shady areas, immaculately clean, just delightful for an overnight stop.

name: Camping Buganvilla
description:
Nice campingground, 10.min walk to the beach   
Bus to Marbella. 5.km
17.-€ with Asci card.

name: Camping Bosque de Gordón SL
description: A beautiful big site with many spots for caravans and tents only alike. Surrounded by mountains, the views are amazing. It's closed for the main season already, but there is might still be scope to stay here, if you can get hold of the owner. It's an older couple, they don't speak English but are super lovely. All facilities available.

name: Parking lot camping
description:
Off season parking lot camping next to the beach. Low season parking lot camping, free, public toilets, very close to the beach. 
I’m guessing this is not possible during high season, too busy, to much traffic. But September/October/November is slow in this area, and the weather is beautiful.
Lots of restaurants, some closed for the season, grocery store near by.

name: Labyrinth Park of Horta
description: Massive Park and labyrinth from the 1700’s very old and very cool. Cost about $3.00 for entrance, worth it.

name: Orio-Igeldo Park
description: Nice picknick area over the sea, grill places, tables, toilets. Parking overnight no problem, directly near the small road, not much traffic.

name: Embalse de Negratin
description: Secluded spot right on the shore of the reservoir. Very quiet and peaceful. Perfect for swimming.

name: camping spot in field next to river
description: Excellent view into the mountains. Just watch the pic. In addition you will find a very nice enduro circular track. Ride it either by bicycle, bike or 4x4.

name: medinaceli
description: camper area on a big parking lot on the side of an old village with roman ruins. altitude 1200m. free

name: Girona
description: a big parking reserved for camper. no electricity. water. free of charge. forest and running place around. ok for any kind of rig. near from the motorway. limited to 72 hours.

name: El Noguer
description: Big field on owners land, loads of space (we came in mid August and still loads of room). €10 for a 24h pitch with water, waste (grey and chem), toilets, WiFi (actually quite decent too) and electricity all included! Owners were lovely. Pet friendly. Nothing fancy but a great stop over! Would recommend and stay again!

name: Castillo de Garcimunoz
description:
Free Campervan stop over in castle car park! 
Sign posted 72 hours max. Water and waste facilities all free. Great stop over right at the foot of a castle! Also great vantage point for amazing sunset and sunrise! 👌

name: Rugby club parking Salamanca
description: Tolerated parking by a bridge near Salamanca centre. Quiet at night, loads of campers around so definitely a tolerated parking area. No amenities but only a 15 walk to the centre so who cares! Felt very safe at all times

name: fuentesdetodos
description: goya village. it is a parking entering the village. kinder playground. swimming pool in summer only. no services. free

name: Big area near road CM403
description: Big flat area, partly shady, nice view, cold in the nights (900 m)

name: bembribre
description: parking of closed restaurant on river boardside under trees. very quite. no services.free

name: Chipiona, direct at the beach
description: Nice parking lot direct at the sandy beach. Restaurants and bar open in high season.

name: Camping Pico de la Miel
description: Big Campground, close Autovia from North to Madrid. All the year open, uncounted lots.

name: Embalse de Bubal
description: Nice spot just down below the road next to the reservoir. Flat ground and few already made fire pits. Nice view of the mountains and the road above is very quiet

name: Parking area San Fernando
description: Quiet and nice place next to the lake. Dustbin. In the evening couplescome to watch the sunset.

name: Motorhome àrea in Viladrau
description: Peaceful place with power, water, in Nivell village with all services. Excursions possible walking and biking

name: Near the marsh and the abandoned town of Escó
description:
Good place to spend the night beside the Yesa reservoir and with views of the abandoned town of Escó.

It does not have services.

In you can see more about the abandoned town of Escó and other abandoned towns in the area

name: Camping Le Viorna  Potes Picos de Europa
description: Lovely “ Alpine “ looking site at the base of an amazing mountain area , good helpful staff ,good restaurant, but closed 1st Nov for the winter !

name: Alhambra Caravanas parking
description: car park designated for motorhomes near to Alhambra. overnight stays allowed. no facilities.

name: Embalse de Beznar
description: parking next to dam and reservoir. no facilities not even waste baskets. room for around 15 campers. nice parking overlooking lake under trees. quiet and peaceful overnight.

name: el Greco, Toledo
description:
full equipped, comercial campground,
walking distance (3km) to the historic town of Toledo

name: Parking lot
description: It is a parking lot in a small village about ten km from the Seasiders. No facilities, but very calm in the night

name: Rioja Alta Golf Club
description: It is a parking lot before the Golf club. The caminando de Santiago de Compostela is Passing by. We had a quiet night here. The restaurant offers good food, beer and wine

name: Bodegas David Moreno
description: We stayed over night after tasting Viños de Rioja. Very friendly owner. We could use the services.

name: Caravan zones in Calatayud
description:
Free city parking with dump station and fresh water, quiet possibility to stay overnight
---
Kostenfreier Parkplatz der Stadt mit Dump Station und Frischwasser, ruhige Möglichkeit zu übernachten

name: playa el playazo
description: Public parking lot on the beach. No facilities available. Restaurants next door.

name: En frente del yacimiento de Ullastret
description:
Esta ubicación es el parking del yacimiento arqueológico de Ullastret. Hay baño si el yacimiento está abierto (entrando a visitar las ruinas). Parking tranquilo y gratuito. Cuenta con una fuente para recargar agua

This is the official parking of the ruins of Ullastret. There is a bathroom inside the building if is open.. Free parking and quiet. There is a fountain in the parking

name: La Tierra Verde
description: Parking for motor homes on the farm. Holiday accommodation. beautiful surroundings, stunning views. very quiet, 5min from A66 Caceres-Mérida

name: Dentro de los Monegros
description:
This overnight place is inside the Los Monegros desert, in front of the hermitage of San Miguel.

Perfect to know the area and the routes Juberres. There is no  services, but you will sleep very calm and with an incredible sky.

name: La Tintorera (Laundromat)
description:
Laundromat. 
Laundry: 19kg (6€), 15kg (4€)
Drier machine: 19kg (3€)

name: Wine Shop (Bodegas Utielanas)
description: Perfect wine shop to taste and buy local wine, specially bobal red wines.

name: Puerto Gelves
description:
small parking / camping area on a breakwater in the harbor.
Fee: 15 per day

name: Las Dunas Trafalgar
description:
parking slot of the 
“Las Dunas“ restaurant
few parkings for RV's. might be crowded during high season.

name: picnic place
description:
picnic area,
cold water, quite, nice walk area

name: Chellanatura
description: Hill top camp site in an olive grove. Clean facilities, washing machine. Owners are Dutch/ Belgium. Quiet site.

name: Parking Area
description:
Parking Area, sandy ground, dirty ground,
you can only enter by drive over the kerb, between the trees, but it's possible also for higher and bigger rigs.
Metro Station is only 200m far away and the supermarket as well, 
there also a small park with a playground for kids. opposite of the playground, near the bicycle station is a water tap located (portable water),

name: water tap in a park
description: water tap for portable water, just to fill up canisters or bottles

name: La Azohia
description: Overnight stop at the far end of the small town, beach side. Would be very busy in summer. Quiet in November!

name: Finca Caravana
description:
Campground in the middle of almond and olives plantations with a very nice view on the mountains around.
The owner Franz (german) is very friendly and helpful.
it is a meeting place for travellers to Africa and a place for relaxing as well.
Does not have own water source, but not far away is a spring with portable water

name: Fuente del Pinar - Spring
description:
small spring with potable water,
to fill up canisters ok

name: Stop & Go Cubellas
description: Small gated RV park 4 blocks from a very nice sandy beach. 12 € without electricity, 15 € with. Right by commuter train tracks, but we didn't notice the noise at night with ear plugs. Good for rigs up to about 28'/8m long.

name: Tulip Inn, Zaragoza
description:
Great value - we were impressed! Big rooms, clean, modern, like a 4-star.  52 euros, or 78 with full breakfast for 2. Good wifi, great shower.   

3 course dinner is 12 euros pp, and includes beer, wine, soda, etc.  

For business travelers and truckers 

https://tulip-inn-zaragoza.goldentulip.com/en-us/?utm_source=google&utm_medium=maps&utm_content=ESP46498&utm_campaign=GoldenTulip&arrival=2018-11-15T00:00:00&departure=2018-11-16T00:00:00&rooms[0][adult]=1&rooms[0][child]=0&location=

name: Edificio Kilimanjaro
description: It has a flat place for parking with no wind. You can ask for shower, WiFi and kitchen. Beautiful views and very good vibes with the owner. You may ask how much it costs because it depends on wether the owner is available or not.

name: El Toyo
description:
behind (right hand side) the big parking area is a dirt road, on the end is a area for parking, near the small fort,
showers are on the beach, trash bins in the park

name: Picnic Area
description:
Very nice and quiet picnic area with tables, trash bins and portable water, nice view to the mountains, nearby is an official campground, 
quiet at night,

(mobile connection is very bad)

name: parking area on the beach
description:
small parking area near the beach, showers and public Toilets (closed in off season) on the beach, restaurant with WiFi (not free of charge),
trash bins

name: Roadside Scenic Viewpoint
description: This is a large level pull-off along side a narrow, hilly, winding gravel road with a solid surface despite the rain. We drove in 4WD to get there, but the other vehicles on the road were 2WD. The parking area is perched on top of a small plateau with shallow valleys surrounding it and mountains beyond the valleys. Very peaceful day and night.

name: View to Ronda
description:
Area between olive trees and near the view point over Ronda, some flat places at this area, nice and quite, not so much shadow, there is a water tap with potable water located
(4G with simyo)

name: water tap
description: water tap with push button, portable water

name: P+R Parking on Metrostation
description:
huge parking area next to the Metro station. there are 11 Stations in between to the city centre. ticket price = 1,90 Euro/person and ride.
Supermarket nearby. some traffic noises of course but still ok at night. nobody bother us.
you will see a traffic sign on the main street (P+R + Metro) and there is also a sign not for vehicles over 3m. but there is no bridge or barrier on the way. so don't be afraid. you can enter this area from both sides. it's clean and looks very safe.

name: La Junquera
description: Car Park commercial centre toilets open from 8 am to 11 PM

name: Poblet monastery
description: Parking monetary with toilets available between 8am and 7pm

name: Massanasss a 10 km de Valence
description:
Tacoval (www.tacoval.com) electronic specialist and Webasto-heating
competent and helpful
specialist of Electronic

name: Ibi Camper Parking
description:
Town area for camper with water bus n°6 to downtown

emplacement municipal pour CC avec un point d'eau bus n° 6 pour le centre

name: Totana/Lorca
description:
better with 4x4 on a gravel field in the middle of nature, it smells of wild bushes and wild rabbits
---
mieux vaut un 4x4 dans un champ Inculte au milieu de la nature et ses odeurs de thym et des lapins de garenne

name: Puerto Deportivo
description: Camper parking on the far side of a marina. It's pretty tight, but we did see a class A motorhome there. Very close to the 140 bus stop into Seville.

name: En la naturaleza | In the nature "Ruta de los pueblos blancos"
description: Good Place to stay and overnight. In the white villages road trip.There was another campers the night we stay there. No services. Very Beautiful

name: Vitoria Train Station (no luggage storage)
description:
I just wanted to let other travelers know that there is no place to guard bags here, at the train station (such as lockers).  The train station is closest to the Parlamento tram stop.  

The bus station (which is across town, but with a short walk you can jump on the tram to get there) does have storage for luggage & is a pretty interesting building design, too.  The closest tram stop to the bus station is called Intermodal.  

The tram cost 1.45 Euro for one ticket.

name: Artium Museum
description: 5 Euro entry fee / less for students.  Worth a visit depending on what exhibits they currently are showing.  They will also guard luggage for you.

name: Nueva Andalucia next to a lake
description: Very quiet and nice level parking in a posh residential area. Small lake, lots of tables and trails for hikes in the hills.

name: Cala Reona
description: Nice parking place direct behind the beach, big enough for trucks. Very quiet out of summer season!! Trekking possible along the coastline.

name: Road Side Pullout
description:
Nice spot to stay for one night, small pullout on the side of a secondary road, the lake is just by the spot.
Very quiet and there are some trails around.

name: Eco Camping
description: Nice, clean, great views of the valley and mountains. About 9km from the center of  town. Easy walk to the Sanctuary of Mercy where you can visit the "Ecco Homo" painting.  About 6€ per vehicle and 3€ per person. Laundry, pool, quiet.

name: almogia
description: large level area next to barragem,plenty of space and fire pits.quiet and no light pollution.weak phone signal.

name: Caso Paco
description: Great food especially calamari. Great views of the Sierra Nevada and Granada from roof top terrace. Dogs welcome on a lead. A little expensive but service was good ( 9.20 euros for calamares starter but good portion size)

name: Ermita de San Zoilo
description: Old church. Tables for eating and bbq. Water. Wild camping under your respondability, not allowed.

name: Melilla Harbour
description:
front office a parking free 72 h toilets 6 am to 12 pm
face au guichet d'embarquement un parking gratuit 72 h toilettes hall 6 a24 h
idéal pour prendre embarquement

name: Almeria
description:
good for one night area like car Park near Lidl free no service
--
parking non aménagé a côté de Lidl bien pour une nuit gratuit

name: view On El Chorro
description: perfect campground with majestic view on el Chorro lakes ear Campillos. 2 magnific point of views near the tent

name: Elche
description:
10 km from Elch After industrial pool front cemetery neighbour quiet water inside cemetery
10 km d'Elche après Z.I devant un cimetière eau potable interieur

name: Tordera
description:
parking of sports areas 5 mn down  town quiet drain spot other side road
parking des terrains de sports 5 mn a pied du centre vidange de l'autre côté de la route

name: ALKORA
description: Insurance company, to buy international green card to non European cars, motorcycles...

name: El Piño, Torrox Park, Malaga
description: Nice site. Compact. Good facilities. All amenities close. Good services on site

name: Camping Malaga Monte Parc
description: Nice friendly campsite with bar, shop and food onsite. Handy for visiting Autocaravanners Hidalgo Malaga workshop. Mostly English people here

name: Camping Malaga Monte Parc
description: nice quiet campsite / camping. In the countryside of Alaurin El Grande, Malaga region. Easy to find as is on Google Maps. There is a bar / coffee shop and a shop onsite

name: Camping Torre del Mar
description: A great site about 100 metres from the beach. they do good winter / long term rates. Restaurant on site. Piping hot water in showers with good pressure. Shops , bars and restaurants are a few minutes walk away. Dogs allowed and a field next door to walk them. There is WiFi onsite, but I have not used it as have my own.

name: El Piño
description: nice site in TORROX, above the coast. All amenities

name: Free parking in Cordoba near historical site
description:
A large free car park in Cordoba next to what seems to be a construction site- it is marked on google as free parking but doesn’t always come up. 
There are no amenities but as parking in Cordoba seems to be a bit of a hassle I would say it’s pretty good and quiet for a night or too!

name: riverside near merida
description:
well established track running along large river about 6kms from Merida. lots of spots to park up, lots of shade, nice hikes or biking along river.
few hundred metres from road, very quiet spot no houses around.
Good spot.

name: Enoteca Pepe Blasco (Wine Shop)
description:
Wine shop for tasting and buying local wine (D.O. Utiel-Requena). 
Opening hours: 
Thursday to Saturday from 19:00 to 22:00.

name: Carnicería Isidora (Butchery)
description:
Well situated butchery. One of the multiple options in Utiel for buying local sausages: «embutido». “Chorizo, longaniza, morcilla, güeña”. Fresh or vacuumed. 
Opening hours:
Monday to Saturday from 9:00 to 14:30 and 17:00 to 21:00.

name: salinas
description: Very nice place to stay. Very quiet, only the sea is heard.

name: Alberg Pere Tarrés Barcelona
description:
NIce hostel . 
17€ shared room 
8,27€ parking for my motorbike  ( private parking , very safe )

name: Lemon Garden HOSTEL
description:
Nice hostel 
private parking for 1 or maybe more motorcycles 
shared room 12€ 
breakfast 2.50€
have kitchen and shower .toilette

name: Fisterra, Galicia
description: Wild camping near beach. There is a fresh water tap available. Easy access for vans.

name:
Área de autocaravanas
Parking Alange

Alange / Extremadura
description: Car park and waste disposal services for campervans and roof tent cars. Free parking for 2 days. free drinking water and toilets (toilets long drop and no paper). best bit is that it is next to a beautiful dam and stunning sunsets and sunrise. good fishing. tiny town and noone bothers you. next to a small football pitch with two storks nests on stadium lights and you can watch the storks feed their young. orange trees growing on the road. very quiet when we were there in March.

name: Askarruntz free camper place
description:
Free parking spots for camper vans etc.
There are no toilets, but when you go to the bar/pizzeria you can use it there.
There are disposals for your dirty water and toilet.
The area is beautifull, but no sun in the morning or late afternoon, because of the hills that surround you.
Bar/restaurant is 30 meters away.

name: Camping La Pesquera
description:
nice camping .
with WiFi in the reception .. and one bar for drink a some beer ! front from the river .

name: parking municipal
description: Municipal parking lot. There were a few other campers there at the time. A friendly police officer showed us the spot.

name: Càmping Aigües Braves
description:
Wild-camping feeling, large open places, right by a river, small bar included, order rolls for breakfast, small pool with chairs, small houses to rent, very quiet
We do not use electricity and kitchen. So I am not sure, same with WiFi

name: Fonte Diaz, Santiago de Compostela
description: Service area with parking for 5 units. Next to a park and children’s nursery so busy during day but very quiet at night. Village nearby has supermarket and bars etc. Close to airport and just 25 minutes from Santiago.

name: San Martin de Ordoves
description: Lost in the wild. Grassland near the Roman church 11 C Mozarabista.

name: Anibal Servicio Fuel GLP San Dump
description: The Anibal gasstation and camper services: overnight spot 7€, shower 2€, washing machine 4€, dryer 4€, sani dump and fresh water intake 2€, internet 1€, diesel, gasoline, high pressure car cleaning and GLP (also fill bottles).

name: Embalsa San Clemente Free Camp
description: Quite a few places to find at the lake. This peticulair spot is reachable by good quality unpaved track, no need for 4wd or clearance. Along the bitumen road that is leading over de dam you find a few paved parkings. Easy access for all rigs there. Very quiet.

name: Height restriction 3 metres ER 246 Santa Elalia
description: Height restriction railway bridge 3 metres max.

name: Albergue La Credencial
description:
very nice place for stay few day in Stgo de Compostela . have parking outside front of the hostel . I think safe .. I don't had problem with my motorbike .
12€ shared room

name: Algodonales free campsite
description: Free campsite owned by Algodonales municipality. Water and electricity for free. restrooms were closed during our stay. No need for registration, nice to visit the pueblos blancos.

name: Peñas de Aya
description: Small parking lot, good views and quiet. No facilities. Big vehicles can park here but will have to go up a steep, narrow, winding road

name: Gran Camping Avenida
description:
Camping Gran Avenida is a holiday complex for the whole family in Benicasim. We offer bungalows and accommodation for caravans and tents.

We are a family business oriented to make you spend the best holidays in a close environment. Enjoy a privileged climate, our natural landscapes and a wide variety of beach and mountain activities. The main objective of our team is to make you enjoy your holidays trying that you have a pleasant stay and that you feel like at home.

Meet people, do the activities you like the most, discover new places and discover wonderful corners in the Mediterranean. Enjoy your holidays at Camping Gran Avenida and we'll make sure you want to repeat them.

name: Bonanza Laundromat
description: Located at 795 Ignacio Sottomaier. Left laundry at 9:00 and got it back at 6:00 same day. VERY EXPENSIVE – Most we’ve paid in South America. 115 Br R      ($30 U.S.) for about two loads. She charges by the kilo. I think it was 11.50 R/Kilo. I think her hours are 9 – 6 Mon. – Fri.

name: Deba Beach parking lot
description: Free car park on beach front, quiet with with some other campers. 3.6m height restriction but no parking spots larger than standard size. Public toilets open from 10am, shower on beach, restaurant next door and supermarkets in the town (5-10min walk).  Near a train track but not very disturbing.

name: HOSTEL DE LAS FACULTADES
description:
nice hostel !! the owner is great ! bicycle  traveler around Europe !!!  
17€ with breakfast ( shared room ) 
Parking in the front ( free ) and safe .. 
kitchen and fridge !

name: Castillo de butron car park
description: car park 2min walk from the castle of butron. no facilities, quiet

name: Lakeside Camping
description: free. picnic benches. hiking trails. quiet. cafe nearby but the manager is an pain who doesn't like pets.  cafe only open on weekends in winter.

name: embalse view
description: free. clean.  2 midsize RVs here and relatively flat. might be packed in high season. great views and restaurants nearby.

name: Bajada a La Playa Free Camp
description: Quiet grassy spot close to the little bay. The roughly shaped hillside provides some windshade. Entrance road from Santillán is paved but quite narrow. Not really steep.

name: Oasis al mar   vera
description:
established campsite  only open November until 1 may.    no showers or toilets  good pitches level very clean  owner very welcoming.   electric  3€  10€ per night include  WiFi.
 washing mashing and waste dump also available  fresh water fill
 plenty of open space for dog run outside camping area

name: Restaurant Cal Quico
description:
Excellent Restaurant with a big Parking. 
Opens @ 1PM for luch. 
Lunch menu (lot of choice) was 12.5€ for 2 plates ;-)

name: Aire de Camping Tapia
description: Black-/Greywater Dumpstation and fresh water too; 4€ per day. Overlooking the ocean, nice place to stay

name: Car park, 500m from Monachil Cohorrus hike
description: free car park, no facilities, a little dirty. other campers around

name: Castile la duque
description: Open beach down a track through houses. Beach cafe with lovely couple running it.   Police not interested in camper vans at this time of the year.  Short  walk into lots of bars.

name: camino del cabo
description: large car park and off road parking near a beach   busy today but it is a national bank holiday in Spain  lots of campervans/motorhome  and paragliding

name: La Mariposa
description:
Lovely place. Tapas with drinks -they where delicious. The people who run and serve are extremely kind and generous. At the bar they speak Spanish, English, Italian and a little of everything else.

Sang my daughter happy birthday (as the first time we went in it was her) and it made the night.

name: Car Park
description: Free car park near hike starting points. Car park with a small river alongside it. Has toilets during week days, water taps supposedly along some hike routes but we did not see any working ones. Has large rubbish bins. Restaurants in town (5min). Tent camping is possible

name: Street parking along beach
description:
Limited street parking near beach, would be busy during peak season.
Free toilets, beach showers, potable water. Free wifi if you sign up at cultural centre. Restaurants and shopping centre close by.

name: Moia
description:
beautiful place 1 km from the town with incredible views and wonderful sunset. calm and peaceful


precioso lugar a 1 km del pueblo con increíbles vistas y maravillosa puesta de sol. tranquilo y apacible

name: Picnic area along delta river
description:
Small picnic area, could fit 3-5 campers, slightly uneven ground.
Has potable water tap, barbeque area, bins and (dirty) toilet area. 
Locals use area for cycling and barbeques in the daytime, but otherwise quite peaceful despite being close to highway.
10min walk to the town which has all you need.

name: Potable water tap in picnic area
description: located near the cooking area, potable water

name: Cabo Fisterra
description: On the right side before the parking of the capo begins, there s nice parking space with a great sea view. Two different Levels, so lots of space for vans. Quiet. No facilities but at the souvenir shops at the capo look out are toilets (200m).

name: Quiet spot outside Ronnda
description: This spot is very quiet and hidden from the road. A lot of shade if it gets too hot. The viewpoint to Ronda is just a few meters away. Water tap nearby (in the corner of the road from where you turn down to this spot). No other facilities.

name: Dehesa de abajo
description: Place on top of a hill. Mixed parking. Bird watching close to Doñana National Park wake up next to the nesting storks. Very quiet at night. Good restaurant and WiFi

name: Tranco
description: Beautifull spot on higher ground with great view on the lake. Spot next to the street but no traffic at night and almost none in daytime. Maybe not allowed to stay here in high season.

name: Embalse de guadalmena
description: Nice place a little higher than the lake but with easy access to the water for swim or kayak. Flat place on gravel. Place for 10 campes. May be more people in summer. We were here alone. Very quiet only sounds of nature. Easy access also for none 4x4.

name: Loriguila dam
description: Flat gravel spots on top of dam left and right. Also one flat spot close to the water. Very quiet day and night. Cool swimming in the lake or perfect for a hike to Chulilla and swim there in the canyon.

name: Scenic Wild Camp
description: Follow jeep trail east of intersection, along north side of property wall. After about 100 meters, turn onto Left trail which goes down a bit, then rises up along a small cliff over lake. No facilities, but good cellular reception.

name: Área De Autocaravanas De Cazorla
description:
scenic place overlooking a huge valley of olive trees. stunning sunsets and great hiking. place has gray and black disposal and fresh water.

pitches more or less level. don't miss the lower deck.

name: Embalse Regajo
description: Lakeside spot on green grass. Just at the same level of the water. Close to the A23 but very quiet. Easy access. Ideal for a swim, fishing, kayak...  recommended

name: Irrisarri hostel
description: nice hostel up in the mountains. they have a nice website with all the info needed. paid €14 for a 10 beds dorm. parking but no shared kitchen (available for 4 euros). they may be closed on weekends for some reasons. better check or reserve online beforehand.

name: All Iron Hostel
description:
nice, clean and spacious hostel with a little cul de sac right in front of the entrance where you can park your bike or car. kitchen has very little tools and just one electric stove but it s sufficient.
€18 with breakfast. fast wifi and easy access to the city, but just outside enough not to be in the bad neighborhood. it s Spain so, lock your things up! big lockers in dorms but only one power plug which is conveniently located inside the locker. beautiful view from the 10 beds dorm.

name: Sant Cugat de Gavadons
description: beautiful place for sleep. Is little, Max. 4 vans. is perfect for sleep in tent. 2,6 kms of the principal road. next to Collsuspina.

name: East side of lake - relaxing and beautiful
description: We came for a night, and stayed a few. Small path 100 meter past picnic tables.  Away from the west side traffic/road noise and with beautiful sunsets and sounds of the lake and birds.  First night we were alone, the second 2 vans joined. Nice walking trails. There is a small bar about 500 meters further with friendly people and toilet. Good cell coverage.

name: Hiking Paradise Sierra de Grazalema
description: This spot is in the middle of Sierra the Grazalema. It is a nice big parking lot surrounded by trees. From here the hike El Pinsapar starts (you need permission for the hike drom the tourist office in Grazalema or El Bosque). About 2km from Grazalema. Very quiet at night. No facilities.

name: Camper Shop Hildago
description: This is a Caravan Center with a small camper shop. We found everything we needed (new water pump, sealing for our toilet, some spare parts). Close to Seville.

name: Next to Park
description: Nice place next to river with some shade.  Toilet about 200m in park.

name: Bar Crescente
description: what a place. underrated and definitely a surprise looking at it from the outside. the host was accommodating and the stay was pleasant. the facilities were all new and INCREDIBLY CLEAN. i parked the bike under a little veranda next to the hotel. perfect quiet night and delicious breakfast made with local produce. €15 for a single room with shared bath. it s on booking.com too

name: Estrella do Mar
description: very nice and clean hostel. brand new facility. small but cozy with a beautiful patio to park your bike in securely at night. steps from the beach and the fortress. €15 a night in a mixed dorm. landry facilities and outside sink and clothing lines to dry your stuff up. iago is a great host.

name: mequinenza
description: a beautiful and quiet space on the waterfront. we where there all day with our rooftop camper, swim in the water, cooked a meal, enjoyed the view. didnt know if it was allowed but saw nobody all day.

name: Fuente parque centro
description:
Accessible drinking water source during park opening hours (or entering through the broken holes in the fences).
---
Fuente de agua potable accesible en horario de apertura del parque (o entrando por los huecos rotos de las vallas).

name: Camping Fresneda
description: Camp site with lots of trees. Facilities are clean and the staff is friendly. There is a swimming pool, but it was not open yet. There are washing machines for self service and you can order fresh bred for the next day. Free WiFi at the bar.

name: Camping Acueducto
description: Camp site near Segovia center. Nice facilities, little shop, bar and free WiFi near the reception.

name: Hostal Trigueros
description: Beautiful old Building, clean and new - nice bedrooms. 20,- / night breakfast included. Motorcycle stays save in closed garage around the corner 1,-€/night :-)   Perfect!

name: Finca Los Juncales
description: Small farm with shower and cooking facilities, free for any adventure bikers with tents. Also 2 bedrooms available, hot water shower, bathrooms and BBQs. Workshop for urgent repairs and under roof parking. Only available until the 30th May 2019.

name: Free roadside parking, 5 terra
description:
Free road side parking near a park. 2 free parking lots and road side parking on the road perpendicular to it. All are busy, arrive as early as possible.

20min walk to La Spezia train station. 
Water tap in park, no other facilities. No tents. Long vehicles will struggle.

name: Hostel el Mercader de Sedas
description: basic hostel but it has public motorcycle parking nearby. the area seems secure but the hostel is slightly ran down. overall it was a great deal for me at €10 a night in a shared dorm with ensuite. there s a tiny kitchen at the top floor you can use. wifi is present only in the bottom shared area and not in rooms.

name: The River Hostel
description: great hostel with big rooms, kitchen, bar, and clean facilities. motorcycle parking right outside so, hell yeah! breakfast available for 3 euros in the am. strong wifi and steps from the city center and the beautiful park along the river. cheap price if you book in advance. paid €14 in 6 beds dorm

name: Mas el Mir
description: Fabulous retreat if you want to stay in the heart of Catalunya and unwind. it s an original 1350 house, refurbished and remodelled recently. beautiful rooms, pool and fantastic fresh local food. the host, Eva, is a keen motorcycle rider and traveller, so the place is obviously friendly in that sense. there are 5 rooms and one apartment to rent. The best place i'be been so far to relax and take a break from the road. The place is listed on booking.com but it has its own website and virtual tour online, as well. well worth the price.

name: Camp and Hotel El Cortijo
description:
Camping grounds behind hotel and restaurant, gated, with nice pool included, with lot of trees and shadow.
I stayed 1 night, paid 12 EUR for 1 person/tent/motorcycle. Shower in the hotel room, restrooms in the restaurant. I guess they have another premises by the pool...in summer when the season is in full swing.

name: View on El Teide
description: 100m into a sideway, just my Motocycle and my hammock. Beautyfull view. Came bevore sunset, left shortly after sunrise. No lager vehicles - I don't know if they could turn.

name: zona acampada controlada
description: In the nature park are a few designated free camping areas, there is water, cold showers and toilets (which were closed when we were here), tables and BBQ places. Very quiet in the woods.

name: Hidden rivercamp
description: Flat meadow next to the river. Enough space for big rigs. Hidden from the road, easy entry to the clear water

name: overnight spot old road
description: Next to the new road is a bit left over old road or a used to be parking lot. We pitched the tent way back behind bushes and trees and had a calm night. Also useful with a camping car I guess.

name: Alicante
description: Big dirt parking place directly at a sandy beach. Nice view of Alicante. Yes, some Airplane noise, but it is okay. It says, there is a 3500 kg limit, but there was also a big lorry/truck parked there. So Big Rig should be okay.

name: Near Parking P1
description: Dumpstation with unknown water near busparkinglot P1.

name: Montserrat Busparkinglot P1
description:
After the last bus and train have left it is absolutely quiet. Police patrols at night. Toilets in the train station can only be used during operating hours. Free parking.
You could also park further up the hill at P2, but very few places are level and if you want to stay overnight you will be charged for another day. If you have twin-tires or double-axle you will be charged as a bus.

name: Centelles
description:
Gravel Motorhome parking space.
Pro: Free parking, free dumping, free water, free electricity.
Con: Traffic noise is quite loud.

name: Free parking at Santillana Del Mar
description: Free parking at the edge of the town in the field. 10 min to the historic town centre

name: Large dirt carpark with lots of tree shelter
description:
Huge carpark under some old pine trees right across the train lines from a main beach. Shaded areas & nice patches of sun. Train line is a tad normal but spot is very beautiful. Shame that there is so much litter. Still worth a stop! 
Be careful of all the pot holes on the way in!

name: Ruta del Cares
description: Overnight spot a few meters before Cain. This spot has no amenities but one can spend the night here and hike from here the famous Routa del Cares.

name: Mountain View on Smugglers Road
description: Beautiful spot with mountain view above 2'000 m. Right beside the Smugglers Trail  on the way to Andorra. Andorra is just over the hill. No facilities, amazing view, lots of horses, no reception, perfect to stay here for a night or two.

name: Santa Antonio   In national park.
description:
Valhalla, Nirvana!  A spectacular place! On top of a small mountain just north of the town of Javea. About an hour south of Valencia. Hard to believe someone else hasn’t already tagged this location. The view is just incredible! 

Ok, down to details. From Javea take the road (cv736) up to the national park. The road is not big rig friendly (5 ton and over). Several hairpin turns and narrow. Ideal for Westphalia and Jumper style and size. I came up from the south. Saw a large plastic Fiat camper. Maybe came up from the north. Entrance will be from the east side of the main road and roughly 2- 2.5 km to park. No official entrance. Keep your eyes open for parking on your left with roughly 22 parking spots separated by wood poles. Private residence beside  parking lot. Please be courteous! Off the parking lot is bike and hiking trails. Picnic area is tiered with lots of picnic tables in good condition. Stone fences in semi circular arches round out this wonderful scene of the Mediterranean. Although there is a sign saying water is available, I found the water taps capped off. No water for some time. 

No amenities here at all. You should be fully self contained, or prepare to drive into town and back. At the end of the road is a beautiful lighthouse on the edge of the promontory. About 1 km from parking lot. Unknown at this time if operational. WiFi is sketchy. Parking lot is gravel. Please be environmentally friendly and stick to the trails and avoid walking on flora and fauna.

So, from here I’ll let the pictures do the talking!

name: Merman’s
description: Original road that was left as a pullout to view the sea. Room for 5-6 campers but only one spot that is level. Pavement/ gravel. In residential area to the north. Drop off to the sea within a few meters of parking. No amenities whatsoever. This is my second time here. Great place to overnight. Some traffic noise but quiet after 23:00.

name: Camping Castillo de Loarre
description:
Great campsite with faclities and good restarant. Set beneath the medieval Castle of Loare and stunning views over the plains. 
Located within 1/2 a mile of the nearest camino rural and a huge selection of trails to drive.

name: West of town of Barbate
description:
Conservation area parking lot. On the A-2233 west of the town of Barbate, 2-3 km out of town. Barbate has fuel, restaurants and shopping centers. There are no amenities at the parking area. A gravel lot leads to many hiking trails that go down to the beach. There is room for a few big rigs but, watch for low tree branches. Parking can be in the open or under shade of trees. 
This is my third time here. Police come in once or twice a day to do checks. No problem. Quiet at night. Beautiful view of ocean and beaches. Leftover defensive bunkers from the 1940’s among a rabbits warren of trails.

name: Camping Playa Penerronda
description: Verry Nice  Clean and Small Camping Ground  close the sea

name: Cliffs on cobaron
description:
It is a beautiful spot in the nature near a cliff! Awesome view.
Sharing with other campers.
The Jakob’s pilgrim way crosses.
There’s water but no toilet, showers
Just nature ;)

name: Tagle - Park Ermita santa Justa
description: Flat parking for 3 or 4 Campers. No services. Great views. Wind exposed

name: Orduña - Nacimiento Nervion Fuente Santiago
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: No overnight camping allowed, please respect the wishes of the locals. 

Parking in protected and picnic area in the middle of an old beech forest . Great views at 15m walking. Waterfall 222m . Usually dry but worth it. Last 1,3 km by not paved road

name: Horta de Sant Joan
description: Picknick area at the road from Horta de Sant Joan to Roques del Benet. Flat parking lot with picknick tables and a small playground, no facilites. At night there is no traffic. Beautiful view to the Roques.

name: Cliff Playa Galizano
description:
It's a gravel parking space on a cliff with superb views!
A local surf instructor told us about it.
We were told not to put out chairs or other camping stuff. 
No toilet, water or shower.

name: Grupotel Maritimo Mallorca
description: Very recommendable. The staff takes care very friendly and one feels always welcome. Clean and modern rooms. It is the best hotel that we ever had!! One feels like in the paradise. Who is not contented here, is not contented with itself. Really food!!! You will be inspired.

name: camping la estepa
description: Actually more a place for camping cars and caravans but the owner is very nice and suggested us the best suited places for tents. There is a service house that offers a kitchen, showers and a living room, all inclusive for 10 €. The pool next to the camp ground is extra for 4,50€. She gave us lots of information about the area. Very calm as the village only has 30 inhabitants and few light smog.

name: Albergue Casa del Pescador
description:
Albergue Casa del Pescador is set in Ambasmestas, on El Camino de Santiago pilgrimage route, 22 mi from Ponferrada and 11 mi from O Cebreiro. Guests can enjoy the on-site restaurant. Free private parking is available on site.

Some rooms feature views of the mountain or lake. Each room is equipped with a shared bathroom. Albergue Casa del Pescador features free WiFi . Other facilities at this property include an outdoor pool, an ecological garden and a sun terrace.

You will find a cash machine at the property. Guests can enjoy various activities in the surroundings, including fishing and hiking.

rated it 9.1

name: Camp Monastery de San Pedro de Arlanza
description:
The perfect wild camp spot in a wild foresty river valley. Protected from sight from the road. I camped here in January - nobody was here. I don’t know how it is in summer.
Also a very scenic drive through this valley. Also don’t miss the monastery and Lerma at the Eastern end of The Valley!

name: Parking Playa America
description: Parking on Playa América. Right over the beach. There are bars nearby and public toilets and showers.

name: Free Parking Cudillero
description: Free parking next to the port. Clean. near Cudillero down town

name: Camping Pantano de buseo
description: Government organized free campground in beautiful location (lakeside)

name: Praia de area
description: Parking right next to the beach at the end of a small road. You can see the lighthouse and sometimes dolphins in the evening. No facilities. Some locals parked here in the morning to go spearfishing.

name: O Cebreiro
description: Great place close to the Ethnografic Complex of O Cebreiro. Marvellous view over the landscape to the north. Over a sea of clouds. Picnic aerea with stone tables and benches.

name: Mountain Look Out
description: Side of the road pull out with a ledge for a bit of privacy.. beautiful view of mountain ranges and small villages. Super quiet spot. 10/10 recommend for a night stop!

name: Area recreativa Los Llanos
description: Big picknick area near Monachil. Lots of tables with shadow.

name: Cicita Bar Cafetería
description: Very cute café run by an Italian couple with very friendly staff. Looks small and not too special from the outside but inside it is really nice and they have amazing homemade foccacia, sandwiches, bocadillos, different coffee etc. for very good prices. “Cicita” is the name of the owner’s grandma and they really make you feel at home in an Italian family’s place. Good place to wait for the Fred Olsen ferries. Anyways don’t miss it when you are around!

name: Tagle
description: End of a dirt road. Good views. Flat. Narrow.

name: Area for Autocaravan
description:
Area for aurocaravan. It is free. It looks surrounded by buildings but finally it is not so bad. Close to a sports field. 
There is a tap with water but when we were there it wasn't working.

name: Between Guejar Sierra and Pradollano
description: Just one minute from the road from Guejar Sierra to Pradolano, a short rough track leads to this nice flat area.

name: Alto de la Escala
description: Nice little spot for one car surrounded with smaller pine trees, located 50 meters away from a very quiet road that goes towards a dam. Nice breeze from the wind, very nice especially in the summer:)

name: Lavaderos de la Reina
description: 12 km from Güejar Sierra. A small paved, then gravel road leads to the starting point of the nice hike to the Lavaderos de la Reina. At the parking lots you can stay overnight. Incredible view to Mulhacen and Pico del Veleta.

name: Camping El Peñoso
description: Nice place next to the beach. Very friendly owners. grass spots for tents. I paid 15€ for tent, bike and one person.No food on-site available but there is a bar.

name: Wild place with nice view
description:
small area with a very nice view on a plane.
close to a track, which lead only to an antenna (for mobile...)  so its very quit.

name: Camping Don Quijote
description:
Regular campsite in bike distance to Salamanca. The lots are mostly not on grass but the bathrooms, showers etc, are very clean and the price is fair. 
Quiet and with pool access and we were told that there is an excellent restaurant.

name: Termas de Barbantes
description:
Lovely place right on the river and next to free thermes, where you can swim.
Great view and very quiet. 
It’s all free.

name: Good over night spot
description: Great great great place! So much so see and do. We stayed here for 2 nights without fault. There are showers on the beach and toilets in town. Get a map from the tourist information place and it tells you what to do and where the toilets are. EXPLORE THIS AEREA! Amazing! It smells bad if the winds blowing in the wrong direction because a sewage station is at the back of the car park. But hey your living in a van

name: Lovely spot
description: Great spot for swimming, quiet. Good half way (ish) point for either coasts. It’s down a little ruggard track but don’t be alarmed the worst parts the top the rest is fine. Many flat spots to chose from if you have a good eye. It’s perfect if you go far right and the up a little bit under the trees. Our stone table we made might even still be there

name: Camping A Fonsagrada
description: Campsite with good facilities and amazing views of the surrounding countryside

name: Playa Otur
description: Natural beach sorounderd by cliffs with many trees. Blue flag. Small bar and public WC and showers from 10 to 18. Campers max 5,5m due to step and narrow access road, but well paved.

name: Thiermas
description: Lovely wild camp spot in the middle of mud lake which is very healing. Few campers around and locals bathing. Highly recommended. Leave the place clean! Fires allowed

name: By the river
description: Very calm village, only 6 people living there. Possible to sleep next to the village with van and camp in the forest next to the river.

name: Playa Berellin
description:
You are surrounded by nature ; cows, hills, trails and lovely beach. 
On the top of the hills, quiet and amazing place to rest with amazing view on the beach and nature. 
Beach is just 2 min walks and rather quiet even in August. 
10 euros to park for 24hours, no services, but on the beach there is a shower. Accessible for big truck more than 30Ft (road to get there a bit narrow but feasible)

name: Ondarra / La Arena - Parking Lot
description: Parking lot beside the street and around the corner. Nice small beach with showers toilets and water.

name: Parque Palo - Sierra Nevada
description: wonderful site for all types of rigs. water stream near by in a pine Forest. defunct toilets from another era that don't work. a few people here but wonderful views and trails near by.

name: Los Llaos Aparcamiento - San Vincente de la Barquera
description: Nice wide open grass Campground beside a Hostal. 100m to beach. Good surf spot. Hot shower and clean toilet. 10 EUR per Night with Camper.

name: Seira
description: Wild camping spot. No through road, Picnic tables, nice spot for a tent at the end of the road overlooking a river. Great views.

name: Hoz de Jaca
description:
Fountain in the village, next to the "bike service point". Average flow in August : 4'14" fort 10 litres.
you can park without hindering traffic.

name: wild quiet camp site
description: nice quiet camp site close to a track.  only for 4x4 vehicles.

name: Orbellido
description: It's a wild parking place, can put a tent too, next to a lake.

name: choyo 2 Hotel
description: Cheap nice hotel, no parking but free safe place around. Clean and nice staff. 35 € for the double room, 18 € for single room. Restaurant and bar.

name: water
description: Water fountain in centre of recreational area.

name: the waterfall
description: We found this place late during the night. Not sure what to expect in the morning. The morning came with some pleasant surprises, a beautiful view to an old paper factory and a waterfall. Parked right in the middle of some view point. Just a short hike for some scenery views. Some locals walked by but did not approached us. Small garbage bag at site.

name: Camping Ciudad de leon
description:
Standard campsite but too many people and overused facilities. 
Since 2020 new owner. Now very clean, nice owners. Very quiet place a bit far away from León. A bar is open We paid Euro 20.- May = off season. Main season Euro 29.- Internet around bar quit well.

name: Castro de Pene Lopesa
description: You can take a good off-road way (you need offroad Experience) along the coastline from south west (Praia de Sartaña) to camp, very beautiful. The smaller camp spot have a great view, located higher, very quiet, surrounded by nice nature. No access to beach - I think? 😊

name: Noelia
description: It has a cafeteria because it's inside of the  albergue zone

name: Confurco Church
description: Nice place to camp with incredible views. I asked some people in the village and they allowed me to spend the night there. Possible to find water near the houses. I went in summer and weather was good. Possible to camp next the church or park next to the fence.

name: sardón de nos Frailes
description: spot bivouac wild at the edge of lac.c'est an old road asphalted, which is fast becoming out trail, but a loophole along to avoid the wrong way .... peace and tranquility, and fish jump to welcome you. lovers outdoor will be the Angels .....

name: Pantano de Ardisa
description: Good coverage of cellular. to 100m from the road.

name: Camping Caravaning Arija
description: Nice camping with lagoon, White sand,and some forest.

name: Cangas de Onis
description: Hotel, restaurant truck stop. Cheap rooms €25 per room. Not that friendly but what do you expect for €25! On a main road but perfectly good for an emergency stop!

name: river camp
description: Nice place next to a river. Occupied by a few camper vans but plenty more space

name: Caserío Pozueta
description: Excellent hostel for pilgrims, with incredible views and very good prices according to your needs.  Dinner and breakfast if requested

name: Mar Menor - Waterfront Car Park
description: Free Carpark next to the promenade the runs along the beach. Lots of spaces and quiet in the evening.

name: Surfers Beach
description:
Moderator Note: This place is accepted but please be certain you have permission to stay overnight.

It's a big parking spot directly at the sea. It's used by many vans, campers and daily visitors!
You're able to sleep in your car or hide a tent behind the dune.
A small restaurant and a surfboard rental/surf school is nearby.
If the parking spot feels uncertain for you, it's possible to sleep in the forest behind.

name: Camping Joncar Mar
description:
Good Place with Store, Pool, clean Facilities!
Friendly and helpful. 100 m away from the beach. They helped even to park in our 10 t Truck!
Price 35,20€ pn.
Only thing is that they charge extra for wifi. 2.€ per hour.

name: durango13
description: in summer, the very low level gives free choice to an immense compact land area accessible to all vehicles. average bathing because mud and mud are present. the village is above for refueling, and a restaurant is present ......

name: La Florida
description:
Great Hotel with view over the City of Barcelona and the Costa Brava. Parking infront of the Hotel for 21€. A few steps away its for free.
Spa and Sport inclusive.
Taxis and busses driving all day long into the central City if the Caming Van is to big for the high traffic.

name: “Ghost town” viewpoint
description:
Parking next to water tower and golf range.
Rest area and exercise round.
A lot of space.
Beautiful view see pics

name: Archidona
description: Camper Service Station. Maybe you can stay here during the night. it‘s not forbidden.

name: Archidona
description: Drinking Water for Campers and Mobile Homes for free

name: Free Camping Benagéber
description: Nice camping area for free! Enough space for caravans. There’s a small house with toilets and private showers. It’s very clean and there’s someone taking good care of this place. There’s also a picnic area with grill. We‘re enjoying our stay here! You can find this location an Google maps: Caravans and Motorhomes Area Benagéber

name: La Seu d'Urgell Camper Van Free Camp
description: Designated camper van parking. Dump, water and electricity for a few euros. Overnighting free. Easy access for all rigs. Close to the old town with market on saturday mornings. Bakery open on sunday. Close to the Olympic wildwater canoe special. Quiet.

name: Xalo Camper Van Park
description: Large gravel parking for camper vans, with water and dump. € 3 water and dump. € 5 overnight, water and dump. There are no signs leading you to this place. Coordinates of this spot are where the entrance gate is. You are allowed to open the gate yourself when it's closed. Prices are visible at the little concrete service point on the parking where you can dump and get water. In the morning somebody can show up to collect your 5 euro's. Easy access for all rigs. Masymas supermarket is your neighbour. The spot is close to the towncentre and the rastro (second hand market) on saturday morning. Wine is serious business in the Xalo (Jalon) valey, tourist info 100 metres. Cheers. Quiet.

name: Encoro das forcadas
description: Small flat parking lot at the northern site of the reservoir. You can have a swim here. Some houses around, but not disturbing.

name: quiet spot in the mountains
description: It's alongside a trail, very quiet and beautiful surroundings

name: Lookout Cabo Busto
description: Overnighter with impressive lookout,  left BEFORE the lighthouse.

name: El Verger Lacolada Launderette
description: Do it yourself Launderette. Prices: 12 kg € 6, 16 kg € 7, 21 kg € 9, dryer 20 minutes € 3. Also open on sunday.

name: In a field next to a reservoir
description:
It's a big field, but can be very boggy, so be careful when driving onto it. It's 4x4 only as the path towards it is difficult and steep, but there are several other spots alongside the reservoir that are accessible for all vehicles. 
Very quiet and beautiful. View of the lake and the mountains.

name: Camping Venta  de Contreras
description:
Campsite with insane scenery. Looks like something out of Red Dead Redemption but with the addition of a massive dam. 

Pitches are large and separated by nature so you feel like you’re truly camping in the outdoors. Can pick blackberries and wild rosemary for cooking and relax in the quiet. 

Electricity available and nice hot showers. 
Perfect for overlanders and campervans who want to be in nature and don’t want a super commercialised campsite that’s full of loud families. 

Really friendly camp dogs and cats. The big ginger cat is the softest cat in the world and will jump on your bed for strokes if you let him inside. 

Go to Lidl on the way for ease but he does have a mini shop and a bar anyway. 

Windy road down to campsite looks mental on google maps but it’s really wide and almost new tarmac so there are absolutely no issues getting in or out even with a 6 metre van. We saw some google reviews saying they couldn’t get their van down but those drivers should have their licence taken away because the road is bigger than most UK main roads. 

Paid €17.50 for two with campervan. Electricity is extra.

name: gr-249
description: nice place with good spot to put a tent. bring your own water

name: Small forest area
description: During the day people are taking walks here with their dogs or go running. After dawn it is at least during the week a quiet place to pitch a tent.

name: Toconera wild camp. Bikes, motorbikes and campers
description: Calm, open and nice place to camp. You can find non treated water (Good for cooking) and picnic tables. Nobody came here but probably weekend is more busy. Lots of trees for shadow.

name: Parque Regional Cuenca Alta Manzanares
description: Parking outside of La Pedriza national park. No vehicles are allowed inside the park after dark but it is OK to park here overnight. No facilities.

name: Camping Can Banal
description: A lovely campground between the trees. Very quiet in low season.

name: Campo de la Matanza
description:
Access from Highway A7 to Fortuna. Take RM423 to the lake. At right there is an old recreation area with stone tables and benches. Could welcome a dozaine of 4x4. Flat spaces on 4 terrasses.
We hear highway traffic.

name: Camping Nautic
description: Nice campsite with terraced sites with ocean view directly at the cliffs. Place is next to the city centre and harbour of L‘Ametlla de Mar.

name: parque de santillan
description: park with drinkable water. parking. possible to stay with a van

name: fuente romana
description: free water. near a park and cheap hostal

name: fontaine
description: free drinking water from tap along the street

name: Fuente del conego
description: free drinking water, bars and shops around

name: Ermita San Isidro
description:
Shaded area in the fields.
Shelter and open fire place.

name: Dirt track
description: Along a little used track plenty of spots to park and stay for the night, leave no trace!

name: Camping Cala Llevado
description: Very large campsite with 600 stands leveled around a terraced terrain so the stands are not that close and on different levels. 34 euro for 2 plus car or ask for ANWN discount To reduce to 21 euro if you are Dutch... In October perfectly quiet and all the space to be relatively alone for a campsite.

name: Secluded Wild Camp
description: Near small stream, enough space for 4 vehicles nice view in valley

name: Camping Las Casitas de las Arribes
description: Small camping, and not overcrowded, with an amazing women holder. Toilet and shower are clean and there is hot water! There is a small bar where you can order food and drinks. You have a town 10 mins at feet and some hiking trails near Duero river, amazing view, a lot of eagles. Around 15€ per night.

name: Jesa Cargo Aduanas
description:
My issue was as follows: I left the EU on a land border crossing in June 2018 (Bulgaria to Turkey) and entered the EU again on a flight from Colombia to Madrid in October 2019. Even though my motorcycle was bought & registered in Belgium (EU), customs insisted that any cargo arriving at the terminal needs to be cleared by means of an import declaration - something I didn't expect, since "it's just a Belgian bike re-entering in the EU".
