Also the fact that I didn't have an export declaration seemed to be an issue for them (I didn't ask for that when leaving the Bulgarian border, not even sure if you can get it there).

I went to some customs agencies, and "Jesa Cargo Aduanas" saved my day! Because of uncertainties (which codes to use, how to declare for a non-resident, how to import tax-free without an export document), Jesus went along to the customs office to discuss the matter with the officials directly - he knows everybody there. 

The issue was quickly resolved:
- use code C08 - 101 for tax free import - the agency will know what this is, and this was confirmed by the customs officials themselves
- get yourself registered in the customs system as a non-resident by means of your passport

Shortly after, Jesus filed the import declaration, and all was resolved. He really went out of his way to help me out, he's very knowledgeable, and just an overall great guy! He charged me 80 euros, what seemed a very reasonable price to me (other agencies quoted up to 325 euros + VAT, for the same job, and I'm sure they didn't really know what to do).

So if you're facing the same issue, go see Jesus! And probably also for any customs procedure involving vehicles, it's his specialty he said.

name: Beliera Campsite
description: A lovely well equipped campsite with everything you need if you have been spending time in the bush! incl. small bar,  pool (though empty when we were here in October), communal BBQ area, water and electricity etc. clean quiet and friendly.

name: Haunted Goat Run
description: Nice place by a stream but probably only usable when there aren't goats grazing here.  Easy to get a large caravan into this space - quite remote.  We called it "haunted" because of the old walls and general vib of the place

name: Municipal Forest
description: Beautiful place, nice pine forest, great views of valley below.  Town is close by - bring your own supplies -

name: Playa de Matale
description: Boat launch area, perfect to park a rig or pitch a tent, right beside the river, 2 kilometers from town.

name: next to the beach
description:
it's a place next to the beach. Some people say that you have pay in the summer season. But in September it's free. There are a lot of other camper.On the beach are Showers and Toilets. But the toilets are bad. 
Clear Water is near the campground

name: Area autocaravanes de Martinet
description: Official, communal camper site (Àrea autocaravanes) of the village of Martinet. Slightly sloping, large tarmac parking across the bridge from the centre. Free, quiet parking. Electricity € 1,00 for 8 hours. Free unisex toilet (1) and free, hot unisex shower (1). Shop, ATM, butchers, bakeries, barbershop, restaurants and bars all within walking distance. Perfect place for a night or two (max = 5 nights). Dump station with free drinking water on site.

name: Talleres Jose Cobo
description:
Mechanic preferred for trucks e.g. for:
  Engine, 
  Brakes,
  and changes of any kind

with over 35 years of experience

Telefon: +34.653.66.55.17

name: El Alamo
description:
Very fine spot on a flat field next to this very small town. Fresh water and shade. Very friendly people that are so glad to meet you. One cafe (cold meals only) and some supermercados on wheels at some days. Nobody speaks english. No public wifi. 

I even was sometimes invited for lunch, for diner, at a birthday party, for personal wifi and for drinks. 
I was even invited to use someone's small daytime summerhouse, garden and bathroom. And I even had a full fridge available (breakfast, lunch, coffee, beer, soup, all for free !). 

I stayed there 10 days and loved to be there !

name: Meson de Sancho
description:
Great hotel near port. Bar restaurant pool very clean 
Parking

name: El Grau De Castellón
description: Municipal campsite for motor homes only, no tents or caravans. Free for 48hrs max stay. On the beach at Castellón de la Plana. Maximum 48 vehicles although overflow happens on adjacent street. Public toilets, water and waste water facilities. Popular so need some luck to find a spot. Aim for planetarium if looking on maps. Max 8m rigs, no height restriction.

name: Camping Rio Ara
description: nice campground with lots of trees and space. no numbered/fix spots. good facilities, super friendly staff and nice view. we were there off season.

name: Parking Storage -a piece of heaven- Barcelona
description:
Overlanders Parking. 

Morning, we are Miquel & family, we are overland travellers with a Van, and ofert a safe (with video 24/7) and private outside parking in our home. If you want to take a rest in your travel, you can leave your vehicle for 1 week, or even 12 months. Available for Camper, motor-homes RV ,Van, small trucks (max. 8m longer 3m alt). We can also transfer you to Barcelona or Girona airport in 45min. Our price are: Camper-van 150€/month, small truck 180€/month. (60€/week). We have a plastic cover for your van.
You have possibility electricity and water tank extra tax.
You are welcome, and we have a Airb&b to accommodation at home: “a piece of heaven” Tona-Catalonia (Barcelona) https://www.airbnb.cat/rooms/34825961 

You need to contact us for reservation:             +34679958097         miquelvilaro@gmail.com

    We are waiting for you and your adventures!

name: La panadella
description: It's a litle forest or grove, next to the path of the pilgrim

name: Posada de Valdeon
description: Large communal area, established for campervans, with hard stand, electricity and drinking water on each pitch. Right behind the local sports hall, of which the facilities can be used (shared showers, toilets for each sexe). There’s also a sink and some barbecues next to the building. Price per night € 10,- per pitch. Maximum stay: 4 nights. The small rural village of Posada de Valdeon is within walking distance with cafe, restaurants, bakery (the local shop closed down). NB there’s a sign saying big camper vans are not allowed on the raod to Cain, so the two spots described there may no longer be reached by larger vehicles!

name: Overlooking Igualada
description: Flat mountain top with brilliant view of the city of Igualada. Accessed via 200 m steep dirt road northwards via industrial sites. Daytime visited by dog ​​owners and Joggers. Quiet nights.

name: CAMPERCAT4X4
description:
After a big family trip from Alaska to Patagonia we decide to open our place to travellers.

Specially for travellers going from central Europe to Africa. Bikers and cyclists welcome.

Just 10 minutes from the highway and 10 minutes from the beach, day hikes. Good place if you want to take the AVE (high speed train) to Barcelona or visit the world heritage roman city of Tarragona. We offer transfer to both places.

Barbacue, swimming pool, wifi, electricity, wc, hot shower, rock climbing wall for children, porch for cooking, dogs welcome (we have one),...

Please contact first at +34 630861669

We also rent 4x4 campers.

Follow us in instagram, facebook or tweeter as CAMPERCAT4X4

name: Ermita la Mare de Deu de la Foia
description: Quiet pick-nick place with running water and tables. Perfect for a wild camp night (bivouac is allowed). Next to an ancient hermitage. Car access. Also perfect place to start your hike up to Montsant mountain (very beautiful and special mountain range).

name: Parking place in the national park
description:
A beautiful and quiet parking in the national park with beautiful views over the mountains. The only sound you hear at night is the clonking of the cowbells. Cows, horses and sheep are roaming free around you so remember to keep your pets on a leach. Several exellent hikes starts here. You can also find several similar spots just down the road. 
Trashcans can be found, no level spots on this parking. 
The road in have some traffic but is generally very quiet, the road is also quite steep and narrow so I would be extremely cautious about going with a bigger camper or van. If you are camping with a tent, this is probably not the best place to stay, but I am sure you can find many other spots in the forest.

name: Camping El Astral
description: ACSI approved campground, unfortunately a bit on the more expensive side for it's location. Price closer to 20 euro for 1 person and a car, it should in my opinion be closer to 10 offseason. Washing machine an extra 3,50 (soap included) Dryer an extra 3,50. Electricity extra so it adds up. Clean bathroom and toilets and shower warm and friendly customer service.

name: Gravel parking
description: Very beautiful and peaceful gravel area between cork oaks. Several potential places along the gravel road. Some noise from the secondary road nearby.

name: Asphalt parking by a lake
description:
A small parking place by a lake, where swimming most likely is possible. Lots of trash everywhere although garbage bins can be found on the parking, this is also a popular place for the free roaming cattle so the terrain is a minefield. 
BBQ spots next to the parking and hiking/cycling trails start here. Might be a busy place during the summer. Quite a narrow road in, but with good surface. I had a good night here.
Minimarket in the town with very nice staff.

name: Small field next to the road
description:
A small field next to the road behind some bushes. Asked the friendly farmer who stopped by if would be ok to stay for one night - it was no problem.
I picked up some trash before I left, the place is a bit dirty and the river is not recommended to use in any way (also fenced off). Some noise from the road during the evening. Had a good night sleep.

name: Camping S‘Abanell
description:
Open all year. Only the promenade with a small street separates the square from the fine, enchanting pebble beach. At this time of year there are almost only long term campers there and the back seats with sea view are all free. Washing machine and dryer available, as well as all sanitary facilities. Dogs allowed, many restaurants around, but currently all are closed. Super nice reception. I paid for me, dog, camper and electricity about 15 €.

Ganzjährig geöffnet. Nur die Promenade mit einer kleinen Straße trennt den Platz vom feinen, zauberhaften Kiesstrand. Zu dieser Jahreszeit sind fast nur Langzeitcamper da und die hinteren Plätze mit Meerblick sind alle frei. Waschmaschine und Trockner vorhanden, sowie alle sanitären Anlagen. Hunde erlaubt, viele Restaurants rundherum, die aktuell jedoch alle geschlossen sind. Super nette Rezeption. Bezahlt habe ich für mich, Hund, WoMo und Strom ca. 15€.

name: Camping Playa y Fiesta
description:
Grenzgenial parking space right on the water! In the summer probably very crowded, this time a real dream. Nice reception, open all year, full supply. 14 € per night incl. Electricity. Pool and restaurant are closed at this time of year, at the reception there is bread to buy in the morning. Nearest supermarket about 5 km away.

Grenzgenialer Stellplatz direkt am Wasser! Im Sommer wahrscheinlich sehr voll, um diese Zeit ein echter Traum. Nette Rezeption, ganzjährig geöffnet, volle Versorgung. 14€ pro Nacht inkl. Strom. Um diese Jahreszeit sind Pool und Restaurant geschlossen, an der Rezeption gibt es morgens Brot zu kaufen. Nächster Supermarkt in ca. 5 km Entfernung.

name: Dunes Area Camper
description:
simple place with very nice owner. All services. Open all year. 11euros incl electric

Einfacher, umzäunter Schotterplatz mit suuuper nettem Betreiber und allem Service. Ganzjährig geöffnet, 11€ inkl. Strom.

name: Beautiful spot by the river
description: Loads of space next a river. open grass to park on. many nice level areas. Plenty fire pits and lots of wood around. The road is across the river but can't be seen. Huge cliffs around.

name: Parking motorhome Free
description: Big place, Parking Free near gas Staion.

name: CAMPING CALONGE
description:
Beautiful organized campsite in the middle of the pines forest. Swimming pool, good shaded areas and restaurant.
Wild forest around with sandy areas and Cega River behind.
Open only on july and august.

Precioso camping en medio de los pinares. Tiene piscina, zona recreativa y muy buena sombra.
Abierto sólo en julio y agosto.

name: Parking
description: Parking Free in the street, big place near the metro.

name: Gas Station
description: Gas Station water. Free. Near sea. Potable.

name: Refugio El Zarcejo
description: Small hut with fire place and big door with no window. Perfect to do a bivy.

name: Parking at Gavà beach
description:
One of the many parking spots next to Platja de Gavà. I stayed here two nights with my dog, car and rooftoptent. In the evening some cars came to the parking lot but didn't stop. In the early morning fisherman arrived, but didn't say anything except for hi.
Each place to enter the beach in Gavà has a (cold) shower and garbage bins. I used the water of the shower for making tea and preparing dinner, don't know if it's safe to drink without boiling.
 
Don't know if they check more strictly during summer period.

name: Benicassim- parking spot in the mountains along the CV 147.
description: This spot is famous for its views towards Benicàssim and the sea. There is also a great steep hike to a ruin of an old monastery of about 1.5 hours. Fantastic place. Stayed for 2 nights. No facilities but at the foot of the mountain there is a dumping station and water.

name: Island on the reservoir
description:
There is a peninsula out to a forested island on a big lake. There is some sort of "adventure park" on the way down. all closed up in November. toilets are open. garbage cans etc. Very quiet and many places to choose from

there are water tape but unsure if potable.

unsure of what is available when the adventure park is open.

name: Government Campsite
description: Huge place next a small stream. water spillway of some kind. take your first hard left at the bottom of the hill to find the good spot. Carry on down the road and past the steps to the main spot. No one around in November. Interesting spot worth checking out. lots of offroading nearby. some covered tables and an indoor fireplace.

name: Site among pine trees
description: Huge site amongst pines. BBQ shacks, toilets, picnic benches, garbage. Loads of room. Gravel road access but fine for any vehicle. Shelter for cyclists. Shows there are showers on the sign but all closed in November. Two toilet stalls were left open

name: Quiet and clean overnighter
description: Quiet and clean overnighter, no services, only a short walk to the village. We took a walk into the village but both restaurants were closed, maybe they only open in the evening not sure. Nothing special but it's free.

name: Area Camper Barcelona Beach, Cabrera de Mar
description:
This is a great, safe and quiet camp ground. The perfect starting point to visit Barcelona, shopping center only a 5 minute walk. The train station less than 
 a10 minute walk and the train will take you right into the center of Barcelona.

name: Tetería Kasbah
description: Great place for tea and sweet treats (they also have a couple of gluten free options).  They also have meals like tajin.  Nice ambiance.  Cozy.

name: Linás de Broto
description: Small place near the river. Magnificient view. Very guiet.

name: Alfaro
description: Parking close to the river Ebro. Quiet place. Good for a night.

name: Hoyos del Espino
description:
Parking place near the village
and info center.  Restaurants 500 m.

name: Mohedas de Granadilla
description: Parking near the lake. Nice view over the water and the mountains.

name: Plasencia
description: Huge park. Near the reservoir. Many nice spots with shade.

name: Casilas de Goria
description: Place near the river Alagon. In the middle of nowhere. No shade, but a beautiful spot. Jump in the river.

name: Malpartida de Caseres
description: Huge picknick area. Lots of nice places under the trees. Can be busy in summer.

name: Santa Marina. Ha
description: Parking near the church. Very  peacefull. Good for a stopover.

name: Ford Ferri-Movil
description: Huge Ford Dealer, with great Service. We called yesterday for an oil change abd they gave us a space today. Could bring the Van in the morning and was ready in the evening (we decided to go to the city in the meantime, car was ready much earlier). Fair price, good work! I have seen that they do service for other brands as well.

name: Land Rover Club Spain
description: +34 603 90 22 62 send Rafa via Whats App a message if you have problems with your Landy, they dint speak English, but use translator. Perfect mechanics with passion. They also have a service truck to get you when you can not drive anymore.

name: Bar Moreneta
description: The best place ever if you like good meat and tapas, we came here will local people.

name: Parking close to climbing area
description: Very nice natural place close to camping and hiking area, no water, no toilet. You can swim in the river nearby. Very safe and others sleeping here in there busses. In summer and on weekends its busy, but no problem at all. We stayed 3 nights

name: Cantonigros
description: Free campsite for vans in Cantonigros village. Water, electricity and dump station.

name: Camping Cáceres
description: Large site with private bathrooms, shop, pool, restaurant etc etc. The good news: open all year long hence this notification.

name: Sant Feliu de Guixols
description: Parking spot, also for big rigs, with dumping station. Euro 5 per night; tickets can be bought at the tourist Office which is located next to the monastery. 5 min walking to the centre of the very nice town.

name: overnighter before catching the ferry to Morocco
description: Quiet overnight spot right next to the ticket office for the ferry to Morocco. A lot of motorhomes stay here before departing for Morocco. Good internet if you have your own Sim card, great shopping centres in walking distance.

name: Territorio Tortuga
description: Sand parking directly next to a beautiful beach. We stayed here with a couple of camper vans and me with my rooftoptent. No water, shower or toilets, but there are garbage bins. Some hiking paths around with a small cave and beautiful viewpoints.

name: Lanzarote
description: wonderful sleeping place over the see.   on the edge of the national park in lanzarote.

name: El Chorro Free Water
description: Tap with standard thread. Parking spot right next so a hose can reach your van.

name: Lake side camp
description: Lots of room along a lake. Beware ground turning to muck after rain! Fire rings, picnic bench etc. No one around in December but looks well used. Nice views

name: Riverside
description:
Area in the trees next to the river. A few vans around appear to be here for a while. Fair bit of room. Good place for tents. Fire pits around. Nice spot on the concert slab at the end. 

Free fresh water tap up the street I marked on another waypoint!

name: Fuentes Blancas
description:
Campground with really good hot showers! Nice in December! 18€ per night, car, 2persons. Public bus to Burgos.

Still a very nice and quiet place. Price between Euro 22.- and 30.- in may. A bit far away to town. God to have a bike with.

name: Camping Regio
description: Open all year, hot showers, 17€/night, 2 persons, car, no electricity. Public bus to Salamanca.

name: Finca La Isa, Tejeda
description: Eco Hostel with huge free spaces, very welcoming atmosphere! Bathroom, showers, breakfast-Buffet for 7 €, homemade dinners on pre-order € 10

name: Beach Parking
description:
Public parking place next to the beach behind a hotel, no signs about camping. 
Good place for surfing.

name: Guadamia Recreation Area
description: nice spot with a great view, some people during the day, at night no other people here in December,  fresh water, benches and tables, barbeque,  no beach etc. you are above sea level, great place for hikes along the coast

name: Los Puercos Free Camp
description: Large grassy and a bit rocky area with trees. Entrance from N430 at km. 440 minus 100 meters. Easy access for all rigs. Firm gravel or grass, secluded or view. Y'll find it here. With also perfect little hideway spots for push/motor bikers. 3G. Altitude of 1 kilometer make temp drop after sunset.

name: Playa de Balerma
description:
Long beach with possibilities to stay close or even on the sand at water line.
It was quite, only few fishers and joggers around.

No Policia or Guardia seen, no signs, so staying for 24 hours without doing camping (putting things out like table, etc.) should be allowed.

name: Plateau in Deserta de Tabernas
description:
A hidden plateau on half height between river bed and plateaus around. So it's possible to stay without sightline to anyone passing by.

Was there for three nights and made small controlled fire (there was plenty of dead dry wood).
Only dew offroader passed the road through the river.

Shortest legal access only via the River Bed, other Track going direct to national Street is blocked by a chain at the end.

It's in middle of beautiful nature, no trash, paper or crap laying around.
So please keep it clean like this and be safe with fire (no fire when windy, have enough water or extinguisher accessible, don't leave fire alone)!

name: Beautiful Playas Sombrerico
description:
Both beaches are beautiful; many space to stay,l; Hiking possible (a 3 Hour round over the hills); ground mostly straight; Mobile net Connection partially bad or not possible; when heavily raining is not possible to go in or out; close to Chiringuito are cold showers and open toilets (the owner of the Chiringuito is cool, please keep all clean); from the position the beach along to north was a natural water source;
policia was cool.

name: Bush next to the road
description: Andalucía is all covered with fences, so while this spot isn’t ideal at all it is at least something. No fireplace nor wood, and no water source – just a tiny place to set a tent and spent a night for free.

name: Matalascañas lighthouse
description: Gravel road with a death and leads you towards the lighthouse. I stayed here for 2 nights with my dog and rooftoptent without problems. Someone told me not to block to "road" (sand) towards the lighthouse, to make sure that emergency vehicles can still pass. Garbage bins very close. When you walk along the lighthouse and keep following the main path towards the beach, you'll find a shower and a possibility to fill some water. Looks like there are some restaurants at the boulevard but I didn't check them out.

name: Marina Alcaidesa
description: This is a caravan parking inside the marina. Toilets are closed at night but it does have a dumping station and a laundry. Great if you are coming or heading to Morocco. Great views to Gibraltar.

name: Portillo del Lazar
description: Nice place and view, very quiet at night.

name: Parking close to caminito del Rey
description: Small parking lot, dead end road, quiet, view point nearby.

name: Pension Calatrava
description:
Cheap hotel for 25€ a night, basically a trucker restaurant/motel. There’s a better/more expensive hotel attached (same owner) if you prefer more luxus. But the rooms are good, pretty big, with AC/heater and bathroom.
Close to the race track and the Spaghetti Western filming locations (Texas Hollywood, Mini Hollywood and Western Leone)

name: mirador del guadiamar
description: Nice place with wonderfull views. Picnic area without tables or services very quiet.

name: Hotel Valcarce
description: A stop overnight place with all the necessary amenities. We took a room as it is winter but you can camp in the parking and use showers and toilets if you need.

name: Aldagaia
description:
4 beautifully designed self-catering apartments with kitchen area, washing machine, WIFI, set in a small apple orchard. Recently developed in a lovely traditional stone building in the interesting and bustling town of Hernani, just outside San Sebastián/Donostia in the Basque Country.
Space in the forecourt to park large vehicles.
The owner is really friendly and helpful, even asked a local mechanic to help us with some minor work to our Landcruiser.

name: Fuente San Ta
description: very good spring water directly on the street

name: Área Recreativa Sedilla
description: very nice and big picnic place with tables and barbecue grills and water  (and toilets and shower, but these are closed) , but the road to the hill is very small and tight, only for small vehicles

name: Fuente
description: it is a small spring with good water, some locals fill their bottles,  some picnic tables around, nice place

name: Fuente de pesca
description: spring with good water, some picnic table around, very nice area for hiking

name: Camping Havana
description: small quiet camping place directly on the beach between greenhouses.  clean showers and toilettes. mostly long time campers. okay for one night.

name: Beach parking
description: very nice place, but only for cars to 5m length allowed !, the police was 6 p.m. here and all motorhomes about 5m length must move

name: Roses
description:
Close to Roses. Quiet place except some dog barking in the distance.
Not a fancy place but good for one night.
Space for about 10 vehicles.
Free of charge.

name: Parking Autocaravanas La Jábega
description:
ADMIN NOTE:  user reports location seems to be seasonal. 

More a parking lot, around 50 caravans, trucks and RVs parked there long term. You can also camp here, 13€ per night all inclusive. Its not pretty though. There's weak WiFi, very clean showers and toilets and a washing machine.

name: Erratzu parking
description: Nice parking located in the village of Erratzu. Beautiful views. Public toilets are in the towns small center, which also has a view restaurants. Bring your own toiletpaper ;-)

name: Barruecos
description: Beautiful place, with a couple of lakes and spectacular landscapes. A battle of Game of Thrones was filmed here.

name: Good Place
description: Good place but not for big trucks. Nice view on Benidorm

name: Zaragoza Motorhome Area
description:
Reserved area for 36 camper vans. 10 minutes to the city center and most of the tourist spots by tramway. 
Free of charge inclusive fresh water and dumping.
Maximum stay 72 hours.
60% of the parking positions were occupied during my visit.

name: Albarracín
description: Parking behind Dinopolis. Quiet. Hiking possibility.

name: safe space in the Hills
description: Only for one car. We found this place with a 6m Bus. This place for big rigs is not possible and not over 3.2 metres high. Nobody here

name: Viewpoint near Xàbia
description: Quiet spot except the waves. Nice view in the small bay.

name: El Castell de Guadalest
description:
Parking area below the street Level. Quiet. Parking fee was 2 €.
Restaurants and bars are close to the spot.

name: Great overnighter, very quiet
description: Great place stayed here for a couple of nights. There are lots of individual benches, fireplaces, rubbish bins, and water taps. This place is nice and clean, we should keep it this way.

name: Hillside
description:
Wild camping place along the dirt road on a hill. You have a nice view over the town Conjunt de Castell d'Aro Castell-Platja d'Aro. Completely quiet, no one here. A local said that it’s totally fine when we stay for the night.
The path is pretty steep. I would recommend a 4x4 vehicle. We did it with a 4x4 Sprinter Van pretty easy in dry conditions. In wet conditions I probably would not have tried it with a 3,5 ton Sprinter van.

name: nice and quiet
description: nice and quiet stayed here for a couple of nights, no one will hassle you. The road in is a couple of hundred metres dirt road but not a problem. There are fire places and there is a water pipe next to one of the buildings. We have seen a lot of people drinking from the pipe and after trying it myself the water appears to be good mountain water.

name: Casa de baños (public showers)
description: Public showers in Madrid, 0.50€ for 20 min, nice hot water + clean showers.

name: Spain
description: We moved on to this location, as a result of having been on from Delta Ebro by the police .... they were charming but firm. This location is frequented by kite surfers and people who fish. It was also considered to be acceptable by the police. Easily possible to camp discreetly ... mosquitoes could be a problem as the temperatures rise.

name: Carboneras
description:
Apparently camping in the National Park is an absolute no-no. However this location is considered to be acceptable .... other vans were here too. 
Approaching Carbonates from the N341 take first exit on roundabout along AL-5106. Take second track on right several hundred meters from the roundabout to cul de sac bordered by sea and cliffs. Quiet other than waves crashing at high water.

name: sacred oak
description: it's in the middle of the olive yard. there's a huge magnificant oak three surrounded with olives. it's a private land. here the local youth & artists organize private parties. just a night before was one so I stayed for another night.

name: Wild campsite with sea views
description: Nice spot for cyclist or off road motorbikes. Flat and calm place next the mountains. To arrive there, go just to a big forniture store called VETA (google maps) , take the path in the other side of the road and you can arrive the place.

name: Almeria Port
description: a well equipped port with a confusing process. there's a cafeteria, restaurant, 24 hour supermarket, toilets, a waiting area and showers (although the showers were locked when I tried them). Follow the yellow signs to FERRYS and you'll loop around the ticketing building to a parking area. there is no order to the parking, just stop wherever. at some point you'll get waved forward and everyone pushes up, motorcycles (and ATVs) can go first. you'll need printed copies of your ticket (2x/each for passenger and vehicle)

name: Camping La Piscina
description: Camping at the outside of the small town Bicorp with restaurant and some sports installations. Also a pool in summer

name: Flat ground fit for big truck or 2 cars
description: Small sort of parking lot near a apple tree yard. Stayed for one night, no services but really quiet at night. Near the road are multiple places to park, except the private roads but these have a sign.

name: Direct lake access and view of Iznajar
description: Long dirt/gravel road (5km). Last part is a Very steep descending to the lake. 4x4 recommended, when wet mandatory!!Really beautiful view over the lake and the illuminated city Iznajar. A lot of tiny mosquitoes though.

name: Elevated position above bbq & picnic are.
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Please check local and country laws to confirm wild camping is allowed in this area. 

We found this site as a result of the official camp site at Montillana closed. It is almost directly opposite and sign posted. We made very little noise and exposed no obvious lighting. It is on a completely level piece of ground with spectacular views of the lake. There is also a lot cover so we were really well camouflaged. There was absolutely no disturbance at all.

name: Aitona
description:
It is a motorhome area with gray and black water emptying services. Equipped with drinking water. 
---
Es un área de Autocaravanas con servicios de vaciado de aguas grises y negras. Dotado de agua potable.

name: Secans del Segrià i Utxesa
description:
It is a small plane with several trees that provide shade and is next to the gates that regulate the level of the Utxesa reservoir and the Serós canal. About 150 m away is the information point called La Fusteria, with drinking water and WC.
----
Es un pequeño plano con varios árboles que dan sombra y está junto a las compuertas que regulan el nivel del pantano de Utxesa y el canal de Serós. A unos 150 m está el punto de información llamado La Fusteria, con agua potable y WC

name: Parco de geolog Jose
description: I slept several day in the Twingo here. Very nice place. People very friendly. Very close to the center. There's a drinkable public tap water & a public toilet. My colleague & I used this place cause we were performing in the streets in the center every day. Just need to be very quiet & respectful to all the other users of the park!

name: Camping la Fundicion
description:
Average camping away from towns in a nice valley. I was first asked for 19€ (price for a spot, vehicle, 2 persons and power in low season) found it a bit much for a single cyclist and paid 9,9€ after discussion ( 1 small tent and one adult).
no mobil network. wifi near reception.

name: Overlooking the forest
description: Great flat campsite in the middle of nowhere. Space for at least 10 tents. Must have a 4x4 to get here. Very narrow road.

name: Near Almeria highway
description:
Nice clean parking near a gas station. 
water and wc and wifi at the gas station.

name: Sant Hilari Sacalm RV area
description:
Parking for RV, water available, flush for camper van and electricity (have to ask at the nearby swimming pool, dont know the price)
Also some flat space on grass for pitching the tent
Toilets during daytime at the nearby swimming pool

name: Santa Cecilia Ermitage
description:
Flat grassy area next to Santa Cecilia chapel, tents only
At the edge of the forest, trees to protect from dew.

name: Home
description: I'm an overlander just arrived at home by the currently virus situation. I offer others overlanders stucked in Spain a place to stay for free with water, toilet, kitchen etc. I also have a couple of bedrooms if you travel with a tent

name: Free Campervan Services (Drinking Water & Waste Disposal)
description: Designated parking for campers with excellent services - drinking water, Black waste disposal and grey waste disposal. No problems staying her overnight. Close to a university so a little bit noisy in the morning but not bothersome. Safe area.

name: Near Gor on the way to Gorafe
description: Nice Spot with greate landscape and view on the snow covered Mountains. Very quite.

name: Lavomatic - Washing Machines
description: Open 24hs - Wash 8kg 4.5€, Dry 3€ - Buy the tokens at the gas station

name: very nice place between the trees
description: very nice place between the trees. extremely quiet, very pleasant climate.  beautiful hiking routes.

name: Malpaso
description: Beautiful viewpoint with a view to La Palma and La Gomera.

name: Playa del Rostro
description: Great river beach. There is also a boat with excursion by the river. During the night the peace comes and it's wonderfull

name: Camarzana de Tera
description: Great place near the River Tera. There is also an informal camping near the threes.

name: Playa de Gerra
description:
Camping Meadow close to the sea, cold water shower and toilettes.
Ground is not flat.
Private ground, guy comes about 22:00 to collect the money.

5€ Tent
10€ Caravan

Possible for every vehicle.

name: Refugio Raso Cubillos Urbion
description:
Public mountain shelter with a fireplace, chair and table. Fresh in summer, ok in winter.
Perfect spot for one night!

name: Alos de Balaguer
description: Wild campsite near the River with a little Fuente, tables

name: Pensión Mosende
description: Great value Hostel. Single & Double rooms. Cheaper and better equipped than some Hotels that I have stayed in. Recommended.

name: Pista Blanca
description: ideal for camping. looking at the stars . no water, no establishment camping

name: Rest Area
description: Green big area with tables, BBQ and fountain with potable water to motorhomes. You can put tent, but at 9am you must remove it. It is a beautiful place with sea views.

name: Matalascañas dune path
description:
Close to the sea, quiet, no facilites in winter
near Doñana national Park.
nice dune beach

name: canyon de horadada
description:
Close to Aguilar del Campoo, really nice place, no facilites, just nature, very quiet. you need a 4x4 to get there.
beautiful place.

name: Gingueta Water
description:
Good fountain. Parking very close. Water runs fast.
---
guter brunnen. Parkplatz sehr nahe. wasser läuft schnell.

name: close to barniedo de la reina
description:
Taken the dirt road, 500 meters.
nice place close to the river . there is a small
waterfall.
no facilities

name: Bomaigua
description: Parkplatz der Seilbahnstation. Mit toller Aussicht.Teerplatz. Am Ende bei Pfosten zwei sehr gut.

name: Caravia
description:
Close to the tarred road. AT the source, take the dirt road. On the top you can park.
quiet place. No facilities.

name: Mirador Heliport
description:
A few meters in front of a great vantage point is a small nice place but without shadow. Accessible via a gravel road. At 1850 meters, it winds wonderfully through the mobile.

Wenige Meter vor einem tollen Aussichtspunkt ist ein kleiner netter Platz jedoch ohne Schatten. Erreichbar über eine Schotterstrasse. Auf 1850 Meter windet es wunderbar durchs Mobil.

name: Gijón, mirador de la providencia
description:
we slept on the parking .
view point to the haven and the sea .
very windy, nice place.

name: Tremolera
description:
Right on the stream. The road can still be heard. Nice for an evening.

Direckt am Bach. Die Strasse ist noch hörbar. Nett für einen Abend.

name: Camping Lizarra
description:
A campsite near Estella-Lizarra. Paid 10 euros for the night in my tent with bicycle on a non powered site. Many families were there, so I guess it should be quiet most nights. powered sites costs more. I was able to charge my phone at the reception. there might be some power outlets around the reception building. 

They have Football and basketball field, swimming pool. Also Minigolf and table tennis, some rental fee might be required.

name: Oceanfront
description:
for 4x4, in front of the sea.
really nice and quiet. windy
beautiful view

name: beach Xove
description:
very nice place, quiet, close to the sea, beautiful view.
no facilities

name: Área A Praíña Acampada Itinerante
description:
Lovely campsite in Pontevea, along side the river.

A five minutes walk of the town (restaurants, supermarkets, etc) and 20 minutes (highway) of Santiago de Compostela. 

The site is managed by Pedro (695239911). He is the one to talk to book the stay.

name: Rocky road
description: Hammock site off the side of a rocky road. A couple of trees off the side of a backcountry rocky road. Perfect campsite for the night.

name: acantilados de Loiba
description:
A great view over the cliff where you can park. nice place for the night.
A lot of people during the  day and very quiet during the night.
there is a chiringuito if you want to drink and eat something.

name: Rinhlo Ocean View
description: Perfect ocean view camping spot, protected from wind overlooking the village of Rinhlo. Very quiet large place on a dead end road. Only some occasional fishermen passing by. Narrow rocky access road, but 4x4 not required.

name: Santiago de la espada
description:
Wild camping near to a spring. Forniture bench and tables. BBQ point.
Perfect for 1 night. Hide tent, not sure if allowed, I stayed and no problem

name: Playa Gueirúa
description: Spectacular sunset and sunrise. Access via steep and rocky descent towards the beach. Only possible with good 4x4. There are some small grass plots, but leveling of the car is required. Not so easy, but very rewarding (this is the reason why you are traveling with 4x4 and rooftop tent).

name: lake near Jarosa s road
description:
Nice place close to a lake ( not possible to swim) under pine trees( smell very good).
There are  lots of trails to walk.
Near , there is a restaurant so during the day there is a lot of people.
quiet during the night.

name: Camper parking in Besalú
description:
Parking area for campers across from Information center. 

Walking distance to town.

Mixed reviews on Park4night. 

No toilets at night.  Maybe during the day at information center.  

There appeared to be a dump area, but not confirmed as we don’t require that service.

name: Camping El Birllante
description:
Camproung next to the City with a little store, friendly personal an campgrounds with shadow. 
There is a big pool included.

name: CAMPING RODAS
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified.

Camping Rodas is a family run campsite located at the entrance of the town of Roses and very close to the beach. A perfect place to enjoy your holidays with family or friends, staying on one of our pitches, surrounded by trees or in a comfortable mobile home. Located in a quiet spot, this is the perfect location to relax and enjoy the many activities, a privileged and unique area such as the Bay of Roses and its landscape, culture, gastronomy and recreational range.

name: Perfect Camping at River - wild
description: Good Spot for a Night close to river. Has tables made out of rocks. Some fisherman around. Besides it was quite. Awesome stars too...

name: Camping at Beach
description:
Nice little place with beach (tiny) close and open view for sunset. 4x4 and motorbikes can enter. Locals do so too for fishing... 
#freiheitenwelt

name: Jandia beach
description:
Nice spot next to the Iberostar Selection Hotel. 

If driving towards Morro Jable, turn left, right before the roundabout. 

Next to the road, behind a tree line but quite quiet at night. Walking distance to the beach 3 minutes. Ventura Shopping Mall with Spar Supermarket and basic restaurants 3 minutes walking distance.

name: Seville visit campsite
description:
Perfect if you want to visit Seville. Storage for campers but also possibility to park outside behind the building. 
Nothing fancy. don't expect a campground but for 10€/24h (1€ for each additional hour) it's perfect. Bus to Seville stops right in front of the place and takes you in 20 min to the city center.
Toilet and water dump, electricity and water tap.
Shower and toilets available. 

Very nice welcome with useful information. 
Yes its near an airport, highway and railway. So there is some noise.  Nothing that really bothered us. 

There was plenty of space when we there. We were able to install chairs and table, this might not always be possible.

name: close to bardenas desert
description: accessible in dry season, very quiet place,

name: piscina fluvial
description: Very nice place. River, possibility swing.

name: Camping Canon do Sil
description: well organised site with a small shop and restaurant open for breakfast and dinner (8-10pm). has some cabins and pods, several hook ups, it may be difficult for very large motor homes to make it up the steep and narrow canon roads. has the most amazing miradors. clean toilets and showers, quiet off season. highly recommended

name: By a river 8km east of Albarracin
description: Just off the A1512. Mostly flat gravel track for approx 20 metres, it's fine for a car if you go slowly. Nice and flat at the bottom with a river running past. Close to the road but not much traffic at night.

name: Montjoi
description:
Behind  a house that looks to be empty most part of the year except summers, the place is tiny but there fit a 2 people tend, it's not a place where people walk through, but sometimes you can hear some cars near in the main Street. 
if you travel by car or moto you can park it 5 mts away in a flat space. 

ESPAGNOL
lugar pequeño donde cabe una tienda doble, esta escondido a pesar de estar cerca de un pueblo de vacaciones, si vas en coche, moto puedes dejarlo un poco más abajo en una explanada, la bici se puede dejar detrás de un arbusto más o menos escondida

name: Portonovo
description: An excellent old style auto electrician who sorted multiple issues with my motor home

name: Quiet place - motorcycle access
description: Quiet and hidden place a hundred meters from the road, suitable for trail motorcycles.

name: REC ON Project
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified.

We are Paulina and Bart and we have realised our dream by renovating an Andalusian farmhouse near Velez Rubio during COVID-19.
Now our eco village is ready to welcome travellers and van-lifers with open minds and warm hearts to join our community and experience like never before.

In our eco village you can be completely free or you can eat, drink, work and play with us!
You can enjoy nature by taking beautiful walks, tours or just relax and enjoy the silence.

Check out our website www.Rec-on.es to find out more about us or send us a message!
If you’re looking for a work-away experience to join us as a volunteer, we also have an house with rooms and all the facilities you need.

Enjoy the video on youtube at https://bit.ly/31FFrzK  and we are looking forward to meeting you.

Hasta luego!!

name: Grassy flat spot near Belsué
description: Grassy flat spot just near Belsué. Place for 2-3 tents. It can be accesed by foot or bike.

name: Rock climbing heaven
description: Big recreational area with lots of good places to camp. No signs prohibiting anything. At 500m high so not cold. Good reception. No amenities. Very clean. During the days families and groups of rock climbers visit. Entry  is very rocky for 20 m preventing normal cars to drive up.

name: Track off the N630 under the A66
description: Two options here. Firstly if it’s raining the road under the A66 is wide and flat and can accommodate any length vehicle although you might have to back out it in. Secondly, the lane has a flat gravel/sand area at the bottom for 2/3 vehicles. No facilities and motorway next to you so maybe noisy in summer, but it’s December and no traffic

name: Ugan Beach
description: Sheltered little rocky beach. The road leading to it has some nice camping spots sheltered from the wind by trees! Easy offroad acces. Lots of different spots to camp.

name: Port Lligat
description:
Village car park wich can accommodate up to 20 campers. Near the water, very quiet.
I assume that restriction for RV may apply during summer.

name: Tosal de can bota
description: Wide spot in the middle of the pine trees.

name: bassa de l'om
description: spot for one vehicle only on the edge of a small hill

name: Morrolius
description: Single spot in a wide turn on remote dirt track

name: Water tank basement
description: round flat surface formerly used for water tank. perfect spot for one camper

name: Els Fontanals
description: Single spot near a water tank, close to the track

name: near the laguna
description: small car park for people who want to walk around. Room for 2 campers maximum, not flat but really quiet

name: Espuña
description: single spot on a dead end track, stuning view and very quiet

name: Recinto Ferial Arjonilla
description:
Informed by the village council that this area is planned to be developed further to provide facilities for motorhomes.
At present the council are happy for visitors to stay but there are no facilities open.
They have already installed electrical points, water outlets and toilet and shower facilities but as yet they are not accessable.
The village has a number of olive factories, one which provides tours. A museum, castle ruins and an air raid shelter.
There is a fresh fruit and vegetable store and also a small supermarket. There are cafés and bars also. 
In the centre of the village is a beautiful church.

name: Isla Cristina
description: very nice camp with equipment.  Trees, shade, small shop.  Off-season.  ena 18 eur incluide electricity water ... Good dealings

name: quit valley on Gomera
description:
Offroad into a quiet valley with abandoned houses. From this place, next to an old house, there are many walking paths. Not recommended to drive further, or up the mountain, gets very rough. Amazing views, easy to see mountain Teide on Tenerife.
Flat space to park, 4G cell coverage, bee hives nearby (no hassle).

name: Wohnmobil Stellplatz  am Ebro
description: Municipal Campground  directly at the river Ebro. Free

name: Camp & shop
description: Camping space right down the road from Lidl and Mercadona. Just drive down the hill from Lidl, go between the big containers, there's perfect asfalt with a nice view. Reasonably private and road noise is acceptable. Perfect for catching the ferry next day.

name: View on Santa Cruz de La Palma
description: Forest road 150 m from the main road with a flat spot for one vehicle. Another spot 50m down the road. Nice view at 1500m on Santa Cruz. Reasonable 4G. Not too difficult offroad, probably doable with a small van.

name: Sa Canterella Restaurant
description: Nice small campground with toiletts and swimmingpool running by a restaurant. Place for 8 motorhomes not longer than 7 meter. Free, but it seems that it is expected that you have lunch or dinner there.

name: Wild camp in a small Pine forest
description:
Just 200m away from the main of road (Camino de Santiago). 
Clean. Quite. No water but the last village it is just 2,5 km away from here.

name: Near road
description: Around 1 km from the main road. Quiet and clean. Well protected by some trees.

name: Offroad -Tenerife
description:
This location point is the entry road to a 1 square km area perfect for offroading and camping. I spent 10 nights there in 6 different locations, from pebble beach to green valleys to hill tops. Absolutely 4x4 as the roads are rough. There is an alternative entry to the area from the village of La Mareta, with some easy camping near the beach that is accessible for any car.
From the location point drive through the tunnel under the motorway and left up, then use Google satellite image to see all the off road tracks. Don't drive here after dark.
Leave the place better than you found it and enjoy the best wild camping spot on Tenerife.

name: La vega
description: Very remote spot at the end of a track. Quiet night warranted. Steep descent on the last 100 meters, 4WD with short gears mandatory.

name: Refugio Cárdena
description: Really Tough coming up from Ribadelago Nuevo. Be well prepared physically and mentally. 4.6 km in 5:30 hours. My bike was 40 kg.

name: Pine land
description: Quite and wood to build a fire (if is not too windy).

name: Zona de Autocaravanas y Campers
description:
Good views of the marsh. Fill water tanks and empty gray and black water. Electricity. In the town, there are all services 
Buenas vistas al pantano. LLenar tanques de agua y vaciar aguas grises y negras. Electricidad. En el pueblo, hay de todos los servicios

name: Fajana
description: Very nice place directly at the coast. Waves, Lighthouse, two restaurants nearby. Room for 20 Campers, mostly empty. Good mobile connection.

name: Fontanilla
description: Big area with lots of wildcamping options. Acces road in bad condition but drivable with any vehicle. With 4x4 you can drive right up to the cliff edge for amazing views, but 2x4 have many options between the trees. Acces to the beach and a beach bar via some steep pathways. No trash bins so lots of trash laying around. Please take some with you when you drive out and let's leave this place better than we found it, otherwise we are going to loose acces to these kind of places in the future. Can get busy in the weekends.

name: El Fondo
description: Large parking lot at the natural park El Fondo. Overnight stays are allowed. Very quiet at night, pretty dark. The park is great for bird watchers. Nice walks or bicycle rides. No shade. Flat gravel. The visitors center is 200 meters away and you will find toilets that are open 24/7 and a water tap.

name: Elburgo
description: Nice big camper parking in front of the lake. Very calm.

name: Playa las Lances
description: Long parking stretch right next to the beach. Camping Vans are allowed to spend the night during Winter Low Season month. After Easter the Police is chasing overnighters away. Winterseason only. They seem to install height restricting bars currently to restrict RV access. Check before entering.

name: Near Gulfar
description: Quiet and clean. Some private houses not far from here.

name: Carcastillo
description: Campsite in the country nex to Aragon river.

name: Near bridge
description: large parking spot next to broken old bridge. very quiet.

name: Caravanas Papiol
description: Our parking for caravans, campers and motorhome is 15 minutes driving to the downtown of Barcelona.

name: Pajarero wild camp
description: Flat place in wild nature. Nice for cyclists, vans and motorbikes. Possible to find water (not safe for drinking, 100 metres east from the flat place).

name: Area recreativa Los Paules
description: Recreational area with parking lot, stone tables and a fresh water tap

name: Bolonia Beach Parking
description: Large public parking area that belongs to the archeological site next to the beach.

name: Gorafe 4x4 river camp
description: Deep into the Gorafe park. Big flat camp next to a little river. Road goes on if you cross the river but 4x4 is necessary. River crossing to the east is also possible, but a few km further is blocked by a gate. No cell phone reception. Use satellite images to get here. Amazing acces road from Gorafe village, highly recommended. 5 stars!

name: Gabo de Gata beach parking
description: Large public parking lot next to the beach. Some restaurants and bars close by. Has garbage disposal. Can be busy during weekends or high season.

name: Albergue de Calarreona
description: Cheap and nice hostel next to the sea. Private rooms with shower, toilet and air conditioning. Common room with microwave and fridge. Parking. Price: 12'40 € pppn. Phone to reserve in summer and spanish holidays.

name: Sound of the bees🐝
description: Very quiet place, surrounded by fields & mountains. Very private with only the sound of bees from the hives 100m further. Good cell service 4G. Nice for walking. More camp spots nearby. No entry with vehicles in the Sierra del Carche. 700 meters high, acces via good dirt road (but can get slippery after rain).

name: Stunning lake views
description: Amazing place with several camp options. Cliff jumping, swimming, fishing easy access to the water. Last camp spots require 4x4, but acces road is easy (though a high tunnel). Very limited phone service. Keep this place clean please!

name: La Muntanya gamping
description: GAMPING LA MUNTANYA, is a valley of fruit trees and abundant vegetation, with a stone wall worked by hand and of great size and value. Waking up in the middle of nature, calm, the sound of animals, .... They make this environment a place of disconnection, and exceptional wild camping

name: Cascading river *offroad*
description: A short but rather technical dirt road gets you down to a cool site next to a little cascading river. Big flat grassy area with minimum road noise and just enough 4G. Nice walks left and right. 4x4 or enduro bike only.

name: Lourdes, Santuario
description:
Very well level parking, asphalt floor, very close village, free, WC next to the convent. Base for hiking in the middle of nature.
.....
Parquing muy bien nivelado, suelo de asfalto, pueblo muy cerca, gratuito, WC al lado del convento. Base para caminatas en plena naturaleza.

name: Wild Watertank Camp
description: Fireroad campsite next to a watertank on top of the hill. No nothing exept a stunning nature and a watertank. Road was a bit dodgy, but made it with a 7m long and 3m high van.

name: El Bruc
description:
Truck stop with free shower. Go to the cafeteria (not the gas station) and ask for the key for the showers (they speak English). They will want your keys from your 'truck' in exchange.
Clean, big warm shower.

name: Beautiful rural spot halfway between Conil and Cabo de Trafalgar
description: Very quiet rural spot, a 7 minutes walk to a gorgeous beach, nudist if you’re into that. Birds, dark starry nights, a farm with thoroughbred horses. Clean. To find: at the end of the road, where it reads “salida”, turn left. One spot only on the right side of the road next to the large stones. Nice meadow behind. Plenty of firewood on the beach

name: Mountainview picnic
description:
Very charming picnic place with stunning views. Big level parking space 100m before the actual picnic area with benches, bbq's, water (toilet was closed in May)and adventure park with tree-walks. Surrounding area has little waterfalls and amazing walking routes.
At 1640m so might get cold at night and probably busy in summer /weekends. Cellphone service 4G.

name: Puerto Blanco
description: Right next to Puerto Blanco beach.This is an abandoned( out of service ) little Harbor where you can sleep. The police use to make a round to check everything is in order.They saw our rooftop tents opened and didn't said anything.

name: Fang Aventura
description: Large farm and activities centre (paintball, quads, etc) with many different spaces for camping.  Free, you can leave something for the property if you wish.

name: Castell de Mur
description: Very nice view, close to the main road, beginning of the road is stiff and Rocky. OK with a short van and good Tyre.

name: Water point
description:
Water spring next to the track.
Easy to stop without blocking the way.

name: Near Beach
description: Nice spot under the trees, just behind the beach. Now and then a jogger or someone with a dog comes by. Light traffic noise, sound of the surf, birds. No one around, may be different in weekends. Great beach!

name: Motorhome campsite
description: equipped with water and dump station for free. you can have electricity, but you have to pay for it

name: Dinosaurs footprints
description:
Lots of nice places on this road and in the area, with dinosaurs footprints and explication boards.
Steep roads!

name: Roadside
description:
vey nice dry camping spot. overlooking the valley.
very quiet. far from everything. nice sunsets.
really worth it!

name: Lake border
description: no noise, beautiful setting, large area for many rigs

name: Spring water
description:
spring water running permanently from a water tap on a large parking place.
Sign says: 'water untreated' but locals come here to fill their bottles

name: Parking Lot
description:
asphalted public parking lot, with grass spots for those who prefer.
surrounded by snowy top mountains and waterfalls. lots of trekking possibilities. water accessible at the river nearby. peaceful night
great place!
Tents are not allowed and dogs must be maintained with a leash.

name: nice spots by the river
description:
many spots for any size of rig, on a dirt road just by the river.
beware the flow of the river can change drastically in short laps of time, it can be dangerous.
mild cell phone connection

name: nice waterfall
description:
inicio senda cascada is a good looking waterfall in a rocky Valley. 
just park here the walk up the river to find it
just 10 or 15 minutes walk

name: beautiful lake view
description:
nice free spot above the lake, surrounded by the mountains. great view.
large place on the side of a tiny road, so very few traffic. 
Space for many vehicles, but not everything is leveled.

name: Caseres
description: There is a zone of BBQ next to the zone of camping. You have the Algars River next to the site.

name: Casas del Buen Mozo - free night stop
description:
Free overnight stops up to 2-3 days allowed on private property, 100% off grid. Inside the Muela de Cortes nature reserve, in the mostly abandoned Cañada de Abajo valley/area.
Some basic amenities (outdoor shower/compost toilet/ phone charging) can be provided but please be prepared for self sufficient stays. 
This is a starting ecosystem restoration/organic farm project. Open to anyone who loves nature and cares to share experiences or travel stories. Great Basecamp for hikers or mountain bikers or for spotting wildlife.
Longer stays are possible in exchange for a lending hand.

Contact info: +34.605.612.644 WhatsApp or Telegram, site is out of mobile phone range, so swift replies cannot be guaranteed.

name: Cuevas Andalucia
description:
You are looking for an original rental, you have a desire for escape, freedom, travel, dreaming and encounters?
An original outing with family or with friends in a romantic setting?
On a property of 8 hectares with a swimming pool heated in winter, come and relax while listening to the silence.
Set in rural country terrain renowned for it's cave dwellings, these cave houses have been beautifully restored to an exceptional standard and include all of the 21st century conveniences expected by today's high living standards. 
Our Spanish cave house properties are ready-to let, ready-to-live-in yet uniquely different whether they have 1,2 or 3-bedrooms.
So if rural Spain is where you want to holiday or live, our cave houses are a must see. 
Just a five minute stroll from a typical Andalucian village (Baza) with its local amenities and 60 minutes from the grandiose city of Granada and airport, this truly is Real Life Spain!
“Aurôre and Sam” will be pleased to welcome you in the historic south of Spain, in the heart of Eastern Andalusia in an area still free from intensive tourism and close to Granada. 
Our lodgings are equipped with solar panels for domestic hot water as well as for warm water for the swimming pool in winter and this in order to guarantee a comfortable low cost energy for our customers during their stay. 

By our activity, we also want to show that it is possible to have alternative ways to live with respect for the environment by quite simply using alternative energies and the comfort of a cueva (troglodyte house) with next to no ecological footprints
Try the troglodyte dwellings of Baza close to the road Ibn Al-Jatib, the natur al reserves of the Sierra of Baza, Pozo and of Cazorla, the Alhambra, the Sierra Nevada, the Negratín dam, the museum of Orce, the preserved beach of Gabo de Gata. 

While being close to nature and quietness, you enjoy the comfort of an ecological cueva enhanced by solar panels for hot water and a natural air-conditioning all year round (18 to 22°C).
At our place tourism is different... 
A mixture of disparate and authentic things which make life worth living!
Welcomed in this unusual land, you will benefit from a most refined stay, the vastness of the sky and the softness of the Andalusian nights.
It is also possible to install your tent, your caravan or motorhome on the vast property in order to limit your lodging expenses.
For the amateurs of coasting flight, parapente, delta, we are at 10 minutes away from Jabalcon, a must for carrying out splendid flights!
It is also possible to practise climbing, mountain-biking, swimming, water sports, canyoning and walking.

name: Top of a Hill
description: It's not really able to place a tent, but neither impossdible. Better with a Camper. It's a stoney path you can get from the CV 133. It's nearly noiceless and peacefully, with a great sigth other the mountains. Check it Out

name: Santander RV park
description: Santander motorhome Area. Free parking for RV with fresh water and dump station. Nice place behind a park and the university

name: Camping Naturista Almanat
description: FKK NATURIST campsite, with all services, toilets, hot showers, electricity, bungalows, outdoor pool, heated pool, sauna, barbecue area, children's park, miniature golf, bar, restaurant. Water and electricity in all pitches. Lots of shade, very calm and quiet environment, it has direct access to the naturist beach of Almayate. An ideal place for the whole family IF YOU LIKE TO BE NAKED in contact with nature. I´m not sure if it's "Big Rig" friendly but I have seen some really big pitches at the campsite, although it's best to ask first by phone.

name: Perdikas
description: Spring with drinking water. Enough space to stop by the road.

name: Peñas de Aya
description: À litre mountain in the middle of a Valley

name: Samieira
description:
2 euros per night, lovely place with sea views and shade, views of the estuary of Pontevedra, very cozy.
.....
2 euros noche , lugar encantador con vistas al mar y sombra , vistas a la ría de pontevedra , muy acogedor.

name: Roses
description: Free parking.  You can sleep, but without taking out chairs and a table.

name: Gorliz Camping
description: Big and nice camp-site, offering also restaurant and small shop. We have paid 30 EUR for car with roof top tent and 2+2 people.

name: Loredo Camping
description: Not too bad site but not the cheapest. Close to the beach.

name: At the river
description: Nice spot next to the river. Also some tables and seats. Will fit few cars, campers.

name: Costa Verde Camp
description: Nice camping and well maintained. 50m to the beach. Good for the long and short rest.

name: Beach Spot
description: Another beautiful beach. Very quiet and great view. It has shower. The spot is big enough for camper vans and smaller cars.

name: Sant Gregori
description:
I live in a house with my family surrounded by a large forest. It is a nice, quiet and beautiful place. 

We have a dog and two horses, your animals are welcome.

It is close to the center of the city of Girona by car (10 'approx) and near the town of Sant Gregori (3' by car, and less than 1 hour walking through nature).

The area is easily accessible. It is flat and it is shaded because it is under the trees. Next to it is an open, treeless, and sunny area, which can also be used.

There is a bathroom to use, with a shower as well.
We have free and open wifi for guests.
In case you need electricity, we provide an extension cord. We also provide water.

Here you can go hiking or cycling, surrounded by forest and nature.

A motorhome fits comfortably, not larger vehicles.

*The price per night is 12€ for one person, 17€ for two people, 20€ three or more*

MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified.

name: Riverside camp (4WD only)
description: A few kilometers from the E80 highway south of Burgos, close to a village called Pampliega, there is the Rio Arlanzón. This particular spot is along this river river in a forest. I reckon there are more spots like this around in this area. Really nobody there, just the wind in the trees and a buzzard lady flying over and whatching... To get to the spot you need to take some farmer's tracks through the fields, they are rather 4WD only.

name: Castrelo de Miño
description: Big reats area next to the lake. Not many people staying for a night when we have been here. Tab water avaible, grils, tables and seats as well. Easy access to the lake.

name: Perfect rest.
description: Great reast area with free swimming pool and lovely restaurant. We staid here for a night as there is some place to park. We are traveling with roof top tent.

name: Camping Villa de Iruelas
description:
Located in the heart of the Nature Reserve, a place where we can rest and walk. From the campsite there are different botanical paths or to the viewpoint of vultures. In a spectacular environment of a high ecological value, you can find the facilities of our Campsite. Located on the north face of Gredos and at the foot of the Burguillo reservoir you can experience multiple activities such as hiking, canoeing, horses, nautical and many more. Nice and secluded spot. Showers and toilets are clean and acceptable. The swimming pool may get crowded over the weekend but overall it´s more than OK.
.....
Situado en el corazón de la Reserva Natural, lugar privilegiado donde podemos descansar y pasear. Desde el camping existen diferentes sendas botánicas o al mirador de los buitres. En un entorno espectacular de un alto valor ecológico podrá encontrar las instalaciones de nuestro Camping. Situado en la cara norte de Gredos y a los pies del embalse del Burguillo podrás experimentar múltiples actividades tales como senderismo, piragüismo, caballos, náutica y muchas más.

name: Free designated campsite Las Acebeas
description: Designated campsite installed by the national park authorities. There are benches, toilets and water but all seems to be locked up out of season. There is a little stream running trough the grounds. On the middle of a beautiful forest. A few hikikg trails start here. Free.

name: Free campsite Bayarcal
description: A campsite that isn’t a campsite… a municipial area “for everybody”, mostly aimed at children camps. There is also a pretty spectacular tyrolien across the valley. Free to camp, good foor rtt and regular tents too. Great views and very calm at night. During the day children camp activities. No real campsite facilities, but there are clean toilets and a restaurant/bar. Probably only open during season? They lock the place at night, so you are locked up :-)

name: Llano escondido
description:
Small esplanade next to the road. It is hidden by some trees. There is a small descent that can be difficult for a van, better in 4x4 although it could.

Pequeña esplanada al lado del camino. Queda escondido por unos arboles. Hay una pequeña bajada que puede ser complicado para una furgoneta, mejor en 4x4 aunque se podria.

name: El Torcón
description: Nice picnic and camping area with drinking water. No toilets. It seems that to camp permission should be asked in the next village (Hortigüela), but just for one night it looks like nobody is going to care. Camped here in july 2021. Quite a few people camping, tents and cars but quiet atmosphere.

name: Camping Refugio de Pescadores
description: Nice, shady and grassy municipal campsite among pine trees. Clean and well mantained facilities. No restaurant and just a few basic groceries sold at reception. The town, Covaleda, is nearby. Arrived by bicycle and paid 7,80 (1 person, 1 tent).

name: Tavernas desert spot
description:
You enter like you are going to mini-Hollywood and there is a small road actually going to the desert. 5 min and you will know where to stop. 
You have a magnificent view over the desert and sunset is one of the most incredible I’ve seen. 
Warm even at night during summer, gets cold after sun down. 
You can camp easily and no one will bother.

name: barrage ruesta
description:
Really a so nice spot, nice view on the lake and the mountain, beautiful view and beautiful spot
Large place under the tree, not far from water.
You can swim, the water is clear and hot.
Higly recommended
Only for van and 4x4

name: Montederramo
description:
So nice place, next to the river, with barbecue, with child's air game, with trash, at 1,5 km from center of the village.
Place for many vehicles under shadows, and access for all vehicles. 
Really quite on week, but in the week-end local people enjoy this place too.

name: Fuente Baterna. Zarzosa
description:
NOTE: No vehicular access!

This nice place with picnic tables and a fountain is perfect for one night camping. Next to the road and partialy visible from it, but no evident. The place is enclosed to avoid animals getting it, and it is accessible only on foot or by bicycle. Camped here and saw nobody. The area is remote and the village, Zarzosa, is the last one on the road. Probably, you will only come here if you are walking or cycling between Zarzosa and Vadillos (beautiful and steep). Just a little further up, there is a forest church with another picnic area and gravel road access.

name: La Rosina Ecovillage
description: La Rosina Ecovillage is an ecovillage project and headquarters of 2 associations. We lodge people , serve vegan meals, hosts volunteers and organize events.

name: public cold shower
description: As described a public cold shower. Nada mas

name: Countryside
description:
Large area in the countryside with great views, offering peace and tranquility and a safe and legal place to park up for the night or longer. Friendly owners on site to help with any advice on the many activities in the local area. Popular tourist area for its beautiful countryside, rivers, lakes, waterfalls, wild swimming, many watersports on the local reservoir, hiking and cycling routes, many outdoor sports and activities also close by.
We provide free WIFI in certain areas and water and flat land for you to make yourself at home. Suitable for self sufficient campers and motorhomes. Very pet friendly - pet babysitting services offered also!

name: Riverside gravel road dead end
description:
there is a small paved road that splits off from the main road. From this paved road there are multiple gravel roads that go towards the river. could be difficult with large camper. 
the spot we stayed had clear signs that people had stayed there before. we stayed in a tent. A van also pulled up in the same area.
calm and beautiful spot.
keep it clean

name: Wild Camping beside Lake(Embalse) De Mediano
description:
Many nice and flat places near the lake.
Some places with shadow.
Beautiful views from mountain and lake.

name: Camping at Río Sinca
description:
Little hidden spot 20meters from the river.
Fits 2 or 3 small cars.
Flat but with weed and dust.
Near the road bu quiet at night.
Wonderful view from the mountains and perfect to swim and enjoy the clear water.

name: Punta de La Pixerota
description:
Just 100 meters before the beach.
At the right side of the street is a nice and flat place in the middle of the olive trees.
Good for campers, vans and rooftent like us. Quiet and clean.
There is a restaurant at the beach and a shower also.

name: Parking lot Usurbil
description: Quiet parking lot with no facilities. We stayed one night and it was okay.

name: Former Campamento La Salle
description: Perfect wild campsite if you are cycling or walking the old "Vasco-Navarro" railroad greenway. Flat, clean and grassy explanade. There is a shelter too. You can access easily the river for water (or a bath).

name: Finestras
description: Nice place for wild camping near astonishing Finestras. very quiet. no utilities. rough road to access to Finestras. the site is 50m of the road. 4x4 only

name: Enguidanos
description: Nice platform near the forest road. Perfect for a night stop on this rough road. 4x4 only.

name: Between Burriana and Nules
description:
A nice coast and shore. We camped with our rooftent just on the Rocky beach. There are some other spots around.
Locals come to have a bath in the little and nice closed beach.
No shade.
Please leave the place clean. Don't litter like we saw some locals do.
Let's take care of our planet.

name: Just on the Playa del Xarco
description:
You have to take a dust road from El Carabassot. 5km west after the hills. The road is not so good, but even in high season only a few people on the beach.
We parked our car with rooftent just at the mast of a flag.

name: Free Camping at Playa de La Chapineta
description:
Very big place where campers can overnigh for free.
50 meters from the beach. Many parking spots for big or small rigs.
There is a supermarket Spar and some restaurants. On the beach some facilities. Blue Flag beach.

name: Cepsa o Corgo
description: Gas station with parking for motorhomes (on both sides of the Road). With black water discharging, shower, restaurante.

name: Cubla
description: Nice plateform with an amazing view at the end of a rough road. 4x4 only

name: Wild Camping at Playa Villaricos
description:
Some nice and hidden spots just on the beach.
There is a big parking lot where you can camp also. But we wanted some privacy so 50 meters in front some nice natural pools from the ocean.

name: Playa El Egido - Almerimar
description:
Couple kilometers from the center, a big place to camp and park overnight.
Showers but no shade.
Quiet at night

name: Big flat place near a huge Eucaliptus Tree
description:
Big place around this beautiful tree at Costa del Sol.
100 meters from the beach where are some amenities like restaurants and shower.

name: Parking and Sleeping at Playa de La Chullera
description:
It's a big parking lot near the beach.
During the day several cars and people going to the beach.
At night we opened our rooftent and slept very well.
Couple of RVs used this place also to pass the night.

name: Calleja motos
description: Good place for spare parts, also a little workshop and another shop selling clothing and accessories, all the same business, but spread over three shops

name: By the dam
description: Enter where the recreational area is and turn right once you get down to the water, couple of nice spots along the edge, out of sight. Little bit of road noise. Weak 3G signal

name: Coruña del Conde
description:
Nice spot by the river to overnight, next to a fountain, with some tree shadows and a picnic zone. There is also a built bbq where you can make fire to cook if not in summer (to avoid risk of forest fire). 
This place is located near a house, so you must be very very respectful and quiet.
The entrance to this spot is done by a slope not recommended for low profile vehicles. Much better if you are on a 4x4 with lifted suspension.

name: Pinar de La Barrosa
description:
It's a public parking place within the woods.
We talked to the Police just in front of the car park and they said it's OK to sleep 1 night here.

There are public restrooms.

name: Isabena Campsite
description: Super relaxed campsite, mainly occupied with off-road enthusiasts; both on motorbike and 4x4. They also have a nice restaurant and swimming pool. Next to this it is also a BMW Motorrad test drive center, so you can try several bikes for a reasonable price. But the best thing is, they also own Enduro Park Isabena where you can do off-road motorcycle trainings. They can also organize multiple day guided off-road tours in the Pyrenees. In short, a very relaxed place!

name: AFTER OPASSA
description: 3x Paces , Marvelious panorama. Also 7.m. Camper high on the Pyrenees

name: Collada de can nou
description: Flat spot where to camp next to the trail. you can fit up to 6 or 8 cars. The access from Sadernes is very narrow and requires a 4x4.

name: Wander Parkplatz
description: a small place near the road but not much traffic and quiet at night.

name: In the woods with view in teide
description: At the end of a dirt road. Only smart rigs fit. Use maps me to navigate. I came here by entering from TF373 but I’m sure there are multiple entries. No people and nice view on teide. Shed off from wind

name: lac La Viñuela,  Espagne
description: smart place close the lac. for small vehicle. Attention in case of rain.

name: Ermita de San Antonio
description:
On the dirt road leading to the "Albergue de Montfalcó" from the town of Viacamp is this picnic area with wooden tables and stools. Surrounded by cork oaks and some olive trees. In addition to the Hermitage there is an abandoned and ruined farmhouse, which is where you can park well, the area is flat, about 20x30 meters. There are no signs that prohibit overnight stays. There is a cell tower nearby, with Vodafone 4G and 4G / LTE coverage at full throttle.
I'm not sure if Big Rigs will go to the flat area because there is a curve past the Hermitage with trees somewhat narrow. I usually enter with a 6.40 meter motorhome and scratch a branch but nothing serious.

name: Campersite Santa Pau
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Image translations  "it is forbidden to unfold the awning. forbidden to take tables outside. To camp You must go to the campsites of the municipality that are in this central zone of the natural park."

Big field for campers, reasonable level. No amenities but walking distance to the ancient town center. ‘Camping’ not allowed, meaning no awnings or full setup. 
Food truck nearby as well as multiple restaurants in the town.

name: Sant Alís/Montsec
description:
Old paragliding take-off area. The dirt road is uncomplicated but there are sections of loose stones. It is not a very flat area but the vehicle can be leveled well.
