The views are spectacular, both day and night.
4G mobile coverage (Vodafone)

name: Saldropo humedal
description: PickNick area with Playground for kids and water

name: Oversized vehicle parking
description:
Parking is expensive but will accept vehicles up to 2.9m high. 
They also have 2 spots for event taller rigs. 
Next to a metro station to get you downtown very easily

name: Eneperi
description: Parking with great views and bathrooms. Easy to find, very quiet. There is a sign forbidden caravans and buses but nobody comes…

name: Yellow Van panoramic Place
description: Great place with great panoramic views. Flat meadow place for some cars and tents. A old yellow van is here as a landmarker therefore the name. The gravel road is very bumpy and high clearence makes everything easier.

name: Spring Water
description: So fresh, so cool and with good pressure, filled our 60l tank within minutes

name: Castro de las Cogotas
description: Near the archeological site of Castro de las Cogotas: flat spot by the reservoir, sandy beach and rocks. A few fishermen by day, quiet at night. Bring your own firewood. Good 4G signal

name: Mountain Views
description:
A spot by the road, for people to take a photo of a picturesque view. There is one more spot like this, about 1 km closer to France, but forgot to geotag it.

No doubt, there are more spots but I liked these two.

name: CamperStop Alegría
description:
A campground at the country side of Extremadura. This campground is especially for motorhomes and vans. 20 available spots. Parking in shade possible. 
Electricity, showers and toilets (they are finishing them right now, because they just opened). 
Village (Montánchez) with restaurants and a supermarket in walking distance

name: Close to Hoces del Rio Duratón
description: Flat ground between pine trees, next to farmland. Close to the national park, where camping is not permitted; here it is ok. No facilities. Good 4G signal. Good acces to hikes along the cliffs; not sure if you can hike to the river

name: Cobos de Fuentidueña
description: Watertap on town square. Not easy to write at least forty caracters about a tap

name: Camping Artaza-Urederra
description: Nice and calm camping away from the roads with excellent views on the mountains. Close to the Urederra natural park.

name: L'Hospoitale de l'Infant
description: Free WiFi, also a restaurant/ toilets/ petrol station.

name: Free Camping at Extremadura
description:
A big parking lot for Motorhomes and all kinds of vehicles.
It was a restaurant here, buts closed.
Just 5 or 6 km from the border with Portugal.
Nice mountains to climb just 500 M from here.
Also a dumping station, but not working.
Many picnic tables and benches. Shade and flat place.
No water or toilet available.

name: Beside Tejo River Near Salto del Girano
description:
A nice and quiet place. You take a short dirty road for 400m from the main road.
Many picnic tables and benches.
Nice view.
At night we were visited by herd of dears. Wonderful!
Keep this nice place clean. Don't feed the animals. There is a fountain with potable water. Fuente del Francés

name: Mirador La Galiana
description:
Nice place to sleep.
Parking lot and a good place just beside.
You can view the "buitres" - cóndor, from here.
Please keep the place clean.
Use the trash can.

name: Ermita Valdehierro
description:
Free camping area in the Sierra de Madridejos, a very quiet place in the middle of nature.  BBQ area and many trails, nearby there is a natural spring
===
Zona de acampada libre en la sierra de Madridejos, sitio muy tranquilo en medio de la naturaleza. Zona de barbacoas y muchos senderos, cerca hay un manantial natural

name: Negratín viewpoint parking
description: After the parking of a viewpoint of the Negratín, you can take an exit to a random village (The signal says it is 4km far). After 1km you can see the spot on your left, just behind/under the main road.

name: Parking Safont
description:
parking in the city of Toledo, 2km from the old town.  Very quiet place.
.....
Aparcamiento en la ciudad de Toledo, a 2km del casco viejo. Sitio muy tranquilo.

name: Parkingplace in Cerler
description: A very large parking place- for RV / Motorhomes - at night very quiet

name: Queralbs car park
description:
Free mobile home parking space at Queralbs.
No supply or disposal.

name: Alora spain
description: Great parking lot with dump and fresh water

name: Área Recreativa
description:
Camped here,very quiet,water portable,plenty of space.
2 km from Cofrentes which has a grocery store.
4G!

name: Los Villares Domus Beticae Cordoba 14029
description: Pitches for camper vans and tents. Toilet clean and in good order. Electric at the pitches, small shop with bar and restaurant only open weekends out of season. 1 x tent motorcycle and person is €18 per night. All pitches are in the shade as it’s situated in a wooded area. Outdoor swimming pool. Staff very friendly and helpful.

name: Los Arenales
description: Large camping ground, with bar and restaurant. Water and electricity points on most of the pitches. Open all year round. Clean washing facilities. Hot water. Pitches are in the shade of trees. Only a kilometer from town.

name: Overlook Punta Gaubieta
description: Large overlook pull off that has a beautiful view at sunset! There were several campers here when I found it. No services but the cell reception seems good.

name: Commune Beneficio
description:
Come and see for yourself!
Even though the parking might appear full of odd dropouts with all sorts of drugs around it is super safe and quiet at night! The parking acts like a barrier to protect the commune that sits in the hills and the forest above.

name: La Pobla de Lillet
description: Place to spend the night.  Road with almost no traffic.  The river has a backwater to cool off.

name: Embarcador Ginestar
description:
Place with 4 parking spaces where it is possible to sleep one night, always discreet. 
 It is next to the jetty of the river Ebro.

name: Ermita El Calvari
description: Here is a fountain with drinking water. In the surroundings, there are some more.

name: Puerta del Campo, Granja-Escuela
description: Large, flat place in a beautiful, rural and quiet environment. Price € 10 for 24 hours per vehicle. Shower € 2 px.

name: Camping Punta del Hidalgo
description:
Vehicle reception hours: (09:00 to 14.00) & (16:00 to 18:30)
you need to book in advance

name: Parking club Náutico Sevilla
description: This is a large parking area that appears to be free and there are lots of other campers here. No facilities, but well lit and safe. Very near all the sights!

name: Old playground
description: A great spot for a night, well above the motorway but still audible but ok. Great views and flat. Good 4G signal. Apparently there is a fresh spring near. Good view of the mountains.

name: Very old section of road
description: This is a beautiful spot to camp. It's an old section of road with a picnic place with bins and tables. You can hear the highway on the background but it's not an issue. There is a really old bridge too.

name: Spring on hillside
description: An amazing fast flowing spring. Many locals go there to fill their drinking water. Water is safe.

name: via verde Terra Alta
description: Nice little spot next to the Via Verde. We spend a night on our bicycle tour

name: Mirador camping spot
description: A pretty amazing little spot. We were there in winter and it was very very quiet. Amazing views. No services but good 4g signal.

name: Fuente de San Lorenzo
description: Many locals stopped whilst I was here to drink and fill bottles. They all said it was the best water around.  So I filled up too.

name: Source of the Rio Tajo
description: This is a wonderful place, quiet with large flat parking area. We were there in Autumn and there were no other people. Might be different in Summer. There are Fuentes for water. No mobile signal.

name: Great spot next to very quiet road
description: A beautiful spot ok for a night next to some walking routes and a quiet road. No services but good mobile signal and lovely view.

name: My car has been broken into here
description: Be careful here! We stayed at this parking for three nights. All good; then the window was smashed. Everything pulled out in the rain and drenched. I can't recommend the place after this incident. But vandalism and broken cars are a huge problem all over the city. Very sad  be safe put there

name: old chapel
description: spooky in a clear full moon night but hopefully worth the goosebumps

name: Sant Martí de Montenegre
description: A parking spot with a nice view for sunset and sunrise. Nearby is a restaurant, but was closed when I was there. It's a good starting point if you want to do some offroading in the mountains. The access road to the spot is gravel road and I saw a bunch of normal 2WD cars, but the road is washed out at some points.

name: Náquera
description:
Place is called la cantina.
Verry good food and nice people who talk a bit of english too

name: Casa Ange
description: Room in a Hostel/Airbnb. 35-25$ per night (you can negociate the price). Quiet place and confortable. Real is the owner and the food is cheap and very good!

name: Water tap in petrol station
description: Petrol station where you can fill your water tank. It takes loooong time because low presure in pipes.

name: Drinking water tap
description: Just a normal water tap. Drinking quality!

name: Ambolo cliffs
description:
Ambolo cliffs mirador just outside the door, great climbing area with board for difficulty grades. 

Just at the end of the road there is enough space to turn around even with a 6m motorhome. People come and go during the day, but nobody cares about us camping here as this is a super rich villa neighborhood. Supermarket to far.

name: Better altenative for Ondarra/La Arena
description: Better alternative for Ondarra/La Arena. Large gravel parking area, with at the end a path to a smaller area with an absolutely epic view. Don’t know if its legal or not, no signs seen.

name: Camper Service
description: Dumping station for grey water. Fresh (slightly chlorinated) water available, too

name: Camping Parque Tropical
description: Camp site for motor homes a few kilometer from the Center of Estepona

name: Sunny spot at the lake
description:
Nice place at the lake. We got here because the second spot at the lake (which is very nice) had no sun a long time of the day (in winter).
Watch out for the water level changes!

name: San Isidro area
description: Quiet place. 40 kms from Albacete city. Flat place. Tables and public roof for tents. Free water in the public white building.

name: Playa de la Canteria
description: Near the Playa de la Canteria, in Orzola, various spots where you can park and stay the night. Orzola is near and you can find restaurants, bars, a little supermarket.

name: Embalse de Forata
description:
There’s a nice little spot down by the lake. Space for one a two vans. Few other little spots a little further up. 
The road down is pretty bumpy, I could make it without 4x4 but you wanna have some clearance. 
The spot is very quiet and secluded. Unfortunately pretty much garbage around.

name: Lebaña camperspot
description: Camper area with amazing view, in the middle of Picos de Europa. Includes toilet and sink, containers for waste. Very good spot.

name: La Naturaleza
description: This is quite a large, rambling sort of place. A bit dilapidated but that has it's own charm. Our pitch didn't have any facilities but I think there are others with water and electricity. The communal toilet block is very clean. This is a useful base for exploring a pretty isolated area of Spain but don't expect too many creature comforts.

name: Camping os Anjos
description: A very nice smaller camp site run by a Dutch guy.  Everything is very clean and tidy. There are all of the facilities one might expect at a simple camp site.

name: Water tap
description: Good pressure drinking water tap. Close by the highway.

name: Algeciras
description: Auto gas, propane butane. Fill Your vehicle with auto gas.

name: Punta de Canales
description:
To find this place you will have to leave the N340 at km 96 and follow that gravel road about 3km downhill passing through an abandoned military post. (Don't worry no more military there), At the end there is the possibility to park your car. Beach is pebbles, the rocks are good to go snorkeling: 

Cellphone availability only through the Moroccan net. 
No water, no shops.

name: Tentspot bike or hike
description: Next to the road is a little trail some meters down. A flat space with great view on the valley. Perfect for cyclists or hikers. Take a check on the wind, bc it’s very open.

name: Puerto de PuntaGorda
description: 20 min drive down initially Camino del Cementario (which turns into Camino del Puerto) on an asphalt just wider than single track road with switchbacks.  Go past the reservoir (on right hand side) and and follow the asphalt road so the sea is on your right.  Follow signs for “el Puerto” (the port) and down to the end of the road - where there is a natural seawater swimming pool - down a flight of 500 steps at the end!  You go past a whole community of places built into the rock down the steps along the way.  This is NOT a port but it is a special place to enjoy.   You can walk from PuntaGorda but takes about 2 hours downhill.

name: Tent site
description: A great spot for tents that is totally hidden from the road and protected from most winds as well.

name: Dry creek bed
description: Go “upstream” in the dry creek bed from the road. Once around the bend there is a flat area big enough for a tent up against the side of the creek bank. Totally hidden from the road. You may have to move some rocks around a bit to fit your tent.

name: Dry creek bed
description: Go up the dry creek bed a little ways until you are hidden from the road. Not a lot of options but you can make it work for sure.

name: Water spring
description: Potable water near town centre. Good drinking quality!

name: Serpac4x4
description:
A Good Workshop specialized in 4x4 but also helped me with my Honda CR-V. Very helpful and doing a good job!
One of the two brothers even speaks a little English which is a big plus!

name: Dry creek tent site
description: The coordinates are for the entrance, not the actual site. From the coordinates look to the west side of the road. You will see a two track road that more or less goes straight up a small hill (see photo). Follow this two track up the valley for a couple minutes and you will see two boxes that look like they were once used for a scientific animal study. Just a few meters from these boxes is a small dry creek bed perfect for a tent.

name: Jalance
description: Free parking for 48 hrs and water servicing. It’s located at very nice village with its Castell.

name: Ermita Nuestra Señora de la Cabeza
description: Mountain church. Flat place for campervans and trucks. Also possible to pitch a tent (just ask the person living there) water, tables and wc. Weekend is more populated.

name: La duna
description:
Great little place! Greasy croissants, homemade quiche and focaccia and salads, pizzas..
Fresh juices and very friendly owner and staff.. right on the boardwalk in el Medano

name: Cool cave nr Faro
description:
Near Faro, settlement in an old lava tube. Steps lead down to a cool little cave that you can walk for a few minutes down. Take a torch or have your phone handy. Not in any guide books that we’ve seen.
Enjoy!

name: Mirador de la Peña
description:
Wonderful viewpoint over the whole El Golfo on a clear day!
a restaurant is here - even open during Covid times! Food looked nice but we only stopped in for a hot drink and a quesadilla. Very welcoming. Small shop as well.

name: Bees Overlander and Motorhome Service
description:
ADMIN NOTE: this entry is by the business owner and has not yet been independently verified by overlanders using the service.

With our fully equipped workshop and years of experience we offer any repairs in- and outside your overlander or motorhome habitat. Replace windows, fix water pumps, change hinges, install solar panels or whatever it will be. As we are building our own Overlander we are also happy to chat with a coffee. We do not repair mechanical parts of your car, but know some very good and cheap workshops. 

You can use our adress as a shipping adress for e.g. Amazon. But we can also provide translation assistance or assistance in hospitals / medical centres. We have been the contact for medical emergencies on cruise ships in the region for several years. We know that in such situations it can be very difficult to cope in a country you don't know like your own. 
As we have lived in Spain for 15 years and speak English and French as well as Spanish, we are prepared for many situations. 
__________________________

Avec notre garage entièrement équipé et nos années d'expérience, nous proposons toutes les réparations à l'intérieur et à l'extérieur de votre habitat overlander ou camping-car. Remplacer les fenêtres, réparer les pompes à eau, changer les charnières, installer des panneaux solaires ou autre. Comme nous construisons notre propre Overlander, nous sommes également heureux de discuter avec un café. Nous ne réparons pas les pièces mécaniques de votre voiture, mais connaissons quelques ateliers très bons et bon marché. 

Vous pouvez utiliser notre adresse comme adresse de livraison pour Amazon, par exemple. Mais nous pouvons également fournir une aide à la traduction ou une assistance dans les hôpitaux / centres médicaux. Depuis plusieurs années, nous sommes le contact pour les urgences médicales sur les bateaux de croisière dans la région. Nous savons que dans de telles situations, il peut être très difficile de se débrouiller dans un pays que vous ne connaissez pas comme le vôtre. 
Comme nous vivons en Espagne depuis 15 ans et que nous parlons l'anglais et le français ainsi que l'espagnol, nous sommes préparés à de nombreuses situations. 
___________________________

Mit unserer voll ausgestatteten Werkstatt und jahrelanger Erfahrung bieten wir alle Reparaturen innerhalb und außerhalb Ihres Overlander- oder Wohnmobil-Lebensraums an. Fenster austauschen, Wasserpumpen reparieren, Scharniere wechseln, Solarpaneele installieren oder was auch immer es sein mag. Da wir unseren eigenen Overlander bauen, sind wir auch gerne bereit, bei einem Kaffee zu plaudern. Wir reparieren keine mechanischen Teile Ihres Autos, kennen aber einige sehr gute und günstige Werkstätten. 

Sie können unsere Adresse als Versandadresse für z.B. Amazon verwenden. Wir können aber auch Übersetzungshilfe oder Hilfe in Krankenhäusern / medizinischen Zentren leisten. Wir sind seit mehreren Jahren Ansprechpartner für medizinische Notfälle auf Kreuzfahrtschiffen in der Region. Wir wissen, dass es in solchen Situationen sehr schwierig sein kann, in einem Land zurechtzukommen, das man nicht so gut kennt wie sein eigenes. 
Da wir seit 15 Jahren in Spanien leben und sowohl Englisch und Französisch als auch Spanisch sprechen, sind wir auf viele Situationen vorbereitet.

name: cliff close to oilrig
description: here are at least three different spots where you can stay. check the pictures and the red line. its close to the oil rig. for the initial entrance check the other spot here on ioverlander. no shades. you can walk to the beach, its a stone beach, no sand. you need a good ground clearance but not neccessary 4wd.

name: natural pools
description: some natural pools. good for a swim. a lot of people here.

name: Small Laguna
description: nice place with a view. also good for a swim. a lot of people. here is also a parking space where you can stay for a night

name: beach place
description: a lot of space, a lot of other campers. easy accessible. wind protected

name: Ifonche
description: a lot of space with an amazing view. here is also a paragliding start point. can be very windy since you are on top of a hill. easy accessible.

name: Tent spot in pine trees
description: From the pullout walk to the electrical line tower and then look down to your left. There is a flat spot just big enough for a tent. Pretty well hidden from traffic on the road but if anyone happens to use the pullover you will be seen. It’s a really nice spot if you don’t mind not being 100% stealth.

name: Taucho Landingsite
description: this is the place where the paragliders land when they start at Taucho. A lot of space. some cool natural pools which are good for a swim. easy accessible. here are also a lot of places a little bit further away from the coastline. check google maps Satellite images.

name: Calpe parking
description: parking place in the middel of the city - very close to the mountain

name: Next to the Chinyero Natural park
description:
We spent one night at this little "roundabout". Quiet, only some dogs barking at night. Only a few cars passed by or stayed here while the people went into the Nationalpark. 
Please take your rubbish with you and leave the place clean!
Nice view of Teide in the back!

name: Tent site wild camp
description: Because the nearby Morro de Santiago camping zone is closed I found this for an evening. Follow the dirt road until it becomes very poor condition. It will go down very steeply to a sharp corner. At this corner there’s is a flat spot perfect for a tent. The road is in such bad condition that there will definitely be no cars on it.

name: Fajana piscina’s
description:
An official free camperparking on a nice spot with view on the ocean. Close to the lovely swimming pools where there are cold showers, toilets and water.
Also nice flat spots close around (and area closer tot sea or a little bit uphill waking distance) to put a tent for a night of wildcamping, since officially it’s not allowed on this parking. Picknicktables provided.

name: Mula Embalse de la Cierva
description: Maravilloso lugar, on top of hill with a beautiful view, next to the Embalse and in the middle of a rather big climbing region with cracks in the sun and shadow. This spot is a gravel ground where approx 8 caravans fit, there are more shadowed parking options further down the road, plenty of space.

name: Car Break-ins
description: In the places along the gravel road, there are  frequently car break-ins by burglary gangs from campo hermoso.

name: flat hill
description: A big round flat space with a stunning view. the entrance to the durt road is between some houses. It looks like you are driving on private property but just befor the asphalt road ends, a dirt road on your right begins and leads to this place. There is no mobil conncetion here so you are completly offline.

name: Playa de Tapachuga
description: Big flat space in a valley. Here are a lot of campers and long term campers/hippies. No mobile connection. Tap water and toilets available. Stone beach is good for a swim and fishing. There is also a picknick area. Quiet at night. Up the hill in the town is a small supermarket.

name: Playa del Medio
description:
MODERATORS NOTICE:iOverlander cannot verify if wild camping is permitted at this location. It is your responsibility to verify local laws or obtain consent before staying the night. 

not a lot of space and pretty full with vans but a nice place

name: Mar & Luis Ruiz
description:
A more than friendly and very secure place to store your 4x4 just north of Madrid, close (15 min) to Madrid Int Airport.
Mar & Luis are overlanders themselves.

name: Playa de la Caleta
description:
The most beautiful beach on La Gomera (according to the internet). 
We spent one quite night here. Could be very busy in summer. 
Downstairs at the beach there are toilets (okayish) and an old shower. 
There is also a little house, probably a bar in summertime. 
The way up to the parking is a little bumpy, drive slowly. Mobile connection is ok/working.
Some small cats strolling around the beach, so if you come here they will be happy about some cat food :)

name: natural pool
description: natural pool. good for a swim. nice place.

name: Playa de Ávalo
description:
We spent one quiet night here. Parking right next to the beach. Could be more crowded in summertime. 
Mobile connection is sometimes working, sometimes not!
Before the parking there is private property (with a fence arround), here lives a man with four dogs.
Please keep the place clean!

name: Toilettes and water
description: in the parking garage there are suprisingly clean toilets. there is also tap water available where you can refil water with a canister

name: Bar Parada
description: Bar to drink "Barraquito" and eat almond cockies, a cafe speciality on La Palma :) you can have it with or without liquor43.

name: El Pinalejo
description:
Moderator Note: User confirmed this water source is drinkable - It is a official tapwater spot from the village.

natural water spring, where you can refill your water bottle/canister. tap water.

name: toiltes and shower
description: toilets and shower at the beach. you can also refil water canisters at the shower on the beach. toilets are open between 07:00 and 19:00

name: Área recreativa Los Galguitos
description:
Parking place with playground. We spent one quiet night here. It's like in a small valley protected with high cliffs/rocks around, in the middle of a town.
Good mobile connection. Some car noise from the street in the morning.

name: San Miguel de Cornejo
description: directly after the river/stream crossing - it is next to farmers tracks - good signal

name: Waterfall parking 7kms along dirt from Riodeva
description: Quiet, isolated in pine woods with nice rocks around, easy or longer hiking here, great water source, 3 or 4 waterfalls along the river.

name: down the cliffs
description: amazing place with a lot of space. the road is very adventurous,  you need 4x4 and a high ground clearance. not recommended by rain or bad weather in general. no/very difficult acces to the sea. we did not sleep here. very good mobile connection. a lot of cactus figs which you can eat.

name: Pizzeria La Locanda
description:
Delicious pizza. You can choose between normal dough and black dough. 
Price range between 6 and 13 Euros. 
You can also choose starters, pasta or salads.

name: La Terrasse
description: The owners of the restaurant are a friendly French couple. You can have for example, breakfast, brunch, lunch or Tapas with wine. also Crepes here. Open Mo-Fr 9-18 and Sa 9-14, So closed. Food was good, European prices.

name: Tajinaste
description: Dirtroad parking space between hotels. Enough space for multiple vehicles, not far from sea. Windy like everywhere on the east side. 10 min. from Santa Cruz.

name: Dragon Chino
description: Next to the Shell fuel station there is a big china "dragon chino" supermarket. this is a typical china store where you find everything and with everything i mean everything. if its not super super special and you can't find it here, you will probably not find it on the island

name: Residência los Conejos
description:
Perfect for Motorbikes and Camper. Big parking inside the yard. Very nice roof terrace. Private and common rooms are available. I pay Euro 33.00 for a privat room. 
It was simple and clean .  Restaurant in the same building. The owner is a old couple.

name: Pizzeria Regina Margherita
description: Very tasty pizza napoletana. probably the best pizza on the island. pizza costs between 4.50 and 6.50 for the normal pizzas. it's difficult to get a parking place for a car.

name: Piscina Natural La Maceta
description: Camping next to natural pools. With dumping station for caravans. Toilets available and a restaurant.

name: Valbona BBQ.
description: A good place for a stop and a bbq. Not hard to find. Close to the main road, but no noise at all. No amenities other than a stone shelter.

name: san agustin del Guadalix
description: potable water free y the street near a Park

name: Pino de la Cruz
description:
Next to the mirador is a little path leading to a nice edge with great view (when there are no clouds..) just before the mirador is a space next to the road for vans / little campers. The path is maybe accessible with small vans (not sure since I travel by bike). Perfect for hikers / cyclists. Super quiet in the night and birds all around! 
On the mirador is a picknicktable.
Connection with phone /4G

name: Playa de Tacorón
description: Beautiful playa with a lot of lagunas for swiming, fishing, snorcheling and diving. places for barbecue available, toilets and water, too. quiet at night. The mobile connection is only available direct at the water (4g). no internet where you park the car

name: Valhondo Free Campsite
description:
Urban free campsites with facilities for empty gray water from motorhome.
Authorized stay: 48 hours. Camping is not allowed. The parking area is a little above the water loading and unloading point. Natural pool and playground a few meters away. The hotel and shopping services are in the town, about 500 m. More info: +34 927 197 373.

name: Next to the Road place
description: A nice spot to spend a night or two. Great view of the gorge and a 5min walk to the river. It is next to the road and traffic is scarce. There is a small finca down the way but wasn’t occupied by the time I was here. I guess if you leave a bit of space for the owner to get there it will be no problem.

name: Little Texas Motorhome Park
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager. 

Little Texas Tabernas were awarded the 3rd best Motorhome Park in Spain by CamperContact in 2021. We are a small family owned business located on the gateway to the Tabernas Desert with amazing mountain views. Our Wild West Theme compliments the numerous Western towns and filming locations in the area.

Our facilities include:

Electricity  (6 Amp)
Filtered Drinking Water 
Hot Showers
Toilets
Waste Water Station (Black and Grey)
WiFi
Washing Machine
Bar
Shop
Freshly baked bread and Pastries baked on site every morning 
Swimming Pool 
Solar Heated Hot Water

Coming Soon.....

Western Themed Restaurant and Bar
Heated Swimming Pool
Solar Electricity 

We pride ourselves on providing a relaxing location for your stay here at Little Texas and look forward to hopefully seeing you soon!

name: Camping La Font
description: Nice camping, excellent as a base camp to travel arround the Matarraña region that is full of POI.

name: castillo almonacid de Toledo
description:
Up to the castle of Almonacid there is a esplanade to sleep with your camper van or motorhome. Quiet place with good views. 
Visit the castle on foot or by bike, it is full of history.

name: Superb view on the mountains
description: Access by 4x4 only. Small patch of grass, not really flat but once you take a look at the view, it doesn't really matter. Close to the woods, lots of sheep around. We saw the Shepherd in the morning and he didn't care that we were camping there. Amazing view. Please keep this place clean (even if the sheep don't...

name: Area Puente de San Miguel
description: Parking area to unload and load water near small shops and ATMs.

name: Camp de Tir
description: Shooting range, restaurant. Parking. toilets --- Campo de tiro, restaurante. Parking. Aseos

name: Free parking bufones de pria
description: Parking with picnic zone to go to the Bufones de Pría. Place to spend the night in motorhome (no camping).

name: Near Solius Rock Climbing
description: A nice quiet place a few hundred meters down a washed out path. In dry conditions probably reachable in a normal small van. We met some people who live close by and they were okay with us camping here. Their dogs might pay you a visit (they both have a collar with their name and a phone number). Good phone service.

name: Antenas Aguadulce
description: Only 4x4 with gearbox, very broken road.  Dead end road, very quiet at night, day hikers.  spectacular views.

name: Parking lot at Playa de Mónsul
description: Parking lot close to the beach, quite far from the next town so very quiet. There were several other campers with us in december. Little privacy but the beach is very beautiful, you can even go surfing here and there are some nice hiking trails!

name: Parking lot with view of Gibraltar
description: A big parking lot right next to the beach with a wonderful view. No facilities. Beach shower didn’t work when we were there. No camping allowed in the surrounding area, the police tolerated/ignored it on the asphaltic area.

name: Antenas Aguadulce 2
description: Only 4x4 with gearbox, very broken road.  Dead end road, very quiet at night, day hikers.  spectacular views.

name: Cuesta La Palma Park
description:
Public park in Cuesta La Palma. Hard dirt and gravel, picnic tables, and potable water. When asking locals where to camp, multiple people suggested the park.

Probably too bright and has highway noise, but otherwise a fine place for one night.

Visited by bicycle. Not suitable for car or rv travel.

name: Santuario Nuestra Señora del Viso
description: Small mountain church. Nice place for two campers, vans and tents.

name: Riverside
description: Great place for wild camping. Next to a river. Calm night with the birds singing.

name: Santuario Nuestra Señora Brezo
description: Incredible place with lots of spots. No cell phone signal.

name: Camping el Cares
description: Small but well equipped campsite just outside town.

name: Roadside
description: Plenty of free parking by this park. Spent one night. A few other good places around this neighborhood as well… No services. If you need a restroom, you can find one at the Aldi Market, next to McDonalds, at the main avenue a couple of blocks away.

name: Embalse de la Sarra
description: Water source right next to the road at the end if the lake. opposite to a small café

name: Camping Moncayo
description: Established site which apparently is open all year. Good toilets and showers and flat camping with electricity if you want it. We paid €20 for Land Rover, 2 people and our cat.

name: Pull out
description:
Close to the Alhambra parking lots, but free. Stopped here to have lunch. Didn’t spend the night, but there’s plenty of trash on the floor that I assume people come here often for the view.
Space for 2 Vans kind of flat. No services.

name: Gas Station
description: Repsol with a restaurant and hot shower for €2. Truck stop.

name: Free dump station in Mora
description:
3 parking places where you can stay up to 72h. Each with its own gray water drain.
There’s one black water common drain for all (marked WC) and there’s water at the wall. All free.

name: Gas station with RV dump and water service
description: Gas station with RV dump and water service. Free.

name: Best place in town. Free camping. €3 shower
description: This is the place for campers in Barcelona. Next to a gas station, where you can pay €3 for shower. There’s also laundry available. Lots of campers in a perfect parking.

name: Pizzeria La Cabaña
description: The food here is exceptionally good! The salad, the pizza, the gnocchi and the dessert were all great!

name: pine trees
description:
Beautiful place not too far from the Interstate 4
At least good for one night...

name: Área de autocaravanas "El Cañaveral"
description: Large RV parking with a nice chiringuito-type bar. Water fountains, electricity and illumination available. Nice views from Chinchilla from bellow. 15 km away from Albacete. The village has an historical old town filled with charming streets and plenty of secrets to discover. The caves surronding the upper part and the 14th century castle should not be missed.

name: Area Malaga  Beach
description: Area Malaga Beach. 16 km from the airport. A place for motorhomes. There is water, electricity, a place to discharge dirty water. There is a small shop, you can rent bikes and order a car.

name: Camper parking for motorhomes
description: Beatiful parking places for campers vehicles. Fresh water. Collecting Black waters. Impresive sea view. Nice restaurant with sea food.

name: Camper Area. Outeiro de Rei
description: Beatiful place clase to the Village. Organized for Camping Cars and Campers. All services free, including electricity

name: Monte Subiedes
description: little picnic-place at roadside with view. Drinking water and seating available.

name: PALM BEACH HOTEL
description:
Right on the Beach. It is not a tipical place for Overlanders. But we have to wait here while repairing our Toyota Hilux, stuck 26 months ar Pointe Noire due to Covid 19. Hotel price is much better if you make reservation by your mobile Phone. Around 80- 90 euro daily for 2 People. No breakfast included.
Very nice terrace with beautiful sea viernes and sunset. Light meals & Coffee. Expensive.
They let us charge batteries in the parking while our Hilux was o.k.

name: Camping Reina Isabel
description: Nice family campsite near Granada. Bus stop next to campsite.

name: Parking next to Camping Osuna
description: Big parking lot with many trees and bushes right next to camping Osuna. It’s clean & for free, we slept here two nights & had no problems. Other campers were also around. It’s next to a street but not very loud. There’s a free public toilet in about 4 min. walking distance right next to the stadion and the parks nearby have small drinking water fountains. Walking distance to the next metro station is about 8-10 min., it takes around 25 min. to get into the city center.

name: Camping El Bierzo
description:
Mid size camp ground on open grass with trees. Nice owner. 
4.50€ per person, 6.70€ per campingcar. 4.50€ for electricity. 
TEL. 987 56 25 15.   www.campingbierzo.com

name: Rodamoto
description: Rodamoto AKA tyre heaven. Insane stock of tyres for Motos. Great friendly people and fair prices.

name: cascadas del hueznar
description: Nice spot close to the cascades and waterfall. there's also a part for BBQ.

name: wildcamping with view
description: lovely place to stay!!! on the one side huge rocks and on the other side a wonderful beach (no swimmimg). stunning sunsets and ocean view   :)

name: Edalmoto
description: Good moto shop with parts, oil, gear and a mechanic.

name: Hostel San Andres I
description: Nice clean hostel. €32 / night for a private room with bath.

name: Splash Bath Brook
description: Little stream. Directly off the road down the bank (north side) by the bridge, but vehicles can't see you!

name: Big Tree
description: Not hidden from the road, but there's hardly any traffic, and drivers have to be looking at the curve in the road. From the tree there's a little path down to the lake. Along the shore here there's quite a few pullouts which would be fine for camping... this one seemed a bit more protected.

name: Rest Stop
description: Rest stop along the viasverde. There's a potable water tap, picnic table, and flat ground for pitching a tent (though it's probably not supposed to be used as a campground). I didn't stay here but wished I had.

name: Hidden spot by stream
description: Beautiful wild camp spot. Not visible from the road, and right by clean water. Only drawback is some thorny bushes, and there isn't a huge amount of space if you have a really large tent. Otherwise, excellent.

name: By the River. Cyclists only
description: Upstream of the bridge, and along the trail on the north side of the river. If you go about 50 m along the trail (haul your bike over some rocks) there's a lovely flat spot up on the left past an abandoned building. Room for 2 tents if needed.

name: Beautiful Spot
description: On the south side of the south end of the Ubend in the road. Take the side road until you feel like stopping. There's a beautiful stream and quiet spots for a tent.

name: Mountain Views
description: Lots of options here. Several gravel paths lead to possible camp options. No water. Very quiet.

name: Coll de Turbians
description: Coll de Turbians is tarmac if you comes from Gisclareny road, it isn't if you comes from Bagà. The place is very quiet and paceful in the middle of prepyrenees. no water near this area.

name: Refugi Sant Jordi
description: https://www.feec.cat/fem-muntanya/refugis/refugi/refugi-sant-jordi/

name: les geudins
description:
very beautiful city, under the umbrella pines, with barbecue, tables and benches for eating and sleeping.
--
très beau cite, sous les pins parasols, avec barbecue, tables et bancs pour manger, et dormir.

name: sevetene Italie
description:
at the end of a dead end, only for van, no motorhome, 3 places maximum, not far from the expressway, but for the night it is good.
--
au bout d'un voie sans issue, uniquement pour van, pas de camping car, 3 places maxi, non loin de la voie express, mais pour la nuit c'est bien.

name: El Grado
description: place for camping car, wild camping, break

name: El Burro Blanco
description: Wonderfull campsite, 25 places in the Nature. Nice host. Not for big Cars

name: Los Manzanos
description: Nice, shady campground with aprox. 40 places for Campers. Quiet and clean. Aprox. 12 km to old town.

name: Camping playa Otur
description:
Nice, small, shady campground. 600m from the beach. Small restaurant, nice owner. 
Payed 25€ for campervan, 2 people with electricity. 
www.campingotur.com
info@campingotur.com
+34 9856 40117

name: Camping Macheira
description: Very nice campground in the nature. Small, quiet, well equipped. Swimming Pool, WiFi at the reception.

name: Camping playa Sauces
description:
Mid. size camp ground. Little shade, bar, clean ablutions. 
No restaurant but bar 
Payed: 20€ for 2people campervan with electricity 
Washing machine and tumbler 
cplayasauces@hotmail.com

name: Playa de Gulpiyuri
description:
This is the cutest beach, and supposedly the smallest one on the world.
The water gets here only during high tide, and you can enjoy a private beach if you’re lucky. Road to get here is narrow and you will get some tall grass touching your paint. No 4x4 needed, but if it rains, 4x4 may help.

name: Playa de Gulpiyuri
description: This beach is very special. There’s a way to turn around here, and space for like 4 vans. Beautiful and super quiet place. Nothing but nature around you. Enjoy…

name: Valcarce Los Oteros Restaurant Gas Station
description: Very nice gas station with free hot showers. Ask for the key at the counter of the bar. I was going to leave the id and they asked me to buy something on the way back. I had just a espresso afterwards, and all good.

name: Clearing by the river
description:
Seems to be a fairly infrequently used track leading to a flat clearing in the trees right by a river. Moto or 4x4 only.
Beautiful spot to cool off or have a wash.

name: Ramales Camping
description: Nice small camping on a hill with lots of shade. Clean ablutions and a good restaurant

name: Camping La Paz
description:
Phantastic campsite, overlooking the beach and the sea. The different sites are terrassed. You need to come early or to make a reservation. 
Phone/Fax: 34 - 985 41 12 35
Good restaurant/bar 
Internet only at the bar

name: Camping Playa de Isla
description:
Mid-size campground ( approx. 160 sites for tents and camping cars) on a hill overlooking the sea.  The campground has little shade. The ablutions are extremely clean and new. Tel. + 34 942 679 361
www.playadeisla.com //. onfo@playadeisla.com

name: As Leiriñas
description: An amazing place! A hot spring in outdoor pool next to the lake. There is also a lot of space for pitching the tent and parking for campers...

name: Camping & Bungalows Leagi
description: Nice campground overlooking the sea. Toilets and showers clean. Restaurant opens only in Season. TEL +34 946 842 352

name: Barceloneta beach
description: you can rest in the beach in summer. bathrooms and showers nearby. many people sleep there and the benches next to the beach

name: Vilarello
description:
River bath with cold showers and some water taps. next to the place is a service installation for campervan to empty toilets and refill fresh water.
There is a playground for kids and some picnic tables + benches. 
very quiet out of season. in season not sure how crowded it is.
the bar is closed (we were here in October).
nice view to the river. 
(4G+)

name: Termal Bath
description:
new thermal bath near the river. it seems not fully built, but it's nice.
cold and hot shower. different pools with different temperatures. 
the railway nearby is ok. we counted only 6 trains in 24h.
open whole year. (For opening hours, check the pictures.) 
parking area a bit higher up with the dirty ground but it's better. it's more leveled and not so busy during the day when the bath is open.
Toilets and shower available when the bath is open. A water tap is located in the "park" after the bridge, behind the wooden fence.

name: Dolmen de pedra gentil
description:
Parking place voor walking tracks 
In the bush. Dirt road well exassable.

name: Restaurante Venta Del Peral Hotel.
description: Service área: hotel, restaurant, gas station. parking also for caravans.

name: Camping Almundia
description: Nice small campground, well equipped. Not at all places Shadow - the trees are still growing. Swimmingpool nearby.

name: Parque público "El Picón"
description: This is a big picnic area in an open forest next to the river (where you also go swimming). There are no facilities around except a water tap and many tables.

name: La Redondela
description:
Very nice picnicplace with benches along the Via Verde del Litoral with one big experienced pinetree that brings some shadow. Every morning the shepperd comes by (twice) and he is in the mood for a chat. Directly next to the small town at 200mts where all you want or need is available. No free watertaps but bottles in the mercados at €0,40 per liter.

Attention : do not cycle the Via Verde del Litoral from Redondela to Gibraleon vv since it is in a very bad condition.

name: Cataya cemetery
description:
Opposite of the Cataya cemetery (at 2 kms east) along a local gravelroad. Not a very nice spot but Cataya offers no better. Nothing available here, however there might be water and toilets at the cemetery but that was closed for a full two weeks. There might be a better spot just some 500mts further east behind the cafe along the mainroad. 

Attention : do not cycle the Via Verde del Litoral from Redondela to Gibraleon vv since it is in a very bad condition.

name: Gibraleon riverside
description:
Very nice area along the river and the Via Verde del Litoral with a bridge helping you to cycle or walk into Gibraleon. There you will find all you want or need.

Attention : do not cycle the Via Verde del Litoral from Redondela to Gibraleon vv since it is in a very bad condition.

name: Valverde del Camino cemetery
description: At the tarmac next to the cemetery. Nice spot, friendly people, water and toilets available during the day. The town is just 5 minutes away where you will find all you want or need.

name: sant gervas
description: Nice bushcamp in the catalan pirinees. Mountan views and some horses around. Need a 4x4 to arrive here.

name: Rest area on top of the hill
description: Nice area to camp with beaches and sunbeds (in concrete) but most important a water tap!

name: The Molinar
description: It’s a front beach parking area, there is an open gym and a lot of amenities for van travelers.  It’s very close from the shopping mall FAN, palm International Airport and more.

name: Night Parking in Jerez de la Frontera
description:
Quiet night parking. Free.
Just parking please don't show off...so others can continue stopping without problems with neighbours or police.

Levelled surface, many places near public pool (or a like)

name: Pared de Roberto
description: Vivac site up in the mountain, close to Roque de Los Muchachos. Amazing views of La Caldera de Taburiente National Park. Be careful in wintertime the temperatures could be under -10° C.

name: Propper Velley camp
description:
Nice quiet campground. 
picknick tables
Shelter with fire place (just not a lot of wood around)
trinking water
trash bin
shaddow in summer
good mobile signal

name: Montserat by the river
description: Between a quiet road and the river.  Also a train bridge but really not that loud.  Epic view ov the Montserat mountains!  Another camper was here and a fisherman came in the morning.  We could hear wolves howling at the moon in a distance.  A M A Z I N G

name: Camping Los Limoneros
description: Campsite from a local farmer. 6 Pits. No Facility or something else. A small walk (300m) trough the wood to beach. Great for Dogowners.

name: Finca Colores
description:
Peaceful private dog-friendly estate with a cottage
Malaga and Montes de Malaga Natural Park 30 minutes driving
Barbecues are allowed; shops and restaurants within 15 min drive
This dog-friendly property is in a great location for outdoor adventures and reconnecting with nature: golden-sand beaches, hiking mountains, gorges, waterfalls, and historic landmarks await within a half hour's drive.
A tranquil atmosphere reigns in this private estate that rises 700 meters above sea level.

Espanol
Finca privada tranquila que admite perros con una casa de campo
Málaga y Parque Natural Montes de Málaga a 30 min conduciendo
Se permiten las barbacoas; tiendas y restaurantes a 15 min conduciendo.
Finca Colores es justo lo que estabas buscando. Este establecimiento admite perros y tiene una ubicación estupenda para emprender aventuras al aire libre y reconectarse con la naturaleza: a eso de media hora conduciendo te esperan playas de arena dorada, montañas en las que practicar senderismo, desfiladeros, cascadas y lugares de interés histórico.
Una atmósfera tranquila reina en esta finca privada que se alza a 700 metros por encima del nivel del mar.

name: picnic area
description: perfect spot I travel by bicycle w a tent there are 2 tables, no benches....the a bench alone and a fountain w water!!! you c hear a few cars but they don't see you. no one comes at night.4km from Linares.

name: behind little church w water
description:
Possibly no vehicle access

This is a great spot. With the little church (ermita) on your right, go straight down a rocky path . There is a small spring w running water and beautiful sunset

name: Playa de los covachos
description: Open field at the top of a cliff overlooking covachos beach. Great for setting up a tent, car, or van.

name: nice wood for the tend close to a lake
description: this is a nice spot for take a rest with the tend or van is very chill, is close to the highway

name: Santacara
description:
Motorhome area with services to empty and fill tanks 

Área de autocaravanas con servicios para vaciar y llenar depósitos

name: Riba de Saelices
description: Small and quiet picnic site by the river with drinking water,  tables and a small shelter one kilometer from the village. Good for one night camping if you are passing by walking or cycling. There is no space to park a vehicle.

name: Camping El Bierzo
description: Quite small and private place with approx. 50 places mostly shady. Nice personal, very polite.

name: Embarcadero de piraguas
description: Great place to relax for a week.  The driveway is easy to find and possible with any vehicle.  Good access to the river with clean water.  Nobody bothers you here. everything clean. From time to time bathers come, everybody is friendly.

name: water
description: Good drinking water, roadside fountain, A little behind the helipad

name: On a big rock
description: Nice area with a good view of the Aragon. better to have a 4x4 to come here. Very quiet.

name: Lakeside de Castrejón
description: Follow small road down on the left side of picknick-benches. Small campground accessible for all cars. Next to the water. View on scenic rock-formation de Castrejón.

name: embalse de la garganta del prior
description: Is a nice quiet place near the lake. Only accessible by bike or walking. You will only be able to hear wildlife overnight, to enter try to follow Google maps towards the Torre de botafuegos.

name: San Nicolas de Bujaruelo
description:
Beautiful area at the top of a mountain road. Flat grass field surrounded by mountain peaks. The starting point of many hiking trails. There's a refugio with good food! Cooling down after the hike in the beautiful clear water ice cold river, that passes under an ancient river, is a must.

The road up the mountain was challenging for our big rig (7,5m long, 2,5m wide, 3,75m high) but doable. The refugio also gets its delivery by trucks..

name: Between the cows
description: 4x4 necessary for reaching open space next to the road

name: Asolaze Camping Izaba
description: Great place in the mountains with ca. 30 pitches in between big trees. Friendly personnel. We paid 25€ for car, tent and two adults. I recommend this site

name: Camping Solopuent
description: Camping Place with fixed huts and ca. 25 pitches for tents/campers. Flat ground near to river with clean WC, hot shower and pool. Polite personnel. We paid 26€ for car/tent/two persons. I recommend this site.

name: Antiguo Parador de Jaizkibel
description: The parking is located on the crest of the Jaizkibel mountain next to the ruins of what was the parador of Jaizkibel. The place is called Santa Barbara. Very close to the parking there is an excellent viewpoint with incredible views. Near the parking, about fifty meters, there is a mountain route, quite busy that runs along the ridge of the mountain but there should be no noise problems. At night it is a very quiet area. The access road is good so that a caravan can access perfectly.

name: Juan Adalid
description: Former cropland in the very north of the island. Garafía. Very windy place but really beautiful and with natural pools everywhere.

name: La Pobla de Segur
description:
Municipal parking lot for 12 motorhomes next to the train station. First train in the morning arrives at 7am.

Petrol station, supermarket, restaurants and swimming pool just around the corner. 

Electricity (2€) and water available. No toilets!

It's ok for one night.

name: Nice and quiet place near a chapel
description:
A parking near a little chapel, very quiet and secluded.
A fountain at disposal near the chapel.
We didn't know if we could settle a tent but as there was no sign we tried anyway.

name: Àrea d'autocaravanes Pla d'Ermita
description:
Parking Lot next to a holiday village. No shade in the evening. Nice views. Restaurants, picnic spot with large barbecue
 and a water fountain nearby.
At the moment there's a portapotty.

name: Faro de Higuer Kanpina
description:
Quiet place at the base of the Lighthouse, pedestrian passage for the path that goes towards the cliff. to reach it there is a very sloping dirt road to the left of the Lighthouse
----
Posto tranquillo alla base del Faro, passaggio pedonale per il sentiero che va verso la scogliera. per raggiungerlo c'è una stradina sterrata molto in pendenza alla sinistra del Faro.

name: Repsol gasstation, laundry and water
description: At this gasstation, just next to the highway, you can wash and dry your laundry in a few externally places laundromats. There's also 2 water filling points.

name: RHO Panorama for a tent
description: Lookout Place over the Convention Center of Milano where surely only few people ever come. A Bit of noise from the street. Check it out in google maps

name: vall de can masdeu
description: awsome place in Barcelona to spend some nights and days. the comunity of can masdeu its running a farm over a large, old building. you can stay near the farm, colaborating whit they comunnity whit work.

name: Parking
description: Parking close to the beach. Opposite Bar Cafetaria Alhmar.

name: Parking O Castro Mountain
description: quiet place in vigo in the nice little mountain of o'castro. autocaravans and vans sleeping. there are stone tables near and nice views of the city. the best place to sleep near vigo center.

name: Out of use resting area
description: Some level spots to pitch a tent a bit beneath the road. Good place for cyclists or hikers. Mind the torns.

name: Along the river
description:
Nice place near the river, a little track on the right of the main road will lead you to the place by the river.
If you have a 4x4 car you can even cross the river by the bridge and go up 50 meters, there is a nice spot by the forest where you can set the tent.

name: Parque del molino
description: Parking lot. Waste disposal for caravans. Picnic tables. Drinking water. Quiet places to camp. Nice place a few kilometers from the village

name: San Marco
description: Nice flat place close to the lake, near asphalt road.

name: El bosc de la Pope
description:
if you wanna arrive at this place, once you reach the closest fork on the main road, take the path that has the “iturrieta” sign. it would lead to a wildroad with little spots throughout the way. it is perfect to put up tents, not valid for vans. there aren’t any facilities, only forest :)

att: MM <3

name: Refugio de Gallegos (Gallegos mountain shelter)
description: Little building without door. Is just a 10 sq meters place with a chimney placed in a spectacular place where you can enjoy the sunset surrounded by pine trees.

name: beach
description: beach parking 2wd or 4wd 8 km from main road,bring everything with you & pack it out.super quiet at night and no light pollution.bins on site.weak phone signal.resturant open june to september 500m.

name: oasis hollywood & zoo
description: take the road into car park, theres motorhome parking for 2.90€  a day or continue on road past zoo into mountains on a rough gravel/tarmac road many pull ins,not problem for 2wd but watch out for flash floods when raining. Good phone signal.

name: montego
description: parking around a lake,great for swimming and paddle boarding.no services except bins.

name: presa de proserpina(lake/dam)
description:
parking around a lake with beach & resturant,set in pine trees used by locals since roman times.
footpath/cycle track 9 km around lake which is lit up all night.
sup & peddalo hire.

name: Tremp
description: Fresh Water filling point and water dump site next to the fire fighter station.

name: CASECHA
description:
Area Granja "CASECHA" ideal para viajes en familia o simplemente para descansar en un entorno rural único, para disfrutar en plena naturaleza.
Grandes parcelas, con acceso a luz, venta de productos de la huerta.

name: Lake Side View
description: Beautiful sleep spot right by the lake. Doesn't get much better than this! Quiet location with a launch point for kayak. Lots of hiking trails close by and fishing spots. Perfect!

name: Lake Side Spot
description: Wow, just wow! Absolute stunning spot 2 metres from the waters edge. Tranquility at its finest... Great for fishing and kayaking with picnic tables close by. Wild camping at its finest!

name: Lake Side Spot
description: Basic spot by road that's also by side of small lake. Did the job after a long day driving.

name: Lake Side View
description: Beautiful spot just off the main road... Stunning views and very quiet once the road slows down after 8pm. Great sleepover spot before heading into Norway.

name: Torup, Bara
description: Big parking lot in a very quite area. Ideal for hiking, biking. Pick nick tables nearby. No facilities.

name: Simrishamn
description: Free parking close to the beach. Small parking lot where you can stay for free up to 7 days (use the side where the sign says "7 dygen"). The street next to it is a bit noisy during the day, but it's quite at night.

name: Lunneviken
description: parking near to Lunneviken with beautiful view to the sea. 100 SKR/night

name: Autoexperten AB Sundsvall
description: Friendly, helpfull and fast working mechanics.

name: Vänern wild camping
description: a relax little site, in between the trees, and right next to an amazing lake. you'll have to drive a few feet on the bike lane to reach this site. the road towards the spot is bumpy. some bugs here, so bring repellent. you can make a small campfire.

name: Kivik småbåtshamn
description: Parking space for about 15 camper vans. Next to the harbor and the center of Kivik. Very quiet. Toilet and showers are available at the harbor. Toilets for free, shower, laundry costs extra. Ask in the restaurant.

name: Damn Camp - Muddus NP
description: Large parking area above the damn. Had the place to ourselves, parked at the far side where we found several fire rings. 10km from Muddus NP south entrance.

name: Skuleskogen NP - West Entrance
description: Parking for the National Park, thee lots, the 3rd (last in the loop) gives the most privacy away from the entrance itself. At the entrance itself you will find toilets and rubbish bins. Nice short and easy walk to a viewing platform. Can hike from here to the crevice which this park is famous for but it is a shorter hike from either the north or south entrance.

name: Parking Hotell Höga Kusten
description:
Parking place infront of Hotel. 
Toilets and water available. 
Nice view to the Bridge Högakustenbron, possibility to hike on the trail Höga Kusten. 
For overnight sleeping perfect and free.
Restaurant in Hotel, Internet for guests.

name: Jävre
description:
Parkingplace, good for overnight parking. 
There is a toilet, drinking water and picknick tables. 
Next to the place (other side of the street) is a gas station.

name: Almö
description: big grass area to park. some walk to do in the beautiful nature around. lot of birds.

name: Tula base
description:
• water
• tools
• basic welding
• recovery help within Trollhättan, Lilla Edet and Vänersborg communities
• a cup of coffee

Any overlander is welcome to fill up their water tanks, borrow tools and so on.

The water hose that can reach all the way out to the street. So even big rigs with permanent tanks can fill up.
(Not in service when below 0 degrees Celsius.)

All the basic tools and some power tools.

Basic welding machine.

Toyota Hilux with winch.

Coffee.

/Jonas & Oil
Send sms on mobile: plusfoursixsevenzeroeighttwofourfivetwofourseven

Or just knock the door.

name: Anundshög
description: parking of the archeologic site wich is free access. lot of picnic table. good for a night

name: Borlänge
description: parking in commercial zone with a lot of shop and Ikea! quiet at night but lot of people on the day.

name: Sollerön
description: place for 3 campers. beautiful view on the lake. picnik tables

name: near the river
description: Just the forest, the river, and you! very very quiet

name: Karlskrona
description:
Parking place on the wharf for camping cars. Power. Registration at the harbor office. World heritage site and major maritime museum
Didn't overnight but parked there during the day .

name: Sandhammeren
description:
Parking with facilities, beside
Beach, suitable for wild Camping

name: picknick spot Kamlunge
description: Simple picknick spot with tables and toilet next to the river.

name: spot at the road
description: A good spot at the road to the castle. A little bit durty, any thing around, just forest.

name: good spot at the wood
description: By side of the road this spot is very nice because the forest is around. Quiet and prety.

name: Free camping spot in the city beside a lake
description: Beautiful (medium) spot beside a lake, heated toilets and shower, the shower costs SKK5.

name: Riddersholms naturreservat; west
description: Parking lot in the nature reserv. Room enough for a couple of small rigs or maybe two big. At the information sign there is a clause that restricts you to; "pitch more than two days after each other". In Swedish; "tälta längre än två följd".

name: Himmelstorp
description: Parking of a nature park with a nice coffee place.

name: cafe cabins and camping
description:
stopped for a coffee and a smoked fish breakfast - delish!

reasonable price - 70kr for fish and 35kr for a coffee and a fanta

lovely location - would be nice place to stop over night

75 miles from Sorsele- was first cafe we saw on road that was open.

name: Wild camping on a smal lake
description: Greater flat place in the end of a 5,6 Km gravel road. Very remote ans peaceful. Fireplace and nature. Perfect for one night.

name: Ångbåtsbryggan
description: 3 parking lots in gras near the habour. Picnic tables and a wonderful View over the lake. Only motorhomes are welcome.

name: Fisherman's Dock
description:
Nice little spot used by owners of local vacation homes to store their fishing boats. 
Directly by the lake shore. Good for overnight stay. Fire pit available.

People using the vacation homes nearby may show up now and then.

name: Clearing near Lake
description:
Nice, big-ish gravel spot over the lake. view onto lake but no direct access to shore.
Lots of space for 3-4 normal sized vehicles.

Easily accessible by gravel road.

name: Dune Parking Lot
description:
Parking lot right next to dune, direct access to basically empty stretch of beach right behind it.

Good for one night of parking your vehicle.

Pitching of tents or camping and driving ontk the dune is not permitted.

name: Gemmelstad parking
description: Big parking at the edge of the beautiful village of gemmelstad (definitly something to see).

name: skelleftea nordana parking
description: a parking in the center. 5kr per hour. quiet place.

name: halsingtuna church parking
description:
halsingtuna church parking just by the highway. we hear the cars but nothing unbareable.
cute church!

name: gavle camping car parking
description: gavle free camper parking. free electricity. 8 places. by the river.

name: mora - knupvagen beach
description: a pretty beach. quiet. lot of place to park with a little slope

name: Direct at a lake not so much mosquitoes
description: Beautiful Campspot. Lots of space for a few Caravans and cars. Here are no much  mosquitoes. Lake is cristal clear...

name: Höljebacka Kulla
description: Old lumber track. Plenty of room. Some left over logs in the area.

name: borensberg trailer park
description:
A trailer park for 195 sek the night without electricity, 245 with. other services are free (washing machine, drier, shower, water...)
Nice spot by the river.

name: Ryd car graveyard
description: The parking of the strange car graveyard is by the road but it's quiet at night.

name: Hörlycke Ekebacken
description:
Along the track leading down to the marker there are some spots suitable to place a small rig over the night. By the marker you could place two rigs and about 50 meters before that there is room for some more, maybe ten if you don't mind being close together.

If you follow the path down towards W you can find a stream with some dirty water. You're better of if you just get some from a tap inside Trollhättan.

The photo is taken of the place where the marker is.

name: First Camp
description: Big camping with a perfect structure. US$32 to saty or US$2.50 just the shower.

name: Piske Parking
description: A parkinglot to fishers with table and chairs front of lake. Nice place but a lot of moskitos!

name: Outdoor bath; Munkeboviken
description:
Small beach by the lake Öresjö.
Hade some tables, wc and a playground.
Dogs not aloud.

name: majas Place.2
description: perfekt place direct beside the highest official Road of sweden. stunning view around and over a several mountain-peaks. enough space (you won't be alone) and a very good hiking posibility...

name: majas Place.3
description: very nice Spot for a night. fireplace, posibility  to swimm and enough space. ( you won't be alone !! ) it's directly  beside/under  the Road Nr. 311 but quiet aswell. There are 3 more nice places directly beside this Road in a distance of 1km.

name: Partille ställplats
description:
Next to Partille youth hostel.
Got 23 spots for RV’s. All with power outlets.

Big rigs maximum 10 meters.

Low season 245 SEK
High season 295 SEK

name: Sandvik, close to Mollösund
description: Parking behind a cliff right by the ocean. Quiet spot. We stayed here in the middle of the winter, might be a little busier in the summertime.

name: Beautiful place at lake
description: I believe a place for fishing but good access for motorbike and maybe small camper. Beautiful place to spend the night

name: Private campingspot in the middle of the woods
description: Perfect hideout! A open area (old gravel pit maybe?) in the end of a service road. Drive down a road called Getingvägen in the little village Hulared, and just keep going for about 3-400m until you find the open area, you will pass a lit up trail on your way. The road is big enough for our VW -van with roof racks and drivable without 4w drive. There is a public beach by a lake close by. We had a quiet stay!

name: Waterfront parking
description: It’s a public parking on the waterfront (beautiful view), 15kr/hour during the day but free at night. Location is convenient, it’s 10-15min walking to the historic center.Relatively quiet during the night, the only downside is that there are no facilities at all and it is very exposed, but the boat-hotel near allowed us to use their toilets (and their WiFi).

name: Vivstavarvstjärns Camping
description:
Campsite by a lake. Hostel and cottages present. There are 5 showers and 6 toilets and a kitchen in the service building. 
A spot for tent, without electricity is 100 SEK, for caravan, with electricity it’s 225 SEK. A 2-bed room is 300 SEK. Cottages go from 425 (2 beds) to 800 SEK (6 beds).

name: The perfect quiet spot for a camper
description: An old dug out lot. A short pull off right where the sign ”Hulared” is from the main road if you come from Dalstorp area. Very quiet! Possible to reach without 4 wheel drive. Right next to a hiking trail. Lake with beach nearby. Good cell service!

name: Skärgölen Lake
description:
Nice spot directly at a small lake surrounded by trees. 
Accessible from the road but the 300m-track from the road to the lake may be a little bit too steep for vehicles without 4WD and enough ground clearence. 
Pretty quite site, only some fishermen "disturbed" us on this saturday evening. Not many fishes in the lake.

name: Site at the harbour with seaview
description: Quiet. Nice site for a one night stopover on a gravel parking lot.

name: End of the trail in Vilhelmina
description:
Perfect quite place at the end of a abandoned trail. Relatively easy to get to with motorbike or 4x4. The place itself is on top of the hill and surrounded with small trees. Sun all day and evening.

The spot has a lot of rocks but still fine for camping. Also possible to build campfire (other people have done as well in the past)

name: Liseberg Stellplatz
description: Absolut toller Stellplatz! Unbedingt am Campingplatz vorbeifahren. Oben am Berg sind die Schönen Stellplätze ! Sir 240/ Nacht

name: Tosteburga Hamm
description: camper van parking and places for tents at boat harbour. warden collects money in mornings, kitchen facilities, showers, toilet, water, power. 100 Skr a night per tent. Quiet, peaceful water side camping.

name: Field overview Hedemora
description: A little service road used by the local farmer to access his fields. Perfect protection from sun under the big pines

name: Hideout by the lake
description:
A little spot right behind the parking by the lake. From the main road, turn by the graveyard and turn left right on the gravel road 60m off the turn. Drive to the parking by the lake, just before reaching the parking there is a steep road to the left, with a few branches hanging down, leading down to a flat, firm area on the right. Almost completely hidden, flat and right next to the lake. You wont need a 4x4 but it is not suitable for bigger riggs. Our VW t4 with rocket box on the roof made it down (and up ) just fine.
 No one will bother you there! And it is really close to Gothenburg city!

name: No Name
description: Parkingplace next to the road. Place for Rating and drinking. Beautiful Lake on this Spot, Swimming possible.

name: Allsta Fiskecamp
description:
A small campsite built in an old sand quarry, right by a river. 
It caters primary to fishers, but I find it to be perfect for overlanders who need a night with access to a shower and 230V power. 
The proprietor can be contacted by telephone, the site has a simple website with the info. Payment primary in cash.

name: Lakeside spot
description: great place for a lunch or even an overnight stay. Close to a quiet road and a few metres from the lake. Some houses in the area, so not remote. Place for a few vehicles.

name: Remote overnight place
description: This is a remote overnight place at the end of a 2 km dirt track. Very quiet and a nice view over the lake just a few steps away. 4x4 not necessary in the dry season but high clearance is a pré. No houses in the area, so you are all by yourself. Easy turning possible at the end of the track. Track is to small for a big truck.

name: InterHostel
description:
Basic hostel with on-street designated motorcycle parking out front. Basic accommodations. $15 USD / night + $5 for bed linens 

Either way, it's a roof over your head

name: wild camping at fjord
description: great place right beside the Fjord, with fireplace

name: Lake/beach: Vassbosjön
description: A tiny, tiny beach with some cliffs. Nice swimming and beautiful spot for lunch. You could probably squeeze in up to four small rigs, but one would be the perfect fit.

name: Bjornlandets national park parking
description: At the parking of the trailhead of several hikes in the national park. Shelter, toilet and fire place present. The place is approx 25 km over a good quality gravel road. Very quiet. On weekend days, local people might be there who spent the night in one of the shelters on the trails.

name: Stora Finnsjön
description: nice open place, u can camp in the forest or right by the water.  there's fire pits and one toilet. (old school)

name: Järavallen
description: Nice lake with swimming and fishing. Lots of parking for overnight stay. Perfect for camping. There are alot of people here during the days in nice weather.

name: Church parking in Kee
description: Big parking lot next to the church and cemetery. Very quiet at night. Few people came in the cemztery in the morning but no one cares about us.

name: Orpusviken
description: nice spot at lake with beach. Toilet in site. fire pits and wood on site.

name: Suzy stays at River
description: Small Place near the street. Very quiet and good dir one mobil.

name: Killingsand
description: Beautiful place right in front of the beach

name: Skibbikken
description: SuzySixFoot: Nice place on the  Sandy Beach of Vindelälf.

name: Hökesjön Bathing Spot
description:
Nice Bathing Spot in the Woods near to Vimmerby.
There is space for a few cars to park. Fresh and clean water. Not very deep at the beginning.

name: Sleeping Spot over Lake Ysjön
description:
A nice littel sleeping spot at lake Ysjön. The place is over the lake, so you have a nice overview. 
There is a rocky road to this spot.
Beautiful drive through the woods and hills.

name: Öradtjärnen Lake Sleeping Spot
description:
The pitch itself is a turning hammer in the forest. From there it is only a few meters to the lake where you can swim. The lake has clean and dark water. At the lake itself are a few houses.
If you have an all-terrain vehicle, you can also drive directly to the water.

name: Kapellskär Ferry
description: The Kapellskär Ferry Port is just over 100 kilometers north of Stockholm. From here, ferries leave for the Åland Islands and Finland. The transfer to Mariehamn on Åland takes two hours. Two minutes from the port is a small campsite.

name: Västersjön
description: Beautiful nature based wild camping spot right by the water, good access with RV, good ground for tents

name: Morup Field at the coast
description: Free Field directly at the coast. Very quiet at night but be aware of the cows you have to share the spot with. Don‘t get irritated by the locked gate. It‘s allowed to be opened but keep it locked afterwards, so that the cows can‘t escape.

name: Glaskogen Lake
description: Beautiful place right on the lake in the woods. Can be reached via a gravel road. The traffic is moderate. There is room for four to five vehicles here. Also two, three larger vehicles can be found here. Swimming possible. Also a bench with table is available.

name: Karlstadt Swecamp Bomstadbaden
description: Nice campsite right on the large Vänner lake. Everything is there what you need. Places are shady in the woods. 400 meter sandy beach is available. There is also a small restaurant on site.

name: Römningen
description: Hidden wild camping spot, only a few farms in the area, peaceful atmosphere, small beach depending on the water level

name: Sikareveln
description: Quiet wild camping spot we found with our kajak, also accessible by car, beautiful sunset and sandy beach depending on the water level

name: Häljanäs
description: A few parking lots right by the lake Flaken, with toilets and showers, nice place for a stop overnight

name: Ventlinge ställplats
description: Classical backyard camping site, 180 sek with electricity, 150 sek without. Clean toilets and showers

name: Löddeköpinge Center Syd
description: Located directly on the highway shopping center with large ICA Maxi supermarket, pharmacy, various good restaurants and various other shops. A petrol station is also available. There is also the possibility for a visit to Burger King. Other shops and supermarkets are available in the immediate vicinity. A hardware store and a convenience store are also available. Is good for replenishing supplies for the trip north.

name: Gävleborg
description: A beautiful quiet free camping spot right next to the water in a small local boat launch. Very clean and well looked after. Parking is in a gravel area and the road in and out is fairly small. No amenities at all so make sure you are well stocked up on power and water etc.

name: Bödakusten Östra naturreservat
description: Ideal wild camping spot, beautiful nature reservat, in the middle of a forest. Close to the beach, nice walks. Sights of the northern end of Öland are easy to reach by bike. Not quite sure, if you’re really allowed to camp here, because it’s a nature reservat, but there’s no “no camping” sign here. We didn’t have any problems.

name: Kanaan Camper area
description: big, gravel parking place. 200 sek for camper and 2 persons. Electricity 30 sek. Beach nearby. Metro (Blackeberg) to centrum 1,5 km. Very quiet place.

name: Parking at the lake
description: Restplace with picknick tables and a beautiful lake. Close to the road but safe.

name: Campalta
description: A nice camp ground next to the E10 road and situated in front of a large lake. Very quiet with good parking and amenities.

name: Torpön shelter
description: nature reservat on Torpön. Easy to reach by car/foot/kajak. Very nice spot with a shelter, right by the water, close to a few little island in the lake Sommen.

name: Beautiful, big spot at little forest road
description: Very nice spot at a little paved forest road, big enough for a big number of campers and tents. We slept in the car but the ground is even and well suited for a tent. Apart from a guy walking his dog and the occasional car on the road we were completely alone. Surrounded by a beautiful forest which you can do a little morning walk in. Also a perfect camping spot to watch a little bit of wildlife, we saw a deer and a fox right by us and certainly would have seen a lot more if we wouldn’t have been so tired. So have fun and please keep the site clean.

name: Wild forest road
