description: We drove 200m up this road. A bit shaky, and some branches here and there, but it went really quiet in the evening, and we were surrounded by forest. Beautiful. The photos are from us leaving so we were further down the road.

name: Naturstig- Kyrkstig
description: Flat area in a forest right next to a little lake called Svarten close to Sommen lake. Walking along the lake on a path you will also find a shelter and a nice fire place. We didn’t see many people here and it’s definitely ok to stay here for a while and discover the Östergötlands leden.

name: E4 Rest Area, South
description: Five star rest area for campervans and caravans. This is just a service/rest area but with parking for around 10 vans on the lakeside makes it feels much better than it should be. It’s free and legal to park here overnight.

name: Töreboda
description: Following a very small and bumpy road you will reach a lonely clearing in the woods right by the lake Viken. There’s a lot of space here, even though the pathway doesn’t seem like it. Nice fire pit and good access to the lake if you’d like to go for a swim.

name: amazing sleeping spot with converted van
description: Beautiful road leading up to the spot. Perfectly doable with a car or a van.

name: alpaka garden
description: Alpaca farm with cafe and spaces for motorhome/camping. 200SEK to camp, 20SEK for water 20SEK for showers 20SEK for EHU. includes entry to alpaca farm.

name: Degerfors
description: Near the road, but not much traffic. Beautiful lake.

name: Boat launch wildcamp
description: Site at the end of a gravel track by a lake where there is a kayak and a boat. Easy access for any kind of vehicle. Some distant noise from the E18 highway but otherwise very quiet and peaceful. Didn’t see anyone and no cars passed by while we were here for one night.

name: Seglora Camping
description:
Very basic Camp. No luxus, but clean. A river nearby.
Campground 150 SEK/Night
Stellplatz 100 SEK/Night
WIFI free. Electricity included.
Animals accepted / free.

name: Riverside solitude
description: Beautiful spot in a clearing by a river at the end of a dirt track. Surrounded by birch and pine trees. Easily accessible in any type of vehicle. Very peaceful. The only sound is the rushing water. Good cell service here.

name: Lakeside near Rogen Nature Reserve
description: Beautiful site in a small clearing at the end of a flat track between two small lakes close to Rogen Nature Reserve. Firepit. Very peaceful. Lots of reindeer in the area. Telenor LTE works well here.

name: Marina In Gavle
description: Two spots with free electric hookups next to the water. Just a parking lot nothing else. You can walk to the town from here. No reason to stop here unless it's Christmas and the goat is on fire.

name: Långholmens Husbilscamping
description: Large RV park, really just a parking lot but it has electricity, dump and showers and toilets. Clean and centrally located. It's a 20 minute walk to the old town or a nearby metro. Right next to a park and on a small quiet island.

name: Marinaside Stockholm
description: A 24 hour parking lot minutes away from all the museums and a short walk from old town. No facilities but unbelievable location 120 SEK for 24 hours.

name: Utsikts Platsen
description: A bit off the beaten path, 20 minutes from the highway. Overlooking the lake (but too far too walk to the lake easily. There's a pleasant restaurant with wifi and a separate wc. Hiking as well.

name: Marina Spot
description: A big lot along the harbor, you can park along the water. A++ showers and toilets.  Free ferry from the mainland. 180SEK per night.

name: Place near Storforsen
description: Very nice place @ the river to stay one ormore nights. Firewood available, beautiful. Strong 4G signal

name: Gålö Havsbad
description: Organize campground with a nice sandy beach. Sites with power and electricity along with other facilities.

name: Pikab Bilservice
description:
Pik AB Land Rover Service

Service center for Land Rovers with many other auto brand services as sales nearby

name: Hätte camping
description: Nice camping next to the village Tarnås. In the woods, right next to lake Sommen (possibilities to swim). Very quiet, nice places for both tents and campers/cars. Sanitary is very modern and clean. All you need is available (wi-fi, laundry machine, bread, electricity). Some things only available in high season. Very kind owners.

name: Kåseberga Beach
description: Wild camping close to the beach, a few people in tents and a few in small cars/camper vans. No facilities, busy during the day if good weather, quiet during evening/night. We stayed here for 2 nights without issues. The road in has a height limit of 2m. So not accessible for bigger vehicles.

name: Rebbetuaröd
description: A dead end T-junction. Plenty of room. Some walls left of a ruin that can give you protection agains the winds.

name: Bosses Bodega
description: At this place there is ample of room for even a couple of big rigs. The beauty that makes is all worth venturing into the forest right here, is “Bosses Bodega”. A barbecue/camp fire hut that is free to use. There is a fireplace in the middle, and spread out along the walls are six tables that each seats up to six or eight people. There do are fire wood in the hut. But as a courtesy you of course bring as much as you use.

name: Stenshult IF
description:
A exercise center that has a timbered shelter with room for about six people. It has a fireplace and a “long drop” toilet in direct connection. Be prepared to carry your stuff from the parking lot. Maybe 50 meters. In off season you can drive down to where the shelter is.

I have not checked the amenities at the center it self. It might be possible to access hot showers, electricity and so on from there depending on the season.

The attached website is the sports club that runs the place.

name: Arjeplog
description: On the 95 13km west of Arjeplog on the road to Bodø. Situated at the water. 2 fire pits and a bench and table. Lovely place to spend a night.

name: Jokkmokk
description: Situated just North of Jokkmokk and the polar circle at E45 on a lake. Seems very quiet.

name: Tanumstrand parking for RV
description: nice and big established parking for RV, van,  camper, campervan

name: Preem
description: I live in the county so I pass this fuel station many times a month. In 99 cases out of 100 they are in the very top among the most expensive fuel stations in the county. Avoid it if possible.

name: OKQ8
description: I live in the county so I pass this fuel station many times a month. In 99 cases out of 100 they are in the very top among the most expensive fuel stations in the county. Avoid it if possible. OKQ8 manned stations are generally in the expensive end. And they are also famous for not having as good quality on their diesel fuel as the other brands.

name: Layby on a small backroad
description: Just a little nook next to the water where one can park up and enjoy the setting sun before tucking in for the night. Not suitable for tents. There's a small trashcan available.

name: Picknick Site
description:
Next to a small lake. Quiet in Winter. I can Not Tell how bussy in Summer. Nice tables next to the water Die . Mainroad however nearby.
Toilet available. During the Season a small Restaurant.

name: Grasviken
description:
parking lot gravel ok for sleeping in the woods
near church farm with swimming facilities

name: Next to a lake
description: Just a pullout on a dirt road, but quiet at night (in April atlest), and lake access with rocky shore and even a little beach.

name: Lakeside camp
description:
Very nice camp right on the lake. Picnic area, swings and swimming beach.
Toilets are here but we're locked in April 2019

name: Local bathingspot
description:
Private land but the neighborhood used this place as a swimming spot.  There is a roofed shelter and a fireplace.
Not the most quiet spot (railways and road are not very far), but more then good enough.

name: Vandringsled
description: beautiful parking lot next to swim spot with a toilet. it's placed in a nature reserve with in a UNESCO heritage side. it's 40 Swedish krona per night which has to be paid in mail box.

name: Gränsö Castle
description:
Area of the car park is reserved for motorhomes/camper vans. It's free, quite and has clean toilets nearby. The Coast is just a few meters away and a very nice small hiking trail starts at the car park. There is a picnic area with fireplaces at the shore nearby.

It's not free. You have to pay 140 skr (on a internetsite) for a spot.

name: Varberg at the harbour
description: 12 places for staying overnight. 12 Euros per night with shower and toilet (you can use the harbour facilities), dishwashing also.

name: Göteborg Stellplatz
description: Good parking and overnight stay to visit Göteborg. Bus-ship stop 100 m to center of Göteborg. (30 Kr per person validity on all transport 90 min.) No facilities

name: Island of Orust
description: Perfect place if you have to stop to wash in a camping. Not too big, nicely situated with washer and dryer. Nice hiking path around.

name: Camping Rörbäck
description:
During off season(!) a perfect spot. Extremely quiet. Very nice owner! Beach access…
A place to relax…

name: Lelangen lake
description: Nice Spot at the lake. Perfect base for hiking activities. Extremely quiet. No infrastructure except an old pit toilet.

name: Överkalix
description: Park site on the banks of the Kalix river. There is a seating area around a fire pit. Lovely place for a night. Easy access also for big rigs.

name: Forest Road End
description:
Forest Road end with Lake view. Possible to access in 2wd. Some underbody clearence recommended. Enough space for 5 rigs. 
Not suitable for big campers/motorhomes.

name: Sand dunes at Lake site
description:
4wd necessary, lots of space 
Sunset, lakeview

name: Ground Zero 4wd
description: Friendly Independent Land Rover specialist. Diagnostic, advice and repairs on all types of Land Rover. Good knowledge of local area/places to camp. All Land Rover Owners welcome! English, swedish and Dutch spoken.    Tel: +46(0)73 580 79 77

name: Ground Zero 4wd
description: Independent Land Rover Workshop. In need Place to camp. Tel: +46(0)73 580 79 77

name: Windmill
description: In front of the sea. Windy spot. Not for big ones.

name: 172sideway
description:
Next a little lake. Not for big ones.
Just to stop for the night.
Little noise from the 172.

name: Nature
description: Nature spot, fountain with spring water, quiet but close to the pretty village of Grandvillard. Privileged place for paragliding.

name: At the fire brigade
description: Free drinking water at the fire brigade.

name: Harbour
description:
Next the harbour, place for one night. 
Not for big rigs.

name: Lakeside Gimsjön
description:
Very nice place direct at a Lake.
Two fireplaces and a little hut.
But (at least in June) many mosquitos...

name: Nationalpark Dalby Söderskog
description: Parking lot with a toilet. Nice view. No water. No electricity. Beginning of June lonely

name: Hovnäs Ferry beauty spot
description: Quiet scenic location ideal for camping or family picnic. Good forest coverage if bad weather. Table and chairs with fire pit and bin on one branch, tucked away space overlooking the water and ferry on the other. Strong current water. Slightly pebbled rocky beach spot. Fishing allowed with a licence.

name: Rånäs Slott
description:
Cozy high end hotel. Nice curvy twisty roads around for motorcycle.
Spent a romantic weekend with spouse. Afternoon tea and fancy food.

name: Store Mosse National Park
description: Parking Place near to wooden church. Very nice and quiet.

name: Hamra National Park
description: Great wild camping spot for 1 night when visiting the national park, next to the river, with basic toilet and old picnic table. Place seems to be used by fishers sometimes too, several fire pits.

name: Wilderness road
description: Beautiful picnic and overnight location on an old collapsed bridge with small river waterfall and rapids. Has shelter, fire place with wood and picnic table with views.

name: Parking in front of troll park.
description: Very nice parking lot in the park information center. Staying over night allowed.

name: Skateholms Camping
description:
Campground with a good price for Cyclists and Motorcyclists (120SEK per night, prices for 2019) if you just pitch your tent.
Shower is 5SEK/5min.

name: Årsvik Sandviks Camping
description: Nice campground with direct view to the sea! Clean toilets and showers.

name: RentVenture - Next to the see
description:
This beautiful place is quiet and save. Officially allowed to stay for 1 night, maybe 2.
Clear water and even a table exists. Additionally a good fire pit was build by us to make small camp fires save and suitable for here. LTE - Internet is available.

name: RentVenture - Big green legal gras area
description: Well maintained big spot covered by Gras. Garbage cans and fresh water exists. Furthermore a small cafe next to the lake and a nice church are located next to the camp ground. The fresh drinkable tap water is available at the outside of the house of the cafe. The key is right above the water outlet.

name: Lake camp
description: beautiful spot right at water edge. 2-3 places, dead end street along waterfront. One more spot at beginning of lake ca, 500m before this one. Old oak trees for shade. Fire place. Clean. Keep it that way. Some locals during the day. Can be quite windy otherwise some mosquitos around. No facilities

name: Tarnaby Camping
description: Tarnaby Camping. Near river. Good spot for fishing.

name: Osterasen Camping
description: Just an open field for camping. Nice playground for kids.

name: cheap camp with washing machine
description: nice spot near a river. 150kr  per van (all persons, dogs, services included) . One washing machine, one hot shower, 2 toilets for the whole place but it was enough, since it was pretty empty.  If it's full they don't have enough services. Some picknick  tables, restaurant/ cafe right here. water, waze water, garbage bin

name: Lits camping
description: Just a camping, Canoe rent and fishing. Close to road 45,. So: noise!!

name: Wildspot near the lake
description: A flat gravel wildspot near the lake. 100mtr close to road 26.

name: Bexet Camping,
description:
Here you find deep forests, great fishing, excellent canoeing and a nice beach. You can swim, fish, make a trip by a canoe or why not have a barbeque by the lake.

At the camping there are 16 camping places. At campingsite you find clean-service building and showers and a playground for the children. The beach is only 50 meters away.

name: By a lake
description: Beautiful spot at a lake.  Close to the road but there isn't much traffic.  Drive slowly when approaching the spot from the main road as the coordinates will indicate a few meters before or after the turn off.

name: Blåbergets vindskydd
description:
From the E45 in direction Strömsund, turn right before the P sign, follow the disused tarred road and just before the end turn left down the track and follow it to the end.  Very quiet spot and the dog can run around safely.

Shelter for eating. Big table that seats around 12 people. Fire pit. Long drop toilet.

Room for as many as you might be. Even big rigs.

Mobile signal 1 of 4 with 4G.

name: Water from resting area
description: drinking water from outside tab.  You need a canister. Toilets, disposal of toilet box and pickning area. I guess you could stay overnight, but there is lots of road noise

name: Bjornstensholmen
description: A big parking lot very quiet place next to the marina. Appearing like for free, but man wit therminal approached us and charged us 150SEK. Be careful on put his “strip” behind the window to the dashboard otherwise he is ready to wake you up at night. For this amount you got an access to sink, toilet and shower. The place was a bit windy, but with an amount of privacy and eye catching landscape and screaming sea birds in the morning.

name: Nordens Ark Parking
description:
big parking lot for the wildpark. Not very scenic, but ok if you  want to be early here the next day. 
They have sheltered parkings where you can leave the dog in the car in  the shade while visiting the wildpark. Smaller vans fit in there

name: Kristinehamn - Possebergsvägen
description:
Beautiful large gravel place right on the lake, easy access to the water, space for a camper.
Behind it there is larger place.

name: Fågelsjö, Gryssjövägen
description:
Lakefront location providing for fishing. Hut table and fire place. wood available for fire.
No sound except those of nature.

name: Abisko Fjällstation
description:
Possibility to use shower / sauna for 50 SEK p Person

Moreover, a restaurant, a small shop, a laundromat and rooms to stay are available.

name: Bolmen lake
description: A nice place under the trees and 10 meters/ yards away from the Bolmen lake. There is also a smal ramp for light weight boats. Good fishing spot!

name: Water from Public toilet
description: Emergency water source from restrooms. Easy If you have a water hose

name: Lonesome spot on sea shore
description: Beautiful hidden spot between the scrubs 30m from sea shore, 4-5 separate places, very clean - please keep it that way. Open to camp. Nice sunset, no shade

name: Spot at the lake
description: Little spot at a lake. For 1-2 Campervans. But there are more spots around the corner. There are no signs that camping is forbidden. Quite and very few mosquitos

name: Campsite between lakes
description: Very nice spot for around 10 campervans on cutted gras with a very little sandy beach as access to the lake. Very few mosquitos. Some  trees for shade, table and benches available. They ask for some donation as contribution.

name: Parking at lake
description: Big parking spot, with toilets and one picknick table. Lake is 100m away, another picknick table there and official tent campsite. Don't think it's appropriate to spread around the car, But sleeping inside is okay. Close to some houses but still okay. Very little biting flies around. Hiking and biking trails available.

name: Evidensia
description: Pet doctor. Useful before crossing border to Norway.

name: E10 Place to Rest
description:
Small place you can access via gravel / dirt road. Close to the street but quiet.
Place for 2-3 vans.
There is a River below the Spot. Should be good for fishing, permit is sold in Överkslix

name: Wild camping spot next to lake with little beach
description: Small beach used by locals to swim. You can park your car under the trees close to the water.

name: Skrubbabadet
description: Flat gravel parking for 20 vehicles under canopy of trees and singing birds. Trash bins here and pit toilets, swim pier and table a one minute hike down to the lake. A few walkers in the day and very peaceful at night. Bus stop to Stockholm a five minute walk back to the main road. Easy to visit the city in the day and free peaceful sleep at night.

name: Kalmar Guesthamn
description: Official overnight parking lot, about 20 places near to the harbor. Nice castle near. Quite loud during day/night. Price per night: 220, electricity included.

name: Gravel Area
description: nothing here but a big flat space directly underneath the road and next to the railroad. Good option if you are heading to Bergen

name: Picnic place with possibility to camp
description: Very quiet place with great view. Picnic place.

name: Lonely place next to the lake
description: Lonely place, absolutely quiet and that, even though you are only 10m away from the next gravel road. Surrounded by trees in a small clearing right on Lake Ossingssjön, you are completely on your own, especially since there is only room for one parking space.  Fishing only with a fishing license. To make a small fire should not be a problem.  Surrounding stones and dry wood invite you to do so.

name: Quiet wild camp with great view
description: At the end of the forest road when you reach the grass, turn 90 degrees left.

name: Lund parking lot
description: Large parking lot near Lund, about 2 km to the center of the city. Price for 1 day: 40 sek, no sign of prohibitions.

name: Big open field
description:
A big open field perfect for camping. 4x4 needed if there’s bad weather. Space for a lot of rigs. Along the ”Hallandslesen”. 
4G coverage with Telia.

name: sturzis Place
description:
Quiet wild campspot directly at the lake. Easy reachable! 2 little left huts which you can use as shelter (rain) or even sleep integre!
Usable for bikers or cars!

name: Cosy flat place next to lake
description: More nice locations in this area, but this one is super. Place with some rocks to make a fire

name: Hällekis, Hönsäter Hamn
description: cheap parking space (Stellplatz) with toilets, shower ond small kitchen. all you need. A nice gentleman comes in at 21:00 o'clock, you can pay the space (135 skr) with KK and he closes the access gate. You get a code for the servicesroom and access gate. The place is right next to a street and industries, but the noses are ok. Good stay for a night.

name: Södra Bolmen banvallen
description:
Along the banvallen cycling and hiking route there is this large area prepared with firepits, benches, toilet and clearings for swimming. 

Probably not intended for camping, so as always, leave no trace.

name: Big flat place with grass, direct access to lake
description: Beautiful area in Sweden, but many small 4x4 roads closed. Hard to find a suitable wild camp spot directly at the lake. This one is perfect though. Very quiet. No other people here when we stayed here, but room for a dozen vehicles. Some boats on the grass, fire place, some plastic chairs. Big hot tub for winter. Full 4G internet

name: Campsite - Lake Ljusnan
description:
Wild campsite near Ljusnan lake.
Beautiful view. The road is not too close so not much noise.

name: Local swimming spot with toilet and picnic place.
description: Great place to stay for a night or just to have a swim. Toilet available. Can be busy during the day

name: Viken Vindskydd (wind hut)
description: A shelter against the wind for sleeping, fire pit and small beach are present. Couple meters from the Viken lake. Toilet is also present (outhouse). One night’s stay maximum. Car can be parked within 20m next to the road.

name: Lytterstabadet public lake swim
description:
Just outside the fenced in public bath area. Plenty of parking space in the woods N and W of the bath parking. Nice swim in the lake. 
Trash deposit and toilets available for the bathing guests.

name: Vindskydd (wind hut)
description: Nice big spot by the lake with a wind hut for shelter and also sleeping (around 4 persons). Fire pit is present. Bit of a slope to the lake but it’s very close. The spot is accessible by regular car but the road is a bit bumpy so drive carefully.

name: Sibbarp Camping
description: Camp site close to the border to Denmark via the Öresund bridge.

name: Calm spot, lake, table, firepit
description:
At the edge of a beautiful national park. On the road leading here there are a couple of spots where you can park then walk 10m to table w bench and fire pits, as well as this one at coordinates given. Directly at lake. Swimming. Parking spot is on dirt road but v few cars. 
Just up on left is another space, with proper shelters and wood. Here start a bunch of hikes. Recommend stage 9 of Bohuslän trail.

name: Lakeside
description:
Big space near a lake.
Flat. RVs and tent ok. No electricity. Near road but not too many cars.
Beautiful view.

name: Wildcamp in the Woods near the dirtroad.
description: Wildcamp in the woods near a dirtroad. No houses nearby.

name: Badplatz
description:
nicke lonly Placebo near a lake , bench,  firepit  ,shelter,  drytoilet 
only 1 small rig

name: Gärdsjön - Camping
description: A lot of options to camp on the road going to site. Nice lake view, good for fishing and swimming and you can also launch a boat on a trailer. Have fire-pits and a lot of space..

name: Arjeplog
description: Lakeside camp at the end of a dirt/gravel track. Fire ring on the pebble beach. Flat areas for tents under the trees.

name: Water at roadside picknick
description: Drinkwater tap and toilets next to picknick area with some table with roof

name: Björklinge
description: We are parked at the gravel parking 100m past the campground. Across the road from the campground is an open field that could possibly be parked on.  Anyway the gravel parking is perfect.  From the parking, walk towards the lake and in the red building are free showers and toilets which are open from 11.00 to 18.00.  Not sure if this is seasonal. There is also a little shop selling hotdogs, sweets and ice cream.  900m away is a dog beach.

name: Riverside
description: Official Campground near river, 6 places, toilet, firepit. More similar places along Theater river.

name: Offroad Adventure Sweden
description: Campground led by a German family. 7places 30 sek/night.

name: Berglunda
description: Dumping station at a large Truckstop.  Head to the big building housing the showers and cafe (as shown in photos).  Only canisters can be filled up with water.

name: Camp Site
description: Couple of spots by the lake, fire rings present. You can hear the traffic.

name: Near Fjalbacka
description: Kind of ok spot directly to side road near fjalbacka. No traffic over the night. Not even single car.

name: Stellplatz
description: RV park, 10 places, more places planned, shower, toilet, running water, near road, near coast, low price for this area, 100 sek/night.

name: Fatmomakke Natuur Camping
description:
Fantastic place Sek 80.-, loving hospitality in the cafe (fish & waffles are both recommended). Toilets & showers available.
---
Traumhafter Platz Sek 80.-, liebevolle Bewirtung im Cafe (Fisch & Waffeln sind beides zu empfehlen). Toiletten & Duschen vorhanden.

name: Jaravallen
description: very Nice parking spot with lake vieuw.little beach and hiking trials.Nice for wildcamping. Available for big rigs and tents too.

name: Västersjön (again)
description: Various spots next to the lake along a gravel road, this is one of them. Quite big for a van, car, little camper. Fire pit at this place.There will be other campers in the area at summer time.

name: Showers
description: Showers in Karlsberg Marina. Next to midget golf course.

name: Parkinglot Mälardstrand
description: parking and sleeping close to the city next to the river. public toilets close by. Free to park from Saturday 17:00 till Sunday 07:00

name: Lill Spännviken
description: Little Grillplace by the Lake, good for 3-4 smaller Camper, Toilett on Place.

name: Parking Place
description: A big parking place at a lake and the "Naturum Park". Free for small cars. Payable overnight place for big motorhomes. (Pay per Internet.) Electricity included. The lake is not for swimming but a nice view. A little bit noisy from some companys and traffic around. We stay here waiting for Ferry with VW Bus for free and had no problems.

name: Bäveravan
description: Flat ground (old river bed) along forest road. Several possible spots for vehicles and/or tents. Close to the river. In the area there are lots of old hunting systems (pitfall trapping).

name: Forest turnaround
description: Small forest clearing. Far enough away to get no traffic.

name: Swimming and fishing lake
description: Quiet spot with picnic tables  and a fireplace. perfect for swimming and staying a night.

name: Flyxens Badplats
description:
A 'no camping' area at Flyxen lake. It’s an official bathing place so you have access to the lake, however,  it is very shallow at the start. It’s probably known by campers, when we arrived with our tent there were already three of them. But there’s enough space to share this place with others. There also was a portable toilet at the side.
No fishing without a fishing license.

name: Near Smedjevik nature reserve
description: Large quiet clearing in the forest with a fire pit and wooden benches, suitable for bigger rigs as well. Off a dead end gravel road, so no traffic going past and no properties anywhere nearby. Didn’t hear a sound all night. There is a little bit of 3G reception.

name: National Park Parking
description: Parking lot with pit toilet and hiking starts at the lake. There is a really nice place for small vans in off-season in the tent area (59.187906, 17.167911). Fire pit with wood in the tent area:-)

name: Lake Parking Lot
description: Parking lot next to a lake with playground, fire pit and pit toilet. Clear and not so cold water:-) We had a quiet night here with some other campers.

name: Camp with Firepit (Parking near by)
description: It's a Place with a small cabin and a Firepit. You cant reach it by Car, but Google Maps will lead you to a near by Parking Spot. There is room for a small tent, but you can stay the night in the cabin. There is also Wood available for a campfire.

name: Public water dispenser
description: This is a Public water dispenser provided by the City of Skövde. It is free to use and the water quality is great!

name: Wild Camping next to the sea and bunker
description: This is a place next to the Baltic Sea, there’s also a bunker and some trees. In the night it was quite windy, but you’ve got a beautiful view and an access to the sea. When we arrived there, there we’re already other campers, but there’s enough space for more campers and tents.

name: Nice place near the lake
description: AT the end of the gravel road a little gravel parking.

name: Nordanagardens Värdshus, Skelleftea
description:
In Nordana (in the historical church village) a very nice restaurant where you get a delicious 3 course buffet,  (soupe, salades, fish, meat, potatoes, fruit juice, coffee or tea and sweats) for 100skr per person. Don’t be surprised to pay by credit card at the entrance. The owner wants you to leave as soon as you want and don’t have to wait for paying the bill.
The restaurant is open for lunch and diner in June, July and August, only for lunch rest of the year.

name: Falun Mine Museum - UNESCO World Heritage Site
description:
A very good museum really worth visiting. 

NOTE: Additional details added by moderator:

Falun Mine was once the biggest copper mine in Europe and was known as Sweden’s treasure chest.
When the mine was closed in 1992, mining had been going on for 1000 years.
A tour of the mine takes about an hour. On the tour there are many steps, and it is important that all visitors are able to walk without assistance all the way. Temperature inside the mine is around +5ºC, bring warm clothes and comfortable shoes.
All year round the World Heritage House and several historic buildings are open, and the mine walk gives an exciting view over the Great Pit, the town of Falun... 
There are also nice shops, cafés, and a restaurant on the site.
(Source: https://www.falugruva.se/en/)

name: Nice Camping Spot at a lake
description:
Camping at a very beautiful lake. Good for swimming,  also a place to make fire there.
Unfortunatly, the ground is too hard for tent pegs, so we built up out tent in the forest besides to the spot.

name: Block House in the Forest
description: Old blockhouse in the forest with fireplace, table and sleeping for up to four persons. I don‘t remember the exact place but you will find it, when you start at Ösjönäs entry and follow a small track along the edge of the lake in eastern direction for a few hundret metres.

name: Rottnan
description: Nice flat place for 2-4 cars. Narrow road so maybe not so good for big rigs. Not far from the E16 and you can hear it. There is a firepit but bring your own firewood.

name: Frändefors oljehall
description:
A business place specialised in oil and everything around it. What ever you need you might find it here. They do sell diesel (no petrol/gasoline) and it tends to be in the cheaper end. There are different kinds of diesel after which blend you prefer.

The shop that sells filter, oil and so on is open Monday to Friday 07:30 - 18:00. Phone 0521-408 50. Diesel can be purchased with credit card by the pump 24/7.

Look at photo number two to see the different blends of diesel they offer. (Sign in Swedish).

name: Kustvägen Laröd
description: Nice parking spot by the sea with toilets.

name: Mossviken - Mossy Bay
description:
Turning zone on old logging road. Room enough for a couple of small rigs or a few big. Gravel surface. Some more protected from wind than the spot about a mile south of here.

Lots of dead wood lying around.

75 meters to the lake, where you can swim, fish and/or just get fresh water.

4G mobile signal.

Road will not be clearing in winter.

name: Iglasjön vindskydd (shelter)
description:
A gras overgrown parking lot next to a shelter. Room for ample of small rigs or a couple of big. Natural source of water just over 300 meters south of the spot, where there is a resting place for the horses. You can also just hike straight through the forest down to the lake.

The shelter is the type for picnic and not for sleeping. Room for about 10-15 people. The were firewood on the rear of it when I was there. In the middle of the shelter there is a fire pit.

4G with 4/4 bars on signal strength.

name: Långeberga traffic control (weight)
description: Usually not manned. If not, and maybe even if, there is a weight here on which you can check that you are within gvm.

name: Mjälaviken
description:
By the water, electricity and running water in connection to the guest boat spaces. Read information sign.
Also on the other side of the bay its a good spot to stay.

name: Border office Storlien
description:
Has a KGH customs services office.
No office on Norwegian side, this is for both countries.

name: Hätteboda Vildmarkscamping
description: FIND silence, peacefulness, solitude, surrounded by miles and miles of evergreen forest, by the fresh springfed lake Arasjön. Here you'll find Swedens southernmost wilderness camping, far away from stores, banks (6 km) houses (2 km) and civilization. Situated in a  beautiful forest with 2 miles of virgin shoreline, near the crater-made lake Mien in the middle of the cranes and greater loons territory. Here you can wander freely, swim or fish.

name: roads end, vinterskogen
description: The end of a road usualy used to ride horses, few ppl went by walking dogs or just walking by since there are hiking tracks close by.

name: Rössjön
description: A small clearing next to a bypass road near lake Rössjön. Sparse local traffic on the road next to it, but the bypass and the spot are quite private. 5 min walk to lakeside.

name: Toregöl
description: A logging road leading to a small lake Toregöl nearby. The lake is accessible by a short walk.

name: Meadow North of Rosen
description: Forest edge near a clearing made for electricity poles. Accessible by an unmapped forest/logging road going north from Rundstorp Björndalen. Accessible by a van in dry weather, if muddy 4x4 would be a better idea.

name: Kulia-Gunnaestorp Parking
description: Parking directly next to the nature reserve Kulia-Gunnarstorp. Great view over the bay/sea and Denmark. Busy with local hikers/runners who are very friendly. No facilities apart from the toilets at the other nearby parking (to the south).

name: camp next to the river near biggest waterfall
description: wide open space, access to the river, next to dirt road, remotely situated

name: Karl Gustav
description:
For small campers. Very nice place by the lake, with picnic tables. Close to the street and a herd of cows next door.

Für kleine Camper.sehr schöner Platz am See, mit picknicktischen. dicht an der Strasse und nebenan eine kuhherde

name: Stora Hälsjön
description:
very nice place with a view of the lake.

sehr schöner Platz mit Blick auf dem See.

name: Quarry
description:
Large place on quarry with bath / angling lake.

grosser Platz am Steinbruch mit bade/angelsee.

name: NV Midsommarkällan
description:
Plenty of room for a bunch of small rigs. 2-3 big ones. Not much else to say. A slight leaning but you should be able to level your car or tent. Lots of dead wood laying around. There is a tiny stream to the SV. Might not have any moving water if it’s been dry for a long time.

Cellphone 1 bar of four. 3G, barely working.

name: Vänern
description:
Very nice place with a view of the lake. the traffic road right next to it,
 who doesn't mind the street noise also a good place to stay.

name: rest area sandajön
description:
A beautiful place.  Picnic tables available with a view of the lake.
 rest area with toilets
 Overnight stays also possible, close to the main street
---
ein wunderschöner Platz. picknick Tische vorhanden mit Blick auf dem see .
rastplatz mit toiletten
Übernachtung auch möglich, dicht an der Hauptstraße

name: Vänerslingan tourist route (start/end)
description:
At this rest area/high way stop you’ll find the start/end of the tourist route Vänerslingan. https://m.facebook.com/vanerslingan


The tourist route goes between the resting place "Viggen" in Grästorp municipality and on to Örslösa round about in Lidköping. On this route there are many attractions and sights. Here you will find museums, churches, accommodation, motorhome parking spaces, farm shops, places to eat, hiking trails and swimming areas.

The route is carriageable by any vehicle. At this end of the route you’ll find a fighter jet, some tables, a tiny playground and wc. No potable water.

Follow the brown signs with the white flower heading north from here.

name: Beach - Vanderydsvattnet
description:
A tiny beach with ample of small spots for a picnic. About 150 meters walk from the road. Nice place for a dive in the lake.

Fishing is aloud in the lake for a minor cost. Information sign about that at the parking lot.

Mobile signal 3 of 4 bars with 4G.

name: Sagostigen och Rastplats
description:
a wonderfully well-kept clean place at the rapids with a 5 ☆ toilet.  with a lot of love and heart the place is made with a hiking trail.  very beautiful.  Thanks a lot for this.  stayed here one night ... very quiet.  suitable for small motorhomes.


ein wundervoller gepflegten sauberer Platz an den Stromschnellen mit einer 5☆toilette. mit ganz viel liebe und Herz ist der Platz mit Wanderweg gemacht. sehr schön. Vielen Dank dafür. waren eine Nacht hier...sehr ruhig . für kleine Wohnmobile geeignet.

name: Rastplas Enebacken
description:
very nice parking lot also suitable for the night.  is close to the street / intersection.
 with playground, picnic benches ....

name: Skellefteälv
description:
Parking spaces on both sides of the river
 View of the river.  Close to the road, very quiet.  with fireplace

name: vor Renström
description:
Very nice place with a view of the river.
Street is close, but quiet.
Sufficient for the night

sehr schöner Platz mit Blick auf dem Fluss.
strassen nah, aber Ruhig.
für die Nacht ausreichend

name: Norrforsstugan
description:
A nice quiet place. With a barbecue hut, firewood, picnic benches, benches around the campfire in the background, the rushing water from the rapids and a small, cozy hiking trail to the rock carvings.

Ein schöner Ruhiger Platz. mit Grillhütte, Feuerholz, Picknickbänke, Sitzbänke am Lagerfeuer  im Hintergrund das Wasserrauschen von den Stromschnellen und einen kleinen gemütlichen Wanderweg zu den Felszeichnungen.

name: Konstverket Vägabstraktion
description:
Large place on the river with grill hut, picnic benches, campfire site with seats and toilet. Close to the road but quiet.

grosser Platz am Fluss mit Grillhütte, Picknickbänke, Lagerfeuerstelle mit Sitzplätze und Toilette. 
strassennahe aber Ruhig

name: Am Stensjön
description:
A beautiful place with a view of the Stensjön.  Close to the road, little traffic.

Ein schöner Platz mit Blick auf dem Stensjön. Strassennah, wenig Verkehr.

name: Rest place next to gota Canal
description: Next to the bike path running next to the canal. So only the cyclist and walkers sorry. I have seen more of these places along the canal. They seem to have at least an shelter, pick nick table, fireplace and a toilet. (Like this one) next to the bike path but I guess it will dead silent at night. And have a lot of shade

name: Camper site
description: Free public tap for water. Campers cam stay here for max 3 days.

name: Ångermanälven
description: very nice place with picnic areas, shelter with fireplace, garbage can, swimming. Unfortunately, the place was already very busy, as determined as us to continue. close to the street very nice place with picnic areas, shelter with fireplace, garbage can, swimming. Unfortunately, the place was already very busy, as determined as us to continue. close to the road

name: skuleskogen
description:
a hiking parking lot.  the hike is a must.  we arrived in the evening, saw a moose with a calf on the way and the next day we hiked the great hiking trail.

ein Wanderparkplatz.
 die Wanderung ist ein muss. wir sind abends angereist, haben auf dem Weg eine Elchdame mit Kalb gesehen und nächsten Tag sind wir den tollen Wanderweg gewandert.

name: Ankarsunds Fiske och Friluftscamp
description:
Camp run by Ankarsunds community. Grill / Dry hut, picnic tables and dry toilet. Multiple fire places. Good for fishing. Easy gravel road to access. Tents and campers possible.
Lots of Moskitos.
Community asks for little compensation (volunteer)

name: By the river
description:
Small spot right by the river suitable for up to three small rigs. There are two old fire pits at the spot, but bring your own wood. The ground is levelled and flat so ground tents will also be ok.

Shady with some sun.

Mobile signal 3 of 4, with 4G.

name: Till Enviken
description:
Large rest area at Lake Balungen, has picnic areas and garbage disposal. Also good for the night. Close to the road, little traffic.

--
grosser Rastplatz an See Balungen.
mir Picknichplätzen und Müllentsorgung.
auch gut für die Nacht.
strassennah, wenig verkehr

name: Roadside rest
description:
Reststop at the 95 close to the Norwegian border.
Fireplace, Dry toilet and Windshelter.
Old Rest house nearby, emergency use only.
Suitable for all sorts of Campers, 1 or 2 tests possible.

name: OEC
description:
A turn around on old logging road. Plenty of room for a handful of vehicles. Protected from wind. No traffic. Didn’t see any people. Gravel surface.

Mobile signal 1 of 4, 4G+.

name: Ödevata fischning camp
description:
Small but very nice camping for fishing and hicking in the midst of Smålands wilderness - where the woods meet the water. At Ödevata camping Sweden, they have lodges and conference facilities in the nature with access to fishing, outdoor-activities, hiking trails and sauna/spa. Experience nature by land and by lake: Ödevata is the place to get to know nature, relax and enjoy yourselves. 
Max. 15 motorhomes.
Camping open all year round
200:-/night per trailer and motorhome/caravan
50:-/night for electricity
Access to showers and toilet free of charge
The camping has no drain for sewage disposal for motorhomes

name: Polarcircelen Portalen
description:
Sculpture at the arctic circle.
Two Rest houses with wood heating, 10 beds. 2 dry toilets. 
4-wheelers: no turning or parking at the end of the road. Walk the last 200m
2-wheelers: rough but drivable.

name: Badplats Skåre Skansar
description:
Great big place with jetty.
 Close to the street, garbage can and toilet.
 The place was very suitable at the beginning and at the end of our holiday as a parking space for the night.

Toller grosser Platz mit Badesteg. 
Strassennah, Müllbehälter und Toilette.
Der Platz war am Anfang und am Ende unseres Uraubes als Stellplatz für die Nacht sehr gut geeignet.

name: Lake Place near Akervika
description: Area at the lakeside. Great Place. Suitable for a lot of campervan.

name: Havstoudd - Disbanded costal artellery
description:
Great wildcamp with seaview and fireplace next to a disbanded costal artellery gun. The campsite is accessable with most cars. Bigger RV’s will struggle to get through the narrow road and last minor climb. 

For bigger cars it might be not posdible to turn at the end

name: Near lake
description: Small Parking Place 5 Meter to the lake nearby the Road. Nice to stay one Night. You Van swim and make a Fire.

name: Kalix Camping
description:
Campground in Kalix at the Kalix River.
OK for Campers, stay away with tents!

name: Haparandavägen
description:
100m before you get to the parking for the nature reserve on the right side.
Just a place in the woods.
Bring miskito protection.

name: Parkinson Place
description: Small simple overnight parking area. Max 3 campervan. Near the Road. Moin Noise After 20:00.

name: Lakeside - E45 RV90 Crossing
description: Small grass patch, big enough for a camper van or 4x4 with roof top tent. Very easy access to the lake for swimming etc. Evening sun.

name: svärdsjö by the lake
description: Beautiful spot at the lake Svärdsjön. During day time quite busy with joggers and frisbee golf players but in the evening calm and secluded. Several fire pits availavle aswell as picnic tables and a wind shelter.

name: In the woods
description:
Close to the E10, at a sand road in the woods.
Enough space for one camper or 2-3 tents.

name: Svärdsjö gruva
description: an abandoned copper mone from the eightren hundreds. lovely csmp spot with room for several cars or 2-3 mid size rigs. arranged fire place with seating. very secluded, we stayed here for two days and only met a group of two hikers.

name: Börtnan
description: Great wild camping next to a shelter with fireplace and a toilet. Accessable with any car.

name: Frederika Camping
description: really nice campground right on the lake shore. Hot and clean showers, restaurant, cabins available.  Van 180 krona without electricity, washing machine 40 krona, dryer 40 krona. Pets allowed. Some mosquitos around, as everywhere.  Good value for money

name: Idyllic spot by lake Brosjön
description: A lovely spot right by the lake, has a little dock, firewood available nearby, plenty of place for 2-3 cars/vans/tents. Road is a bit bumpy but easily accesible. Especially beautiful with the sun out in the morning, great sunrise, not too windy.

name: Råå
description: parking lot allowing normal cars (no campervans) stay overnight with a nice ocean view next to a naturist (nude) beach. The parking lot is next to an official camping site.

name: Ryttmästarvägen
description:
Very nice place in nature.
Good for swimming, nice little beach.
Possibility to make fire.

name: Kävsjö Village
description: Nice small parking space near secondary entrance to Mosse National Park. Green, no facilities, ca 5 or 6 campers possible. Not for camping, but we rested and slept here for a few hours. You can still hear the road, but a lot less then at the official camper place of the national park. Nearby is a parking place for a small church with trees.

name: Canoe wind hut 2 (Vindskydd)
description: A beautiful vindskydd place on a canoe trail. The wooden shelter with fireplace and some benches is located on a small river. It is part of a series of 6 that are put in place by the fishing society. This one is well looked after and the caretakers come by a few times a week to check up on things. Also they provide a bit of wood and a picknick table. The place is visited by people with canoes, but we could stay there in the van. Road is good for smaller vans.

name: Lake overlook
description: Large clearing in the forest just off the road to Tiveden national park, reached by a gravel road. Another dirt road leads off of it which can be reversed down to a smaller area overlooking the lake, with a path down to a firepit directly at the lakeside. Road is a little bumpy but fine for any vehicle. Flat camp site, very quiet and very beautiful.

name: Wind Shelter
description: Next to a river, space for tents. firering and benches complete the package.

name: Lakeview
description: Wonderful place by the lake; benches, a firering, an amazing view and plenty of perch (-:

name: Adventure Camp
description:
Nice Camping on the water, good for fishing!

Cabins (with A/C)on the river for 350/500kr, camping 150kr.
possible to rent a boat for 50kr

name: Rajskkällan
description: Perfectly drinkable water straight out of the hill. You can’t miss it.

name: Mon
description:
Just a turning area at the end of a gravel track. Some fire wood laying around. Rough gravel surface. Probably a problem if you have a ground tent that needs to be pegged down.

A big rig will fit here if it’s not huge. Plenty of room for small rigs.

Cell phone 2 of 4. 4G

name: Naturkompaniet
description: Store with wilderness and camping supplies.

name: Spraggtjärn
description: wind shelter with fire ring by a lake, very quiet at night. the lake is well stocked with large rainbow...

name: Borgforsens mätstation
description:
Room for two small rigs or one big. End of small gravel road all the way down to the lake. There is a small measuring station at the end of the track, where they check water levels for the hydro plant. Do leave room enough for the staff to turn there car at the “parking lot “ 15 meters before the end of the road. They come every morning to check the water levels. 

Some dead wood laying around, but you better bring some of your own.

No cell reception at the spot.

name: Lundhags Factory Shop
description: Lundhags have been producing quality shell boots since the 1930’s. This is the place where they produce their high quality gear, now also including clothes and backpacks. You’ll also find other general camping and outdoor gear. Bring a big wallet.

name: Tjuvskytten
description:
Definitely not a romantic spot but it works fine for a couple of small rigs or a big one. Further down the road there is plenty of room for turning around and also making camp if needed. Room for hundred rigs down there. :) It seems like if the locals use that area as a local “hillbilly “ shooting range.

There is nothing around here, but some noise from the main road.

Mobile signal 2 of 4 with 3G.

name: Stora Kullhög Beach
description: small and chill wildcamping spot. there is more then enough place for tents around the beach. there is also space for around 10 cars/vans. you are never alone here. the beach and the surrounding smells like dead fish, shells and muassels and bird poop. the birds are really loud. there is a lot of toiletpaper in the woods. pleas take your trash with you.

name: cafe luka
description: here is a small cafe. you can get drinking water from a waterhose for free. they guys are friendly. there is also toilets but you need to order something to get the pin

name: Sommen lake wild camp
description: Great remote wild camp at the end of a well prepared dirt road accessible even for rigs with enough clearance for a 10 cm high dirt bump. The place has a fire pit and the water is very clear. Tried to fish but we weren’t very lucky...

name: Angler camp
description: Old angling spot with fire pit and access to the lake. Shallow waters, not really made for spin fishing or swimming if you don’t like underwater vegetation on your skin. Plenty of space for 2 to three rigs and tents can be put in the grassy ground.

name: Torne Camping
description: A danish guy runs this small and sweet camping spot. He speaks a lot of languages. You can go fishing and kayaking here. 200 sw. kr. for 1 night 1 person. shower extra.

name: Fish - Böda fisk rökerei
description: Here you can get some fine smoked fish. tasty but not the cheapest one. if you are here you should have a try

name: small place in the woods
description: a small parking place in the middle of the woods next to a small street. here is enough place for 2 cars or one really big caravan. have a look at the picture. nothing special about this place. its good to have a quite place for a sleep.

name: public toilet with hot water
description: Clean public toilet with cold and hot water

name: mormors stenungsbageri
description: You can buy some of the best bread on öland here.

name: end of road in the woods
description: end of a road with plenty of space. some smaller bushes are around here. probably better suites for offroad cars. pretty silent here. lake nearby but no access

name: lovely place by the lake
description: a big place by the road. you can park 2m away from the lake. the sunset is just beautiful. some locals tend to go fishing here. clear water. good for swim. 15 meter away a small river flows into the lake. since its direct by the road you can hear the passing cars. you can also hear the river flowing into the lake. a lot of mosquitos in late August. quite a lot fireplaces available. a lot of wood to make fire is available. have a look at the pictures. the 4g mobile signal here is very strong.

name: Rick's & Lena's place
description: Beautiful and deserted place with fantastic views over a lake. No phone reception. Only the mosquitoes can form a problem some seasons.

name: Jonsered
description:
Quit place to stay for a night, no parking restrictions. Surrounded by woods, small grass field and a lake (not suitable for swimming). During daytime often used by dog owners for training of their dogs otherwise no other traffic.
LTE available in good quality.

name: Kållandsö
description:
Beautiful and very quiet place at the coast line in the forest, nice hike possible. LTE available.
15 min. from Läckö castle.

name: Diver's Spot
description: Lot of space (so can be 3-4 other cars) easy access, beautiful view on the lake and fire place!

name: On the Wild Side
description: The square is at the end of a fork in a dirt road. If you want to be alone this is the perfect place.

name: Tättövägen
description:
Tattö Loftahammar campsite, very nicely located, on three sides by the water, two bays, playground, water supply and disposal, clean sanitary facilities, washing machines available, very friendly staff.
250,- incl. power and WLAN.

name: Ävrö
description: Directly on the water in almost maximum seclusion, which is still easily accessible by car.  The street makes a bend to the left here, the place is a bit hidden straight ahead.  Theoretically there is a barrier, but it was open during our visit (probably normal too).  Space for tents down by the water is limited, 2 - 3 vehicles would probably fit on the gravel parking lot.  Absolute quiet at night and only a few cars during the day.  In contrast to the already registered place (a few km away) not directly on the country road and if you don't look specifically, nobody will find you here.

name: Next to Pitealven
description: Small site with established fireplace. It has a couple of good spots for tents. Really nice spot. Remember mosquito spray.

name: 2 Brittas väg, 380 62 Mörbylånga
description: Such a Wonderful place. Difficult and very narrow road to get to. Crowded. But the place is Fantastic next to the sea. Perfect Sundown. There are 3 spots available. Please Keep it clean for everyone.

name: Lake side camping spot
description:
Nice spot for wildcamping at beautiful lake. Close to E45, so you can hear some traffic. Enough space for a few campers or tents.

Some mosquitoes. Light to medium density.

Cell signal; non to 4G.
Big rigs will work, if not some super size 15 meter thing.

name: camping spot
description: Huge place for several vehicles. Next to a parking spot. Here it's much quieter than at the parking spot.

name: Water tap with long hose at harbour
description: Perfect situated water tap around harbour.

name: Parking near lake Ruoksujarvi and near Aurora Lodge
description: Small and even spot for about 3-4 campers, depending on size. Garbage disposal available. Very quiet and nice setting close to lake with hiking trail to the island.

name: Near private castle
description: A perfect overnight spot off the main road in an open field parking, absolutely calm. Short hiking trails available, pit toilet too. Lovely surroundings with unique houses! Free.

name: In The Woods
description: Open space in the woods suitable for a couple of cars. Not for caravan.

name: No Silver
description: A turn around on logging road (equivalent). Plenty of room for even the biggest rigs. Gravel surface. Not much more to say. Easy access for a quick stop. Last stretch probably not cleared if snow. Dam just under 250 meter west. Good mobile signal.

name: Riverside
description: Overnight stay winter + summer with toilet + fireplace next to river. A few fireplaces. Quite clean toilets. Drop off for camper toilet. Ok for one night.

name: MAX
description: Hamburger restaurant close to different shops.

name: Huskyfarm Veijejaur
description: Nice place directly at a Husky Farm. Space for 2 Camper. Great nature around. Please contact the owner in advance. Phone +46 73 097 09 77. Shower also available.

name: Habour Lulea
description: Top view in a nice city: Ten places with electricity direct at the habour of Lulea. 150SEK at a parking lot per night. Pay per App or the boot shop nearby. WC and shower in the building next to the place - closed in winter).

name: Nikkaluokta
description:
At the end of a long road from
Kiruna - the highest mountain of Sweden (Kebnekaise) in view. Lonesome in winter. The campsite offers mostly huts - but there are places with electricity for campers. These are open in winter (best to write an email), WC, Shower and Sauna - 200 SEK.

name: Camp Grinsby
description:
The campground is large and varied, and there are spots close to the water as well as more secluded spots at the edge of the forest.
At Camp Grinsby there are no numbered campspots, you choose yourself a suitable location that suits your needs and desires.
CAMPSITE with seasonal pitches and about 75 touristic pitches
Choose a campspot by the water, in the forest or in the big field …
Stay where ever you would like, close to the lake, on the grass or on a gravel spot.
6 CABINS Overnight basic one room cabins (ca. 15 m2) that sleep either 2 or 4 with fridge, hotplate and kettle.
The 2-beds cabins have single beds and the 4-beds cabins have bunk beds. No sanitary inside the cabin.  30-60 m to the service building.
(No dogs are allowed inside the cabins.)
DOGS Of course dogs are welcome (on the leash). We even have a dog beach where you can let your dog play around, always be aware of other guest who are not so fond of dogs, or who can be afraid.

name: Björknäs Camping i Boden
description: Situated in the center of town. Nice pool area and good service.

name: Veberöd vattenkiosk
description: Drinkable water. Free of charge. No sewage drain just water.

name: Gafsele Bygdegård
description: Inactive Pit-Stop on Road 90 in the near of Åsele. Quiet, a small beach and WiFi for free or paid with the sponsoring-fee of 50 SEK.

name: Mullhyttan
description:
Campsite for tent. Close to a nice river.
Also a shelter and a fireplace

name: Stinnkakebacken S
description:
A small cross section in the woods not far from the lake. Room for 2 vehicles. No idea to venture further down the track. There is no room and you have to reverse out. Road not cleared in winter. Some minor ground clearance  might be good to reach this spot.

Quite dense forest so not possible to pitch tent in the forest, only on the track. Gravel under the thin layer of grass.

Water can probably be found down by the lake, but we never checked it out.

Lots of hunters towers and eating places for the wildlife in the area. Respect the hunters and landowners and we can probably continue to use this spot.

Mobile 4G, 3 of 4

name: Påryd Lantcafe
description: Nice friendly village summer café popular for surrounding towns to visit during warm summer days. Located in the middle of area of lovely villages and old Swedish 15 cth history to be explored. Has a few well prepared hot meals as burgers, fish and ships, salad. Worth swinging by for a coffee or lunch if in area. Fri and Sat open to 2000 other days to 1500

name: Roadside
description: Clean gravel parking surrounded by woods. Used for truck stop. Place for a few caravans. Very close to the road so its noisy. i parked with my motorcycle one night and no problems.

name: Lovely riverside in the wild
description:
An excellent location close to river side after driving few km on dirt road.  
There your will find wind hut with pit fire and wood. Please refill what you use. 
Easy access to river with stone beach. 
Some wooden house on the other riverside but not disturbing. 
Just nature and yourself to listen the trees growing, bird singing and the flow of the river melody. 
Seldom noises of railway far away. 
Place very clean and should remain this way. To be preserved to next overlanders passing by. 
Can be accessible for big ones and RV if careful with potholes. 
Great place for dogs.

name: Sporrsjön
description:
A flat grass area next to the lake dam. At the end of a logging/construction road. Flat gravel do able by any vehicle. Fits for big rigs as well, unless you got some monster size. This spot is on the SW side of the dam. Not all maps got the road leading there. Access is from the tarmac road at a spot 1 km SSE of the camp site. It’s not possible to cross the dam with a 4 wheeled motor vehicle.

Keep in mind that the dam is automatically adjusted so the current can change...

Road might not be cleared in winter.

Mobile reception between nothing and an 1 of 4 with up to 4G. We got that on the roof of the ute.

Medium density of mosquitoes.

Lots of small camp spots én route. And... we saw a wild reindeer.

name: Spruten
description: Natural water source. There is also a shelter, picnic table and a small water fall, 5 meters downstream, perfect for showers.

name: Stor-Rotliden wind power park
description:
Viewpoint situated inside the electric company “Vattenfall’s” biggest wind power park on land. 40 power plants producing up to 78 MW, enough for about 50’000 households.

From the viewpoint you can see a vast area, as far as up to 100 km.

There are signs showing you the way to the view point, but they are bent and pointing all directions.

Visits are not recommended in winter time due to risk from falling icicles from the power plants. Other parts of the years you are welcome.

name: Svartbergsforsen
description: Small fishing spot by the river, nice rapids alongside the campsite

name: Wild lake spot
description:
After 1.5 km of bumpy trail, you arrive to a clear area few steps from small wild lake. Accessible easily for 4x4, and others if driving carefully. 
There is there bench and fireplace facing the lake. Few steps away north there is pit toilet between trees (clean, comfortable) with view to the lake. 
Seems not used. 
Very quiet, mosquitoes if no wind. 
Perfect for few days if well prepared and stock of food. Clear water but with peat bottom. No idea if fishing allowed as seems to be private lake. 
Perfect for dogs as well

name: Stora Skäppträsket outlet
description: Natural water source. Easy access from the road. Water in smaller streams in Sweden is in general potable. Particularly up in the north, where even lakes and smaller rivers can be of use. Common sense as usual... In the south avoid anything but the smallest streams.

name: Abborrträsk byapool
description: A tiny outdoor bath run by the local community. There is a regular pool and a baby pool. Warm shower, a changing room and toilet. All free of charge, but donations are welcome.

name: Abborrträsk fuel station
description: Only credit/debit card. Be aware that this station doesn’t accept MasterCard. Head for Arvidsjaur about 20 km to the NW instead.

name: Holm
description: Parking place in the middle of the woods. For 1 minibus. no other Campers. No infrastructure, quiet.

name: Mosquito à la carte
description:
The name says it all. Bring repellent.

Not a romantic or scenic spot at all but it’s close to town and there is ample room. Just head down the dirt track and there is room for everyone.

Mobile 1 of 4. 3G.

name: Beach
description: Cute little beach close to a nature reservat. It’s right in front of a hill - on that hill you‘ll find a toilet, a fireplace and a shelte.r

name: Near Road on Peninsula
description: Prepared camp with a shelter, fireplace, pit toilet and access to a lake. Beautiful landscape and the sound of silence.

name: Drinking Water
description: Fresh potable water from a spigot. Just make a donation to Greenpeace

name: Beach
description: Flat, quiet, level, fire pit, picnic table, easy access, and steps from small sandy beach - it's awesome!! Surrounded by trees and with amazing East/West views.  There's even a small shelter nearby.  Road around lake is not pavement, but well maintained and easy with any car or bike.  Lake is shallow. Great for dogs to run around. Very limited mobile phone access.

name: Bergsmannijärvi
description:
A turn around at the end of a logging road. Some fire wood can be found but not much. Otherwise nothing there. Plenty of room for any rig.

(The sign at the gate in the fence when entering the road says “close the gate”.)

Mobile: no signal

name: Lost beach by lake side
description:
After 800m of dirty road accessible for all car if driving carefully by RV, you arrive to a sandy beach by lakeside with easy access to water. Fireplace possible, no neighbors, no mosquitoes if windy enough. Place for 2 cars on flat ground. Feel like alone in the wild with astonishing sunset. Good place for kids and dogs. 

If you have a normal car that is low to the ground, you will scratch your bottom. If you are a big wide campervan from left to right it can be scratched by branches. We did not dare to go further with our Kia c'eed.

name: Pitten
description:
A big open area for as many as you might be. Reachable with any vehicle when not snow. Hidden enough. Nothing around accept some left over logs and three car wrecks in a corner. Venture further down the track if you want to stand between the trees just next to the track.

Mobile: 1 of 4, 3G.

name: Albacken
description: A nice quiet campsite by the lake.  sanitary is great.  Ideal place for fishing and other outdoor activities

name: All to dream about...but mosquitoes if no wind
description:
Excellent spot after few km of sandy road...see an issue for RV here. 
Arriving on top spot by lake side. Easy to park in front of table bench, pit fire, hut with indoor pit fire. Pit toilets as well. All done to welcome. 
Even a guest book in the hutt. Wood available but please remember to bring yours to not abuse. 
Lake is simply beautiful and easy access to water with tiny sandy beach. 
Not sure you can fish there as regular patrol of boat all around...camping doesn’t seem an issue as he saw us without any reaction. The big point are mosquitoes which are legions and hungry ( good stock of repellent requières) but no miggs. :-). All in all normal in Lapland in summer :-).

name: Umea  Peem Filling Station
description: At the filling station is water aviable ( see pic)

name: Parking Lot
description: Large grassy lot near public toilets (closed overnight). Lot of space, near the road (very little traffic though), Near the beach.

name: Kubbavägen Dead End
description:
Good gravel road to the end of the road at the lake.
Morning sun. Hiking trail and lakeshore right at the spot.
Folks, please take out what you bring in, this is not a garbage dump.
Can be booked for 200 SEK using the Eremit app

name: Dorotea
description: Drinking water at the filling station OKQ8 (see pic)

name: Malmesjaure
description: Small shelter with benches and a fireplace overloocking the water.

name: Verkasjön lake nature park
description: Small lake with a dozen designated camper/tent places. Busy during the day with local people walking and fishing. At night all places are full during summer season. Mostly with tourists from everywhere. A nice place anyway. Road far enough away and little tragic to not disturb too much.

name: Naturum Ställplats
description: Huge camper overnight parking place (20 plus places). Nothing else, open no shade, but free. Toilets present but closed at night. Good for a night if you want to visit the city or the Naturum Park. Gravel road.

name: Ljungskille Rest Stop
description: Nice rest stop by E6, is separated by trees so the noise is a bit lower. There is area for up to 12 hour parking with picnic tables and standard rest stop toilets open 24/7. Quite a few other campers but not fully packed.

name: Fisherman's campsite
description: Nice spot close to the lake. It has space for a few cars and cones with a fire pit and picnictables as well. No facilities. Quite and calm. Seems like a spot for the locals around the lake.

name: Wild spot by the lake
description:
A very nice wild spot close to lake. 
Stone beach at few steps. 
No direct neighbors. 
Crystal water close to bushy forest. Some remain of old camp fire but place seems not so much used. 
Not too many mosquitoes and road far enough to allow you to hear trees growing :-)
Perfect for dogs, for kids beware of small stone cliff. 
Good mobile connection. 
Access road rather for 4x4 or carful RV drivers.

name: Top location close to wild lake with some facilities
description:
A perfect place close to cute lake surrounded by forest. 
Fisherman association arrange a big fully closed shelter with fire place, pit fire and benches outside. As well a pit-toilet. 
Seems that you can even rent a small cabin with bed inside (closed). 
Perfect place for one night with direct access to lake (rocky access). 
Some wood logs might be available but please bring your own. 
Perfect for dogs. 
Fishing seems subject to paid permit. 
Access difficult but not impossible for non 4x4

name: overlander parking by the water
description: Free parking with ample space for several large RV's. Close to grocery stores and the city center (walking distance).

name: Fogelsjon further out
description: Very quiet spot, surrounded by trees and stones. There is a pretty view to the lake and option for swimming.

name: Nostalgicafé the 50’s
description: A campsite for RV, it is toilet, shower and dish room. In daytime there is a cafe and exhibit.

name: end of forest road
description: at the end of a gravel road in the forest with room for two larger rv's or 3 regular size campers. 150 meters to the lake.

name: Lakeview
description: Nice little place for a Night, locals have their little fishing boats here, firespot

name: Water, garbage and sanitation dump Station
description: You can get free drinking water, nearby are restaurants and a Gas Station

name: Parking lot by the marina
description: Large parking lot next to marina. Camping tables and bbq available. Few mosquitos. Very quiet.

name: Riverside
description: Shelter with fireplace, enough space for 2-3 small tents.

name: Almö naturreservat
description: Only tent camping is allowed. Campers and caravans are forbidden. The parking spot has an altitude limit, so cars that are higher than 2,30 meters have to park 50 meters before the „original“ parking spot at an other parking spot. Near the water are enough space for a lot of tents.

name: Parking near hiking trail
description: Large grassy parking next to the road, separated by bushes. Hiking trail nearby. Dump toilet available. Very quiet during the night, no other campers were there, almost no traffic. (There is another paved parking lot on the other side of the road with camping tables but no toilets.)

name: Rastplats Åryd
description: Parking spot, with toilet and benches, also garbage Recycling

name: Sandaholm
description:
Camping and Restaurant.
Camping is separate next to the lake. nice spots. clean toilets and showers. 4 stars! I cannot change the stars.

name: Skogsby shelter and fire pit
description: There is a shelter and a fire pit with a beautiful view at the lake. 50 meters north there is a flat piece of ground that offers place for a tent or a small camper van. Beware of mosquito's and horse flies during July and August. I advice to bring a repellant or build a fire quickly.

name: Ställplats Rödhaken
description: A small RV place with 4 spots, very nice spot. Not much to service, there is a outdoor shower. It’s cheap, €5/24h.

name: Log road
description: A turnaround for logging trucks, good for one night sleep. 4x4 recommended. Not good for tent because hard ground.

name: Hasselfors badplats
description:
A great public swim site with lots of place for tent and rigs. 

Great Lake view

The water is a bit brown because of streams from the forest, but clean 

Locals come here to swim and fish so expect company when water is good 

A few small spots nearby along the dirt road can be found and more quiet

The driveway have a small incline

name: Vindskyd Holmforsen
description: Absolutely lovely forest place with shelter and fireplace. Part of a kano route - first come first serve, but you have to share space with people who arrive per cano. Not good for cars, perfect for tent. You can walk from the parking spot. about 1 km.

name: Dalslands kanot och camping
description: Nice camping close to lake end canots for rent

name: Lake Värsjön
description: Quite spot along the lake. Also used by a few locals for a swim. A fire pit is available. The water is shallow, you can walk in far. Easy accessible by foot, bicycle and motorbike. Cars can park at a small parking lot along the quite road.

name: Stenungsbaden Yacht Club
description: Stenungsbaden Yacht Club, Södra Stenungsön, 444 48 Stenungsund

name: OK Q8 Gas station
description: Water at Gasstation, in the Vatten & Luft box.

name: Träfikplats Höganloft
description: Dump station for portable toilets, by the restroom.

name: Fägelöviken lake
description:
It took us a while to find a spot on Torsö island where free camping is allowed. This nice spot at a very small beach with fire pit is ok for a small tent or small van.
Water is good for a nice swim. No people around at all, not even on the weekend.

name: Near Hammarstrand
description: A nice Campsite near the river Indalsälven close to the town of Hammarstrand. A Fire pit is here and the ground is mostly flat. The way down here is narrow, so big rigs will probably not fit.

name: (Sweden - 840 31), 440 Forsen
description: Cozy place with dry toilet and a fire place.

name: Längenäsudden
description: Small parking spot next to the sea. More space up the road. No restrictions.

name: St Ristjärn Lake
description:
Less crowded spot then the others around. Did stay here with two small tents. 
Sun in the morning, shade in the evening. Good for a morning swim.

name: Mäfällingen lake
description:
Quite spot along the lake. Good for swimming and fresh water. Access by foot, bicycle or motorcycle. The path to the lake is closed with big stones for cars and camper vans.
Internet 4G.

name: Rastplats on Lake
description: camping with tent/car/motorhome allowed for one day. space for 3-4 campers, there are also other pullouts to stay. quiet at night. tables and benches.

name: Vemforsen Fiskersplats along the river
description: several possibilities to stand for at least 6 mobile homes. quiet at night. places at ground level. shelter with table and bench. fire pits.

name: Latrin - free dumping and water
description: you will need a hose for greywater. Dump and water for free.

name: Campsite by little lake
description: Campsite by the lake with fire pit, shelter & toilet. Careful the gravel road might be too narrow for campers.

name: Stelle direkt an der Ostsee
description:
Schöner ruhiger Platz direkt am Meer
Keine Infrastruktur

name: By the bay
description: We found a good place for our motorhome just a few kms drive away after exiting the E4. There was a hotel there but they let us stay the night nearby. We had a wonderful view over the bay and we were completely alone there. We didn’t ask, but maybe electricity is here possible, too! There was even a shower, but we didn’t try, because it’s a bit cold outside, now.

name: Pinnarp Camping
description:
Nice place at the lake övre Föllingen.
For swimming and canoe and fishing

About 100 pitches

name: Streetside and harbourside,
description:
Many streetside camp spots with water views, walking distance to Kariskrona city centre. These spots are not necessarily only found at the exact given coordinates but also in an area of about 500m south. Looks like some industrial complex had been torn down here.
No charge. Fills up during high season. Water, toilet (free) and hot shower (SEK 25) at Preem petrol station. Nice spot!

name: Smögen public shower
description: Believe it or not, 50m north of this parking lot there are a few public toilets and one public hot shower. It's free, it's hot, it's real! :-)

name: Haverdal shower
description: Free, hot, luxury shower at this small marina. It's  on the back side of the marina club house (closed when I was there), so coming from the parking/camping lots, you have to go around the building.

name: Muodoslompolo campsite
description: Small campsite with a shelter, toilets, (still) water, some 4G reception and place for tents and motorhomes. Plenty place to make a fire. Very quiet road. Some picknick tables.

name: Portbrostugan campsite
description: Small cottage with an awesome view over the lake. No access for campervans, but bicycles and bikes will do fine. Some place for tents ans sleeping in the cottage is not allowed (!). 4G reception is fine.

name: Torsborg campsite
description: Small campsite at lake with picknick table, shelter, camper parking, fireplaces, good 4G reception. 50m from main road.

name: Falun Coppermine Parking
description:
Overnight parking for 195,- SEK with access to shower and restroom. Space for about 24 RVs.
Good for a night and walking distance to Restaurants in the city.

name: Käbbo
description: Big open space on the side of a secondary road. Lots of space even for big campers. Terrain is slightly soft but doable by normals cars and campers. Nice shade all around, no facilities. Road has little traffic during the weekend.

name: Alingegolen Lake
description: Wide area in the middle of the forest, follow the offroad paths for Aligegolen Lake. Road might be slippery when raining, lots of tall grass and mud. Doable with offroaders, probably with campervans with a little caution, the road is not very steep. Less than 10 minutes from Norra Kvills national park. Near lake but no other facilities.

name: Near Brunnshult
description: Right side of the road when you're travelling towards Brunnshult on the M1875. Not too far from the TET

name: hedlandet
description:
4wd recommended.
Just by the lake called "Hjälmaren".
No bathroom, No toilet.
Just a sweet lonley place in the forest by the lake.

name: In forest near small stream
description: After a little daring ride uphill, you will reach an open spot where you can turn your vehicle. The far end the path continues to a stream where there is a wooden bridge so that you can cross the stream by foot. Really quiet place apart from the water rushing through the stream.

name: Bandsjön
description: grass area next to a lake. toilet available, swim platform. a lot of place for RV's and campervans.

name: Lööfs gasol AB
description: Filled a bottle with a German connection. Bring your own adapter for other, ie French.

name: Mangskog
description: 2 lovely Stugas (cabins/houses) with all you need on a very nice family property.

name: Beach and forest
description:
Nice place at a natural reserve. With beach and forest.
On the way to beach you have plenty of places to camp in the forest.
Camping with tent is allowed 24h at beach.

name: Close to Byrum raukar
