description: A quiet nice place in the forest close to raukar and beach.

name: Forest Road
description: Official free camping place in forest. Seven spots, table, pits, quiet and secluded.

name: gyllebo slott castle lake
description:
2.1m max height to enter informal camp ground on nature reserve.
Many spots with tables and pits, beautiful lake camping within the trees.

name: Sneriget
description: Comfortable place where one can hear a rooster sometimes

name: Hilltop with a view
description: At the end of a gravel road, like so many places in Sweden, but actually not bad. Flat, grassy and with a bit of a view. Some walking paths. Good reception G4. No shade, no services, very quiet.

name: Sauna's, Kukkola~forsen
description:
More than 10 different SAUNA huts/houses, where also a international sauna conference is held. 
We stayed on the camping, payed 300 Swedisch Krones, € 30,- for the car, rooftent and 2 adults.
The use of two saunas is included. One heated by woodfire, the other electric. Easy to heat them by yourself, wood is free available. 
Next to a wild river where you can dip in. (Or go fishing) 
Both sauna's were for us alone (because there were no other guests). Also hot showers,  rest room and kitchen. 
On the site is a restaurant etc.,  but i.e. nice restaurant River Side is a 9 km drive (Haparanda).

name: Blaviksjon
description: Rest area with possibility to empty the toilette cassette. No builtin tanks, no fresh water. Also ok for overnating stop.

name: Rosén place
description: Here you can either put up your tent or sleep inside

name: Ställplas Bengt I Orkelljunga
description: We pulled in to these services because there was a camping symbol. Ställplas Bengt I Orkelljunga kindly let us put up our tent. We didn't use power and there are no facilities so they let us stay for free. It's great if you get caught in the dark like us without anywhere organised to stay. Lots of food options around to walk to.

name: Kungsviken
description: large spacious free parking next to a marina.  The place is a protected bay surrounded by mountains.  There is a small shop that opens at 11 am on weekdays.  There you can also buy waffles and coffee.  There is also a waste container at the port.  It is a quiet and safe place to stay overnight.  The road to the site can be challenging for motorhomes over 7 meters as there are some narrow curves on the road.

name: Jannesland. Stode.
description: Beautiful campsite situated next to a small lake.

name: Stausee
description:
It's close the Storfossjön.
Right at a Reservoir

name: Mölle Golfklubb
description: Tap for drinking water just up the path opposite the restaurant

name: Korumpan
description: Parking place on the lake, boat launch with room for 4-5 camper vans, and more private spaces for tents as well. Free. Near the village.

name: Simlångsdalen Rästplats
description: Basic caravan site, no real facilities, but right in the village. Next to a shop and a hotel.

name: Stensjön
description: Nice little place to stay a night on a lake. Near the street 310

name: Abborrtjärn
description: Little place next to the street with a realy clearwater lake. It gives also a little fireplace. Good for staying a night

name: flat beside a lake
description: Litte place to stay a night with a lake and a fireplace

name: Langtjärn
description: little fishing camp with place for 10 cars. Fireplace, Toilette, garbage romm, also possible in winter

name: Spökbacken
description:
Good spot with a nice view. It’s a local ski slope where the parking is on top of the slope. Accessible with a any motorhome but with 4x4 you will be able to get a nice spot by the forest. 

Run by the locals so take care of the place and don’t leave trash

name: Rödvattnet Camping
description: Very nicely located all year round campsite right on the lake.  Nice operators!  We were here in late autumn. No problem with a 7 m rig...

name: Information point Fulufjället NP
description: On the backside of the toiletbuilding is a watertap.

name: Mountain water next to road 84
description: Water straight from the mountain near road 84. On the right side of the road if you are driving in the direction of Norway.

name: seven bar adventures overlanding camp
description:
seven bar adventures overlanding camp.
Indoor dual pit toilet in the short side of the barn. always close the gate to the toilets.

swimming and lake on the other side of the road 400m

obstacle course for 4x4

4x4, offroad trailer, and motorcycle only.

Entry att sign (camp 4x4) can be hard to se. you maybe need to open the fence, it's okay. if you close it directly after you enter can be sheep in there. (very important)

name: Adelso Nature Reserve
description: Wooden picnic table. Level, clear area for camping. At the end of a 2 km forest trail. Right beside lake Maelern on Adelso Island. Great place to launch a canoe from. Be careful with open fires. Gets dry in summer months  with overhead foliage. No services within 5 k. Photo from Easter 2022.

name: vesljunga badplats
description:
beautifull quiet spot near a big lake. 
between the three 's place for 3 or 4 camper vans. more closely to the water you could easily set up youre tent

name: mjöllknabbens
description: nice quit campingsite. nice view over the lake.  clean showers en toilets.

name: åker
description:
Super nice and quiet spot next to a big lake.  in the middle of the woods.  
toilets were closed when we arrived at the end of April

name: Train worker shelter
description: Train worker shelter, with possibility to heat.

name: Karesuando
description:
Next to the general store.
By-Macken Karesuando

name: Campspot and firehut next to TET track
description: Right on the TET Sweden is a cute fire hut, with firewood available.There are also benches and a fireplace outside. Enough space for a couple of rigs. The ground is not really suitable for pitching a tent, but I guess you can spent the night in the hut. This place is very well maintained by locals so please treat this place with respect and keep it clean and tidy.

name: River camp ground
description: Beautiful camp space next to a big nice river. Fisherman used it until early in the evening but after that the place was ours.

name: Camping at a small beach near TET track
description: Small beach at a lake near the TET track. For one car or small campervan.

name: Parking avec toilettes
description: Nice parking space at the top just next to the border. There are toilets, tables for eating and the start of several hikes

name: nice wild camp place (flat)
description: Beautiful open place in the woods, not far from the road, but isolated and sunny. Small track

name: Near Lossen Lake
description: On a small track close to the Lake, pine trees and nice view. Birds and trace of reindeers.

name: Trans Euro Trail
description: Nice quiet spot in the woods right next to the Trans Euro Trail. Two motorcycles and a large tent fit nicely here in a flat spot just down from the dirt road. Bring mosquito spray though!

name: Rindal
description: Free drinking water at Gas station YX and waste disposal

name: Marcus Workshop
description: Repairs to big rigs, all makes. Mechanic and problem solver.

name: Sjönevadssjön badplats
description: Small campsite next to the lake. Public toilet available but very dirty.

name: Nice area at lake
description:
A small area between the road and the lake. Only a few cars passed by.
A small hut is giving you shelter, if it's raining. A fireplace including firewood is also available. 
Brave overlander can go for a swim, the beach seems somewhat sandy.
No mosquitos (mid June), but that could have been due to the wind.
Relatively flat ground for tents. One big rig fits.

name: Cafe Hälla
description:
Nice little café run by a kind Dutch woman.
Coffee, tea, cold drinks and sweet bakery are on the menu.

name: Lakeside view
description:
Nice small spot to pitch a tent or park 1 car / small camper. The spot is level just in front of the lake but the road is steep and a bit wet at the end. Front wheel drive could get stuck. 
Slept here and enjoined the view

name: Bridge view
description: Beautiful place at the beach with view on the bridge and mountains.

name: Prostudden
description: Nice spot by the lake, camp fire spot, trashbins

name: Gunnbofallet
description:
Remote area next to a small waterfall which was the power for a waterdriven mill.
Ground is quite level, but a little wet. high air humidity at this moment. there are some places to sit and relax. 
** DONT CROSS THE WOODEN BRIDGE WITH ANY VEHICLE because it is in very bad condition!! **

name: Ravlunda
description: Quiet wild camping close to a military practice area, but outside the actual area. 500 m from here at road 19 is a resting area with toilet and water. Place for 2 or 3 vehicles. No need for 4x4.

name: Yngeredfors
description:
Interesting field surrounded by trees to set up a tent camp. Little noise from the easy flowing waterfall below the former Yngeredfors dam.
Small car park 100m away from here.

name: Billebjer Södra
description:
Parking spot near a small nature reserve. Very calm, no traffic at all. Hard gravel ground and a smooth grass field for tent camping. Slept for one night. Nice wide view over the wheat fields (be carefull when you have hayfever!).
Trashbin and picknick table available.

name: Near Tjärby Sanddynsreservat
description: In a forest a place for one camper. Very quiet.

name: Quite place by the lake
description: Nice spot near the lake. Also a spot to let boats into the water. Around 10km of gravel road leads you to this spot but it’s worth it

name: Parkinglot next to footbalfield.
description: Parkinglot next to a hikingtrail and footballfield. Good for one night. Almost no traffic during the night.

name: Renhornet
description: Very nice cafe with big souvenir shop of local stuff. we got high quality Reindeerskins here. Friendly staff wich loved ouroffroaders.

name: Bokskogen
description:
Overnight stay allowed. Large parking with more or less even spots. Large playground, bbq spot and rain shelters (if you don’t have camper.)

No facilities except trash can.

name: Holmtjärnen
description: small gravel place next to Holmtjärnen with pittoilet. You can go down to the lake, there is a bridge to a small island with fireplace and table. Fits one camper.

name: Nice river spot
description:
A nice spot beside a river. The road is little used, so it is very quiet. There is also a fire ring.

A bit up the road is a holiday home. As we've been here, there was nobody. But there are enough trees between the spot and the house, so everybody has privacy.

name: Stauseewiese
description: Just a huge place to stay usable for all kind of vehicles. Marked as fishing area

name: Perstorp
description: its a nice place, with a campfire pit, not too far from the road. A nice view on a lake. We stayed here for 2 days and only 3 people came by. We came here with a caravan and it was a good place to stay at.

name: picnic place
description: nice picnic place, water availeble. on the side of the highway

name: picnic place
description: a nice picnic place where you can fill your water tanks and empty the chemical toilet

name: Arlov
description:
NO VEHICLE ACCESS

very good place for 5 tent, for one night

name: Skaudo beach
description: Sandy beach at the end of a dirt track. Signposted of the e45 as a local swim spot. Fire pit available

name: Between lakes
description: Quiet place between 2 lakes. No facilities. Fits large rigs

name: Dimforsen
description: Follow the sign to dimforsen. Place for one or 2 4x4 near the fishing spots onbeheerd dimforsen rapids. Steep entry only suited for 4x4. Fits a big rig if needed put it probably can’t turn.

name: Lakeside
description: Gravel road to the lake. Campsite big enough for 2 tents. Ideal for 1 car, motorcycle or bicycle s.

name: Camping Långsele
description: Nice campsite on the river with small cabins and space for tents and rigs

name: Multi level camping spot
description: Parking lot with a second level with access to the lake. Out of view and out of the wind.

name: Lake Side
description:
Wooded area with easy access next to a lake. 

Fire pit

Enough for 4-6 vehicles

name: Honeymoon beach
description: Found this beach on our honeymoon trip. Visited again 20 years later. Stil as beautiful as we remember. Please keep it that way.

name: Magnarps
description: Wonderful view on the sea, very quiet place!

name: Lila beach
description: Nice place with swimming possibility. 2-3 pitches but uneven for tents

name: Järavallen
description: A nice open space, with a lot of places to pitch your tent.

name: Granjasvallen
description: Nice parking place. In the Sommer a lot of insects. Good place for travelers

name: Sjötorp beach
description: Small parking spot near to a beautiful small beach on the lake

name: Right at the lake
description: Gravel road for caravans, off-road vehicles and motorcycles. At the end a big place for 6-8 tents or 2 caravans. There are possibilities to turn. Water and wood accessible.

name: ipenburg camp
description:
good place for wildcamping 
lake 10m Walking. there is a Firepit. 
good place for fishing and swimmjng

name: Vilhelmina road sign
description: small  wild camping site. benches with a fireplace next to the water. any kind of car fits, 2-3 cars can fit.

name: tent camp joëlla
description:
No vehicle access

nice sunset, camp in front of a small beach. place for two tents. 
there is a fire pit. perfect swimming water. 
try to fish but no succes.

name: Open place next to a lake
description: This is a open place next to a lake. Its in the forrest but nearby houses. Its a field for more overlanders

name: Breviks Camping
description: Beautiful camping spot especially for motorcycles/tents, caravans and big rigs. As motorbiker you get extra discount. Not so many toilets, could some queue there. Campsite is right next to the lake Vättern. When we were there the water was 21degrees and the beautiful beach was almost empty.

name: Hedlandet
description: A beach on the lake, small port and a square of grass to install a tent. also picnic tables and fireplace. not suitable for campers or any engine powered machine.

name: Parking of highest point of the island
description: Small parking place with a small field. On the foot of the highest point of the island.

name: Tockförs lake site
description: Beautiful spot in the near to the official camp site. Direct access to the lake, place for 2 tents or 2 campers. There is a fireplace and table with sitting possibilities.

name: Infront of the naturen
description: Just a parking spot with a Nice view. Toilet in the naturum

name: Kvarnekastjärnet lake (shaped like the Netherlands)
description: A place for a small tent next to the lake. There are a lot of blue berry bushes. There is a fireplace and some stones to build an oven. There is enough wood for a fire. A camper or caravan can be parked at the informal parking place 30 meters away from the lake. Beautiful and quite place.

name: sörsjön
description: It is a gravel parking place close to the road next to the lake with a little beach and with some trees around it. There are some pit toilets and a fire place. There are two somewhat hidden gras place for tents. We stayed for one night, however if you stay for longer you probably won't bother anyone.

name: gras camping spot next to gravel road
description: this location is in the middle of the woods. there are no formal facilities. however it is possible to gather some fire wood and make a smal fire pit if you like. Since it not that far away from a habitats some locals might walk by. great place for a short stay.

name: Open space in forest
description: A little road ending in two open spaces, both with informal firepits. The ground is hard to get your tent mounted on. It is quite and the forest stops the harsh winds. Just like any other forest place, there are plenty of berries.

name: Storbäcken Ställplats
description:
Nice place along a river. 
Costs 5 euros per night

name: Lake view
description: A good spot to pitch a tent, with a fireplace and lots of firewood laying around. A 100 meter walk through the forest allows you to take a dive in the lake (follow the path, shown in the pictures). It is a quiet place, and is big enough to have more tents. Maybe the spot is also available for camper vehicles.

name: Nylada beach
description:
Cut grass area behind the official bathing area might be used as additional parking area on sunny summer weekends. When we camped there, a group of young Swedes also set up two tents, so it should definitely be allowed to camp there. Close by there is a horse stable. If the wind comes from the wrong direction, one might smell that sometimes.
Dogs are not allowed to swim during swimming season.
There is a fireplace and various tables around.
Not sure if the lake water is safe for drinking but probably ok for washing/doing dishes.

name: Stellplatz Malmvägen
description: Official place for campers, gravel ground well kept. Very close to ferry terminals. In city/industrial area. Roads medium busy, shopping next door.

name: 266 97 Hjärnarp, Zweden
description: one of many spots next to the lake. Very nice.

name: One night for Bike
description: small grassy ground direct at the lake. Offraod.

name: Truck stop Ljungby
description: 50kroner for Shower room. 1 code that works multiple times for a day. You can purchase entry code at the gas station vis a vis

name: Store Mosse nationalpark
description: Free parking for campers and in my case tent for 1 night stay. Dry toilet. No running water.

name: Tisarstrands Camping
description:
Beautiful, peaceful campsite by the lake. Proper sanitary facilities, fully equipped kitchen.
---
Mooie, rustige camping bij een meer.  Proper sanitair,  volledig uitgeruste keuken.

name: Bergafjärdens camping
description:
Large, fairly busy site on the bay. Restaurant with simple but tasty dishes.
---
Grote, vrij drukke camping aan de baai. Restaurant met simpele maar lekkere gerechten.

name: Rännuddens camping
description:
Beautiful campsite on a lake. Restaurant with good kitchen. Very friendly owner.
---
Mooie camping aan een meer.  Restaurant met goede keuken.  Zeer vriendelijke eigenaar.

name: Bergafjärdens camping
description:
Large, fairly busy site on the bay. Restaurant with simple but tasty dishes.
---
Grote, vrij drukke camping aan de baai. Restaurant met simpele maar lekkere gerechten.

name: Bergafjärdens camping
description:
Large, fairly busy site on the bay. Restaurant with simple but tasty dishes.
---
Grote, vrij drukke camping aan de baai. Restaurant met simpele maar lekkere gerechten.

name: Shower and Toilet for Truckerstop
description:
Free Shower and Toilettes.
Drinking water.

But you have to drive a little bit into the truck stop. Entrance to showers and toilet is on the side of the "Lack Center" building.

name: Strömbäck kont
description: Wild camping/parking on the side road. Very quiet with dry toilet. Up to 4 cars side by side.

name: Allsåklubben
description: Wild Camping by the lake. Camping itself is free. If you want to use amenities like washing machine, sauna, hot shower, toilet are onetime paid extra. I paid 10EUR/100Kroner.

name: Shelter next to Lasses Grotta
description:
big shelter, possible to sleep inside with (small) tent.
Drinking water available from Mid April-Mid October, fireplace and picknick table in front if the shelter
Pit toilet a few hundred meters away, next to the cave-house, very new and clean, with toilet paper but no light.

Very good access to the parking spot of the cave. Follow the path straight a few hundred meters more, and then turn right. Not sure if it allowed to go there by car.

name: Campervan Park at the Harbour
description: Nice Spot if you want to visit Malmö. 15 min. by Bike to Malmö City. 200,- SEK for 24h incl. Electricity/Wifi/Showers/ grey Water and Drinking Water

name: Naturcamping Mosätts
description: Nice Place at a big Lake. 100 Krones per Night. No Water, No Waste Water, No Electricity. Toilet simple but okay

name: Lake view for tent only
description:
A beautifull place to camp with lake view. You can park a vehicle on the side of the road, but you have to walk a couple of meters to reach this place, therefor it is only suitable for tents. There are no services except for the 2 logs and a fireplace. There is space for up to 3 tents. 

To reach this spot drive to the parkingspot. (There also is a boatramp. If you stand on the jetty you can see the camping spot. (You'll get an idea how far to drive) drive on the gravel road untill you see a small path on you right, it's not far. We parked our car there and walked to set up camp.

name: Ivo klack - open clearing near forest
description: Open area next to forest. Place voor 3 or 4 overlanders.

name: Grandholmen
description: Small place were People’s launch their  boats. Room for 3 cars.

name: Harbour camping spot for tents only
description: Tent spot sheltered  from wind by trees. Next to camping. View over the Harbour.

name: Wild camping at Skrea beach
description: Good spot to spend one night with your tent on the beach. To get there turn left at the parking lot at the beach. Find a small wooden bridge acrass a small river and turn left just afterwards. There is a little spot that is protected by trees and bushes from the wind. There is a toilet and waste bins at the parking lot, but no drinking water.

name: Shelter cabin with campfire
description: super nice place to spend the night, with a sheltered campfire spot and big bench. acces by 4x4 preferred on the gravel road towards here.

name: forest hut
description: nice cabin in the woods with fire option and shelter, 4x4 access only

name: between two small lakes
description: nice spot to stay the night between two small lakes, slightly camped higher with a view. Including fireplace and picknick table. acces is a little small, so no campers.4x4 needed when wet.

name: at the lake
description: nice spot, some other places so it can be crowded

name: parking at swimming place
description: nice spot to spend the night, parking with view of the water and with tent you can camp at the beach

name: Lokal beach
description: Lokal beach. At the day and evening a few locals swimming. In the night quit.

name: place near a lake
description: Multiple spots near a small lake. With some fireplaces and benches. Also for bigger caravans or motorhomes. With a 4x4 you can stay closer to the lake.

name: Gasip Industri en Svetgas
description:
This shop we found because we need an adapter for our stove. It is a nice shop with a helpfull owner full with gas bottles also camping gas, gas pressure adapters, stoves BBQ etc

He also fills LPG bottles and cars.

Http://www.gasip.se

name: mariestad
description: Parking place for type 2 cars. so only for campers or caravans or campervans. big area with view over the lake

name: Skenäs wild camping spot in a large meadow
description: Secluded spot accessible by 4x4 with a nice large meadow.   The green grass was reasonably high which suggests not much is done with this field.   We enjoyed a quiet night.

name: Siljansbadets Camping
description:
a this established campground you can do your laundry without staying at the campground. 1 load of laundry is 40 sek, 1 load of laundry + dryer is 70 sek. you book for an hour fx 2-3 pm. Bring you own detergent. There are 3 washing machines and 3 dryers.
The laundry room is at house 2 on the campground. Booking and payment in the reception (they were really nice), after that you get a key to the laundry room (it is locked). We did not book in advance, all the machines were available.

name: Lysetjärnen
description: Beautiful spot beside the lake Lysetjärnen close to Bengtsfors. Walking trail, fishing, open sauna at the trail. place for motorhomes, tents or hammocks. There is firepits and benches and even an old open cabin. local fishing club and muicipal keeps this place open for wildcamp.

name: Lilleken
description: Windshelter by the lake Lilleken. Beautiful place to camp. place for a couple of cars or campers. Great for tent or hammocks. sometimes firewood in the windshelter. A watering can to extinguish fire. A firepit. Fishing allowed with fishing permit.

name: Multiple Spots along a dirt road
description: Multiple Spots along a dirt road right next to the lake.

name: High coast whisky distillery
description: camping at the distillery, either with tent on the field, with camper on the higher part or glamping. also a good restaurant. if you come with your own stuff, camping is 150Krones and the showers, washing machine, kitchen, etc are yours and SUPER clean ... plus you can go wild with tasting 😁

name: Björköbodarna open space surrounded by forest
description: Turning point at the end of a gravel road.    4x4 recommended.  Superb quiet spot with great views due to some trees who have been cut.    Place is still superclean so pls take all your stuff when you leave and keep it like that.    Ladies this also is valid for your french flowers(papers).

name: Ljustero wildcamping
description: the best (and as far as we could find only) wild camping spot on the island. we spend the night here and took the ferry at the harbour (7 minutes away) the next morning for hiking in the Archipelago Islands. 4x4 is needed to get through the forest and of you drive a little further there is another open spot. it is an open place in the forest and SUPER quiet, we even heard some dear running by at night.

name: Fjälkmossen Circle
description: great overnight Spot in the woods just next to Fjällmossen Nature Reserve, but still outsude of the Reserve. gravel and grassy ground. very Light angle. the reserve offers great hiking tracks. G4 two bars

name: Parking Place
description: Parking for Nature Reserve. Quite popular but quiet spot.

name: Fishing hut & campfire at Lakeside
description: great spot to spend the night, especially when it is colder or some rain. smaller road towards it, so no campers.

name: next to lake with shelter & fire pit
description: spot next to the highest road in Sweden, next to lake, multiple spots, also for bigger cars

name: The longest strip of land inside the lake?!
description: This might be the longest strip of land inside the lake?! you can drive  a long way although past the shelter halfway it becomes Jimny size road. 4x4 needed. you can even walk or bike further until the land stops in the middle of the lake.

name: Huge pullout on Västra Jockfallsvägen
description: Very large off road pullout, perfect for a quick night stopover. We were there alone and even the traffic on the nearby road was almost non.

name: near by lake
description:
Very nice place on a lake beach
Place about 1 Van
Simply toilet

name: La Barre
description: An OK place for overnight, respect it....you'll love it

name: Camping Morteratsch Plauns (Pontresina)
description: One of the nicest campgrounds in Switzerland! The (tent)sites in the little forest are the prettiest ones and accessible with van size cars. There are two big and modern facility buildings with very clean toilets, hot showers, sinks for dish washing and laundry facilities (washer & dryer) as well as water faucets. Power outlets (long cord needed) are all over the area. There is also a grocery shop, a kitchen for use and a small restaurant in the main building. Very nice and friendly owners. Lots of hiking options from the campground. As everything in Switzerland it has its price: we paid CHF 8.50 p/P plus CHF 12/car plus CHF 3.50 for power and Kurtaxe CHF 1.92 p/P all per night, so CHF 41 per night. Wild camping/parking is strictly forbidden in the whole region (actually in whole Switzerland)!

name: Ferienhof Rüti Morschach
description: Farm with beautiful campground. Very nice and friendly owners. Walking distance to cable car Stoos. Stunning vieles and good hiking aerea. Around CHF 20 per night incl power and shower.

name: Grimselpass I
description: Parking lot Grimsel Pass, overnight allowed, CHF 10.00

name: Grimselpass II
description: Parking lot Grimsel Pass, overnight allowed, CHF 10.00 payable at the nearby restaurant, bathroom facilities of the restaurant can be used

name: Camping Rendez-vous
description: Nice Campground next to the cable car station Oeschinensee (beautiful). Around CHF 33.00 2 pax with camper incl. visitor's tax, low season.

name: Camping Carrera
description: Very nice campground above the Rhein Valley close to Ilanz. It's one of the few places without permanent campers. There are two large fields for motorhomes/vans/buses and the like and many grassy spots for tents. There's power and a common building with clean showers/toilets and sinks for dish washing. There is also a little shop and a fridge for use. Good location for hikes and mountain bike tours. No wifi available. We paid CHF 35 per night for a Land Rover, 2 persons and power.

name: Relais De La Sarvaz
description: Per night per person 10 Swiss francs and per tent that includes a motorcycle or bicycle is 10. Plus taxes that was 1 for the tent and .75 per person. Total biil 32.50. Expensive but this place has everything: nice and clean bathrooms, hot water, dish washer, laundry area, kids play area, etc. restaurant and small shop. Electricity is extra. Wifi in a zone.

name: Sportplatz/Camping-Area Niederried
description:
Idyllic, beautiful place on the Aare in the middle of nature. Large meadow with tree shade. The fee of CHF 7.- p / P is collected by the sympathetic Platzwart Siegfried Fuhrer. 

Idyllischer, schöner Platz an der Aare inmitten der Natur. Grosse Wiese mit Baumschatten. 
Die Gebühr von CHF 7.-  p/P wird vom sympathischen Platzwart Siegfried Fuhrer einkassiert.

name: Camping Campofelice
description: 5 Star Campground. Directly at the Beach of Lago Maggiore.

name: Paso San Gottardo/Gotthardpass
description: Parking lot close to the restaurant Hospiz on top of San Gottardo just beside a little lake. Restaurant nearby. Free of charge.

name: Kevin's Workshop
description:
This is my workshop.
If i am not travelling, you might visit me if you run into any problems with your vehicle.
you can also stay here overnight if needed.

name: Türlersee
description:
Big gravelled parking place, very quite, surrounded by forest, the lake is within walking distance, .
Just at the hottest summer days its a bit busy, specially at weekends.

name: Wild Camp
description: Beautiful place for free in the grass

name: Vue Des Alpes
description: On a parking lot, free for 48h. Beautiful view on the Alps.

name: Parking lot / Seegarten
description: Parking lot at Vierwaldstätter See opposite of restaurant "Seegarten" - order the "Knusperli"- they are really great! Quiet. Parking fee: 0,70 CHF/ hour during the night. 1,50 CHF/hour during the day.

name: Badi Seewen
description: Parking lot of the ice rink, for one night it's ok to stay there.

name: Camping Gemmi
description: Nice, familyrun campground. Medow and some trees. Almost no permanents. Good infrastructure. Recommendable. Large spot, car, 2 pax, electricity and tax CHF 40.60

name: Lombach
description: Small spot next to the road. Accessible by 4x4. Very quiet, despite next to the road. Not a very "nice" place (in forest, no views), but very convenient if you don't want to stay down in Interlaken.

name: Mountain and monastary panoramaview
description: Small spots next to small and steep roads. no 4wd needed. very nice view. some are pretty close to the village.

name: Rotegg
description: Parking next to the road. 2 - 3 cars. Very quiet and surrounded by forrest. Nice view to Schrattenfluh. Very good mobile phone reception. Stayed here with the T6.

name: Piccolo Paradiso
description: Very nice campground. Perfect for climbing nearby and swimming in the Maggia. Very quiet. 41 CHF for a California and 2 adults. Very good facilities, clean.

name: TCS Camping Gordevio
description: Good campground. Everything is available that you possibly could use. But expensive and less "cosy" than Piccolo Paradiso just a few minutes away. Also 10 CHF more expensive... we payed 51 CHF for one night, 2 adults and T6. Not worth it...!

name: Gütighausen
description:
Small campground beside the river Thur. No electricity, free fires on the river bench
Big Rig is possible but you must stay on graveled grounds

name: Next to Rhine
description: In Switzerland next to the border of Austria, Feldkirch and next to the highway. Need to arrive close to or after sunset.

name: Trimbach
description: Silent ending of a little gravel road in the woods. The perfect place to stay for one night.

name: Morlon
description: Parking lot next to the Gruyères lake... nice and quiet !

name: Behind the Shooting Wall
description: A very nice quite place behind a shooting wall under some trees directly on the lake and hidden. Just for camping. I think no one saw me, or pased. Even though it's quite in Town. Was there already 3 times the last couple years when I passed by. There is a little trail leading to this secret spot. Or you go just arround the shooting wall to get to this nice quite place. Also quite hidden in fall or wintertime with no leaves on the trees.

name: Old Tunnel
description:
Right beside the tunnel entrance is a big flat spot to camp. Hidden from the road.  it even has a fireplace with some tiny benches. If it rains, there is an old part of the tunnel which is possible to camp inside.
I think it is possible to get there with motorcycles too!

name: Parking Warth
description: It's only a parking. Good for a overnight stop. There's a nice firepit closeby (100m) also a rubbishbin. Perfect point to start a kayak or rubber boat tour on river "Thur"

name: Garage Rentsch
description: Great Toyota garage with experience working on older 4x4s. Very helpful. Best we found in Europe.

name: St Jakob Lift Station
description: Gravel parking next to St Jakob lift station. Quiet place at night next to a flowing stream at the bottom of a fairly remote valley. Nice clean bathroom open 24hrs. The lift station is unattended so there is very little traffic except in the morning when people go up to and return from the mountain huts. The road up the valley is very narrow and winding, but we made it in our LWB Sprinter without problems.

name: Camping Mattli, Göscheneralp
description: Basic campground with basic facilities in beautiful surrounding. 15 CHF for 2 incl. car. No electricity. Showers in restaurant 500 meters away. Firewood for firepits available. Good area for hiking.

name: Parkplatz Basel nahe wetsteinbrücke am Rhein
description: Public cold shower directly at the rine border. Info to public toilets in basel here https://www.basel.com/en/city-map/public-restrooms - on the other side of the rhine (Kleinbasel) there are also parc slots.

name: Chappell Place
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Vehicular access needs to be verified!

Some flat spots for a tent beside a chapel on the main cycling road number one. Chappell was open and could be a save place by a thunderstorm.

name: Stalden Elektrizitätswerk
description: Near the river at a sports center and electricity plant on a quiet parking lot

name: Verolet Accessories Auto
description: Shop with a lot of car parts and other usefull stuff

name: Camping Aaregg
description:
Good camping by the lake, have restaurant, cafe and store. Store closes at 19:00. Clean toilets, showers, good internet but expensive.2 pp and a tent / moto 42 frank per night. 
Tip: pass this camp and see another one on the left before railway bridge. İt seems cheaper option. We saw it late. :(

name: church parking
description: free parking next to church - restroom by the cemetry

name: Fitness trace parking
description:
Parking in the wood
near fitness trail
fire place further up

name: Camping Eichholz
description:
Situated in a quiet, beautiful area by the river Aare, only 30 walking minutes from the city centre of Berne.
The caravan site offers space for around 50 caravans or motorhomes.
The camp is equipped with clean showers and lavatories as well as washrooms, kitchen, washing machine and drier. Barbecue areas are located at the river Aare.
Wintercamping with reduced services available from October - April

name: Gurnigel
description: Free parking and sleeping on a tank shooting range. Beautiful mountain panorama and good starting point for hikes. It is still a fantastic place but from Aug, 02.2019 you will be charged CHF 5.-- per day for parking.

name: Wohleibrücke
description: Gravel parking lot with public toilet directly on Lake Wohlensee. In summer ideal place for swimming. During the summer months, the restaurant is also in operation.

name: Camping Au Lac
description: Beautiful camping site direct at Lake Brienz. Very friendly staff. Free Public Transport to Interlaken.

name: Camping Schützenweiher
description:
Whole Saison Camping. Not very cheap, but verry good Infrastructur.
Restaurants and Shopping for Food and others things nearby.

name: Bois de Coudré
description: Wild Camping with the Van next to the very quiet road. Space for two vans. Nice views. Small stream at 10 meters for water.

name: 4x4manufaktur
description:
Anna and her team are specialized in Landrover but they know other overlanding cars as well. She often accompanies tours in Africa as a mechanical aid /  guide.

www.4x4manufaktur.ch
Bubikonerstrasse 41a
CH-8635 Dürnten
Tel:   +41 55 265 16 16

name: ATW Expeditions-Service
description:
ATW organizes since 1980 guided tours around Africa and have a shop with rooftents, overlanding vehicle and outdoor stuff at that location. If you’re traveling in this area and have some problems, they can help.

www.atw.ch
Bahnhofstrasse 76
3232 Ins
Tel  +41 32 313 44 07

name: Azalaï Reisemobiltechnik
description:
Azalaï is a well known french manufacturer of overlanding cabins (RV). This is the swiss counterpart. Pascal and his team can help you, when you’re in troubles with your camper. (He knows also a lot about the VW Bulli).

www.azalai.ch
Bahnhofstrasse 62a
3232 Ins
+41 79 781 94 29

name: Overland technics
description:
Overland technics are specialized in Landrover (and VW Amarok) but can help with other overlanding vehicles as well.

www.overlandtechnics.ch
Betti 25
CH-8856 Tuggen
Tel. +41 55 534 12 10
Cel.  +41 79 378 86 38

name: burger king parking
description:
big park place next to burger king and some Generale shops.
not so quiet at night!

name: AutoSolar - Solar for Camping and Overlanders
description:
You can find all kind of solar stuff here and also good Lithium (LiFePo4) batteries. Flexible solar panels, cables, connectors, cooling boxes, batteries, solar controllers and much more...

see also www.autosolar.ch

call them before visit: +41 44 999 01 01

name: Fully - close to Martigny highway
description:
Parking lot close to the entrance/exit of Martigny. WC. Perfect stopover to start exploring Wallis.
Possible to stay a couple of nights without being bothered by the police. 
Many biking/hiking trails starting here. It's not written it's not allowed and people overnight frequently. The police never come by.

name: Emme Camping
description: Lovely place at the riverside with fireplace. Stayed here for a night after a mtb tour. Quiet at the time we were there (April).

name: Les rouge terre
description:
Camping tolerated when the cattle is not in the meadow. In summer a lot of people arrived early. No service but night in nature. 
Camping is only allowed on weekends!!! (Fr til Sun)
25 chf par night

name: Räsch
description: Emergency place, no comfort, place in gravel, in slope, and under the bridge of the motorway, therefore quite noisy, by against near the caves of the hermitage of the madeleine https://www.fribourgregion.ch/ en / P15411 / caves-of-the-chapel-de-la-madeleine

name: Grotto al Bivio
description: Great host paula, great local food... polenta, risotto, ossobuco... very delicious

name: Small trail in the woods
description: It is a small trail near Steg im Tösstal

name: Samnaun
description: Storage for camper vans, summer  + winter

name: Lagalp Corvatsch Lift Talstation
description: Parking Lot at Lagalp Lift, Asphalt, Off Saison

name: Restaurant Rössli, Safnern
description: The owner Christa and Kölbi travlled around the world with a Land Cruiser for many years. Christa cooks excellent dishes with local ingredients and makes homemade bread and Pasta. They offer free overnight place in quiet parking lot. Restaurant is closed from June to August 2018.

name: Off Road Accessoires
description:
Sales and installation of high quality off road 4x4 equipment. 
http://www.offroadaccessoires.ch/fr/
+41 22 792 80 00

name: Eglisau
description: Is a nice place whithout all but verry nice for one night

name: Chlital ropeway
description: Very scenic spot in the mountains next to a mountain creek. One-lane access road from “Vierwaldstätter See”, narrow and steep for 8 km, especially the last section (2 km). Definitely nothing for big rigs and the faint-hearted. Doable with 2WD.

name: Cheyres
description: Parking lot. You can park up to 48 hours. nice cycling route.

name: Neuvecelle, lake parking
description:
Just a parking in front of Geneve Lake. No services but in a urbanized touristic area. Parking free 7pm-9am. Many slots. 
Nice view to wake-up.

name: Güpfi - van space in the mountains
description: Just below the mountain "Güpfi" you'll find a nice place to park your van (or a nice spot for a tent) with a stunning view towards Interlaken and Wilerhorn. It's a small road up there, but it's worth the way. Also a great starting point for hiking!

name: Blueberry Hill
description:
Motorhome parking on the real coutryside with a beautiful view to Emmental. In the middle of blueberry fields.
Good spot for walking and biking.
CHF 10.00 per car per night.
Fresh water, dumping station but no public toilet.

name: Monte Brè
description:
Parking d’un restaurant, la semaine il ferme a 17 :00 et ouvre à 10 :00, vendredi et samedi, il ferme à 22 :30 et le dimanche à 18 :00, il faut donc éviter d’y aller le week end, la route pour monter est très sinueuse, et pas large du tout, même avec un defender 110 j’ai dû manœuvrer dans les épingles et le dernier bout est remplis de nid de poule et c’est en gravier, la place pour dormir est en pente, prévoir des cales. Mais la vue est simplement MAGNIFIQUE… 

Parking of a restaurant, the week closes at 17:00 and opens at 10:00, Friday and Saturday, it closes at 22:30 and Sunday at 18:00, so avoid going on weekends , the road to climb is very winding, and not wide at all, even with a defender 110 I had to maneuver in the pins and the last end is filled with pothole and it is gravel, the place to sleep is on a slope, provide shims. But the view is simply BEAUTIFUL ...

name: Garage Mösch
description: Roli Mösch and his Team repair all typ of 4x4-Brands. They do also lots of modifications and other helpful things!

name: Jeanbrenin
description: At the edge of the road, but very very little passage, it is fine for one night, there is the foundation for the horse next to it and otherwise it is overlooking the fields ...

name: Gadmerwasser
description:
Smal place away from the road. No scenic view but beside the (noisy) river. 
Good gravel road from the main road.

name: Old road bend at Route des Ormonts
description: Perfect to spend one night. Shady place without view. Some noise from the nearby road. But there is a little stream where you can take a bath. If you like rockclimbing, here are some routes.

name: Camping Bleiche
description:
Small, simple camping ground. Very friendly owner. Lets you check in and out whenever you want, costs are always the same (10.-/person and night).
Just 2 restrooms, 1 shower, cold water to do the dishes. Very calm, nearby the Reuss where you can riversurf if there is enough water. Thumbs up for this one!

name: La Perche
description:
The best place to wild camp and enjoy the sunset in Porrentruy.
Set in a hill and a bit outside of the city, this is THE best place to enjoy the sunset. The indoor lodging provide 2 fire places but you need to book and pay if you want woodpile. If there are people, you can just climb a little bit more to pinch your tent.

name: Auberge d'Ajoie - Hôtel
description: Nice and quite cheap family hotel between 80/1pers. and 200CHF/4pers. Beautiful view from the rooms.

name: Porrentruy Castle
description:
Porrentruy castle is a Swiss heritage site of national significance. Construction of the castle took place between the mid-thirteenth century and the beginning of the eighteenth century. The oldest part is the thirteenth century Réfous Tower (Tour Réfous). Fourteenth century ramparts survive on the western and northern sides.

Since 1271 belonging to the bishopric of Basel, the castle served as exile residence of the prince-bishops of Basel from 1527 until 1792. The bishops had been exiled from Basel during the Swiss Reformation in 1529, whereas they were able to keep most of their territories outside the city.

name: Camping Seefeld. Fritz. ZURICH
description: Beautiful camping on thé ZURICH LAKE ....

name: Depot 195 - Hostel Winterthur
description:
Hostel with dorms from $36 and private rooms (family rooms, double, single, from $99)
Limited parking on request, outside parking for bigger vehicles (reuqest beforehand!).

name: Saint-Leonard
description: A free public campsite for camper vans (RVs) with free sanitary facilities. A 10,-. CHF is kindly asked/preferred.

name: View over the valley
description: Spot next to the street with a beautiful view over the Rhone valley. There were just about 1-2 cars passing by, so it's very quiet. Small street to get up there but worth it. Totally fine for a quiet night.

name: cute hilltop between the trees
description: We found this wonderful hilltop with an amazing view over the Nationalpark Gantrisch. Just soft grass between two trees with a bench next to it. Guess there are plenty of places like that in the area. Camped there for one night with a small tent.

name: camping next to fire places
description: This place can normally be used for public barbecues or picnic (benches, fire places). No signs indicating that camping is not allowed but street only accessible by foot (we drove there with a scooter anyway). There is even a portable lavatory installed. Camped there for one night in a small tent, it was very nice, nobody complained.

name: like a campingground
description: Drove by this place and saw many campervans. People said that it's free. Next to the street but convenient. Right next to the lake, beautiful sunset. Just perfect!

name: Brunni Ski Lift Parking
description: Level parking lot at the ski lift where you can stay for one night with your car. 5 EUR/ day. Starting point for hikes to Mount Mythen. There are toilets at the lift station/ don’t know, whether they are open all the night. Not very idyllic, but quiet.

name: Sattelegg parking
description: Parking lot at the top of the pass Sattelegg opposite the restaurant where you can stay for  one night with your car. Starting point for hikes to the mountains Chli and Grosser Aubrig. Very quiet during the night, when you park far away from the street in the corner next to the little church. Free. Mobile internet.

name: Travel Quarry Urnerboden
description: It is allowed to drive through the gravel quarry to get to this point at the creek. Free. If you want to “pay a fee”, buy your groceries at the Dorfladen in Urnerboden. Quarry and shop belong to the same family. Mobile internet. Very quiet.

name: Vorauen Camping
description: Very idyllic, quiet place at the corner of Lake Klöntal. Can be crowded during weekends and season. Canoe rental. 39 CHF / 2 persons +campervan. Restaurant near by.

name: Small field in thhe forest
description:
It‘s a grassy patch in the forest. Even covered from the minor road (with about no trafic) next to it. 
Acessible by all vehicles, nice to pitch a tent. There‘s firewood, u just have to collect it in the sourpunding forest. 
Quiet place :)

name: Horgerberg
description: A small parkinglot in the middle of the woods near Zürich.

name: Horgerberg 2
description: Big Parkinglot without timelimit or parkingfee.

name: Rastplatz Aspholz
description: A parking on the A3 just before the exit to Wollishofen (on the way to Zürich). Dumping station is just on your right hand side when you drive in

name: Fehraltdorf
description: A gravel parking lot with a huge oak next to it, you can‘t miss it. There is no parking limitation.

name: In the woods
description: A long parking lot away from the main road. It heads towards a shooting range, so no one‘s around in the evening or night

name: Camping Mulina
description: Very idyllically situated, on grass near a mountain creek, quiet. Very friendly staff. Bread in the morning. 3G mobile Internet. With 28 CHF for 2 persons in a camper van in high season very reasonably prized. Showers extra.

name: National park parking
description: It is tolerated to stay for the night on the parking area of the Swiss NP. Gravel, quiet, free. Water well, restaurant/ kiosk and fire place available at upper parking area approx. 150 m away. Mobile 3G internet.

name: Pe Munt Camping
description: Natural terraced camp site on grass at the edge of the forest. About 1km to the center of Santa Maria. Clean facilities. Quiet. Various restaurants in town, kiosk at the camp site. 14 CHF for a camper van plus 10 CHF per person per night.

name: Riverside spot
description: Very quiet, a few kilometers from the nearby town and swimming spot. Flat and room for a few rigs.

name: Free with Great view
description: Nice area to put up tents, next to the forest with a nice view.

name: Wangen an der Aare, Right on the River.
description: Nice parking right on the river opposit the lovely small old town.  Only 2 km to the Highway A1. Perfect for a overnight stop. CHF 5.- for 24 Hours.

name: Restaurant Walliser Keller, Swiss Alps Cuisine
description:
If you coming back from travelling the world or you make a stop over in the historic part of Zürich and want to eat the best Fondue, Raclette or other Swiss Specialities, you should go to this beautyfull Restaurant. Martin, the General Manager, travelled the Panamericana by LandCruiser for almost 3 years, until April 18. He loves to meet and talk to Overlander.
www.swissalpechuchi.ch

name: Nice Place to stay for one Night Next to the Rhein
description: At the end of the Road is a parkingspot with a bench! Next to the freeway, a Bit noisy!

name: Col du Pillon
description:
Parking of the 3000- Glacier gondola
They let you camp here if you buy a lift pass. Toilets are usable during the daytime

name: Shooting House Oberglatt
description: Nice Place in the Green close to the Airport

name: Hochwacht
description: Small parking just before the road is closed for public traffic. Quite location for an overnight stay or a base for a hike. Not far below is an old traditional restaurant. Accessroad is narrow an steep but paved.

name: Wild Camping with fireplace
description: Campground at the road with a fireplace, Space for 2 vehicles and a 5km long small road leads to this place. Just follow the yellow signs toward "Feuerstelle".

name: Beautiful spot in the woods
description: Beautiful spot in the forrest above Nivo. Not far from the highway to or from San Gottardo. Fire pits available. No facilities.

name: Kleintierpraxis ACR (Veterinarian)
description:
Veterinary clinic for cats, dogs and other small animals. Long opening hours incuding saturday morning. 
Phone 0041 52 202 80 00
Web www.kleintierpraxis-acr.ch

name: Jak. Bösch AG
description:
Skilled mechanic who is specialised on Land Rovers.

adress: Untere Bahnhofstrasse 29, 8340 Hinwil
phone: 0041 44 937 47 63
web: www.boesch-defender.ch

name: Autoland AG
description:
Supplier for Land Rover and Santana spare parts.

adress: Zürcherstrasse 53, 8620 Wetzikon
phone: 0041 44 934 60 00
web: www.autoland.ch

name: Gespannservice GmbH
description:
Motorcycle mechanic who is specialised in sidecar bikes, especially Ural and Dnepr. Also has Royal Enfield.

adress: Botzen 17, 8416 Flaach
phone: 0041 52 301 24 00
web: www.gespannservice.ch

name: Camping Profi
description:
Lange shop for camping and caravan equipment. Not the cheapest.

adress: Giessenstrasse 11b, 8953 Dietikon
phone: 0041 43 322 58 58
web www.camping-profi.ch

name: Le Goille
description: At the end off a step small road. Water tap on place.

name: Giswil
description: Parking-Lot for 3 big Campervans, near the Road, but save and its officially a sign for Campervans. In the near (250 m) you can get fresh Water an empty your grey/black Water. Toilettes you will find by the church up the hill or maybe in the restaurant nearby.

name: Freshwater & Dumpstation
description: Freshwater, Washroom and Dumpingstation (no Toilette)

name: Camping Talacker
description:
The camp site is situated in the nice village Ringgenberg in the heart of the Bernese Oberland on the south-facing side of Lake Brienz and just 5 minutes drive away from Interlaken.
The lovely and well-kept campsite is located about 50 metres above the picturesque Lake Brienz on a sunny and idyllic grassy terrace. The pitches are terraced, not parcelled out, and bordered by meadows and woods. You will find peace and quiet, a calm oasis, in the middle of nature.

name: Water + dumping  station at autobahn parking
description: Water/dumping station/toilet at autobahn parking

name: Parking lot on seaside
description: Nice parking lot suited on the Vierwaldstättersee with a public toilet nearby. 7 chf per day, free at night.01.11.-30.04. parking for free, 50 parking lots. Quiet at night, a bit more busy when beautiful weather.

name: Camping Les Grottes
description: Small nice campground next to the caves and the dino parc. Clean facilities. Restaurant over the road. CHF 30 for 2 incl. elec.

name: Car park by the Rhine
description: Car park next to the boating club which has a beautiful quiet and country setting. Big rig friendly and has rubbish bins available.

name: Camping Rausenbach
description: Nice and clean campground also for small and big RV's. Close to the Lake. Very calm in the night. Hot shower.

name: Parking lot
description: Big Parking lot next to the lake. Free from 8pm to 8am. Clean plublic toilet in 3min walk (47.483463, 9.478451). Nice walk at the lake with fountain.

name: Col du Marchéruz
description:
Admin Note: Might be necessary to ask for permission.
A small gravel road going from the paved road into the woods. With the van we were able to drive in about 100m, you still hear the traffic but you don’t see the road. With higher clearance you could go much further. And the farmer passed us and didn‘t seem to care... lovely place, especially in spring!

name: Parc Bourget
description: Parking lot with a nice Park arround. Its for long time Parking. Moderate Taxes from 0800-1700, after this time its for free.

name: Saignelégier, Marche-Concours south-west-side
description:
Parkinglot on the southwest-side of a big historic building. Restaurant "Cafe du Soleil“ aroud the corner. 
Services less then 1 km to the east. 
Exzellent area for biking and hiking as well. A lot of horses in the area.

name: Aire de repos de Reconvilier
description:
Very quiet and nice highway park & rest. Maximum 15 hours parking allowed although I doubt it is enforced.
The place is huge, it has modern toilets, games for kids, an arboretum and table/benches for picnic.

name: Villeret
description:
Gravel parking, for Camping Car and
Hiking People.

name: Camping Lindenhof
description: Very nice and quiet camp site on a orchard. The owners are very welcoming and friendly. In high season they also run a small shop. You find every thing you need at this site and it' all very well kept. There's also a fridge and free WiFi.

name: Camping Giessen
description: Great remote place right to the river. You choose your site in the shadow or the open field. Most of them have a fireplace with grill. Very good hiking possibilities.

name: Les rasses
description: Endroit près des remontées mécaniques, calme et tranquille, nous y avons passé une bonne nuit. Impossible l’hivers.

name: Malcantone, Migleglia
description: Nice parking in the green at the border to the village, free parking, flat, toilet at the station of the cable car 100m away, restaurant 80m away, calm and very sunny. No troubles with locals, they are very nice.

name: Sounds of water and townbells
description: From “main” road drive down a gravel road, you pass a steep road on right down to an alpin hut, you continue until you reach a turning area, which is a fine quit spot for wild camping. You hear a smaller waterfall near by, and the townbells from Lungern, when ringing:)

name: Lac de Joux
description: Beautiful, quiet parkinglot next to the lake. On all the other parkings on this road there is a sign "camping prohibited” but not on this one. Parking is free for 10hrs.

name: Forest edge
description: A small road leads up to this perfect place next to the forest. The view at sunset is amazing although you hear the highway quite well. Wouldn’t stay too long there but for one night it’s perfect. A rubbish bin is right next to the camp site.

name: Santa Maria in Calanca
description: Small parking area in the wood suitable for mini van. No other services. Very shadow and fresh.

name: Fafleralp Camping
description: Big Parking place with also an green Terrain only for Camping.

name: Moto Schmid
description: Motorcycle and 4x4 mechanic. Marcel works on all brands. Has plenty of experience on overlander vehicles. Speaks German and English. Possibility to camp next to workshop if needed. Fuel station, car wash, shops and railway station are within walking distance.

name: Trient
description: A great place near the river front of glacier Trient.

name: Parkplatz an der Aare
description: Big Parking Place with Pique-nique Area and river nearby!

name: An Alternative to the Parking
description: If you don't want to stay at the parking of the National Park it is a good alternative.

name: Oberi Bire
description: Beautiful and quiet parking with views of the mountains. In summer the fountain is filled with water (no drinking water). 30min away from the climbingrock Poyet.

name: Rhein River
description:
Coming from Landquart, take a right on to the dirt road, follow the road into the woods. There is an older building with a parking spot right next to it. Little bit hidden, people don't see it very good. No signs about no overnight parking or forbidden camping. So you're good to camp here;) 
Also super close to the river (30sec walk)
which lets you freeze off your butt even in summer. Also nice to dance through the forest in the rain;).
Wouldn't make fire there, cause it's a parking spot.

name: M.Gilgen Garage Autoelektro
description:
Car maintenane and electrician specialist especially for VW Transporter / vans.
www.gilgen-autoelektro.ch

name: Camping Osenbach
description: A very nice and big camping with a lot of trees and shady places. Very recommended. Sometimes you can have a meal for 10€.

name: Waterfall view
description: Nice wild Camping near the kleine Emmen (River) and right at the front of e small Waterfall (10m). Noisy from the water and sometimes from train where are at the other side of the river!

name: Tiefenbach Wildcamp
description: On the Road to the Mountain is a small Place to setup camp. No Traffic so far.

name: Schwengimatt Panorama
description: Asphaltet parking lot with an amazing panorama. Fire pits and big swing next to it. Narrow road. Nice hikes! Enjoy!

name: Lea’s Waschhaus - Laundry
description:
Super clean self service laundry with great machines. 
Open: 
Monday - Saturday 
7am - 10pm

name: Camping Jungfrau Lauterbrunnen Switzerland
description: Nice campground, Family run, clean restrooms. Affiliated restaurant with decent prices.

name: Restaurant Fliegertreff
description:
Nice Cafeteria, with view of the Military Airport. 
Good cheap Food for Swiss standards.
Nice to see FA18 Hornets and other Military Airplanes.

name: tcs parkplace
description:
parking area next to the road!
some traffic but quiet at night!

name: Plang la Curvanera
description:
Very nice place above Savognin. Accessible over a small road. 
Parking lot for hikers. 
Firepit with wood and chemical toilet on site.

name: Camping Waldhof
description: Nice little campground. Good for 1 or 2 nights before you visit Zürich

name: On the shore of Lake Sarnen
description: very nice campsite right on the sarnersee. Open all year round. It is a bit expensive, in the high season about CHF 50.- in the winter half. However, it is worth spending a little more money here. Mountains, Lake and Lucerne all very closed. 2019 they made an award for TOP Campsite.

name: Fälmis
description:
almost leveled parkground!
you can park 24h .
very quiet.

name: Forest Street
description: It’s a small forest road almost half way between the villages Neuenstadt and Prägelz on "Route de la Neuveville“. There you‘ll find a small gravel place where you can park. It‘s no official parking lot, but there is no sign saying, that you can‘t camp there for one night. After 50 meters driving is forbidden.

name: Lions Club BBQ Spot
description:
A beautiful spot right at the river Rhine in the forest. Access is a bit difficult to find because there is only ONE route all other options are not open to public traffic.
There is a BBQ  place with seating and a few flat places close by. There might be people having a BBQ since it is a public place. At night, you should be alone. It is only suitable for an overnight stay. See photo for access details. A GPS might lead you there via closed roads. Last 2 km are good gravel. Due to this and space limitations only small vehicles should use it. 200 m back up the road is a hut with an accessible chemical toilet

name: Dogana di Ponte Chiasso
description: Custom Switzerland-Italy. If you are in Switzerland and you want reach easily the city of Como you can go through this customs.

name: Le Creux
description: An open space that's quiet and remote. It is only suitable for 4x4 or smaller campers. It's on the end of a small gravel road and there is a generous supply on fire wood found around it. Only for one night recommended

name: Ze bar
description:
Really nice bar and brewery. They serve their own beer (10 different beers) ,beer based cocktails (like a Beerito), homemade lemonades, cider, and... Probably more stuff. Small stuff to eat. 
Live concerts sometimes.
Opening hours: 16-20hours BUT stays open as long as there are people consuming!

name: Waldhütte Besenbüren
description: Great spot at the edge of the forest, right next to a small cabin with drinking water fountain. We've camped here several times, always quiet & very peaceful.

name: Kappelle Emaus Parkplatz
description: Big parking lot under huge trees, next to a forest with a vita parcours-trail and a charming little chapel. Lots of people walk their dogs here or go running, but if you park at the far end of the lot, it's very quiet&peaceful.

name: Höchhand
description: highest peak of the "Tössbergland" and not very well known. the top is flat and plenty of space for  tents. the view over the whole "tössbergland" is breathtaking. 1h walk from the next parking lot and just a short one with a bike. we also talked to the owner of the alp and he's ok with wild campers :).

name: Camping   Schwändital
description: It is a small Campground. Very nice in the mountains and very quiet.

name: Picknick place
description: Beautiful for picknick, hiking, just relax

name: green van spot
description: On a tiny road from Alpnach to Siebeneich you find a quiet gravel parking space. No restaurant nor toilet nearby.

name: Kempthal gas station
description: All amenities such as dumping, fresh water

name: Parking lot at junction
description: Close to some beautiful biking and hiking routes at the junction

name: Hüribach
description:
Nice little spot along a small creek (hüribach).
More places and parking lots along the small road, just drive up further. Has even a toilet (toitoi) and firepit for barbecue. Quite lovely place, but I bet it can get crowded on summer days.

name: Small spot by the creek
description:
Small spot, fits two or tree tents. Tucked away between bushes and trees, hard to spot from the road. 
Right by a small creek where you can go for a dip. 
Stayed there for two nights. Parked the car close by, next to the road. You can’t drive down, but it‘s not far to carry stuff.

name: Free overnight parking spot next to Rheinfall with lots of trees
description: Free and nice, large parking lot for free next to Rheinfall. Lots of trees and no one bothering

name: Riverside
description: A small flat spot between a small river and the street. There is enough space for only 1 small RV. The street is not too busy and because of the river you don’t hear the street that much. Very calm and a nice spot to spend one night.

name: Moleno
description: nice place directli at a river.... disadvantage next to highway....

name: Water-Reservoir
description:
It's a nice and flat parking spot. Good to stay over the night with a small bus.
Turn right from the main road in to the forest.
only the beginning of the raod is on Google maps but just follow the road in to the woods after 100m you reach the reservoir and the parking.

name: Lukmanier wild
description: Right under Lukmanier Pass. Idyllic place next to small stream

name: Little Woods
description: Its right after the curve (or before, depends from which side you come from) and then you can turn right on a gravelroad, then drive till the end (ca. 50m). Here you can park save and hidden, there is only a little noise from the street but not bottering

name: Lac de l'Hongrin
description: Nice place close to the dam. There are many places also with fire-pits.

name: Kläsihof
description: Privately owned Campsite with lovely owners. Camping on grass, facilities are available. Very chill and quiet, good for a rest or start a hike. Pricing was 25 CHF per night for our big rig and it hasn't showers.

name: Luzern-Neuenkirch
description: Gray- Black water dump Station. Pass the Gas Station and next to the Staff car parking. Unfortunatly no sign and unmarked.

name: Bergrestaurant Ahorn Alp
description:
The Ahorn Alp is a summit in the Napfbergland at 1,136 meters above sea level in the municipality of Luthern in the canton of Lucerne and borders directly on the canton of Bern and the municipality of Eriswil. From the maple you have a wonderful view over the Swiss plateau and the Bernese and Central Swiss Alps. The Ahorn Alp can be reached by car from Eriswil and Luthern.
______________
Die Ahorn Alp ist ein Gipfel im Napfbergland auf 1'136 m.ü.M in der Gemeinde Luthern im Kanton Luzern und grenzt direkt an den Kanton Bern und an die Gemeinde Eriswil. Vom Ahorn hat man einen wunderbaren Ausblick über das Schweizer Mittelland und in die Berner und Innerschweizer Alpen. Die Ahorn Alp ist mit dem Fahrzeug von Eriswil und von Luthern her erreichbar.

name: Fireplace by the river
description:
Beautiful spot right next to the river. Enough space for three campers and two or three tents. 
More spots along river, close by.

name: Berschner Wasserfall
description: Beautiful waterfall in the middle of the forest, for free. 20 minutes trail upriver. There are two different trails to go there, it's visible on the satelite. Enjoy!

name: Au abord du camping
description:
Official campsite and possibility to park for free downstairs near the lake.
Toilet, lake, playground, ...

Camping officiel et possibilité de se garer gratuitement en contre bas proche du lac. 
Toilette, lac, air de jeu,...

name: FC Nidau Parking
description: Nice place near the Lake und beside a channel.

name: Forest parking
description: Huge parking lot inside the forest and next to the road. Used during weekends as parking lot for football matches in nearby ground. Fountain with drinkable water across the road, lots of possibilities for long walks around, 10 minutes drive from Biel.

name: Paradiesli
description: Place where two little rivers come together. Picnic-Site whith firepits, tables and a toilet. Perfect with children to play at the river and try to wash some gold in the river „kleine Fontanne“.

name: Next to Maloja Pass Road
description:
A small dirt road leads down from Maloja Pass road to a wooden bridge and a creek around 100m. Signalisation is for hiking trails but there is no prohibition for vehicles. When you pass the bridge there is a small flat area for small rigs, also easy to turn. It's partly visible from the main road. It's quite high and even in summer cold at night. Camping with a tent could be possible, I'm not sure about to local law, at least there is no sign. I parked my motorbike and slept in a hamock. I had no issues with the farmer who drove by. 
And always keep in mind: Leave No Trace!

name: No camping in this area
description:
According to the police wild camping is not allowed in this area (Engadin).
Signs have been posted everywhere.

name: Lac des Toules
description: Nice place away from the street with great views.

name: Gerbe Camping
description: Wonderful, small, farmer camping place with pool, playground for kifs, barbecue place and a lot of animals. 30min to the lake, 5min to the next village.

name: Stellplatz Orpund
description:
On Friday, June 26, 2020, a parking space was opened in 2552 Orpund near Biel. It has space for 7 campers, supply and disposal, electricity WiFi and a super good location. Price per night 20 francs. Electricity and fresh water costs according to consumption and information on site.
For three months there is a garden pub at the square where various items can be consumed. In addition, the place is located on the Aare and is therefore ideal for cycling and hiking. The cities of Biel, Bern and Solothurn are easily accessible. Take the opportunity to get to know the beautiful Bernese Seeland on your trip through Switzerland.
Coordinates: N 47 ° 08 ′ 09 “E 7 ° 18 ′ 28“
--
Am Freitag, 26.06.2020 wurde in 2552 Orpund bei Biel ein Stellplatz eröffnet. Es hat Platz für 7 Wohnmobile, Ver- und Entsorgung, Strom WLAN und eine super gute Lage. Preis pro Uebernachtung 20 Franken. Kosten für Strom und Frischwasser nach Verbrauch und Angaben vor Ort.
Während drei Monaten gibt es beim Platz ein Gartenbeizli wo Verschiedenes konsumiert werden kann. Zudem liegt der Platz an der Aare und ist somit ideal zum Velo fahren und wandern. Die Städte Biel, Bern und Solothurn sind gut erreichbar. Nutzen Sie die Gelegenheit bei Ihrer Reise durch die Schweiz das wunderschöne Berner Seeland kennenzulernen.
Koordinaten: N 47° 08′ 09“ E 7° 18′ 28“

name: Passwang/Zingelen parking for hikers
description: Nice  parking between meadows, good starting point for hikers. During the day, traffic to the mountain restaurants in the upper valley. Mobile internet. Waste bin near the cow grid.

name: Hotel Belvedere Furkapass
description: Next to a famous old hotel after the Furkapass, there is a parking lot with a great view. At night, all the day tourist are gone so no worries to sleep here.

name: Furkastrasse
description: There is a tap free to use next to the parking lot.

name: Wild camp by the river
description: Nice spot to pitch a tent in the woods beside the river. Access from a path leading down, there are enough flat spots to pitch a few tents. Very quiet - you're visible from the pathway above but very few people use it and nobody disturbed me. No vehicle access to this one but there are a few places a van could park/camp slightly further south along the river.

name: Perfect Spot at End of Valley <3,5t
description:
Perfect overlander spot. Quiet, flat gravel parking in the meadows /wood, nearly at the end of the valley. Beautiful views. Nice hikes. After Innereriz access is limited to 3,5 t/gravel road. Rare mobile internet. Waste bin.
Don’t miss to buy cheese at Drüschhübel Alp.  And don’t forget to pay the fee.

name: Picnic/BBQ area with hut
description: Amazing spot with space for 3 barbecues, lots of benches and a sturdy hut with two large benches and seating inside. There's a fountain for water, plenty of firewood and the views are spectacular. No vehicle access but you could park not too far away. There's space for freestanding tents, and woodland just behind it where you could also camp if you wanted somewhere more hidden. I just slept inside the hut on top of one of the tables. Very quiet from the evening, no one around. Great spot!

name: Twannberg
description: Beautiful and quiet area, the hotel has been closed down for at least 5 years. No sign saying not allowed to park.

name: Camping Sonogno
description: this is a parking lot where camping is officially allowed if you purchase a permit (24 chf per day) from the tourist office

name: Location Rösa
description: Theres a small road (not sure if private, no signs) going into the forest. After about 20m there is a little space to park. There is a footpath to a house a little lower. We didn't see it at night and there was no one there as we found out next day. You can hear the close road but a nice spot to stay overnight.

name: legal wild camping
description:
Legal overnight camping on trekking parking. 10chf to be paid in coins.
relaxed atmosphere, only cow bells to be heard

name: Lac Bleu
description:
Beautiful small mountain lake. A 30min hike from the main road, no technical difficulties.  Perfect place for a picnic. 
Can be hiked in a loop from Arolla, a bit more technical but secured with ropes. Breathtaking views.

name: Camping Arolla
description:
Supposedly the campground at the highest elevation in Europe. 
It’s the perfect base for several hikes and climbs. Hiking for all levels, beautiful views, plenty of space. Can spend multiple days here :)
Open from May/June to September. No reservation possible, no numbered places. 
Check their homepage for all details.

name: San Gottardo Lake
description:
Near the lake there are many spots on both sides of the OLD mountain pass gravel road 
where you can find your favorite place. On grass. We just marked the “best” spot right at the lake. Depending on the wind direction no/tolerable noise from the NEW busy mountain pass road. Nice views. You can also pitch a tent here. Crowded in high season. 4G mobile internet. 
Nice hike to the small lakes/ Laghi d'Orsirora above the pass (about 500 m in height).

name: Eichelspitz
description: Great place to stay - and quiet.  Good for one night. No drinking water - you may contact the farmer nearby: Werner Gerber.

name: Predigtwald
description: Good place to stay for one night. Nice walks from here. Not forbidden, but may be not more than one place so far

name: VOLG Hagendorn
description:
Quiet place for one night, no services, grocers VOLG which has everything.

Beautiful wildlife reservate walk D starts here...

name: River side
description: Big flat place next to a forest and a river. Stayed for one night. It was very quiet. On the other side of the road is a restaurant.

name: Rocky Fireplace
description: It is a very nice place with a fireplace and a few rocks. it is situated next to the main road. Use the long part of the road to access. During the day you hear many cars and motorcycles but at nighttime it is pretty quiet.

name: Emosson Barrage
description: Parking space at the lake emosson, wonderful view, toilets nearby

name: wyler bauernhof
description: i nice big gras spot on a farm.nice view surrounded by mountains

name: Lai da Burvagn
description: Next to a lake. The access road is narrow and only suitable fro small campervans. It‘s a grassy place with a firepit. Do not swimm into the lake!!

name: Nice spot at the edge of the forest
description: Place at the start of a lot of walking trails, lots of dog walkers but very peaceful. Nice place

name: Parking Chalet de la Dole
description:
Steep and narrow road leading up yet most is one-way. 100 m behind the obvious parking along the road (follow sign) in a large and level  clearing with fire ring. Very quite at night but on weekends it can get crowded by hikers during daytime.
Great hiking to the summit of La Dole or try the restaurant La Barilette at the end of road, great view on the Alps and Lake Geneva.

name: MALOU CUSTOMS
description:
4x4 Shop and Garage. Specialized on Jeeps but also other Off Road Vehicles. Small family owned business.
Open Mo-Fr: 10:00-12:00am & 1:30-6:00pm

name: Röllin
description: Helpful for any kind of emergency or service

name: Fire place and benches
description:
Quiet, secluded spot in the woods above the lake. Very quite. comes with fire pit and benches. Firewood provided for free.
enjoy and clean up your site afterwards

name: Picnic area
description: Picnic area along which the Via Francigena path passes. Has a table, on which I slept. All around it is all vineyards and woods. Drinking water fountain at 200m, at the stop sign overlooking the Cantonale Route. (see other label)

name: Drinking fountain
description: Drinking water fountain next to the Route Cantonale

name: Jägerbänkli
description: Great place, quiet. There is a fireplace and a table. Ok for one night. No signs...

name: Simplon Pass Summit
description:
NO VEHICULAR ACCESS!!

Immense pasture of lawn and small shrubs up to 15cm high. I slept in a tent, there are scattered pines and few flat spaces. Along the Simplonstrasse there is a car park with public toilet open all day: in men 2 toilets and 2 sinks. You can park your vehicle there or on the edge of the many lanes leading to the farms.

name: Saedel
description: Great. Quiet. Good view. Will be good for a stop over 24 hours... like this place. Fireplace

name: Pizzamiglio customs
description: Customs Switzerland-Italy for vehicles in both directions.

name: Krückhaldenweg
description: Nice and quiet. Saw another Camper there. May be place for two cars, better not stay longer than 24 hours. Don't use too often - actually it is still legal. Fireplace is there. A little Creek nearby, beautiful for children to play there. Really lovely. Restaurants and Shops some km in Kiesen and Wichtrach (Niederwichtrach). No littering in this paradise please!

name: Free dump station
description: Free dump station for gray and black water (originally for buses but RVs are allowed too). Potable water for free as well.

name: Rheinau Waldkindergarten Grillstelle und Platz
description:
Square of the Rheinau Waldkindergarten. Bookable at the municipality of Rheinau, shelter, ToiToi, water connection (register with municipality), electricity possibly also, large fire pit, stairs to the Rhine
.....
Platz des Rheinau Waldkindergartens. Buchbar bei der Gemeinde Rheinau.
Unterstand, ToiToi, Wasseranschluss (bei Gemeinde anmelden), Strom evtl. auch, grosse Feuerstelle, Treppe zum Rhein

name: Zinal Le Rousses
description:
Large parking space at the end of the road. Winter seems to be the busier time of year but you can park and camp here year-round. 
Parking is paid at the meter and is half price in the summer?!

There are picnic tables and fire pits nearby plus the river that runs next to it. It's an ideal spot to start a hike or just relax. 

You can pay for parking with credit cards too.

name: CamionREP Iveco MAN
description:
Large mechanical garage mostly for heavy trucks, but they gladly accept lighter trucks. They also have extended knowledge of campers and can help especially in the field of electricity (as I was told).
