It's not cheap, but as they say, each minute will be used wisely for the most serious and smart repair. Check Google comments.

name: Wild Camp near Forest
description: Drive on the field path and you will see the spot. Space for one car.

name: Rossgrabenbrücke
description:
Nice place. But just notice that it is a protected nature reserve. There are quite a lot of fireplaces around. Beautiful Schwarzwasser river. Nice to be here if it’s warm. Walking along the river only if there is good weather, because you have to cross the river. 
And be careful when sleeping here. Don’t stay close beside the riverside. The water level may change quick. At least 1.50m above the river level. Its a serious problem here if there is heavy rain.

name: Roadside
description:
A place at the side of a small road. Good view over the lake and into the mountain. Not far from the village, but still quiet.
Good to stay for a night if visiting Tecino. 
Negative: next to the road.

name: Airolo
description: It is a small street with a good view over the  valley. Perfect if you need to sleep near tge Gotthard.

name: Parking above Zurich
description: A parking area not far from Zurich, free to stay and with a forest nearby.

name: Parking
description: A small parking area with good view over the lake.

name: Farner Parkplatz
description: A simple and quiet parking. Good Restaurants in walking distance.

name: Les Charbonnieres
description: authorized parking lot close to the lake

name: Parking-Camping Gfellen
description: Camping on a gravel parking area between a pass road and a river. There is a public barbecue area as well. The spot is somewhat cold as it is situated between two mountains so the sun sets early and rises late. Plenty of traffic, especially motorcycles.

name: Neuchatel motorhome parking
description: all facilities perfect and clean parking Form several vehicles ;walking distance to city of neuchatel and lake

name: Camping de peches Le landeron
description: professionel motorhome and campsite close to the lake of Biel

name: camping Miralago
description: A very nice camping for all kind of people, also welcome are dogs, very good sanitary, laundry, bar, restaurant, swimmingpool, and it is directly at the beach. Kinda pricey.

name: Morschach lake view
description: Parking near Morschach, beautiful view over the lake. Many hikers during the day, but silent in the night.

name: Valle di Lodrino
description:
Big place. very quiet. Possibility to walk and climb.

Water from river, very nice view of the top of the Riviera.

name: Valle Lodrino 2
description:
Beautiful place with beautiful view over Biasca.

Place for tents, car...

name: Medels
description: Big place with potable water in Medels to fill vehicles

name: Cascata Piumoga
description: Quiet site to see the waterfall, little lake. Place with table, bbq, toilet, garbage, water. In summertime you will be able to swim.

name: Eistlebach
description: Great and quiet. On the other side of the river possible too. Please take care about the nature, no littering. May be better one night only. Don’t stay close to the river for camping. The water level changes in seconds.

name: TiCamper
description:
Garage for Campers and 4x4
Repairs, Services, Shop 

+41 091 840 12 38

https://www.local.ch/it/d/cadenazzo/6593/ticamper-sagl-EWMdGvPbaX6n1N7zpJu8AQ

name: BR Motors 4x4
description:
Best Mechanik for car, specially 4x4, campers. 
Very big workshop with lot of spare parts. 

ARB

https://www.brmotors.ch

name: Streetlegends Garage Ammann
description: Garage specializing in US cars and off-road vehicles. But also any other repairs

name: Forest Parking
description: It’s a parking lot in the forest. It’s hidden from the road. Good for one night.

name: Seegasse, Kirchdorf
description: Nice little parking spot next to graveyard and school. About 3 minutes walk away there is a lake with outdoor shower and benches.

name: Monte Tamaro
description:
You need to take a cabin lift, or climb the mountain to reach here. There are various possible activities, such an adventure park, a zip line, sleighs and more. I found the more interesting is this church built by world famous architect Mario Botta (see pic).
At cabin lift's departure, there is a big water park with spa, great for both kids and parents.

name: Stand Biasca
description: Quiet place in Biasca. Very good for transit.

name: Gravelground by the River
description:
It‘s a gravelground parking. There is no „camping forbidden“ sign. There is space for about 4 cars/vans or 2 big campervans.
Its next to the river so bit noisy and 100m away from the road but the road is really quiet.

name: Giswil
description: A nice place to stay for one night, outside the protection zone of the Laui river.

name: Parking lot
description: Nice place in the forest. There is a picnic place about 300 m away. but you can't drive there. There is also a fresh water fountain and a toilet. At the parking lot is a river.

name: Camping Sternen
description: Big campground for residents. There are few parking spaces available for overnight camping. Just ask.

name: Camping Chapella
description:
Very big, well managed site.

Hot clean showers and facilities, huge amount of sites with power. 

The whole campground is very well kept, spacious has all amenities and facilities, kids playground. Great vibe amongst campers. 

Property has beautiful clean river running through it. View to amazing mountains all round. BBQ sites. 

Good wifi.

Fresh water, grey and black disposal sites. Gas cylinders to buy.

Paid total for a motorhome with 2 adults +1 child, electricity, tax... (all in)
36CHF.
Card payment available.

name: Near Rhein River.
description:
There is a parking lot with a sign that is written 'parking for 12 hours'.
We came around 17 h. had a wonderful time having a bath in the Rhein River down the path. About 100m walk. There were people around till 21h.
We made our meal and went to sleep. Good and silent. Only few cars passed nearby on the road. Good for one night.

name: El Azteca
description:
If you traveled through Mexico and all the „Mexican“ restaurant in Switzerland have been a big disappointment so far, don’t fret!
This place is legit! Run by a Mexican the food they serve is probably as close to Proper Mexican food as it gets! 
Go here, sip a margarita, eat totopos, and relieve the good times from México!

name: Talstation Pizol Matells
description:
Parking Lot of a Ropeway Station/Skiresort

You can Park here for about 20$ per Night. Every Person older than 16 cost about 5$ extra. 

No Trailer, No Tents

name: Parking 11 - Hohmatt
description:
Large gravel parking at the so-called Hohmatt in Macolin. A restaurant is close by, lots of possibilities for walks, biking and country skiing in winter. There's a swimming pool open between June to September 15 minutes walk away and a grocery store 20 minutes. 

No amenities, so pack up in advance and make sure to leave the place pristine before leaving.

name: Camping Sur En
description:
Cozy camping on the Inn river. On the cheap side for Switzerland, also with special one night only spots. 
You can freely pick the place you want, there are no numbered places. 
Great area for hiking, Bus to Scuol once an hour, firewood available, great sanitary installations, spotty WiFi. 
Maybe not the best place for tents, there is not a designated tent area.  
Big rigs: there’s a covered bridge leading to the campground, the Postauto fits but nothing wider or taller (3.3m clearance, 16t). Great base for hiking. 
Open all year!

name: Berghaus Splügenpass
description: Very nice proprietors for info about hikes

name: Mühlehorn village, in front of the train station
description: Parking for the night directly at the Walensee. Close by is are two toilets: At the swimming place (there is also a cold shower, pls don't wash dishes there, the locals don't like that) and it's not drinking water) & one toilet next to the curch. It is a bit noisy (train & clock tower). But very beautiful and practical.

name: Parkplatz am Strand
description:
Area for overnight stay, parking fee 1Fr per hour during the day (payable also in €). Beach with sunbathing area and toilets, boats and beach volleyball.
.....
Geduldeter Bereich für die Übernachtung, Parkgebühr 1Fr pro Stunde während des Tags (bezahlbar auch in €). Strand mit Liegewiese und Toiletten, Boots erleichtert und Beachvolleyball.

name: Lac de Vernex
description: Small quiet Lake with space for one or two cars and a tent. Access road very steep.

name: Egger
description: Simple established campsite. On a small farm. Perfect place to visit Grindelwald and it’s surroundings. Next to railwaystation. Campsite has watersupply, toilet and shower. The really friendly owners can make your stay unforgettable. We paid 35 francs for a pitch, two persons and tourists tax. Not all pitches are flat.

name: Large Picnic Spot
description:
Large flat Picnic Spot with wooden tables and benches. The place belongs to a municipality but it says on a sign that it is free for use. Has even running water and two fire pits. There is a toilet but it is locked. Keys available at the municipality.
Beautiful scenery.
Plenty of space for several vehicles or tent.

name: Parking along road
description: Parking lane along the road, max 10h during daytime, no restriction night time. Lot of traffic during the day, rather quiet at night.

name: wild camp at river
description: very quiet place next to river. if you have 4x4 you kan also camp next to river

name: View on Churfirsten Range
description: On Tannenboden Alp Parking (flat only for one or two cars). Restaurant nearby. Sound of cow bells during the whole night, you have to like it.

name: In the forest next to a huge stone
description: Take the dirt road behind a beautiful little church. spot right in the forest. can put 2 or 3 vans and camp all around the huge stone. and fire ring. close to the village but hidden. no sign "camping forbidden"

name: Luzzone
description:
Beautiful spot directly by the Luzzone Lake. 
Water from natural source, fish and swim in the lake.

name: Parc Vertou
description:
Flat public parking situated between a nice park on the lake side, and a wastewater treatment plant. Stayed 2 nights and can say there's hardly any foul smell coming from the plant.
Parking is allowed max. 10 hours during daytime, no restriction at night, free of charge. Very quiet, great views. There's a toilet with washbasin and dust bins.
Large vehicles : can be tricky more than 6 meters (mine's almost 7), make sure to only use one space, it gets very busy during daytime and people will feel offended if you use two spaces.
P. S. Police regularly make a round at night but do not bother campers; let's see how long this lasts.

name: Wald-Stdllplatz-Rhodania
description:
Nice parking space on the Rhone, right next to the outdoor pool.
Free seats,
Twint or local cash register.
--
Schöner Stellplatz an der Rhone, direkt neben dem Freibad.
Freie Platzwahl,
Twint oder lokale Kasse.

name: TSC Camping
description: Pretty quiet for tents and a lot of space. Paid 40 CHF for two people and a motorbike. Quite costly but very clean and beautiful!

name: Waldcamping Landquart
description:
Large campground, well-equipped and easy to deal with

grosser Campingplatz, gut eingerichtet und sehr unkompliziert.

name: Parkplatz Ballenberg
description:
On the 2nd parking lot at the east entrance of the Ballenberg open-air museum. Camping allowed from 4:00 p.m. to 10:00 a.m. - pay CHF 10.- for the night.
Depending on the visitor, the parking lot can still be a little full with cars at 4:00 p.m. Place is a bit sloping, but very quiet at night.
Toilets at the ticket office / shop from the museum were very clean.

Auf dem 2ten Parkplatz beim Eingang Ost vom Freilichtmuseum Ballenberg.  Campen ab 16:00 bis früh um 10:00 erlaubt - bezahlen von CHF 10.- für die Nacht. 
Je nach Besucher kann der Parkplatz um 16:00 noch etwas mit Autos voll sein. Platz ist etwas schräg, aber nachts sehr ruhig.
Toiletten bei der Kasse/Shop vom Museum sehr sauber.

name: Ägerisee, Lac Aegeri
description: Very nice spot with view on the lake and a lot of walking trails around. Easy to get on the place and to park.

name: Urnasch
description: The village has a very long parking space along the river, free, quiet, very few cars.

name: Pony Ranch
description:
The Pony Ranch is famous for their Western Style Music Events and the local Food-Restaurant in the middle of a quiet forest.
Large Parking Space for small and big rigs.
Nice place for walking in the forest, near the town of Biel-Bienne
The Restaurant offers a WoMo-Dinner and Breakfast, with stay over night.

name: Motor Legend Swiss
description:
Land Rover specialist garage
Contact : +41 27 764 10 28

name: Grass
description: Plain grass area 30 meters from the road, hidden by the woods.

name: Ferme Hohweid
description:
Idyllic, quietly situated pitch between a cattle pasture and a small vineyard on the Hohweid organic farm. One minute's walk above a private barbecue area on the edge of the forest, with a view of the Jura chain and sunset. Ideal starting point for hikes (Mutzbach waterfalls, Oberbühlchnubel viewpoint) or bike tours. Electricity and drinking water connection, benches, fire bowl with barbecue, WC available on the farm premises. Use of wood sauna on request. Direct sale of Bio Natura Beef. The "Glungge", where the films "Ueli der Knecht" and "Ueli der Pächter" were filmed, is right next to the Hohweid organic farm. In the cosy Glungge-Beizli under the old lime tree (self-service) you can enjoy snacks and drinks. By appointment only via Whatsapp/Telephone
Open April - October
3 pitches

name: Fribourg
description: Parking next to cemetary and shopping center. 0.75 SFR per hour. bus stop to down town 10m walk in front of ice stadion. Quiet specially all the way at the end of the P.  City gardening staff will start early morning causing some traffic.

name: Prilly-Malley
description:
Not sure how long this one's gonna last. There are many very old washed out boards boards saying parking is not allowed, one even says it is reserved for ambulances. Fact is it is being occupied free of charge by workers of firms around since months if not years.
Stayed here three very quiet nights. Very convenient if you have any business in the area. Buses or trains will take you anywhere.
Just make sure not to reach here before end of day when all cars are leaving or you might not find a spot. Some are level, some not so. Also discretion is advised to avoid attract unnecessary attention.

name: Dump Station and Overnigth for Caravan
description: CHF 25.- for two Person incl. Dumping. Just Dumping is CHF 5.- checkin via free Wifi

name: Castello di Sasso Parking
description: Quiet Parking with a view and fountain for Water.

name: Garage STC
description: Mechanic workshop specialized in Land Rover but also knows other car brands

name: Camping Delta
description: Bigger Camping with newly renovated ablution blocks and beach to the lake.

name: parking by the River
description:
Small parking lot by a river next to the highway and train line. Good as a rest stop or overnight stay. Between horse fields on a small side street. Not a hidden place.
--------------
Kleiner Parkplatz an einem Fluss neben der Autobahn und zuglinie. Gut als Rastplatz oder Übernachtung. Zwischen pferdekoppeln an einer kleinen Nebenstraße. Kein versteckter Platz.

name: Centre Sportif Colovray
description:
This is a 15h parking allowed on both sides of the road. A few other campers here too.
There’s a water fountain and access to the lake with toilets.

name: Waldparkplatz
description: Quiet parking lot, near the dog club. Access only permitted from Niederlenz.

name: Camping Le Bivouac
description: Camground at the bottom of the ski resort called Les Paccots

name: kleine Emme
description: Spot in the forest next to the river "kleine Emme". A little hidden from the road and there is a fire pit

name: Mountains
description:
(Old) parking place between the mountains . Used to be a parking place but it is not anymore, perfect place to park your van. Some scouting kids walked by but said hi and everything was just fine. 

It rained a lot so it was a bit muddy. Hopefully,  less mud when the weather is better. 

Short unpaved path but doable for normal cars or vans (we have a Ford transit, no 4x4).

name: Off Road
description: Area for camping with small tent, bikes or motorcycle, just off the road. Nearby hiking trails and waterfall. Great for a quick overnight visit.

name: Toni s ski museum
description:
On two levels you discover amazing private ski museum and the old traditional equipment. It is an open place with gratis entry. 
One of the best we have ever seen

name: Up to Morschach
description: Steady pace for two cars - beautiful view and left into the woods is a bench with fireplace

name: Regula & Felix Road
description: Small spot (3 Camper) with a small river, fire place with fire wood and a trash bin - some horsefly- but the view ist nearly perfect: huge waterfall

name: Route des montagnes
description:
Moderator Note: Place might be private property. Please talk to the locals.
Nice place to stay for a night into the wild

name: Camping Reussbrücke
description: Campground with some nice spots for motorhomes, trailers and tents. Small pool, playground, covered barbeque pits.

name: Raststätte Münsingen
description:
Sani dump, balck and grey water.
Also for Casetten Toilets.
Freshwater station at the same place.

name: Hidden camp
description: A nice secret spot in the woods. Flat area for around 2 “normal” size vehicle. Also perfekt for motorcycle travelers because you can get out of the rain at the entrance of a cave.

name: Picnic area by the river
description: There's a little picnic place by the river with a wooden bench and signs of a campfire. Good spot for wild camping along the Veloroute 4! You can be somewhat seen from the bridge nearby but there's not much traffic and when I was there, nobody seemed to mind that I was camping.

name: Meadow behind a forest
description: Nice spot between the train tracks and a forest. It's flat, nice view, there's a creek with crystal blue water right next to it that you can easily access. Basically nobody can really see you except for the train conductor of the train that passes by every hour, shouldn't be a problem

name: Foresty hill
description:
I camped here right next to a hiking trail, in the evening 2 people came by but didn't mind. In the morning just as I had packed up my stuff a whole school class came by! Other than the hiking trail being there you can't be seen from the road or from a farm or anything if you hide behind the hill. Absolutely stunning views of the mountains here, incredible. 

There's also another hill right next to it that has a lot of trees on it, where you're perfectly hidden and invisible, even from the hiking trail. Only thing is that the ground is covered in pine cones and sticks and it'll be a bit of a challenge to find a completely flat/even piece of ground there but should be possible.

name: Campground Cevio
description:
Basic campground next to a river. Nice quiet grasfield which can host 30 vehicles.
there are toilets but no shower.

very close to a very nice waterfall and a bicycle road.

costs: 20 Francs per night.

name: Le Coucou
description:
Parking in Caux above Montreux. Amazing views on the lake, the alps and Vevey. Ascension is pretty steep, do take the road from Montreux.
There's a public toilet and a fountain delivering chilled drinkable spring water.

name: Col de Jaman (Jaman pass)
description: Just fantastic! Lovely road to reach but totally crazy me taking the one via Les Avants with out 7m camper... We'll take the road via Caux on the way back. We just climbed the Dent de Jaman, which took about 3-4 hours go and bacjy, a real must with breathtaking views.

name: Les Bains Payes
description: Public toilets and hot showers, free of charge. The showers are probably only open during the warm season though, tbc.

name: Gottardo
description: Established camping with space for tents, caravans and campers, plus 4 rooms for rent. Facilities include toilets, showers, laundry, electricity, WiFi, swimming pool, restaurant, bar, bakery

name: Fountain
description: Drinkable water by the picnic area near the Piumogna waterfall.

name: Fountain
description: Drinkable water by the picnic area near the Piumogna waterfall.

name: zizerser gumpa
description: small parking (max 12hrs) by a forest and small pond.near to motorway but quiet.

name: Camping Waldesruh
description:
Nice, quiet small place. New and clean toilets and showers. Restaurant. W-lan at the restaurant. Terrassed on 5 Levels. Nice owner. 
CHF 28 in high season for 1 Camper Van and 1 person. 
info@campingwaldesruh.ch

name: Alpen Camping
description: Choice of large or small sites for different price. Good WiFi coverage throughout, albeit a bit slow. Filling and emptying facilities as well as laundry. Surrounded by a mountain range and next to farms. Small shop for food within reception. Accepts card and cash.

name: СТАРНН МАИН
description: Small hotel with restaurant and bar. Staff really friendly and helpful. Off road secure parking. My bike was locked in there garage. £11 for a double room for two people. Spacious and clean room. Food excellent.

name: Kiev
description: Island across from city, recreational area. One night stay allowed. Free. Lots of mosquitos.

name: Poltava
description: Nice resort just out of town, close to highway. Camping under trees, toilet in restaurant which is open 24 hours. Sauna next to camping spot. 200 local currency (around 7,50 euro). Electricity from pole at BBQ. Only one girl speaks English. Friendly people.

name: Melitopol
description: TIR, parking lot for trucks. Toilet & shower available in hotel. 100 local currency (3,65 euro)

name: Nova Kakhovka
description: Recreation Center Slavutich: we camped behind the sports facilities. Friendly people, not English speaking, but very willing. Used Google Translate to communicate. When we were here, there were no activities and little other guests. Payed around 3 euro. Toilet and shower available, but we didn't trust the water of the shower.

name: Zatoka
description: Was mentioned as camping in navigation system, but turned out to be appartments. After lots of discussion (no English), they let us stay for around 7.50 euro. Allowed to use the pool (cold outside shower next to it). Used own toilet.

name: Guarded Truck Stop
description: 3 Euros for a Camper. Ugly place but save! Busstop in 300m.

name: Holly Source
description: Very nice Place  in the Wood. Drinkable water from a holy source. One can hear the main road, but not too loud.

name: Campsite next to river
description:
Campsite next to river.
on grasland. Just follow the track next to the river

name: Beach Camping
description: Long stretch of beach used by locals as wild camping ground. It is right after the established camping Alba. Just continue the sand road. Beware: it gets a little bumpy and you can drive your rig onto the beach...make sure you can, the sand is soft.

name: TIR park
description: Very big place. Shower quite OK the toilet not useful full of crap. 1 Euro for a car with two people. Guarded.

name: see photo for the name
description:
recommend this place for the experience even if to stop for coffee - fab Ukrainian style.  
really lovely garden as well.  
directly on main road E373 on outskirts of town. 
there are rooms here but I don't know the deal.
not much English- Google translate a must!

name: the Antique House
description: nice Place until you order food - I ordered one salmon steak for 95 ukranian to be shared between two - one steak is 100g it was explained to us when ordering .... then the bill comes I am charged for a steak of 360g.... the bill ended up being double what was ordered.... do I think we got a 360g steak shared between 2? no.  it was 100g .... i made the point but didn't push it because it is still cheap on exchange - but the principle speaks volumes.... moral is don't use your card here (we paid cash)  and eat somewhere else.

name: Sea side camp
description:
On a hill straight at the sea. 
A few Ukrainians also camp here and on the weekend the locals turn up for a swim.

name: basic camp
description:
Basic camping, as always in Ukraine a paid car park where you can overnight and has toilets and "showers". 
100m down the hill to get to the beach.

name: picking site
description:
A couple of grassy picking sites at a small river next to the road. 
There's no traffic at night so it makes it a very nice overnight spot in a very touristy region.

name: small spot near a small river
description: small spot, good for one night with a 4wd. crossing a small river.

name: Parking lot in L'viv city
description:
Fenced parking space with security located in a residential area in city center. Some noise during the day but very quiet at night. Gate locked at 01:00, so not ideal for those who want to partake in the city's nightlife. Mostly level and mostly paved 

Edit: Sign states open 7-24h. We didn’t sleep here so don’t know for sure.

Price for sleeping 300 Uah per day. Price for parking 150 Uah per day. Cash only.

name: Parking of hotel Чайка
description: Pretty quiet place, 15 km away from downtown. 3 € for one night for 2 people and a camper. Showers.

name: Zabaryne
description: Recreation area on the bank of the river Dnipro . Family friendly. Kids’ playgrounds. One swimming pool, bar, restaurant, pound with fountain. BBQ area on the river site. Good timber houses for rent 1500-3000 hryvna per night. One can stay only for a day for 150-200hryvna per person.

name: Dobrovlyany
description: Turn off the main road either side of the bridge to access the shingle river Bed. possibly only usable in summer months when river is Low. can get busy with locals enjoying the river

name: Dnister River
description: loads of parking along the top of a 20ft cliff overlooking the river and dam only a few locals were about in the weekend in mid june

name: Murafa River
description: nice grassy spots along the Riverside. track and fire pits from where the locals use the river. meet some of them and they were very friendly. a little noise from road in distance during the day

name: Teteriv River
description: either use the main parking area at the top of the hill or if you have a 4x4 you can drive down to the rivers Edge. a few fishermen about on the distant banks. a little noise from the road bridge above but the views make it worth it

name: MOTO CTO - BMW Motorcycle Workshop
description:
English speaking and highly qualified BMW workshop, but not official. However, the guys have training from BMW. Nice little garage with all tools needed, diagnostics computers and friendly guys! They keep normal maintenance parts in stock also, even the Kahle fuel filters inside of the fuel assembly.

They know all BMW bikes, but can also work on other brands. They also let us work on our bikes ourselves.

Contact Denis at +380674024832

Highly recommended!

name: Paved area next to a sunflower field
description:
A good place to overnight when you are driving to/from Kharkov. Paved area but the track leading from the main road is sandy. 

The track is a dead-end so it should be quiet. Saw 1 local passing by, probably on his way to dump some garbarge in the bushes behind the spot (unfortunately, this seems to be a problem on most places that are out of sight in the Ukrainian countryside). 

You can hear the road.

name: Kozak
description:
Simple campground with electricity, warm water, shower and WC.
Costs are 500 per night for 2 persons and a camper.

name: Vegano Hooligano
description:
small vegan Restaurant,
the offer of the day was Soup + Burger = 140 UAH

name: Parking near Beach
description:
Parking Area near the Beach, Restaurants and small Shops around,
busy during the day at the summertime, at night only on weekends,
there is a Security guy during the daytime
at night quite exapt weekends
we stayed for three nights and nobody bother us
20 UAH/1 hour
the path down is in some parts narrow
public toilets are on the cycle path (open 8 am to 10 pm).

name: Maverick Hostel
description:
Nice and new place in Ternopil. They have a big parking space in the Yard suitable for all kinds of vehicles. Hostel itself ist very cheap 120uah. 
Staff ist super friendly.

name: Camping Solovinaja Roscha
description:
small Campground most occupied by Huts, there have 8 or 10 Places for caravans or tent's, the place is located in the second row, between the road and the beach, the beach is downstairs, a five minutes walk, shower's (cold during daytime), toilets, small playground for kids and a Mini-Market, the entrance is a bit small and the gate looks narrow (2,80m), some low blanches. electricity available, portable water as well,
a quite place, 3G with Lifecell
we paid 180 UAH/Night for 2 persons and caravan

name: Parking lot next to the catacombs
description:
parking lots in front of the gate / fence to the catacombs, this is the center of the village and it is a bit noisy, small shops around. 
the toilets (downstairs) are 24h open, just a hole in the bottom
open from 9 am until 5 pm (tickets until 4 pm)
to visit: go downstairs, went to right side, right of the entrance is a second door = ticket office
150 UAH per person, we got a english guide and if you pay 200 UAH more, you will get a special tour through the catacombs
the tour ends opposite, behind the street at the small museum
3G Lifecell

name: Motorush
description: Motorcycle repair workshop - contacted over Facebook to arrange tyre change. Very quick to respond. Happy to communicate in English. Very happy with service. Open 10 till 6

name: Palmira Beach
description:
Nice place at the peripherie of city Kremechuk, directly at river Dnepr. Place with Bar, Restaurant and water toilets. The deal with the owner: parking and using toilets are for free, when you use the restaurant. Best Schashlik ever and ice cold beer. Parking under trees at a fenced ground. Friendly staff. Only opened at season, depend the weather conditions. Normally between end of May until
September.

name: Terrible road M 14 to Mikolaïv
description: Terrible, only walking speed. Whole by whole. Not useable with a normal white camper!!!!!

name: Fish river sugoklija
description: nice Place for one night friendly People and clear water for swimming

name: Chernobyl
description: Dytyatky checkpoint. This is the border of the exclusion zone and as close as you can freely go to Chernobyl/Pripyat. There is a small parking lot where you can stay for free. The border guards make it very secure. Hardly any traffic at night. This is also where you leave your car when taking a tour. There are toilets one the other side of the gate (ask the guards) and the information booth has no set opening hours but probably opens every day around 10 for an hour or two and again at 5. They sell coffee, snacks, ice cream,...

name: In the forest
description: A clearing in the lovely forest. Follow a few sand tracks to get here, at the end of one of those tracks. Stayed 2 nights as it is so calm

name: Parking missile museum
description: If you visit the museum you are allowed to stay for the night on the small parking lot. 24/7 guard. Middle of the fields but the dirt track behind the parking sees some light traffic. Very friendly staff -only Russian/Ukrainian. Very clean toilets inside and we got offered showers. Museum is really cool (the undeground bit).

name: Dnieper River island spot
description: Small oasis close to Kyiv, all green and surrounded by water. Locals go fishing, biking, running here. To get to a decent place  with your camper you need some ground clearance and 4x4 if muddy

name: Pelican
description: Campsite of tour company. & hotel of the same name. Spots are basicslly on the parking, but it is a beautiful parking indeed, right next to a canal. 50uah if you need no facilities, 75uah with shower included. There toilets inside the complex. Tours are recommended! It’s the delta, so bring bug spray

name: On the beach
description: Another spot where you can just drive onto the beach and camp. Few local tourists around that do the same. Drive past the hotels (under construction) and when past them you will find multiple tracks leading to the beach. Soft sand to drive on!

name: Dnjepr River Parking
description:
a new parking area on a dnjepr island. illuminate and controlled by camera. a small kiosk and dixi toilets.
the next bus stop is a five minutes walk far away.
take the bus 114A to the city centre. the bus will stop at the maydan square. 8 UAH per person. the fare is usually pay while driving at the cashier.
per taxi: around 140 UAH.
this area is really crowded and loud on weekends, but you will find a quit place around.
there are also some small beaches and a huge area for bicycle drivers

name: Hotel Jockey
description:
Hotel Jockey (http://jockey.lviv.ua/).
They have a Area for mobile homes. they charge 10 EUR per night. You have to pay in Euro!
Shower and toilet are available in the hotel. shower cost 50 UAH per person.
nearby is a huge Shopping center. 
To city center take the bus 3A (5 UAH per person).
the bus station is in front of the hotel.
if you need water - there is building on left hand side with a water tap.

name: Khotyn Castle
description: Parking lot of Khotyn Castle. 10hrv for the parking. You should askbfor permission with the security guards down at the castle. The asphalted parking is on an akward angle, but if you wait until everybody is away (+-7pm) you can drive on the level patch of grass at the bottom. Try to be away from the grass again by opening time at 9am. Lots of little shops and restaurant onsite, but all closed at 6. Music stops at closing time, thankfully :-)

name: Carpathian views
description: On top of a mountain, large grassy patches with excellent 360deg views over the carpathians. Picture perfect. Very calm with a shepherds hut in the distance to keep you entertained. This is 4x4 territory. Three possible access roads, all will require high clearance and possibly 4x4 to clear obstacles created by erosion. Road might be a bit narrow for bigger rigs

name: Next to river Prut
description: A picnic spot next to the river prut, and next to the road(but seperated by trees). Inside Hoverla park (past the gate). Road is mostly busy in the morning and evening when the buses go past. No traffic at night. Sites are kept clean (with varying succes :-)) by park guards. Fire pit, bench, and pit toilet available.

name: Hoverla gate
description: We did not intent to stay here, but it turned out ok. We arrived late at the gate and were no longer allowed in the park, so we just stayed on the parking next to the road 100m in front of the gate. Perfectly quiet at night - dead end road - traffic starts to build up around 9. There are two restaurants and a well stocked shop. There is a sign pointing to tualet, but did not try. 25hrv pp for entrance park (unlimited time, just stay inside). As an alternative, you can also stay on the parking of the Sport complex all the way at the end of the road (start of Hoverla summit), first parking is free, latter parking (under the ski jump) is 20hrv for the night, small shops available selling everything.

name: Mt Pryslip
description: On top of the pass over Mount Pryslip, there are picnic tables next to the road, but for better views drive up the track towards the forest. Superb views and very calm place to spend the night.

name: Small Lake Camp
description:
Very nice place to stay for one or two nights. Nice view on a small lake. Very quite.
In the small village before, there is a small shop (Magazin).
If you join the Zaxidfest, it's near to the entrance.

name: Gogolin
description: A public community parking a few minutes away from the highway. Empty and quiet at night. People come to park here in the morning. Use the upper parking lot! A lot less activity there. Toilet building (open 7:30 to 18). Highway can be heard in the distance and there is a train station nearby.

name: Lovely spot at a lake
description: Some spots around this lake close to the village, mainly for fisherman. you can leave the dirt track and find yourself a place whereever you like. some of the spots seem to belong to private property (no signs at all). In our case someone asked us what we were doing there, but when we explained that we were tourists staying for one night everything was "харашо". this were the only people we met, it's absolutely quiet and the scenery is beautiful.

name: "Führerhauptquartier Wehrwolf"
description: Ruins of the old "Führer Headquarter Wehrwolf". Although it was destroyed during the 2nd WW you can walk around, see some ruins and get some interesting info via audio guide.

name: Border Ukraine to Transnistria / Moldova
description:
Leaving Ukraine was very easy and quick, BUT if you are planning to go to Moldova and leaving the country without going back to Transnistria you will also need an entry stamp for Moldova as there is no real border between Transnistria and Moldova where you usually would get one. So after getting the exit stamp of Ukraine go to the Moldovan registration bureau directly (literally 3m) behind the Ukrainian costum service when exiting Ukraine. The procedure is easy: Go to their little cabin (you can´t miss it, it should be at the end of lane 3 or 4) and you´ll get the stamp.

If you are entering Transnistria by car you have to pay a tax (4 USD for our VW T4, you can also pay with EUR, UAH ...). So before qeueing in the line for the regular immigration drive to the left after crossing the river and you´ll see a building with two floors. Just go inside on the first floor to counter 1, get a piece of jotting paper on which they write the amount you have to pay, take it to counter 3, pay ... that´s it. Immigration itself is super relaxed, but make sure you have the paper for the tax. Otherwise you have to turn back when you arrive at costums control (so happened to us).

All in all an interesting border with nice people and very quick and uncomplicated (no car check at all) ;)

name: Dream House Hostel
description:
Nice hostel with super helpful and interested staff. It is located in an inner courtyard where they have two parkings. We could stay there for 3 nights and could use their facilities. Each shower (also for non-guests) is 50 UAH, one night parking also 50 UAH, kitchen, toilet etc. was for free. In the evening it might be a bit noisy as there is a cafe and people are sitting in the courtyard, but during night - also at the weekend - it was absolutely okay. If you know in advance that you are going to the hostel better make a reservation for the parking. During our stay it happened that other Overlanders had to leave as there were other guests coming (but you can still stay on the street infront of the building). 

The location itself is unbeatable as it´s in the heart of the city center.

name: Sandali Trukhaniv Island
description: Very nice resort on the Trukhaniv island at the border of the Dnipro river. It is possible to stay on the parking. Need to talk to the guardian at the entrance of the island and to register. People are very willing to help. Closed during winter season but if you are lucky they let you in also out of season.

name: road by the forest
description: quiet forest road, on the side of de-forested line (gas line underneath?), good to take some sleep after crossing the border

name: Insurance
description: Paid $20 for what they claimed was a minimum of 2 weeks. Very unpleasant people. Initially asked me for a lot more and wouldn't let me leave to shop around. Seems like they were the only insurance company here anyway.

name: Motel
description: 500 UAH for a twin bed room. Large yard in front, quite modern and new, very clean and tidy.

name: Greguar Hotel & Apartments
description: Five star apart hotel in center of Kiev the capital of Ukraine

name: Arnika
description: This is a hotel/resort but they offer camping. We paid 50 uah for 2 people in one tent. Given access to toilets, shower, WiFi, and lighted picnic tables with outlets.

name: Camping at highway rest area
description: Stumbled upon this camping area after seeing the sign on the road that has a picture of tent and hammock. On maps.me it is labeled as a “highway rest area” and if you are heading south it is located right before kilometer marked 17 on the left side of the road. The are is enclosed in a wooden fence so vehicles can’t enter picnic area but there is room to park outside. Many covered picnic tables, a spigot of mineral water, and disgusting pit toilet near by. Had a wonderful peaceful night here in our tent before cycling the pass.

name: Akwa Plus Kompleks
description:
Touristic complex near a lake with parking space on gravel - near the lakeside restaurant. Not an official campsite, but they allow (groups of) campers if it’s not too busy (outside weekends and high season). We couldn’t find anyone who spoke anything but Ukrainian or Russian, but there may be someone during the season. Price to be negociated, but expect some € 15 per pitch.

Nice restaurant in the main building, where there are hotelrooms as well. Electricity available as well as toilets (at the back of the lakeside restaurant). For hot showers you may need to book (and pay for) a standard hotel room. Or take a dip in the lake.
Some 10 km from Chernivtsi City Centre. Most probably no public transport available, but taxis will bring you from the train station.

name: Train station Zovkva
description: Parking area beside train station. Quiet at night. There are very very less trains. Free of charge. Public toilets are at the station.

name: Sun (Solar) Valley
description: Found this campsite on google maps. It is in a recreation complex - there is a ski slope and a zoo! You have to pay to get into the complex. We didn’t have any cash so got in for free and not sure how much it should have been. Follow the road until you get to the reception, then go straight past it down a small concrete road down a hill. Follow that and then there is a campsite on your left as you come out of the trees. When we went it didn’t appear to be open, but there was a lady living in one of the huts. We weren’t able to drive onto the campsite (car with roof tent) but she let us camp in the parking area for free. If we had a ground tent she was happy for us to camp in the campsite. There are covered picnic benches and some bbqs. Didn’t see facilities. Don’t know when it opens officially, how much it normally costs, or if you can drive into the field during the summer.

name: Ukraine/Romania Border
description: Romania-Ukraine: took 1hr 23mins. Romania passport and then customs - straight forward and quick, one booth for passport control, a second booth for customs (5 meters apart). Ukraine - we got an a6 sized white form at the barriers which they wrote our number plate on. We then needed 3 stamps on the form before we left. After they gave us the form we got directed to a queue. All of the people came to us in our car in the queue. 1st stamp they checked inside the car, then 2nd stamp they took our passport and v5 (car papers) to passport control. They brought all the stuff back with the second stamp on the form. 3rd stamp = customs. They checked our car again and then took passports and v5 again. Brought them back with final stamp and said we could go. We had to give white form to person at final barrier. Place to buy car insurance on the left after you go through barrier.

name: Ukraine Car Insurance
description: Lots of booths on the left as you come from Ukraine/Romania border. Booth with red and white sign for car insurance. The guy didn’t know much English, but we think you could buy 15,30 days, 2,6,12 months insurance. Cash only. We paid 150 UAH for 15 days insuring 2 people in a Land Rover Discovery. He told us it would be €10 if we paid in euros - nearly half price to pay in UAH. ATM at petrol station across the road but didn’t work for us.

name: Canyon Recreation Campsite
description: Campsite by the river at the end of a narrow steep rutted dirt track. Being from Western Europe we would have said you need 4WD to get here, but the locals were bumping past in their old 2WD saloons, so what do we know! Very friendly owner who did not speak much English, but enough to get by. We paid 100 UAH (yes really €3.40!) for one night (2 people, car, roof tent). There were covered tables which had lights and a electrical socket. Toilets and hot showers - basic but clean. Children’s play park. There were also cabins for rent with beds but no bathrooms. We were the only people there, but probably out of season.

name: Hovinda, vegetarian Hindu restaurant
description:
After months of fat, Balkan/Russian style food, it’s lovely to eat something different: Indian-style ánd vegetarian. They even have banana lassies. 
There’s a roofed terrace with shade.

name: Camping behind hotel and restaurant
description: Grass area behind the restaurant snd motel some shade. Restaurant is open 24hours and has clean toilets.  €5 for 2 people and a camper. You can pay extra for a shower   Also a TIR stop away from the camping. Food is good buffet style.  free WiFi in restaurant.

name: Russian and Kazakhstan insurance + SIM card
description: On the road from leaving the border the first cafe we saw, fed us, sold car insurance for both Russia and Kazakhstan and we were also able to buy a  SIM card. Sorted.

name: Fort Tarakanivskyy
description:
Abandoned fort builded in XVIII-XIX centuries.
Strange and quiet place, you can arrive there ride a bike or bycicle and put tent there

name: Liman Park
description: Established camp in the delta of the river Dnepr. Has parking, wooden condos with bathrooms and kitchenette for rent and area where tents are allowed. So one could stay in his own tent. The showers and toilets are available too. There are pub, swimming pool, restaurant. Fishing site, pound for sport fishing. Dingy with outboard engine available for rent. Garden where personnel growing vegetables and berries for restaurant, food is good and always fresh. Little zoo and kids playground. Nice friendly personnel.

name: Nizhin hotel
description:
It's a hotel in the centre of the town. Young reception lady is very friendly and attentive. We could sleep in the parking lot behind the hotel for 30 hryvnia (1 dollar) per person. 

There is fast and good WiFi that reaches into the parking lot. Showers are nice warm. Laundry was 50 hryvnia (1.60$) 

The hotel itself looks old but also seems refurbished. It is a mix of old Ukrainian style with new elements. We liked the atmosphere but it is not for all.

name: Camping Pechora
description: Campsite with mainly cabins, but also little space for tents. Next to river. Nice owner. Looks like an old Soviet campsite.

name: Rafting Myhiya
description: Campground with rental tents and rafting facilities by a flooded quarry. It’s not very common to camp in your own tent here, but staff helped us find a beautiful place with stunning view over the quarry for our car with rooftoptent.

name: Chernomorsk Beach
description: Parkinglot next to the City Beach. Good to stay before taking the ferry to Batumi.

name: CTO car workshop
description: a good car workshop that has many parts available. Fixed our VW T4 battery belt for 15 Euros. Professional and quick. Recommend!

name: Ukraine - Poland Border
description:
very slow border on both sides (6.5 hours) We went UKR -> PL and arrived there at 21:00 and left at 3:30.

The queue for leaving Ukraine was 1 hour. Ukraine guards didn't trust us because we came from Kazakhstan and they did a very unprofessional but thorough search. They took off our walls to check for drugs and checked EVERYTHING. Took 1.5 hours and a sniffing dog (puppy) even gave a false positive! They accused us of having marijuana which we clearly had not, very unpleasant situation. When we started to phone our embassy they let us go. At 00:00 we left Ukraine. 

Entering Poland took 3.5 hours of pure waiting. Very very slow, you could move 10 meters every 15 minutes. Around 120 cars  total in the queue before us and hundreds of truckers. It was very simple, no search and no documents to fill out. Just hand the documents to the guards and wait.. At 3:30 am we were finished!

So: I don't know how busy it us during the day, but when arriving at 9pm it was very very busy. Not a difficult crossing when you don't get searched!

name: river theiß
description:
Basic little spot directly at the river. Might be flooded at high water. Road is narrow and was quite muddy when we arrived.
Just turn right after the bridge and follow the dirt road. 
We had a beautiful sunset and some mosquitos. 4x4 recommended.

name: Tepli Vodi thermal pools
description: Public swimming pool with natural mineral water and lots of basins from 20 to 38°C. It was kind of busy on a Wednesday afternoon but we spent 2 very relaxing hours. Prefect with kids! Entrance 200 hrywna pp for the first hour, 50 hrywna every extra hour

name: Camping Cocha
description: Campsite right at the beach under the pine trees. There are toilets and showers and there is a small shop.

name: Beach by River
description: Amazing spot for a warm summer day, popular with locals for swimming and barbecues. There is a beach with sand and clear water! Also lots of shaded spots along the river. It was busy with families (summer holidays) until 20.00 but then we had the place for ourselves. Ok for big rigs, 2x2 and tents.

name: Picnic spot by the river
description: Nice place for picnics by the river. Accessible by 4w drive. Middle of nature, a lot of mosquitos, but quiet.

name: The Zoo
description:
Parking space next to the entrance to the Nature park / Zoo. We came late and the guard was super friendly and let us stay the night. 
There’s the toilet with running water, which can use. The parking is huge, and there’s no one there but the guard. 
Thousands of mosquitoes. Better come prepared.

name: Edem hotel
description:
amazing hotel for only 350 Ukrainian unit's. 
air-condition 
amazing bathroom with towels,  soaps and even a bathrobe. 
food in restaurant of hotel is amazing.

name: Honey Blue’s Camping
description: Nice campground with open field to camp in. Also campers / vans welcome. Great amenities for kids and they do honey making tour. Mainly in Ukrainian and Russian.

name: Ukraine / Poland Border
description:
We drove Ukraine to Poland on a Wednesday morning 8.30. A simple process but takes times. Ukraine has a staggered entry allowing 50 or so cars past the main entry fence at a time. Took us nearly two hours to pass 2 stops (customs and passport stamping). 

Duty free has pretty ok prices. 

Poland side is a similar batch process. There are signs of No milk/dairy, no meat, no cheese (but we were able to keep ours). 1st stop customs, where they check for car insurance. We had green card so all ok. With EU passports no more stamping. Polish side took 1 hour. 

As said not complicated but time consuming.

name: UKR Ferry Checkin / Registration Charnomorsk - Batumi
description:
Checkin counter for UKR Ferry to batumi.
Took us a while to find this place! 
Very friendly guy speaking OK english.
No ticket sale here!

name: Well
description: Covered well, excellent water! Popular by locals.

name: Small pond near highway
description: Quiet hideaway, good for one night on the way to Odessa. Some mosquitos.

name: On the Dnieper banks
description: On the way back from Chernobyl perfect place to relax under a willow tree. Some mosquitos.

name: Lviv Cemetery
description:
Lychakivskiy Cemetery.
Tombs decorated with magnificent statues. 40 Ukrainian entrance

Cimetière Lychakivskiy.
Tombes ornées de magnifiques statues.

name: Above Teteriv River
description: Better than place under the bridge. Shady place near dirt road on a meadow over the river. Less mosquitos and less dirt than under the bridge. No 4x4 necessary to go there.

name: Hotel Ukraine car park
description:
Car park (with gate) of the Hotel Ukraine, 50 UAH for one night. Close to the Maïdan place.
A lot of shops. Not very quiet.

name: Korostyshevskyy - Old Quarry with Lake
description: Easy access, very nice and quiet, not very clean, but OK. Pretty lake with fishermen.

name: Sherwood
description: Nice new „wooden” hotel. Very friendly staff. Doubleroom around 35 $.

name: Border Ukr - Rus
description:
Easy, very laid-back border, very cursory look into the car by the UKR customs, pretty thorough search by the RUS. ~1h total with no queue. 

Coming from Ukraine, they check that you have insurance for Russia, and sell you one if you don’t.

name: Na Mangal Steak House
description: It's not hard to find good food in Lviv. Anyway, I found this Steak House and it's good quality they serve here. I am a admittedly a steak lover and was very surprised here. Had the New York Steak with Veggies. It's not like perfectly high class as in Buenos Aires but very good ;-)

name: Trapezna Ukrainian Restaurant
description: Ukraine good. Very tasty. From Salads to the classic soup borsht to stew and many more. It's located in the basement so don't be afraid you to go through the Museum entrance.

name: The Baczewski Ukrianian Food
description: This is my top pick in Lviv. Ukrianian fusion food with Jewish and polish elements.  Can be tricky to get a table for dinner. I was lucky for lunch.  Excellent Vorschmack, Borscht and duck fillet. But also anything else looked amazing. Try Wodka or the house made liquor!

name: Border Post Ukraine - Poland
description:
Big border post, road was brand new (Aug 2021) and being painted when we crossed.

Warning: 3.5Tn Maximum.

name: Wild camp
description: Ok with 2wd. !uiet and nice place. Some mosquitoes. Edit - no wifi but there is 2 bars of lte with Vodafone.

name: Baturyn
description: Easy access, near of spots to visit. Quiet in the night. Autopark of the Kochubeyivskyy Park. Restaurants and stores not far (<1 km), in the village.

name: Border And customs
description: super easy border crossing with my motorcycle. took less than an hour. Not much English spoken but people were very friendly. nowhere to buy insurance but no one asked for it.

name: Lviv Loft Prison
description:
Very unique hostel made to look like a prison since it's in the basement of the building. beds are comfy. showers are hot. there is parking for motorcycles as well as cars in the back alley where the hostel is located. not through booking.com for 105UAH for a dorm bed. while I stayed the hostel was almost full and was quite busy and noisy but for the money you can't beat it. they even have a small kitchen compete with drinkable water.

*update I left after 2 nights. The long-term guests who stay here for months at a time are quite loud and have quite a bit of BO going on. very loud at 2 or 3 in the morning both nights and pretty lame social environment. moved to comfort hostel and loved it. marked it on the map as well 💪😃

name: Lake camp
description:
Good overnight spot at the lake under trees with nice sunset, wood for a campfire and tasty berries all around. Swimming was refreshing. Edge Kyivstar internet.
Unluckily, there is a lot of rubbish laying around. When we came on a Sunday afternoon in high season, there were many people around the lake, but they left in the evening. There are many spots at the lake and we found a quiet one.

name: Truck stop Start on and Tire change
description: A good little truck stop, showers, food, tire change. German owner. Friendly and very clean.

name: Resting Place
description: tiny resting place where you can stay overnight with car or tent. little bit loud at the street

name: Comfort Hostel
description: Awesome hostel with a fantastic location. Comfy beds and kinda warm showers. Friendly owner who speaks a little English. Parking for a car or motorcycles! Super comfortable place to relax! Walking distance to just about everything a person would want to see it so here in Lviv! Stayed a week and loved it. Great little kitchen and fast Wi-Fi. 150 Ukrainian a night for a dorm bed. Private rooms as well. If you negotiate with the owner for a longer stay it's 150 however normally it's 200 a night for the dorms. Only able to pay in cash.

name: Moto Tovary
description:
small motorcycle parts shop who can get just about anything you need for your bike. only a little bit of English is spoken but they are pretty friendly guys. I ordered some sprockets with them and it takes about a week or so to get parts but they were happy to help. 

WhatsApp   +380 97 852 0474

name: UNIQA Vehicle Insurance
description: I used this office to get insurance on my BMW 650 motorcycle.(the border i crossed 200 km to the north did not have a place to purchase insurance) These guys spoke pretty good English. I had to pay in cash as my card wouldn't work in the machine they have there. impossible to get full coverage insurance on a non Ukrainian vehicle but one year of liability insurance that covers up to almost $4,000 USD costs 863 hryvnia. 3 months costs around 400 hryvnia.

name: Teteriv Lake
description: Beautiful place right next to the lake, very nice to watch stars! No view compact to the road but nearby. Road to the place a bit Ukrianian style. Dogs barking in the nearby village.

name: Next to the lake
description: Beautiful when you have arrived, roads down there are horrible, be careful and don’t drive by night. At the lake there are hundreds of tent areas for free. On the weekend crowded all over, on weekday no problem.

name: Local cherry liqor
description: Great place to sample the local cherry drink at 60 a big shot. At the end of the day really busy!

name: Dymer
description: The place is between Kiew and Czernobyl. Good to reach concrete ground. Sand beach. No Toiletts. No Electricity. Otherwise some friendly local people. Perfect spot for a trip to Czernobyl.

name: Border Ukraine-Rumania
description: Very small border for fast crossing. Custom on Ukraine side is very detailed. They check every corner. Had some problems with walkie talkie.

name: NP Skolivsky Beskydy
description: In a field next to a side road. Several old firepits. slightly visible from the road. We asked a shepherd if we could stay here overnight, no problem. A local car passed by and waved. Peaceful place.

name: River camp
description: Quiet grassy spot on the Stryi river. Several old firepits and fisherman nearby. Slightly visible. Nobody bothered us. More spots down the river.

name: International border
description: Ukr->Poland. Small border crossing mainly used by local cars. Bringing in dairy and meat products is prohibited, but they only asked about vodka and cigaretts. Especially busy when Ukrainians return to Poland to work.

name: The Riverside Camp + Restaurant
description: Easy, very quiet large place directly at river with very good access. Simple facilities 20 UAH per night /car, very good restaurant nearby, some locals. Fits all size of rigs.

name: Forest
description: Follow the dirt road from the mainroad( there is a cross at the beginning of the dirtroad) into the wood. There are many places, hidden from the street and protected from the wind. We didn’t drive very far into the wood.

name: Oleskiy Zamok
description: Super cool castle where you can see some artefacts as well as a good view of the countryside. Down in the catacombs of the castle you can see a incredibly deep well with the face of Lucifer watching over it. 240 hryna entry.

name: Lake Camping
description: Along the southern shore of a small lake runs a dirtroad with several flat spaces to park in the meadow. Used by the locals for fishing. Some noise from the street, only a few mosquitos.

name: Picknick Spot Good for a Night
description: We had difficulties to find a quiet and flat place in this area. The ramp from the road is quiete steep, you need a high clearance. Small river nearby.

name: At the Lake
description: Access by gravel road from the north. Place for fisherman. From here you don't see the industial plant on the opposite bank. Some rubbish around.

name: Come to a full stop here!
description: If you dont't come to al full stop before the policeman comes out the let you make an alcohol test. At the Ukrainian checkpoints always switch on the warning lights, otherwise they may try to give you a fine.

name: The Old Fortress
description:
Entry to large old fortress and ruines. Very interessting and strange. Several spots to stay overnight around. Did not stay - too early.
Iveco 90-16

name: Shelter hotel
description: Nice small hotel with various good value rooms and secure parking. Quiet neighbourhood, only a few airplanes flying over (did not bother us). Laundry service was only 20 for two loads! There is a busstop in the street, but we used Uber (around 22-25) to get downtown. We used Booking to book.

name: Dimitri's Garage
description: great local mechanic who is capable of doing just about anything from an oil change to machining new bushings for your axles. he helped me for a few days with some welding as well as machineing 2 new bushings for my rear wheel on my BMW X-Challenge 650. he also took me for a ride in his 1912 model t Ford and even let me take his 1934 BMW motorcycle for a ride. great guy with a big heart. doesn't speak much English but Google translate did the trick. he charged me 1300 Ukrainian for 3 days of work including him going to a shop to buy some raw aluminum bar stock to machine down for me. if he can't fix what is wrong with your rig who knows someone in this garage complex who can!

name: Yak Olympic Hostel
description:
Nice hostel in a high building at 16. floor with nice view. Rooms and prices are good. Private and shared rooms.
Official garage is 400m away and safe.
 Location is very good for sightseeing

name: Lake near Denarky
description: Lake in forest with benches and also pit toilets. used by lots of locals for camping, swimming and fishing.

name: Ridgecrest Camp
description: Great campsite out of sight out of mind. Absolutely no road noise as there is no road. A 4x4 truck or adventure motorcycle will have no problem getting here even after a pretty good rain. beautiful view of the sunset!

name: Bunker Camp
description:
super cool bunkers with graffiti murals on the inside. I rode my motorcycle inside of the first bunker and camped for a night. The second bunker you can walk around the bottom floor But be sure to bring your flashlight and waterproof boots! Really beautiful views at sunset. I was here on a Saturday and ran into a few locals who were camping as well but I'm sure on the weekdays you would be hard pressed to find anyone up here.

the road coming up the mountain is paved with concrete tiles. any car that has decent ground clearance would have no problem. I saw a few Russian made Luda 4 door sedans up here on top of the mountain. on an adventure motorcycle or an SUV you will have a blast coming up the mountain side. Not too difficult of a road even if there's a bit of rain. highly recommend bringing some camping supplies and dinner to enjoy the sunset.

name: U Leva Motorcycle Resort Hotel
description:
Found this hotel by accident and stayed a whole week exploring the nearby Carpathian Mountains. great location for unloading your motorcycle and taking off on the dirt trails up into the hills for day trips. I even brought minimal camping gear and left the rest of my stuff at the hotel and took off for 2 days for some wild camping on the next Ridgeline over from this mountain range.

the owners are super friendly and definitely off-road enthusiast. I met a few new Czech friends who where here at this hotel the 9th time for a week long motorcycle vacation. If you have any problems with your bike the hotel has a covered parking area and plenty of tools they are more than happy to lend you. Should you need any parts they have some friends nearby that can get just about anything you need.

Single Room: 15 Euros a night
Dinner: 150-250 Ukrainian

a single room having a huge bed with hot shower and bathroom is 15 Euros a night including a pretty hardy breakfast. they have 3 and 4 bed rooms but not sure of the prices of those as I'm just one person. it's also possible to camp at this property as well in the garden next to the creek that runs through the property. I'm sure this is a cheap option but I forgot to ask the price to pitch a tent. if you do camp you might be woken up around 8 in the morning by the grazing goats nearby who have bells around their necks. 

a very large and delicious dinner is served in the resorts restaurant every night. it's usually grilled BBQ or fish with potatoes and salad of some kind. if your into veggie meals they do that as well. the dinners cost anywhere from 150-250 grivna per meal.

they also have beer for 50 grivna a half liter on tap. juice, coffee, and sodas as well. 

they have a sauna in the hotel as well as a cold dipping pool filled up by the river. they also have a pressure washer which they will let you use to clean your vehicle off with after you go out playing in the mud.

no one speaks English here however they do speak Russian Ukrainian and Czech. I would highly recommend to agree on a price before moving in because I was told 15 euros a night but wanted to pay in Ukrainian money as I didn't have Euros so we had to work out the conversation rate. they don't take card sooooooo bring plenty of cash because most places in this area are cash only. I stayed 5 days and wild camped for a night in the near by mountains. this was my total for my time at the hotel:

3900 grivna total for:

5 nights single bed room
5 dinners
5 breakfasts
2 soup lunches
6 liters of boxed juice
8 draft beers
1 coffee

highly recommend the hotel as well as exploring this area of Ukraine if you're on a motorcycle or 4x4. amazing beautiful.

name: Little Forest
description: Off the main road, not too far. Hidden in a little group of trees. Lovely.

name: Police Checkpoint
description: Always STOP here - do not only drive slowly! Even if nobody watches you, they will stop and fine you, if you didn't stop. We got fined but everything was very polite and official. You get a paper and have to go to a bank and pay it there.

name: Confluence of Sluch and Tnya
description: Nice spot at the confluence. You can drive all the way down to the grassy spot by the rivers. Some fire pits. Wood for fire in the bushes. Some fishermen around. Very beautiful.

name: by Stryi river
description: Wild camping by Stryi river. Very nice spot with grass. Almost no trash. A lot of fire pits. Maybe in summer a bit more people, because it is marked as “camp” on maps.me. River is good for swimming. Some fishermen around in the evening. I guess good for big rig, since we saw Zil coming down in the morning for sand.

name: Ukraine Hungary Border
description:
We crossed the border from Ukraine to Hungary. On the Ukraine side smooth, 1/2 hour, from that the check was 10 minutes. On Hungary side slow. But just moving to the check point. Once there, we were finished in 10 minutes. Quick check. Not sure why we waited for 3 hours in a row of bot so many cars (4 rows were open).
We travel with a dog, and had no problems at the border. They just checked the Pet Passport. (We were traveling in Central Asia for 4 months, and this was the point of return to EU)

name: Abus
description:
Great motorcycle shop where you can purchase Kriega waterproof luggage and Abus bike locks. they are a distributor for Ukraine and mainly do Internet business but their office is here and they are more than happy to help with a cup of coffee in hand!

the office is a little bit difficult to find because it's in the basement...you must pass through the green gate and then go through the glass door through the hallway and turn to the right for the entrance.

I got a US-5 litre bag to put my tools in and spent about an hour looking at all the different gear they had available here. great people in the shop who speak English.

name: Ribs restaurant at the arsonal
description:
Hickory smoked barbecue ribs on a rotating grill. What will they think of next?!?

This place was awesome! Built inside the cellar of what used to be an arsenal back in the day. However today it's home to one of the funniest restaurants in town!

The food was top notch! The beer was fantastic!!! The restaurant itself was an absolute ball. Honestly the best BBQ I've had in Europe to date.

My favorite part of the dining experience was they do not have plates or silverware. (But they are good enough to draw them for you on the paper covering over the table) Sooooo this way you get to eat like a true savage! When the chick brought out the ribs she cut them with a giant battle axe.

The beer is 56 Ukrainian and comes from the local microbrewery.

The ribs cost 150  and besides like vegetables or potatoes are anywhere from 50 to 90 Ukrainian.

Super reasonable prices to me for such an awesome meal! highly recommend the experience of eating here as well as seeing the museum just above the restaurant. the museum costs 50 Ukrainian

name: Cafe Cesar
description:
Crazy cheap and delicious! I have eaten here at least 8 times in the month I've been in Lviv 

beer 25 Ukrainian
coke 16 Ukrainian
main course 40-90 Ukrainian

highly recommend the Caesar pen which is potatoes covered with cheese chicken and some vegetables for 69 Ukrainian 

the cheese sticks are probably the best I've ever had! 39 Ukrainian!!!

I don't think I've ever had a bill more expensive than 150 at this restaurant

name: kievstar
description:
cell phone store where you can buy a SIM card for 125 Ukrainian and have unlimited 4G LTE internet for one month.

you also have 600 minutes to call other numbers in Ukraine and a few other surrounding countries as well as some text messages.

the internet is blazing fast and you will have no problems watching movies or using your hotspot for your laptop.

name: out door stood gorgany
description:
a wide array of outdoor items like sleeping bags and carabiner clips. they have some hiking shoes as well as hiking clothes.

I got a Czech made sleeping bag for 2000 Ukrainian good to 2 degrees. good quality gear and the staff speaks pretty good English.

a few items were a little bit overpriced maybe 5-10% but still reasonable in my eyes seeing as you will have to wait 2-weeks for anything to come from the EU in the mail.

name: wondering guest house
description:
nice guest house with a warm shower and secure parking for a couple of cars or motorcycles. nice kitchen with a few pots and pans.

200 Ukrainian for a dorm room.

name: Oleso Castle
description:
super cool Castle with a huge painting on the inside & a great view of the surrounding area. there are a few other castles in this area as well one of which that is even bigger than this one but I did not personally get to see it because it was closed on the day I visited this Castle.

80 Ukrainian to enter and we'll worth a how or 2 of exploring

name: Museum of political oppression
description:
really well done museum dedicated do the oppression of the Ukrainian people. you can walk inside some of the prison cells as well as see some of the photos from the 1920s to his recent as 5 years ago.

free entry and we'll worth a visit. 

closed on Saturday and monday

name: Komanchero Outdoor Store
description:
this place has it all! rock climbing gear. camping equipment. backpacks. ski mask. hiking clothes. smartwool socks. belts to hide money in!

pretty reasonable prices compared to the United States. I got a fantastic ski mask and a few knives here.

they have a huge selection of synthetic as well as down sleeping bags.

the camping store downtown is pretty good but this place is quite a bit larger with more selection

name: Dnister
description:
Nice spot at the river Dnister. No garbage, several flat spots and calm at nights. Can be reached by all rigs.
Kyivstar very weak.

name: Riverside - Hoverla
description: Nice camp spot directly at the river prut, quiet, firewood around. It's also the beginning of some hiking trails. 4x4 recommended, might be difficult for very big rigs as the way down is pretty steep. Good internet with Kyivstar.

name: dream hostel
description: 140 UA for a night for a dorm. Pretty secure parking in the courtyard for a few motorcycles or possibly one car. Comfortable beds with individual lights and plugs for each bunk but the showers are lukewarm at best. Close to everything.

name: Volads garage
description:
great mechanic who helped me with reconnecting some wires on my motorcycle. he would not let me pay him but I brought him some beers. he doesn't speak much English but Google Translate did the trick!

his shop has a super old roadster from the 30s in front. a bit hard to find until you see this old car

name: metro hostel
description:
new hostel 
only it's ok if you want safe parking and stay alone .. 
no kitchen . only machine for coffee or tea and microwave 
room is comfortable .

name: Hotel Oktan
description:
super nice hotel on the highway . 
amazing room for 450 uah (16€)
parking ... safe place no problem 
have restaurant 
book by booking for reservation .. better than arrive there without reservation .

name: Hostel 51
description:
nice hostel 
very good location just in the center . 
about parking it's just in the back yards , just safe .. no problem for motorbikes .. for cars I don't know if it's possible to park here . 
bed comfortable 
5€ per night .

name: Zinʹkivsʹkyy Zamok
description:
A suuuuper interesting place but more than a little hard to find. From on top of this hill there isn’t much to see at first glance buuut once you find yourself up there you will find a few underground forts you can go in and explore!!!

Looking out of these firing holes on the valley below you could easily defend this position for days at a time as long as you had ammo and water.

Built in the 1400’s it was partially destroyed by the Turkish. Then in the early 1800’s the remaining ruins housed police and a church if you can believe that. 

Then rumor spread that the remaining wall would fall and crush the houses in the valley below. Sooo dismantling began and now there isn’t much left but the views from the top of the hill are amazing!  @ Zamok, L'Vivs'Ka Oblast', Ukraine

name: Medzhybizh Fortress
description:
This castle was super impressive from outside but inside its a little lacking because they are rehabbing the insides. The guys doing the work let me walk setting for about 5 minutes but it's was mostly construction equipment and concrete everywhere 🤣😂

Set at the convergence of 2 rivers this castle is in a picturesque location without a doubt. Originally a wooden castle built in 1146 the impressive castle we see now was built in the 1500's being added to up to the late 1800's. 

Since 1968 there have been major renovations here to bring us the museum we see today. There is also a church inside the castle built in the mid 1500's.  

I was sad about murdering a 🐔 I was more sad that I didn't get to see this 🏰

 @ Меджибожский замок

name: Palace Thor Lange
description:
This has been one of my favorite discoveries so far! Just the setting of the house... The condition of the house. Everything was perfect! 

This place used to belong to a Danish Diplomat Thor Lange. He was a poet who translated many Ukrainian stories and songs into Danish. Some of them even becoming National Danish folk songs 😛😂🤣 

At his home in Ukraine he was also a horticulturist experimenting growing different fruits including Pineapples. From what I found his house was abandoned upon his death in 1915.

Super cool ride out there finding this ole gem 🏍️💨💕

 @ Napadovka, Vinnyts'Ka Oblast', Ukraine

name: Sadyba Zabotinykh
description:
You never know who you're going to meet on the adventure road... Just so happens I met a lovely lady named Natasha who was hanging out in this manor. She is in the process of turning this place into a Sri Chaitanya compound.

I'm not exaggerating when I say this manor is in the middle of nowhere. It took me 45 minutes to get out here in BFE bombing down dirt roads. She was shocked as I was to see anyone here haha

She told me that she rented out her apartment in Lviv where she lived her whole life and move down here to be closer to God and do some more meditation... Also just as luck would have it that a little puppy dog came walking up to this place a few weeks ago who she adopted. He was the coolest!

This manor was kind of mysterious and creepy all at one time. There were cows grazing around it and the building itself seemed in decent shape but it is locked up tight as a drum...
Yet it also looks like it hasn’t been used in years. 

Built in the early 1900’s nobody including Natasha seems to know what happened to it through out the 20th century. Other locals say in the 90’s a business man bought it and started making repairs before there was some controversy about if he was allowed to buy it or not. Finally he walked away and it has remained locked since... Until now!

Natasha was good enough to send me down the road with a huge piece of apple pie... Which came in handy later that night while camping! Yuuuuuuuuuuuum!!!
 @ Vinnytsia Oblast

name: Church of the Holy Trinity
description:
I had no idea what this was other than at one time it appears to have been a church.... Until I met a lovely lady and her grandkids who were tending their garden. 

This grandma was incredibly excited to give me the nickel tour of this old church turned hospital. Back in WW2 when she was just a kid younger than her grandkids this was used to house wounded soldiers of both sides of the war at one time. 

She was showing me where the doctors slept and how they separated the soldiers so they wouldn't fight while in the hospital. 

This was an underground hospital thought the 40s used to save lives regardless of who they fought for... That's pretty heavy 🤯

name: Sergei Pavlovich Korolyov Museum of Cosmonautics
description:
Feast your eyes on the USSR's answer to 'mercas NASA... This was an actual satellite that was supposed to be launched into space to house astronauts!

$2 entree fee

There were many gadgets and replicas of the Soviet lunar lander robots (which actually moved graphite off of the roof in Chernobyl) A few crazy space tools. They even had a few space suits! The actua Soviet satellite was by far the most impressive for me.

To think how much money was spent on the space race 🤯 After the States landed Niel Armstrong on the moon the Russians packed up their toys and went home. Astonishing really to me 🙈 @ Sergey Korolyov Astronautics Museum

name: Korostyshivsky quarry
description:
I found a super neat place to do rock climbing! In the summertime I'm sure this place is where it's at for camping and hiking!!!

This place used to be a mine... Until it got flooded... Today it's been reborn as an outdoor activities park 💕

name: Abandoned Soviet Space Camp
description:
Abandoned Soviet space camp
Not even going to lie & say it was not eerie walking around these deserted hallways... The main building still has beds in it like children will be arriving any minute to live out their dream of being an astronaut

name: Museum of strategic rocket forces
description:
