Coolest experience of my trip here in Europe so far... Aaand quite possibly of my life!!! I got to spend the night in what was an active intercontinental nuclear ballistic missile silo 

The Tour costs $12 USD!

I held the A.C.T.U.A.L. key that could have ended the world. If that isn't cool... I don't know what is.

This was not your average tour... This wasn't even supposed to happen.... But it did!!!

After a long day on the bike I show up close to dark at what I think is just a Soviet military museum in the middle of no where... Negative...... 30 years ago this was the most strategic and secure point in the entire USSR!!!!!

With the input of a secret ever-changing code, a flick of 2 separate switches, and the simultaneous turn of 2 keys less than 10 feet (3m) apart a nuclear warhead could reach the United States in less than 22 minutes 

This former Soviet base contains 3 missile silos that were just over 140 feet (43m) under ground. Each individual silo was covered by a hatch that weighed 14 tons! This hatch could open fully in just 8 seconds!!! In 1959 the construction of this base started in the early fall.... In the summer of 1960 it was fully operational! In less than one year the Soviets built and engineered this entire base.

At the time this base was completed it had state of the art computers which were also underground in a room that was big enough to be used as a warehouse... 85 percent of the cooling capacity of the liquid helium refrigerators was used solely to cool this behemoth of a computer!!! The smart phone you have in your hand right now has 20 times more computing power than this Soviet cutting edge 60's tech.

The missile... Let's talk about that little guy.... It had a range of 15,500 miles (25,000km) which was more than enough to reach out and touch the States just about anywhere the Red Army wanted to. It's minimum range was 1,200 miles (2,000km) & this was important incase they fancied an attack on the UK, France ooooor Western Germany. It carried a warhead 37 times stronger than that was dropped on Hiroshima! The missile herself weighed so much the Soviets had to manufacture a truck capable of carrying so much weight with multiple electric motors in each wheel... There were 24 wheels..... All with their own motor to help the diesel powered truck up the hills and down the highway.

They also had a secret train which was used to carry missiles thought the USSR... Very under the radar because there's trans were made to look old and busted... The only way you would know these were not normal passenger cars as they passed you on the tracks were the fact they had 4 wheels instead of 2 at each end of the train cars... Because the weight of the missiles works have crushed a single axle train.

The Soviets had to move, install, and seal up the missile in her silo in less than 2 hours or the Americans with our satellites would know what these commies were up to. Which could have very easily caused the cold war to go hot... Damn hot!

After the soldiers who guard this base gave me the nickel tour which lasted 3 times as long as it should have I asked them if it was ok to camp in front of the base... They told me no it was not buuuuuut I was more than welcome to have a bed in their barracks, share some cognac, and have dinner with them.

These soldiers work a 3 day shift of 24 hours and rotate out every week. They were great guys and incredible friends! We talked about my time in Iraq & Afghanistan as well as their time in Afghanistan... It was a different war they were fighting and it was fantastic to see both sides of the coin as well as have the full tour of this amazing place that very easily could have ended humanity as we know it @ Strategic Missile Forces Museum, Ukraine

name: Zaliznyi Port - west suburb
description: Wild camp at the water next to the Black sea nature reserve. No convenience even but close to the nature

name: ТИРОЛЬ / TIROL
description: Hostel open 24/24, around 500 Hrivnyas for one night

name: Place under the tent - Місце під палатку
description:
Place under a tent on a meadow, slope, water

Місце під палатку на полонині, схил, вода

name: White Ocacia
description:
There is firewood, there is water and a flat surface for a tent in the shade of trees. Everything for a comfortable rest after long twisting down the hill!

Есть дрова,есть вода и ровная поверхность для палатки в тени деревьев.Все для комфортного отдыха после долгих вкручиваний под горку!

name: Tiasmin
description:
There is firewood, water and a flat surface for a tent in the shade of trees. Everything for a comfortable stay.

Есть дрова,есть вода и ровная поверхность для палатки в тени деревьев.Все для комфортного отдыха

name: Makovysche
description:
Somewhere in the small quite village Makovysche. We searched for a quiet and very safe night spot. Therefore we turned off the highway M06 and stopped at a wild area.
Very silent and safe too.

name: In the direction of mountain Jagidna
description: In the direction of mountain Jagidna, place for rest and have a bit.

name: motoE
description:
Motorcycles shop; details and accessories for motorcycles and the service 
Phone: +380949823826 (What’s Up; Viber; Telegram) | Instagram: @motoeuropean | Facebook: motoE

name: Village Nova Huta - spring water
description:
Village Nova Huta - place were you can take pure spring water and to 
fill your bottles . There are benches and place for rest, with possibility to put on a tents.

name: Border
description: Easy border compared to what we have read about others. Our luggage was inspected fairly thoroughly and bikes VIN numbers checked leaving and entering. Dogs papers checked but not thoroughly against microchips. Total process took about half an hour for check out of Moldova and into Ukraine. All officials were very helpful and friendly.

name: Shevelivske Reserved Source
description:
Shevelivske Reserved Source
You can collect water for free

name: Wild camp
description: Here you can cook on the fire and put up a tent.

name: U Fedora
description: Budget rooms for one or two persons. Current price ca. 13 € per person, no refrigerator or AC. Nice personnel, only Russian.

name: Glam Camping
description: Wonderful wild stretch of coast, and this is one of 4 campsites - choose which one you want, they all offer very similar facilities at around UAH 300 per night. If you really want to get away from it all, here is the place. One of the campsites is called Authentic camping, offers a Cafe, hedonistic, yoga, really cool.

name: Podróże Na Kacu
description: quiet place close to nature.  pasture for cows.  perfect for one night

name: Podróże Na Kacu
description: wild place by the river.  some rubbish.  a lot of anglers

name: Podróże Na Kacu
description: a lot of space.  tall grass. dirt road. steep descent to the water

name: On top of a ski piste.
description: I don't think it's being used anymore. Asked a few locals if we could sleep here. No worries they said. Also by looking at the map it's a road to other areas.

name: Nankiv'kyy Monastyr
description: Monastery with 15 monks. Large parking lot at the entrance. We visited the church, and then we politely asked permission to stay overnight. There is drinking water behind the church (ask the monks, because there is also another place with bad water). Toilets available next to the parking. No fee.

name: Near highway
description: Head east off the highway a few hundred meters and there are clearings in the shrubs for vehicles to park. Very private, no visitors but did hear dogs at night a little. Great for a quick overnighter before moving on. A few mozzies. Full LTE with vodaphone

name: Abandoned facility
description:
Nice area outside of town, old cement structures around, looks like old cattle area from way back. Good grass on the Northside, LTE is 1-2 bars on vodaphone. Nice trees, overall a good stop for a night. 

- looks like to town near by uses the south east corner for rubbish but is at least 800-1000m away so it’s okay. And it’s a small tip.

name: Podróże Na Kacu
description: peaceful free site on the cliff. path to the beach is available

name: River valley camp
description: Small area next to river where you can park next to road for the night. Stunning area nestled in the cliffs just down from the waterfall. There is some traffic but only till 6pm  it people were friendly. Clean water, shade. Overall a nice place to sit for the night.

name: Glam Camping
description: Beautiful wild sandy beach with other camping around the strip of beach. Next door is Authentic Camping with cafe & yoga.

name: Metropolitan Mall
description: Inside the mall, upstairs, Прачечная самообслуживания (= Self-service laundry) "Постирушка". Open 7/7.

name: Good Place on the Lake
description:
Some Locals here but in the night it's quiet.
Maybe on the Weekend, it's not so quiet. You can swim here!

name: Park recreation Novoselytsia
description: Recreation parc with a nice camping next to the Samara "river" - it's rather a pond area.  Sand beach. Pizzeria. Very crowded during the weekend (we arrived Sunday 6pm when everybody was leaving). A bit noisy, the highway is 100m away.

name: Beach of грушiвка
description: Nice sand beach on the Dniepr, used as camping spot by the locals. Places for tents and campers. No shower, but the Dniepr is clean enough.

name: Along the Tysa
description: Well used spot along the river. Lots of trails going towards the river from the main road, just pick one and enjoy. There’s some trash though. Very quiet at night, but gets busy in the weekends by swimmers and fishermen.

name: Tustan Rocks
description:
Famous tourist site and sold as daytrip from Lviv. There used to be a huge wooden castle here in the Middle Ages. 

Signs in English and Russian. Tickets cost 80 UAH

name: Wooden Church of St George
description:
A UNESCO wooden church from the 15th century. One of the oldest i. The Carpatian region. It’s very impressive both from the outside and inside.

Entrance including taking pictures is 100 for two people.

name: Public distribution of potable water
description: Public distribution or potable water (Бювет)

name: Yard hostel
description:
Nice hostel, clean and well organised. It’s quiete and there is place for motorcycles. 7,5€ in dorm.
Super location

name: Under the train bridge
description:
Exactly under the notorious bridge you can park your van or bike. Quiete in the night (except for the few train passing).

(Please keep it clean and pick up trash around, even if it’s not yours)

name: Cosy Bakery
description:
Wonderful little cosy bakery in the middle of nothing, where they make sweets and bread. Free WiFi (and nice toilet).
I suggest a stop here

name: Abandoned palace
description:
If you like abandoned places, this is the place for you.
The young Katia brought me all around, a kind of friendly private tour

name: Good place to stay
description: Good place for one night. Next the forest and 100m far from the road. A lot of space. Bit dirty. Tables and gym facilities

name: Arqueological site
description: Paved parking lot of the kam'yana Mohyla arqueological site. Only a short detour from the main road and the site is well worth a visit

name: Zaporizhzhia
description: Quiet parking lot by the national reserve Khortytsia. There's a cultural park/open air museum near by and plenty of trails to walk, run or bike.

name: Waterside
description: A bit rough. 100 m downhill road leads to a beautiful lakeside.

name: Cliff Camping
description: Quiet place on a cliff. There's a path down to the beach.

name: tscherkassy forrest
description: A nice, quiet plot to stay for one night or more near Tscherkassy. Many sandy roads into the forest. A lot of shade.

name: Inveraray
description: trucker parking lot

name: Cannock Chase
description: 3000 acres of ancient kings hunting lodge

name: Pen Y Fan
description: Nice sleep spot just off from road with access to the mountain trail. Quiet and has free toilets. There is a breakfast stall open in morning for hot drinks and food.

name: Nature Reserve
description: Lovely spot on nature reserve 500 metres from road. Quiet location with mountains, river, lots of grass and tables for eating on.

name: Life's A Beach
description: Arrived late afternoon and no one in office to pay. However next morning staff arrive at 9 and will charge you £5. You could leave before this time and pay nothing... Beautiful and quiet spot right on the beach... Toilet and showers close by. Make sure to stay high up the beach to avoid tide! There was at least 6 other rigs doing the same so it's accepted by the locals. There is a traditional camp site behind dunes for the crazy expensive price of £10 per person if you like that kind of thing (no thanks).

name: Lake Side View
description: Beautiful spot by lake and perfect for kayaking and hiking trails. Slightly difficult to get to as roads are steep and narrow in parts so take it easy. Modern toilets available.

name: Tryfan
description:
Small car park just off of main road...

Beautiful views of surrounding mountains and lake (great for kayaking). Also perfect if your heading up Tryfan. This is hiking and climbing heaven! Take the north ridge for some awesome scrambling fun.

name: Llanberis Pass
description: Perfect spot by the large boulders... Busy until about 7pm then nice and quiet. Need to use ramps to get level. If you love walking and climbing this is the place to be... Stock up on supplies from the town below and then stay here a few days. Buses regularly take you up to the top of the pass. It really is one of the best places in the UK for hiking and climbing! Take on Crib Goch if your feeling brave!

name: Castle View
description: Beautiful spot on the river right by the castle. 3 other vans close by so no problems with locals. Great for fishing, kayaking and walks into town for historic experience. Toilets close by.

name: Calor Autogas
description: The only place we found for propane that would fill our permanent tank.  In London neighbourhood called Bow.

name: Lee Valley
description: Established family campground 45 minutes from London via public transportation. Spaces for RVs and tents. Clean hot showers, laundry and dish washing facilities (no stoves) Near to golf, movie theatre and recreational activities. We paid £22 per rig with electrical and water nearby. Not a natural setting by any means but good if you want to explore London.   Public bus is a 3 minute walk from campsite. Wifi is paid separately to a third party company with 24, one week options.

name: Kayak Launch Spot
description: Great spot for launching kayaks (no charge) that offers a great paddle along quiet river... Parking is free all day with the possibility of sleeping the night. There's a great pub/restaurant on the other side of the river along with beautiful walks. Highly recommended!

name: Northern Migration
description: Our temporary home... All are welcome! If you need a base for a few nights/days, our door is always open. Cooked food, washing, hot shower, etc. Our home is your home, free of charge. Simply leave a note and give a few days notice x

name: Trossachs Holiday Park
description: Site with terraced and landscaped parking for motorhomes. Full facilities. Like all formal camping it was on the expensive side £25 for 2 adults and a motorhome. But much prettier than the usual flat field of other parks. Great spot for exploring the North West of Scotland.

name: Loch Collie-Bharr
description: Very quiet and secluded parking and picnic area near the loch and walking trail. Free. No amenities.

name: Creek side near Shiel Bridge
description: Pretty spot in valley with creek. A bit noisy from the street. Great views. No big rigs, space for 1 vehicle only.

name: Staffin Seaside Parking
description: Wild camping on dead end road next to the beach. There are also camping sites at end of road, paved parking for the pier. It's a tad smelly by the pier so we parallel parked along the shore. Fairly flat and quiet.

name: St. Margarets I White Cliffs I Monument
Pett Level
description: Just beside the street; OK for one or two nights; Public toilets at the beach front; several restaurants nearby

name: Beach spot
description: Quiet spot. Perfect for the early morning ferry crossing next day... Kids park and fish n chips close by.

name: Marine Parade
description: It's a free place to park and to sleep for the night. The ocean is 50 meters away just across the road.

name: Cullpeppers Dish
description: Wild camping in forestry commission car park.

name: Rothiemurchus Caravan & Camping
description: Located beautifully in the woods between trees and along a river. Very clean toilets and showers. Not one of those typical campgrounds, rather one that is really nice to stay at.

name: Campincentre
description: It's a nice Campside 15min to dover  two persons and campcar 26£/Night

name: Causeway Farm
description: Nice little farm just outside Weymouth with camping for caravans/motorhomes. It's part of one of the caravan clubs but non members are welcome. Grassed field has a bit of a slope but there are a few flat spots. Bathroom, potable water faucet, and WC dump. There are 3 points to plug in for electricity at the bathroom. Very nice owner. £8 a night without electricity.

name: Harbor Parking Brixham
description: Nice flat parking lot at the harbor. The sign at the entrance says no camping but we stayed with 2 other campers and had no problem. £8 for 24 hours. Beautiful views and the cute village is a quick walk along the water. Fairly quiet at night.

name: Mayfair Car Park
description: Car park with a dirt lot at the back for overnight camper parking. Conveniently located near shops and Tintagel Castle. Flat grassed lot and quiet at night. £3.50 overnight, £2 for the day. There is also a paved parking next door for campers for £3 overnight at the King Arthur's Car Park.

name: Hamilton House Farm
description: Nice flat grass field in the front of the farm for camping. Electrical outlets scattered around the field. There is a bathroom and shower I saw people using but could never find it. 9£ a night electricity included; same without. Tents okay. We couldn't find anybody when we arrived and had to track somebody down to pay in the morning. Nice place for a stop over.

name: Baron's Haugh Car Park
description: Car park for a park/nature reserve just south of Glasgow and right off the highway. Good for a stop over. Flat, and quiet overnight. Nice trails for walking/running leaving from the car park.

name: Lay by Parking Loch Lomond
description: Parking in a lay by off the A82. Beautiful views and it's free but you can hear the traffic from the highway, although there are trees blocking you from sight of the road. Traffic slows down at night but there are still cars. Quite a few other campers here, a couple looked like they'd moved in for the summer.

name: Lay By On Loch Ness
description: Two small parking places on the back side of a lay by on the A82 on the shore of Loch Ness. You can tuck back in some vegetation so you are more or less hidden from the road but can still hear the traffic. Not too much traffic at night but if you are a light sleeper this isn't recommended. Flat parking and beautiful views of the lake.

name: Bught Caravan Park
description:
Message on gate that site is close for this season 18-3-2022
Typical fairly nice campground. Flat grassed camping field, large pitches, and dated but clean bathrooms. Some pitches around the outside are right on the road so traffic can be annoying. Separate area for tent campers. Washing and drying machines 4£ each. Good location for visiting Inverness. Located a block from the river and a very nice walking path to town. 22£ with electricity for a camper and 2 people. Internet is 2£ extra for 24 hours and I believe there is an extra charge for dogs but don't know how much.

name: Shieldaig Crofters
description: Small grassed lot at the top of a hill overlooking the town of Shieldaig and a beautiful bay. We didn't stay here but it looked like a nice spot. It is an unlicensed camping spot. Good for campers and tents. Bathrooms available at the bottom of the hill in town and garbage bins at the entrance. Free.

name: Bont Fechan Campsite
description: Informal rustic campsite set over 4 fields with toilets and bins on site.  Shower, fridge/freezer and charging facilities at owners house on opposite side of main road. About 1 mile to beach and local village.  No set pitches plenty of space but access gate is a little tight for vehicles over 8m.  Price was £7 per night for 2 people and motorhome plus £1 per additional person.  Showers take 20p pieces.  No charge for dogs.  Tents are £6.

name: Bay And River View Pull Out
description: Beautiful flat grassed spot along side a river with views to the bay. Off of a small road with little traffic. There is some vegetation between the clearing and the road although you can still see from the road. There was a small fire pit already made. Great boon docking site.

name: Dufftown Parking
description: Nice little parking lot tucked back off the street. Quiet at night and a good location for whiskey distilleries and shops in town. Bathrooms are located within the parking and open during the day. The lot starts to get busy pretty early.

name: Allt Mor Parking
description: Very nice parking for the forestry commission. Off the road and lots of parkings tucked back in the vegetation. Quiet at night and lots of walking trails near by. Beautiful location. There are some other parkings near the lake close by with signs saying no overnight parking but there were no signs here. 2£ pay and display.

name: Tanpits Cider Farm
description: Lovely informal camping in Apple orchard.  Suitable for all types of rig although approach road is a little narrow.  Toilets, showers (30p), water, two cassette emptying points.  Peacocks, guineafowl and geese on site.  Fee is £8 for two persons for tent, motorhome or caravan and car.  EHU is £4, dogs 50p, laundry £3 dryer £1.  Canal 200m pub 500m 3 miles into Taunton, asda 1 mile.  Best part they sell home made cider for £1.35 a litre if you provide your own container.

name: Mortonhall Caravan And Camping
description: The only campground in Edinburgh. There is a bus stop near by to take you to town. It's probably nice in the off season but I wouldn't recommend coming in the high season. If you have a camper do your self a favor and find a boondocking spot on the street. The pitch was so steep even with 4 blocks we were too angled to cook. Never had a hot shower the entire stay and the bathrooms were filthy. £31.75 a night 2 people and electricity, there is an added fee to make a reservation, Internet is extra but so bad I wouldn't waste your money. All in all a terrible campground.

name: Wyming Brook Nature Reserve Parking
description: Nice flat parking lot off a small little used road. There are nice walking trails leading off the parking. No height restrictions and no signs prohibiting camping. Some foot traffic in the evening but quiet at night. Gets pretty busy early in the morning with walkers.

name: Little Styrne Campground
description: Nice campground for motorhomes and caravans. Big flat grassed lot. Bathrooms but no showers, chem toilet dump and water spigot. Nice walking/biking trail along the river near by. The site is a caravan club certificated site and the sign says members only but wasn't even mentioned when we inquired about camping. If nobody comes to the gate call the numbers on the sign at the street. 10£/night without electricity.

name: Scotland
description: Coolinview guest house -- nice place. Not cheap at ninety pounds per night for two, but with its own bath and continental breakfast it's about the going rate for the island it seems.

name: John o groats campsite
description:
Open all year, £10 for me just with a tent and motorcycle. 
Toilet block with hot showers. 
Right in the coast so great view. 
Friendly host, room for big rigs

name: Hawkshead Hall Camping
description: Farmland with plenty of space for camping and caravans with or without electricity. £18 for 2 adults with a tent, £3 for a car, extra adults £2.50 kids £1. Good clean toilets and tv room with free wifi, public footpath directly to hawkshead town (10 min walk)

name: Brocklands Farm
description: Beautiful location, amenities lacking though if you not carrying your own.  eg.  no shower block and an open air toilet... there are a couple of sheltered toilets where farm buildings are about 5mins walk from campsite.

name: Longniddry
description: Good place to stop and rest, quiet and with sea views. Pay machines are been installed  for parking. there is a 2 meters hight restritaion.

name: haldon Forest Park
description:
Free shower and toilet here. Ask the rangers and they may fill your water too. 

Lots of walks and cycle tracks here. 
Great cafe!

name: No Man's Land
description: Beautiful abandoned spot with a few ramshackle skeletons of abandoned homes. Views straight over the most northern point of the British mainland. Need 4WD for access via steep road. Touch windy but it's par for the course up here.

name: Castle Drive Car Park, Falmouth
description: Lay-by style car park with lots of spots for RV/van camping. Views across the bay. No facilities. Slight sloping but for one or two nights, no bother. Paved. We happily slept in the back of our 4X4. Occasional night drivers honk and race past but it's not too annoying.

name: Allt Mor car park
description: for 2 £ you can stay the whole day. overnight camping is not forbidden as it is in all other car parks in this area. nice spots in the forrest. no infrastructure. a river is nearby.

name: Churchill barrier Orkney
description: Good beach side dune site with multiple camping spots and clean toilet facilities, great views and ground fires seem to be allowed

name: Gorleston Cliff
description: Right at the southern end of Marine Parade there's usually lots of space to park Motorhomes for an overnight with a great sea view opposite the expensive houses.  We've stayed here a few times for a single night, no parking restrictions and streetlights are 24 hours.

name: Searings
description: Motorcycle mechanics good friendly service

name: Searings
description: motorcycle mechanics

name: Sainsburys
description: Sainsburys Supermarket near Braintree on Blythe's Meadow Drive

name: Tesco
description: Tesco supermarket near Braintree.  ATM and car wash too!

name: Abinger Roughs car park
description: Car park in trees

name: Farm Camping
description: It's a nice place with a great view on the sea

name: The Lazy Trout Cafe
description:
great stop for full english brekkie - good price ( big brekkie £6.50 - super big £10).  cappaccino here too :) simple lunches available 

big parking area suitable for big rigs

open 8am to 3pm - 7 days a week

name: Car park near Bignor Hill
description: Grassy hill top car park. nice view. no facilities

name: The West End Cafe
description:
carvery £5.95 
good coffee £1.50

all day brekkie £7.95

favourite with bikers

name: Scotland Loch Lomond
description: Just after Drymen (1h)

name: Gwerniago Camp Site
description: Nice basic campsite with good facilities. Around £15 per night for a pitch with no hookup.

name: Honister Pass
description:
Large lay-by on the Honister Pass road, just by bridge with 6'6" sign. Right beside a fairly fast flowing river which is clean and great for getting water.  
Valley can be really windy sometimes. 
Big enough area for trucks. Approach road is narrow in both directions but wider than the 6'6" signs state. Steep mountain pass to the West.

name: Maidens Cross Car Park
description: A good sized spot beside a road that is quiet at night. Right beside the wind turbines overlooking the surrounding hill tops.

name: Llynnau Mymbyr Layby
description: Decent sized lay by with views of Mount Snowdon. Road can be busy during day time.

name: Llynn Geirionydd
description: A good lake side car park which is popular with campervans and campers. Not really accessible for motorhomes or overland trucks as access road is very narrow.

name: Llynn Crafnant Picnic Parking
description: Another good sized car park for a quiet nights rest. Sheltered location but be aware of the midges when there's no wind. Natural water from the lake just up the road or small streams running through picnic site.

name: Grave Yard Campers
description: perfect camp ground at loch leven. drive to the end of the road at kinross house straight to the cemetary. you will have a perfect view over loch leven. in the day hours it's frequented with wanderers, cyclists and dog walkers.

name: Kiss the Skye
description: Drive from Broadford to Kilbride, than a single trail road leeds you to a meadow with sheeps and a beautiful view to the sea.

name: View over Fort William
description: Drive up the old miltary road until you reach the view point or drive further if it's crowded. You can enjoy a beautiful view over Fort William and Ben Nevis.

name: Nant yr Arian
description: Mtb and Walking trail centre with a good car park and nice and quiet over night. great views of the coast towards Aberystwyth.

name: Coed y Brenin Trail Centre
description:
A busy hub for Mtb, Walking and Trail Running. The top (overflow) car park is best for campers and is popular with campervans and motorhomes and big enough for trucks as well. It is also nice and quiet after the masses leave around 5pm. Despite the no overnight stay signs the management are fine with people who are tidy and considerate. We can also recommend the trail centre cafe for a good breakfast! 
WiFi, toilets and hot showers available at the centre during business hours. A drinking water tap is located on the exterior of the building on the lower level, tucked round the side past the running shop.

name: Hordens car park
description: Great little spot to stop overnight with walks out over the West Pennine moors in both directions.  The big hill at the back is Winter Hill and the views from the top stretch from the Lake District to Wales and all the way out to the Fylde Coast.  If the parking is full there is another about 300m west along the road.  Road a bit tight but still good for large trucks steep and narrow coming out of Belmont but wider afterwards.

name: Chapel House Farm
description: Great little campsite with hard standing for large trucks and grass pitches for tents.  £6 per person per night.  Open all year round.  Fantastic walks from the campsite.

name: Woodend Caravan Site
description: Nice and quiet Campsite. You can was your clothes in a washmaschine and there is also a dryer.  Washmaschine costs 3 pound, dryer 1 pound and shower 10 pence.

name: Llynnau Mymbyr Layby
description: A good sized Layby beside the lake that has flat grass suitable for tents. Road is busy during the day but not too bad at night. Look for the big boulder. A short walk is Plas Y Brenin where the bar does excellent food and local beers.

name: Erwlon Caravan and Camping Place
description: Nice place with lot of grassy areas but not many shades. It's next to a road but there's not much traffic going on. They charged me 5.50 pound for one person, one motorcycle, one tent (which is pretty good). It's five minutes walk from a nice village with a supermarket. For the internet you have to pay extra...

name: Bryn Y Bwyd Camping
description: Small, minimalist and cheap camping place by a farm house. Super nice owner with dogs. You can see the sea from the camping ground. It's next to a road but it's not that busy. If you want a well facilitated, busy campsite than this is not your place....

name: Blue John Cavern Road
description:
Roadside parking underneath Mam Tor. Turning space for Bus' and bigger vehicles further down the road. 
May be cosy for wider vehicles but we found there was space for a step outside with space for vehicles to pass. 
There are no signs stating 'No Overnight Parking' etc, which we have encountered at many other places in the Peak District.

name: Hanover point National Trust
description: Nice car park with amazing views and toilets

name: Oban Backpackers
description: Super nice hostel, great hosts. I've paid 17 pounds for one night's stay.

name: New Slains Castle
description: Right next to New Slains Castle (which might have inspired Bram Stoker in his story of Dracula) & the cliffs. Beautiful view , quiet (aside from a few visitors to the castle during the day) & 4G reception

name: Torridon
description:
Free camp site with free hot showers (donations welcomed!).
Campsite is for tents only but there is a car park for vans next to it.

name: car park at Lael forest garden
description: car park 30 metres from the road. Tables.

name: Applecross camping
description: Nice place with everything you need. Wifi is only at the reception and it's kind of slow. Store and bar is about 10 minutes walk away.

name: Park House Campsite
description:
Supernice, quiet, small, family run place. No internet and phone reception, but they have everything else you might need. The surrounding area and scenery is breathtakingly beautiful. In the back of the campsite there is a waterfall. 

The place has been converted to glamping, they accept tents only with a yurt reservation http://www.keldbunkbarnandyurts.com/

name: Camber Sands
description: Large holiday resort at the coast with many entertainment facilities. Expensive: GBP 49 (2 adults, camper, high season).

name: Park Farm Camping
description: Very large campground with big lawns. Fires allowed at pitches at the lawn. Playgrounds for children. Shop selling fast food and snacks. GBP 20 (2 adults, camper).

name: Maynard Caravan & Camping Park
description: Lawns for camping. Some noise from nearby road. GBP 11 (2 adults, camper), electricity GBP 3. Free wifi at next door's restaurant and hotel.

name: Oxford Camping & Caravanning Club Site
description: Lawns and old but functioning and clean ablutions. Bus to town (2 km). GBP 27.70 (2 adults, camper). Extra fee GBP 4.10 for electricity.

name: Moreton-in-Marsh Caravan & Motorhome Club
description: Large grassy campground with well maintained ablutions. GBP 31.80 (2 adults, camper with automobile club discount). We didn't use the internet.

name: Riverbend Caravan Park
description: Large terrain with cottages with a separate field for trekking tourist next to the Banwy river. Lawn with some trees, excellent ablutions. GBP 25 (2 adults, camper, high season).

name: Tan-y-Fron
description: Friendly campground with permanent holiday homes and grassy space for touring travellers on a terraced reasonably sized field with view over Dolgellau. Payed WiFi to be available mid August 2017. Well maintained ablutions. Every pitch has electricity, water and TV-connection. Walking distance from town. GBP 26 (2 adults, camper).

name: Tanforhesgen
description: Friendly, reasonably sized campground. Lawn next to hill around farm. 30 mins walking from Harlech. Electricity at some pitches. GBP 14 (2 adults, camper), electricity GBP 3, hot shower GBP 0.20 for 4 minutes.

name: Conwy Holiday Park
description: Very large terrain that is divided in sections of some 40 pitches each. Because the pitches are separated by lines of trees and hedges it gives the feeling of a small, not so massive campground. Well maintained ablutions, rather poorly signposted walking path to town (30 to 45 min.). GBP 23.99 (2 adults, camper). Electricity charged separately depending on required power. Fast, free internet in the Swallow's nest bar (only). No vans or trucks allowed.

name: Dowlaw parking
description: Quiet place to park overnight, with beautiful views over the Fife peninsula and Forth estuary. We were there on a clear evening and could see the Cairngorms silhouetted against the sunset nearly 100 miles away. Direct access to a pleasant coastal walking trail. The gravel parking area is large and relatively flat, and is sheltered on three sides.

name: Wasdale Head parking
description: Great place to overnight whilst hiking in one of the most dramatic parts of the Lake District. Beautiful surroundings and close proximity to the charming Wasdale Head Inn. National Trust discourage but tolerate overnight parking.  The road down get progressively narrower and worse condition as you approach Wasdale Head. The last stone bridge has a turn immediately after it, which will limit the length of vehicle that can pass. We visited in a 7.5m long, 2.5m wide truck and had a few cm to spare; a coach would have difficulty.

name: Nant y Moch Reservoir
description: Plenty of places to stop around the reservoir. This one in particular is big enough for large vehicles.Very quiet road and feels like you are in the middle of nowhere.

name: quiet Layby
description: Lay by with no facilities in a quiet road

name: Chatsworth Park Caravan & Motorhome Club Site
description: Well maintained campground with lange pitches with pebbles. Hedges and trees between sections of about 6 pitches give the feeling of a small but sterile campground. The campground is on the estate of Chatsworth House, but the full entry price must be payed to visit it. Small shop at the reception. Expensive: GBP 36.40 (2 adults, camper with automobile club Key Card discount). No tents. We did not use the internet, so we don't know the speed.

name: Camping & Caravanning Club - Cambridge Club Site
description: Large but friendly campground. Big lawns without trees with a mix of tents, campers and caravans. Well maintained. WiFi through external service. Regular bus service to Cambridge. GBP 23 (2 adults, camper with Key Card membership). We did not use the internet.

name: Cherry Hinton Caravan & Motorhome Club
description: We did not stay at the site as it was fully booked. Touring motorhomes and caravans are welcome. Site closest to Cambridge.

name: Keat Farm - Hawthorn Farm
description: terrain with large lawns separated by hedges. Large areas without numered sites, so little risk that no pitch is available. Well maintained ablutions. GBP 20 (2 adults, camper), electricity GBP 3.

name: Dover-Calais ferry crossing
description: Extremely quick border crossing traveling from the UK to France for EU citizens. No UK immigration, French immigration in Dover just waved us through.  We crossed nearly 3 hours earlier than booked. The shipping company DFDS changed the booking without additional charges. GBP 80 for 2 adults and a small camper.

name: beach near ferry to Ireland
description: from the main road first a tar road that turns into a gravel road. take the turn left and you end up at the beach.  road is not suitable for big rigs. there is a river for natural fresh water that runs into the sea.

name: Elaghvale campsite
description:
campsite with nice ablution a little social room where you can swap books and a washing machine that you can use for free!!!! owners are very friendly people. the city londonderry is 10 minutes driving . toilet and hot showers are good. we payed 12.50 pounds for one night two people car and roof top tent. with electricity is more expensive. it s a small quit nice
 place in the rural part next to the city. so it is not a big campsite with al the luxery like swimming pool and play area.

name: Incledon Farm
description: Established farmyard campsite with basic facilities including toilets, showers and a small food prep and storage area. have been coming here on and off for around 10 years. £7 per night per person.

name: Trwyn yr Wylfa Camping Site
description: Very clean and nice campground. 2 pp and a moto 16 pounds

name: Portavogie Car Park
description: Car park right next to the beach. Toilets and trash bins are also here. Very quiet when we stayed there. Flat area so it's easy to stand level. Also a little playground nearby where kids can play.

name: Arrina Forest
description: A quiet sheltered clearing about 100m down a track. Stream nearby.

name: Bornais
description: Wonderful place, quiet, nature, need 4x4,

name: Stroan Loch
description: Dunfries and Galloway Forest. Camping in the Forestry parking area at the end of the Loch. Just off the Raiders Road

name: Quayside, Glencaple Rd, Glencaple, Dumfries DG1 4RE, UK
description: Glen Caple Quay side parking area. Honesty Box for upkeep donations

name: The Drove, Stonehenge
description:
The Drove is a Gravel Byway that runs past Stonehenge. It is a Vehicular right of way and an unofficial wild camping spot. Important!!! Access is from the A303 when travelling West bound. Turning right into the Drove from the East bound A303 is prohibited for Road safety reasons.
It is possible to view the stones when parked on the Drove

name: Quiet Layby
description: A quiet layby set back from a B road and partially screened by trees from the road.

name: Stratford on Avon Leisure Centre Carpark
description:
Stratford Upon Avon Leisure Centre Car Park 
CV37 6YY
Lorry, Coach, Car and Motorhome parking behind the Leisure centre.
Only £2 for overnight parking 4pm until 8am.
Within easy walking distance from the Theatre and Town centre.

name: Sango Sands Oasis
description: Durness. Sango Sands Oasis Campsite sited above the beach. Wonderful views.

name: Coop Supermarket
description: The Coop supermarket at Brodick allow overnight stopovers in there car park

name: Sea Front Parking Brodick
description: Overnight parking all along the sea front at Brodick

name: Loch Carron View Point
description: Overnight stopover at Loch Carron View Point / Picnic area on the A890. Fantastic views across Loch Carron

name: Clootie Well with camping option
description: The Clootie Well is situated in a forest beside the A832. Possibly suitable for an overnight stopover, but the main attraction is in the forest. A section of the forest contains pieces of rag (Clooties) tied to the trees having first been soaked in the small well as a offering to cure health problems. Surreal and though provoking.

name: Chanonry Point
description: Chanonry Point has a small parking area by the lighthouse and it's the main site to view Dolphins feeding on Salmon . Excellent Photography site

name: Hawick Motorhome aire
description: Hawick council have set an aire for motorhomes and campervan in the car park with dedicated parking area.

name: Stratford on Avon Racecourse
description: Stratford on Avon Horse Racing Course. Has an Established Camp site at the entrance and is also the site for the Adventure Overland Show held in April and September. The show runs a campsite during that time. http://adventureoverlandshow.net/#

name: The Ross. Forestry car park
description: A forestry Commission picnic area / car park just of "The Ross" a road that cuts across Arran from Lamlash.. A quiet area with a small Brook. Used by dog walkers and hikers.

name: Hafren forest car park
description:
remote parking and picnic area.
Lots of gorgeous walks.
can walk to the source of the River Severn.
good spot.

name: RST Landrovers
description: Friendly and knowledgeable Landrover specialists. Always busy but always willing to help with advice and parts/upgrade

name: Sand veld Dorpshuys
description: Small campsite with swimming pool a very noisy rooster and lots of local and road noise. Expensive for what it is at R330 for 2 and a car.

name: Rails road car park
description:
A beautiful parking near a small lake. It’s a lot of trails and a small river.
At the night it’s quite. At the morning a lot of birds singing and people running. It’s ok to sleep a night, it’s safety. No facilities.

name: Church Field long stay carpark
description: £5 overnight parking charge from 6 pm to 10 am. Toilet block available. Situated on the quay side with views. Motorhome/campervan overnight sleeping allowed

name: Riverbank Long Stay Car Park
description: £5 per overnight parking 6pm to 10am. Motorhome/campervan overnight camping allowed. River side location

name: Main Long stay carpark
description: £5 per overnight car parking. from 6pm to 10am. Motorhome/Campervan overnight camping allowed

name: Manor Long Stay Car park
description:
ADMIN NOTE: a user reported on 2019-03-03 that this place is in the wrong location. Please update the coordinates.
---
£5 per overnight parking 6pm to 10am. Motorhome/Campervan overnight camping allowed.

name: Liverpool Marina Car parking
description: Marina Car park £15 per 24 hour parking. Motorhome/Campervan overnight camping allowed. A key to the marina toilets and showers available during daytime for a £10 deposit £5 repaid we returning key to the reception. Easy walking distance to the Dock areas and Liverpool city. Yacht club restaurant available

name: The Watton Long Stay Car Park
description: Watton long stay car park, Free overnight parking for motorhome/campervan parking. Overnight camping allowed. 4 large designated motorhome parking bays. Toilets nearby. easy walking distance to Morrisons supermarket

name: Park Neath Port
description: Great place to take a good shower! Toilets are cleaning, it’s wonderful! Pay 1,50 pouds for 5 min. Its possible sleep, but we don’t now the price. We were here in the winter and this shower was really good.

name: Runswick Bay
description: Car park with no overnight parking, toilets and cafe are close.

name: Mcdonald Automotive
description: Landrover specialist but deals with all makes. Great to get you back up and running fast without ripping you off.

name: Riverside campground
description: Great campsite , new facilities, very clean, nice walks on the river and Alex the manager is great

name: Rough Grounds Farm campsite
description: Great quiet campsite, hot power shower and clean bathroom and washing up area with a washing machine! £12 for a tent

name: Knockfarrel
description: A lovely place to stop overnight on the top of a hill called "the cats back" this is a flat bit of ground used for parking when locals walk their dogs well away from any traffic and looks onto a lovely Victorian spa village reputed to have healing waters. You can walk down to this (2miles) by taking the farm track to the right. Don't miss the standing stones on the way down. When you get to the main road turn right. The overnight stop is about 200m off the road up a farm track and would be ok for most size motorhome as (ours is 7.2m long). Please don't empty your waist here as it's my local walking area and don't want to come across your rubbish.

name: spital beach car park
description: stopping overnight in our campervan. no parking restrictions. height limit of 2.3m (barrier) you are virtually on the beach. large bins to put your rubbish in.  free parking.

name: South lytchett manor caravan & camping Dorset
description:
ADMIN REPORT: Location updated, Please check in and verify GPS coordinates. 

Great place to stay perfect for tents and campers in great location for Poole not the cheapest but is well worth pay that bit extra for this place 
Cleanest showers and wc you will find 
Bikers are welcome

name: Culbin Forest (FC Car Park)
description: Culbin Forest FC car park. 24hrs pay and display. Excellent modern, clean toilet block apparently open 24hrs also.

name: Dunnet Head (RSPB)
description: Car park overlooking Dunnet Head, Orkney Islands and across the sea to mainland. Can be busy during the day; arrive late. Exposed. Amazing views in good weather.

name: St Margrets Bay
description:
Lovely little car park. Very quiet. Nice views at the base of the Dover cliffs. Great stop over for the ferry.
CAUTION. Vehicles over 3ton or trailers will not get down the tight road to the bottom.

name: Forestry Car Park
description:
Forestry car park just before the Fairy Pools Car Park.
Set back from the road

name: Berriew (mid Wales)
description:
small quiet car park alongside canal by sports field / tennis club. 
few minutes walk to village with pubs and shop. Andrew Logan (modern artist) gallery. 
clean, toilet block behind football stands.
good walking / biking along canal.

name: Blaen y Glyn Uchaf car park
description:
A quiet and remote car park maintained/owned by the National Trust. Ideal for overnight stays in a camper/van, and for trail access to nearby Pen y Fan (~6m). Surrounded by conifers, waterfall, and hills of the Brecon Beacons, it's a lovely spot for nature, solitude and stargazing. 

There is room for some 25 cars, but is seldom full outside of peak season. There are no amenities of any kind aside from a few picnic benches. A nearby waterfall might tempt some for water, if needed (take typical precaution). Poor/no phone signal. It's the type of spot to unplug.

name: Tan Hill Inn Camping
description: The Tan Hill Inn has a grassy site with a view and welcomes campers for £5 per adult per night.  Kids free.  Basic toilet facilities available, and pub serves meals and good beer. Can get vehicles on to grass, but can also camp in truck/van in the parking lot.  You are away from it all out here, great views, top of the world, can get windy as is high up in the moors...

name: Brades Acres
description: Very clean and tidy just in proses of a of a revamp. Jackie’s very nice and helpful. £10ish for a motorcycle and tent. Last time I stopped by here heavy rain was forecast so she offered me a great little cabin for an extra £10

name: Celtic Camping
description: Right on the coastal trail. Hot showers, kitchen, wifi, electric.

name: Talybont Farm
description:
Large established campground with all the facilities. Very well maintained. Good pubs and walking trails nearby. Washing machine, kettle, wifi.

£20 with electric. £17 without.

name: oceanfront roadside
description: Beautiful quiet roadside site on the ocean.

name: Dornie
description: Oceanfront campground with views of Castle Donan. Pick a spot. 15£ collected in evening. 50p hot showers (can just stop and use). coin-op electric uses 2£ coin for 24hrs. Small bakery and pizza 100 meters away. Walk to Castle or pub in town.

name: Kyle community facilities
description:
laundrette, showers, restroom
not many of these around

name: Torvaig Campground
description: Laundry and hot showers. 21£ plus a few more for electric. Nothing special, but good place to dry off and wait out a windy rainy day.

name: Staffin Community Slipway
description: many flat parking places along road with beautiful scenery. dinosaur footprints can be found at low tide. peaceful place!

name: Outside Sheildag with view
description: Super location with great view. Near roadside, but quiet at night.

name: Port a Bhaigh Campsite
description: Waterfront camp sites and new facilities. free WiFi, free showers, laundry. Excellent pub across the street.

name: Stoer Head
description: Parking area for lighthouse and trailhead. Flat spaces with great sunset views. One toilet and food stall open in summer. Donation box for overnight parking. Amazing white sand beaches on drive up.

name: Portree Isle of Skye
description: Big Co-op store for provisions, Water,Alchol and the car parking is good for overnight

name: Ceannabeinne Beach
description: Multiple parking areas near this beach that are used for camping. This one is up the road to the zip line and a graded gravel parking area for 3 cars. Off the main road. Sheep and ocean views. White sand beach below and freshwater stream across main road.

name: Helmsdale Harbor car park
description: parking area for harbor and town. waterfront. cell service. pubs and coffee shop nearby. public toilets at end of street near roundabout. recycling and garbage right here.

name: Torvean Campground
description: All the amenities. Free wifi and showers. Laundry available. £21 for a VW bus and 3 people with electric

name: Sydney Cove On Praa Sands car parks
description: Car park. £5 for 12 hours. £8 for 24 hours. Public toilet facility pretty disgusting. Cafe/ bar next to Praa Sands beach.

name: Road side pull out.
description: Pull out near small road, no facility.

name: Polperro car park
description: car park camp in the main car park. £8,50 a night. no toilets but main village has public ones.

name: cliff top view
description: dirt parking spot overlooking the bay. very quiet. steep road access in from the south (30%) made it in a MWB transit but one spot the 4x4 kicked in. all paved but could be tricky for the larger rigs in the wet.

name: white horse inn car park
description: Came across this when searching for parking for a hike up Blencathra. It has a sign saying pub parking and wild camping. Great parking spot for hikes and pub, close to the main road so there is a little traffic noise. We didn't camp but would be a handy spot. Dog friendly inside the pub.

name: Glenshee wayside
description: Large flat grassy area off road. Lots of space and great views. A river is a short walk below. Weak cell service. Ski area with shops about a mile up the road. Silent at night. We had a herd of 28 red tail deer wander through at sunset.

name: Hever castel car park
description: On the car parking of castel visitor; no service

name: Petwort cemetery
description:
Northern town exit, after playground. 
Not possible to enter with a big rig because of a narrow entrance gate

name: Winchester car Park
description:
free from 6 PM to 8 am, free Shuttle to downtown, no service
gratuit de 18 h à 8 h du matin navette gratuite pour centre ville aucun service cadre agréable

name: Nempnett Thrumbwell
description:
On the car Park of à really small Town Hall around Meadow and cattle
--
Sur le parking d'une toute petite mairie au milieu des champs

name: Druridge Bay Beach
description: Beach-front camping, just over some dunes. Wide flat grassy area at these coordinates, and other gravel parking area at each end of road. Popular with walkers and cyclists, but otherwise completely quiet and undisturbed. Sleep to the sound of the waves below. Cell service. No facilities.

name: Avebury Silbury hill
description: on ROAD 4 à car Park noisy but better nothing from here you Can  reach Avebury stone site by pedestrians parths around 2 kms no service

name: Cashel campsite
description:
Good facilities, very clean, 
Down side no open fires to deter midges.

name: Castle Inn and Campground
description: Pub with tent pitches on a grassy lawn and a few parking places for small rigs. 10£ including showers, wifi, toilets outside. friendly owners. close to ferry terminal.

name: Newcastle
description:
Plenty of free car parks in town, Castle Park on downtown is protected from wind, public toilets near the tourist office. 100m from the sea

de nombreux parkings gratuits Castle Park parking en centre ville protégé du vent  toilettes publiques parking office tourisme à 100 m de la mer

name: Glenafm Harbour
description:
a Big area before Gabor without service 2 pubs in 100m
--
une grande aire sans service 2 pubs à 100 m

name: Loch Leven
description: great place on tar for at least 5 campervans. Almost level, no facilities but great view over the lake..

name: Pitlochry in the woods
description: narrow road, little bit uphill the last 50m on dirt track. May be tricky after heavy rain. 1 almost level area. Very quiet, no facilities. Good for tent camping or small campervan. No big rigs. Bad phone reception.

name: Speyside Gardens
description: All facilities incl. laundry available. 25£ for camper, electricity and 2 people. No Wifi. 20min. walk into town. Grassy and gravel sites under pine trees.

name: Rosehall Walking Trail Parking Lot
description: nice quiet spot in the woods. Some hikers and dog walkers during the day. No "no overnight parking" signs.

name: Broomfield Holiday Park
description: Campsite on the waterfront on gravel or grass. Nice view. 25£ with power.

name: Dundonnall Lookout
description: fantastic view from a public parking lot on top of a hill. Lively during the day but quiet at night. Level parking on gravel, no facilities. Good phone reception (LTE)

name: Rixanne
description:
Rhossili
Swansea, United Kingdom
@theshopatpittoncross
+44 1792 390593

Parking Lot Camping
Shops

name: Pitton Cross Caravan and Camping Park
description:
Rhossili
Swansea, United Kingdom
@theshopatpittoncross
+44 1792 390593
Parking Lot Camping
Shops
Restrooms
Beautiful views
Rental cabins

name: Sands Holiday Park
description:
Large campground on the beach. 
First visited this place in September 2002 and we were the only ones there. 
Today with school holidays it's busy.
Things have changed, new facilities and management.
£20 per night for 2 with tent.

name: parking place with room for a tent.
description: Just off the main road, flat grass area for a small tent behind a wall which shelters you from the wind.

name: Alnwick. The Sheperds Rest
description:
Small camping grond With 8 places. 
At the beginning of the town
Clean toilet and shower location

name: Drumnadrochit
description: An informal camping site near Loch Ness. Free WiFi and electra possible

name: Woodland waters
description: Established Campsite, Tenting Caravan and lodges available.

name: Beacons Fun Farm / Eco Camping Wales
description: Bike friendly camping with shower and toilets, Campfires on certain pitches.

name: tarfside
description: village field place everone is welcome to canp out free

name: Cornwall Tour StartPoint
description: Cornwall Tour Start Point, lovely cottage near the co op

name: Barn Park farm
description: small campsite. looks unofficial when you drive in but well kept and pitches set out for you when you arrive if you have pre-booked or an honesty box if you want to just turn up. clean toilet and shower block and sink for washing up. water and recycling points etc. allows fires. Part of a working dairy farm so cows in joining field. Amazing views of rolling hills and 5 mins to Woolacombe beach. Cash payments when farmer comes round on his tractor!

name: Faichemard Farm
description: Good secluded campsite with beautiful views of the surrounding area. 18+ Adults only. Lots of space between camping spots. £16 for a tent and 2 adults. Free WiFi, laundry, warm showers, friendly hosts. Beware of midges.

name: Port Ban holiday park
description: Informal, laid back ,caravan ,camping site on the coast overlooking the Island of Jura.  Nearest village KILBERRY , nearest town Ardrishaig in Argyll Scotland .

name: Dundonnell
description: A small track off the main road goes up the mountain about 50 metres. The track gets worse and is suitable for 4x4s, offroad motorcycle etc. The ground for camping is uneven but I found an almost flat spot! Some of the camping area can be seen from the main road. Not the perfect wild camping spot but it has a great view!

name: urquhart castle loch ness
description:
parking at visitor center.
quite spot for motorhomes.

name: Brocklehead Farm & Caravan Park
description: Established campground on a working farm. Elevated with a beautiful view overlooking Darwen city. Electric hookups, clean bathrooms, and CDP. Great for caravans, motorhomes or tent. Small grounds, about 20 spots in a large field. Can park right next to the milk cow fields! 20 pound per night for motorhome with or without electric. Excellent cell service and 4g data. No wifi.

name: Halfway filling station
description: 24 hour laundry machines. 2 washers (8kg-4£ 18kg-8£), one dryer 2£

name: Look out car park
description:
Small car park off A498 on left hand side shortly before junction with A4086 at Pen y Gwryd. Great view over valley and lake below and towards Snowdon (if you can see it!). Windy.
Reasonably flat and tarmac surfaced. Busy with people admiring the view until dusk but a fair way from the road so not a lot of road noise. No facilities, it’s just a car park with a great view!

name: Cairn of get
description:
A parking just near a pond juste for a van or small motor home
Very quite

name: New shawbost
description: Small parking near a beach small véhicule only 7m max

name: By way of parklane
description: Very quit dead end way/walking path perfect for a night camping

name: little parking lot
description: Gravel parking near the 'long man of Wilmington' site. Beautiful walking paths. Bit windy. There is a slightly bigger parking one km up the road also used by campers. Both are next to the road, so some traffic passing.

name: Hushinish parking
description: Free or by donation parking right by the beach. Clean toilets. Showers 1£ for three minutes. Garbage and recycling. Beautiful spot.

name: Seven Sisters Cliffs
description: The parking lots are all pay/no overnights but there's a pull off just past the turn on for the overflow lot that's large enough for a van or small Motorhome. We pulled in behind another van and had no problems overnighting.

name: Devil's Dyke
description: Parking lot at the edge of the dyke carry on past the pay and display to the large gravel lot. There were a lot of people parked up here and a gorgeous view. As a bonus there's a pub as well as hiking paths

name: Park side street parking in Leith
description: Restriction free parking next to a large park in Leith with a bus directly to the city in about 15 minutes. We passed two nights comfortably and there were about 10 or so others parked here.

name: St Cyrus nature reserve center
description: Parking in a lot next to the small visitor center. The larger lot has a 2.1 m height restriction but directly in front of the center is fine. Toilets and walking maps.

name: Ardtower caravan site
description: Lovely brand new campsite. Lovely bathrooms, laundry facilities and even a baby/toddler bathing room. Gorgeous.

name: Roman amphitheater
description: Parking lot next to impressive ruins of a amphitheater and privy. Not too far from the highway. Toilets closed now, large green space. There were some kids in the evening going into the amphitheater so park field side. Extra long vehicles spaces.

name: Paid parking lot close to town.
description: Overnighting for large vehicles in this lot, reasonable rates, quiet overnight. Flat spots closer  to river, cafe on site. A few minutes walk into town.

name: Blidworth bottoms car park
description: Large car park with plenty of room, I suggest turned left immediately as it’s a bit quieter. Nice walks into Sherwood Forest. In the morning there’s a coffee and cakes truck that pulls up to accommodate all the dog walker, and there are a lot. No bins or water and no mobile signal.

name: Views for days
description: Large lay by (with stone wall separating) with gorgeous sea and countryside views and a bonus castle view thrown in. Quiet at night but lots of people stopping during the day.

name: Swan meadow car park
description: Very large car park less 5 minutes walk to Saffron Walden which has a large park and playground. Fairly flat. Free after 5pm and on Sundays. You can park for free at Auden End House during the day which is less than a 10 minute drive and an English Heritage Site. There’s also the children’s play park across from Auden End House with a miniature train.

name: Deepdale backpackers
description: Beautiful eco campsite.  Electric or non electric sites available. 17 pounds without. HOT showers, laundry facilities and a kitchen. Cafe on site. Walking nearby. There are also rooms to rent.

name: James Cooke woods
description: Small parking lot next to the woods a 5 minute drive from town. Not much to see in town just a stopping place to the coast. Walks in the woods. A few cars around 9pm which was strange but all gone overnight and quiet.

name: Boardwalk Beach Club
description:
Absolute awesome place to stop for a coffee and a bite to eat! 

Run by Eddie from Edinburgh and his fantastic team. It has amazing views, amazing coffee and food. Definitely worth a stop on your way north.

Another small business worth supporting!!!

name: New road parking lot
description: Parking lot on edge of town, no charge, no signs forbidding camping. Quiet night. Castle ruins in town. It’s the castle on the hill referenced in Ed Sheerens song, fun fact.

name: Pier Ave
description: Free parking with no restrictions along a wide boulevard. The whole of pier Ave is allowed we parked about 100 meters from the pier. Might be more difficult or frowned upon in the summer but we passed two nights happily in September. The road along the sea has no camping signs. Southwold is beautiful and definitely worth a look in as it also has a lovely sandy beach. Dog beach at opposite end of town.  Toilets by the pier as well as water to the right by the beach huts.

name: Eden Tree Caravan Park
description: Very laid-back campsite with about 25 spots for travellers. The rest is for permanent stay. 20£ incl electricity. Clean ablution block, good showers. Restaurant around the corner and close to Bradwell (3 pubs and a supermarket). Good hiking in the area.

name: Keswick Car Park
description:
Big but quiet car park in front of the 'Theatre of the Lake', close to the lake.
Pay and display, £1 for overnight parking.
There was even a tent on the meadow next to the car park.

name: Road side Chunnel overnight
description: There are very few places to park that are large and open in this part of the world, but this is a good one. Large and flat close to the intersection on the way to the train station more spots on the way to the station but not as flat. We passed a quiet Friday night here, might be nosier/busier weekday mornings.

name: Canal side parking rue de victor hugo.
description:
Canal side parking on a quiet road, 15 minute walk into town. Passed a quiet night here without problems. Playground near by as well as a large carre four. 

COORDINATES ARE NOT RIGHT, look for 7 rue de victor Hugo.

name: Witches Craig Caravan Park
description:
This place is awesome! Great spot to pitch your tent or bring your big rig! 
A park that’s been run by a family for over 40 Years. 

If you want a nice family friendly place to stay, this is it. Even if you’re solo this place is it!

They have incredible scenery and about 40 SCOTTISH HIGHLAND CATTLE!!! 

very affordable too!!!

name: Sandsend Car Park
description: Hard car park, Overnight camping allowed. There is a Height restriction of 2.5m and width of 2.4m. There are Toilets at the start. Local cafes and pubs. Faces on to the beach. Night Fishermen use it as well.

name: Woburn 4x4
description: Great garage for services and other vehicle related jobs

name: white cliffs holiday hostel
description: Its a really small but definitely the best hostel where we checked in until now. It lays right next to the port of dover, but in the second row :) Our first taught when we look through the window was that its used to be a pub a long time ago. We entered and everything there is so cosy and family-like atmosphere. The tiny house has lots of beds and a nice balcony to sit on and enjoy the sun next to a really fantastic view of the chalkcoast :) Paul, the boss, is the most relaxed guy we've ever met. So we've made a deal to get food and bed for less for some work at his private house. It was a really nice stay and we only can recommend this location.

name: Killhope Cross
description: Large gravel viewing/parking area off the road.

name: Grey Mares Tail
description: Grey Mares Tail waterfall. Wild camp in National Trust Car park. small parking charge, but free to National Trust members. Stunning scenery and the waterfall is massive

name: Exmouth Recreational Ground
description: Delightful, but limited (around 10 max), overnight camping spot for Motorhomes. GBP11/night in summer and GBP3/night in winter.  3 days max stay.  Beautiful views of the Exe estuary and easy walking to town, No amenities, but toilet block open during the day.

name: Oswestry Racecourse Car Park
description:
Oswestry Racecourse is a fantastic spot for walking with great views across the English plains to the east and rolling Welsh hills to the east.

The car park doesn't have any no camping signs but please be discreet if you stop here.  There are no facilities.

There's a Caravan Club camp site next door if you want some services. It's a members only place but worth joining if you are overlanding in the UK.

Posted by a local overlander.

name: Park Farm Campsite
description: A relatively cheap campsite at £8 per person per night. Not the best facilities but the showers are free. Good ground to pitch on you won’t get flooded out. No need to book for tents. Nearest shops are about a mile away and are locally owned and shut early.

name: Loch arkaig
description: One of the hidden beauties of Scotland!!! No other loch in the country like it, hundreds of places to wild camp right next to the water,  great views, waterfalls, hikes.....the list is endless for anyone who wants to see Scotland’s untouched natural beauty, there is a road in good condition that goes all the way to the end of the loch

name: Kilnaughton Bay
description: A lovely meadow directly at the Kilnaughton Bay and close to Port Ellen. Suitable for cars and tents.

name: Golden Grove Farm Camping
description: Farm campsite on a medow next to a small river.

name: RSPB Glenborrodale
description: A parking area with gravel ground. The trees between the street and the parking area provide some privacy. Good for one night, arrive late.

name: Windmill Farm
description: A cozy little farmcamping site with stunning view over the bay.

name: Islay wild sea front
description: Wild camping in Islay - Bridgend few mt from the sea

name: Hoarwithy Picnic area/layby
description:
Great spot next to the river wye, only space for a couple of vehicles but usually very quiet.

Good pub within walking distance- Cottage of content

name: Helwith Bridge Inn
description: Pub with free camping on the car park as long as you buy a few beers in the bar.

name: Beach near Garmouth
description: Open parking area behind a shingle beach not sandy no facilities.

name: East of portgordon
description: This is a nice site for wildcamping just outside the village no entry restrictions no facilities shingle beach not sand, could be windy

name: Beare's den
description: Smallish campsite (17pitches) with sea views. Lovely m/f showers and compost toilets. Washing up area and drinking water.  Great owner called Adam who pays attention to detail.

name: Mull of Galloway Lighthouse
description: Parking lot near the lighthouse. No signs, but windy.

name: Llyn Rhys farm campsite
description:
Field. Clean but not many ablutions, nice walk (5miles) down to Llangollen.
2 miles up the road is the Llandegla MTB trail centre, good fun day out.

name: Western Beach Berneray
description:
Perhaps the best wild camp spot in Scotland!
Quiet , great view , nice costal walks along the beach

name: Caragh Forest Car Park
description:
Quiet place and with wind protection
Dirt winding road to car park

name: Glengarriff Forest Picnic Stop
description: Parking/ Camping in Picnic area 2 tables and walking tracks

name: Penrallt y Gardde Picnic Area
description:
Small picnic area just off the road- very quiet..nice.
Entrance is difficult to see but it is just north of the road opposite.Drive in and loop around to the cleared area.

name: Tywyn End of Road
description:
End of road beside railway line.
Foot bridge and walking tracks to beach.
Views over the estuary 
A few dog walkers at end of day otherwise quiet

name: Iron Age Ring Cairn
description: Great spot on a lake and next to a  1900BC Ring Cairn

name: Garn Goch HILL Fort
description: Small  grassed area in parking lot for the Iron Age fort

name: Swineford Picnic Site
description: Picnic area , nice and quiet with a walk to the local pub

name: Roadside area
description: A small pull off area. The ground is a bit rough but you can find place. After dark a quiet place.

name: Hitchwood Lane car park
description:
A small informal car park for the local forest.
On the corner of two roads so traffic until after dark. 
Not much else around this area but OK

name: Highway Rest Area
description:
A120 Highway rest area for cars and trucks. There are no signs saying no overnight stays.
A 3m bar prevents access to the car area but you could use the truck bays.
A similar area is on the other side of the highway heading West, this one has a toilet

name: International Port Harwick
description: Can camp at the port before loading. We asked the security guard and it seems many stay overnight before loading the next day. Toilets are available if the waiting room is open.

name: Mount Batten
description: Car park, seems quiet and secluded enough, nice and close to the beach and ferry over to Plymouth. Cafes etc nearby.

name: Oakhill Leisure camping
description:
Great for caravans, motorhomes or tents.  Woodland walks, fishing and peace, yet still close to both Lincoln and Newark.
Clean and new shower facilities.

name: New Ground parking
description: This place got a stunning view and is a good spot for 1-2 nights 10£ per night. Other campers were already parked here and after a chat with one of them, we slept there for one night. Hotel and coffee not far with a toilet.

name: Leigh Woods parking
description: Big Picknick and parking Spot near hiking and biketrails

name: Ardcastle Wood
description: A small off-road parking area, gravel.  Situated in a forest with signed walks

name: Leacainn Forest Drive
description: An informal gravel parking area beside a public right of way through the Leacainn Forest.  Room for about 10 overlander rigs.

name: car park opposite the waterfall
description: Water fall. hard surface so nowhere to peg out a ground tent but plenty of places along this road for them.

name: Vatsetter
description: Strip of level grass between freshwater lake and sea loch. salt water and freshwater fishing. potential to be very windy. honour campsite. donations accepted. water from farm. fires with permission or we just sat on the beach next to the pitch. shower and toilet at community centre approx 2 miles

name: burravoe pier campsite
description: small honour campsite. we didn't stay here but called in to fill water tanks and use showers. good stop off to regroup on a long trip. hardstandings with some grass on the small dockside. seems sheltered from wind. shops in small town nearby

name: this pace is only for one camper.beside the mainroad to stornoway.
description: only for one car.it sreps down to a small loch.in rainy weather be careful to get out again.

name: parking at the bridge
description: public parking,at the river.10 pitches.for one night.ok. it was very calm in the night.

name: YSS bunkhouse
description: great place in the middle of nowhere. bunkhouse with 30 odds beds, kitchen, wifi, hot showers and all the amenities you need for a quick break. price? £6 per person per night. amazing. clean and prefect for one night dry stop. byo sleeping bag

name: Ted’s at hunger hill
description:
Ted's is a smallholding, with grass pitches on a gently sloping field set among the Shropshire Hills Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. Sheep and ducks wander the site – the kids are welcome to say hi or go and meet some of the menagerie at the animal paddock – and free-range eggs and fresh meat are usually available for sale.

Among the well-maintained amenities are disabled-friendly showers and toilets, chemical disposal points and facilities for charging and recycling. There's easy access from the site to Sheriffhales village, just off the main A5.

name: Kellie Castle
description: Parking lot from the Castle. Quiet in the night.

name: Toscaig end of road parking
description: This is a parking lot for several cars. Nice and quiet place near a village. Time to time camper vans park here overnight.

name: Finalton, Allt Coire an Laoigh
description: Parking in quite open area by the road. A small forest nearby

name: Lay-by on A87 by the lake Cluanie
description: Lay-by on A87 by the lake Cluanie. Very exposed to the road but with nice view to the lake

name: Riddings Wood Campsite
description:
Riddings Wood Campsite. Nice campsite with fully serviced pitches. £17 per night low season for two adults and electricity. Free WiFi. Shops and pubs near. 

Suitable for big rigs and tents and everything in between.

name: car park by Castle Loch
description: Small car car park between main road and beautiful Loch.

name: Ledgowan Lodge Hotel
description: Charged us £5 to stay in the hotel carpark overnight. Bit of noise from the road overnight. Hotel bar a bit odd and beer not too good but friendly.

name: swan Inn carpark
description:
Pub car park
Large grassy area slight slope
Near B Road, some traffic noise

name: Crinan Basin
description: Water Tap, outside of the Shower House at the Parking lot.

name: Glyncorrwg Ponds Visitor Centre
description: Nice quiet place in the valleys. Cost 3 pounds to park for 24 Hrs. Free Showers.

name: Dartmouth (SW)
description: Little car park, near to skylark pub (lovely landlord). There are two of these little car parks next to each other - the other was renowned for dogging so I picked this one. Still got a few cars coming and going last night but other than that, very fine and secluded wild camping spot.

name: The Gaggle of Geese
description:
The camping field is behind a lovely old, refurbished pub, with limited numbers in the field to avoid crowding and informal pitches on grass. Their are two additional converted shepherd huts offering private showers & toilets. Brand new shower and toilet shepherds hut and washing up area. Fire pits for hire. £12 a night per pitch at the time of writing which is fantastic value for Dorset.
With five acres of gardens & orchard, the Gaggle is set within a beautiful rural location in Dorset, surrounded by woodland trees and a stream running alongside. Very peaceful and beautiful walks from the village.

name: Chepstow Castle car park
description: Pay and display car park. £4.40 for 24 hours. Toilets at Visitor Centre, but locked after hours, so self contained only.  leave before 9am to ensure no issues with the bylaw officer.

name: The Pilot Inn
description: Pub which allows motorhome/campers to stay the night for free in the car park if you eat and drink in the pub.

name: Hayburn Wyke inn
description: Sheltered tucked-away inn protected from the wind in a forested valley. Allows camping in the parking lot or grassy picnic area, good food and nice country pub. Short walk to the beach, very scenic.£5 per person to camp outside and use facilities.

name: Cannich Caravan Park
description: Great little campground with a friendly host.  very close to the spectacular Glen Affric. £9 pp for unpowered site

name: Glen Affric
description: Just next to the street. But it‘s the end of Glen Affric Street so nobody is there in the night. Wonderful view of Glen Affric and the Loch Beinn a‘Mheadhain.

name: Culling harbour
description: This is a parking area near cullin harbour no visible restrictions on parking overnight public toilets close by

name: Cliftonville
description: huge parking lot for free along the ocean. no facilities. quite and possibility  to walk along the ocean

name: Conkers Camping and Caravanning Club Site
description: Beautiful camp site in the middle of the national forest! Staff always willing to help out anyone and go out of their way if they can to help you, quiet out of peak times

name: Ferry Road carpark
description: official free overnight park for self contained vehicles. free from 6pm to 8am, or pay £1 for a sleep in.  nice flat car park with litter bins.

name: Bamburgh Layby
description: nice sized layby off the quiet country road. self contained only.

name: side pull off
description: free. simple and a bit covered by trees.

name: Beach Isle of Harris
description: Very nice place. Quiet and just next to the beach. It‘s the end of a single track road.

name: Fleur de Lys Lowsonford Warwickshire
